title: Great spot!
text: I stay at this hotel frequently for work and it's one of my favorites in the area.  It's around the corner from my office, which makes it extremely convient.  The rooms aren't terribly small (much better size than other hotels in the area) and the beds are comfortable.  One thing to note, if you're staying on a lower floor, it can be a little loud at night dur to construction in the area.  Staff is wonderful and if there isn't a room ready when I get in, they always call when I can check in.  Restuarant is very good too!

title: Reviews can't be real? What hotel am I at??
text:
The staff upon arrival is either extremely stressed or lacks any aspect of customer service. The software system apparently has been down for days so check in requires lots of paperwork and filling out forms for credit cards manually. 

My room bathroom was maybe updated and then the construction crew left mid way thru. Molding is hanging or just not existent. There are no garbage cans anywhere and the thermostat is broken so the room temp is 78, while the AC is on. Happy for a single night stay for $400 plus. One and down.

title: Amazing weekend at Four points Manhattan SoHo Village
text: Earlier this month I had the pleasure of staying at the four points in SoHo and it was everything I could have hoped for. Angie was a great help in making my experience a good one. She gave me everything I needed and even gave me an excellent restaurant recommendation in the area. It was my first time staying at the four points and I can confidently say that it won't be my last. I can't wait to come back.

title: My Stay in SOHO
text: Room was clean and had a safe and coffee maker; however, it lacked a microwave and refrigerator. Price was reasonable for the SOHO location. Close to the Houston St. subway station.   The hotel served coffee and a few rolls in the lobby in the morning.  Try to get a high floor away from the elevators to avoid the street noise.  There is a nice coffee shop right across the street from the hotel called Seven Grams and Essen offers good informal breakfast, lunch, and dinner meals.  I was not overly impressed with the Italian restaurant adjacent to the hotel and would rate is as average; however, there are plenty of other excellent dinning locations close to the hotel.  The Westville restaurant was quite good and reasonable and within two blocks of the hotel. I recommend this place especially if you can get a high room with a north facing view and are planning to stay in SOHO.   I felt relatively safe walking the streets of SOHO during the day and early evening.  Rooms were on the small size but it is Manhattan and were sufficient for up to two people.

title: Great Stay
text: I stayed at the Four Points SoHo in January 2024. I found this to be a very nice property. The rooms were a really good size for New York City and even though my upgrade high-floor room wasn't available, I think it worked out for the best - I was on the 14th floor with a room facing the back of the property and even though there was no view, there was also no noise from the street! The staff was great and the lobby was inviting. The room was well appointed and comfortable. I'd absolutely stay here again for easy access to Greenwich Village, my favorite place to go in NYC!

title: Nightmare
text: Room was dirty and we made a pot of coffee to get the smell out. Bottle of water in the room was open and half gone. Hair on coffee cups. Big coffee stain on bath shelf. We could hear people talking in room next door . I awoke at 2:30 am to 2 drunk girls laying in the hall and yelling . 5 mins later they were all arguing outside my door . It is in a god location and people were friendly at desk but I recommend do not stay here .

title: A Great Place to be in Manhattan
text:
Super comfortable. 
As with many Manhattan hotels, it is small for 4 people, but extremely comfortable. 

It's located in SoHo, so quite a bit of good food in the area, within walking distance (but don't expect a 2-3 min walk). 

Its fairly central and near subway stations, so it's never a problem to get anywhere.

The coffee and tea at the lobby was a good bonus. It was welcoming to have a nice hot drink in the morning or when we came back in the evenings.

All in all, a great hotel!

title: Great spot
text: Check in was easy, staff was friendly and they held our bags until the room was ready. Room and bathroom were nice, clean, comfortable. Appreciated the free bottles of water. Location was great few min walk to subway and only 15 min to get to midtown or 10 min downtown. Area felt safe. Would return.

title: Malfunctioning elevator
text:
Small room, inexpensive, convenient location.

The room is cramped, when you lay down in bed you stare at the door. Carpet was sticky. Be sure to bring slippers. The window opens. We kept it closed and there was still street noise. Bathroom is also cramped. The room has a closet for hanging clothes, there were water bottles, safe, no refrigerator.

I would tolerate all this given the relatively low price for NYC. However, getting stuck in the elevator was unpleasant. We were stuck between floors. We rang the bell and the staff responded promptly and asked if this is the elevator on the right. They are aware of the problem with this elevator. They said that they are getting someone. It took 8 minutes for someone to unstuck the elevator. As we were checking out I heard someone else getting stuck in the same elevator. There are only 2 elevators. Don’t use the elevator on the right.

There is coffee in the lobby. There is a restaurant that serves breakfast. Housekeeping staff in the hallway seemed nice.

Subway is convenient. There is a Trader Joe’s within a couple of blocks. You can walk to soho for dinner.

I would probably not stay here again given the elevator situation.

title: Marriott Disappoints Again
text:
I used 209,000 Marriott points to book a stay for 5 nights – August 29 thru September 3 - at this Four Points SoHo Village.

Let me note that I am a Bonvoy Gold Elite member & if this is how we are treated, well......

I read a note on the website that mentioned nearby construction and, being concerned due to the work and Zoom meetings I’d scheduled to do in my hotel room, I phoned the hotel’s front desk. This was at 2:59 PM on August 28 – the day prior to my leaving for NY.

The employee I spoke with assured me there was no construction going on at the hotel and, "All of that was old news". I explained my work needs and she assured me she would place me in a room far away from any sort of neighborhood construction noise.

Upon checking in at approximately 2 PM on Tuesday, August 29, I was directed to my hotel room. The room had scaffolding outside my window and one of the first noises I heard was a jackhammer.

I phoned the Bonvoy Customer Service line where the person I spoke with told me that since  I had “already checked into to hotel so now there was nothing he could do about this”. He actually said to me that “You should have complained before you checked in”. I did enlighten him to the fact that I could not see &/or hear my room "before I checked in." and he responded with, "Sorry but that’s the policy". (I had tickets for the theater so I could not pursue this conversation longer.)

(Side note: The security lock on my door would not close securely so I had to prop a chair against it that night before bed.)

The next morning, I called down for room service so I could have breakfast while working. I was told there was no room service. I asked if I needed to go downstairs to breakfast and I was told there was no breakfast. This is in spite of having room service menus, breakfast advertisments, etc. in the room. 

I asked if he could please call one of the local shops or restaurants that delivers and he told me I would have to call Uber Eats or GrubHub. I’ve spent too much time in NY to know that every hotel has their close “favorites” that the hotel uses for both employees and guests.   

At this point I again called Marriott Bonvoy Customer Service where “They value my long relationship”. I spoke with a young man who told me I could check out of the hotel but I would forfeit my 209,000 points for all 5 nights. I was transferred to a Supervisor who was apologetic but still insisted that I might get reimbursed for the remaining 4 nights but not for the points I’d spent on this first night.

I asked if she could assist me with finding another hotel for the remaining 4 nights and she did find a couple hotels in the $400 - $600 price range. I asked that surely she could find a discount for me since I was in this bind through no fault of my own. She offered a couple AAA or ARRP discounts but clearly did not actually *try* to assist me. After this waste of a call, she didn’t apologize for not assisting me but told me, “Thank you for being a valued Gold Elite Member”.

Not being willing to stay in a Marriott-affiliated hotel after this fiasco I ended up spending $498 per night for a room at another hotel which met my needs - meaning no construction and with room service.

I have filled out every Marriott form, contacted various customer service phones and emails, and have only been given the run-around. I've been told that they "Will take care of your situation', but now, over ONE MONTH later I am still out 209,000 points for less than 20 hours in a terrible hotel.

title: Had a Great Stay!
text: Great location. Lobby welcoming and staff friendly. Small but functional rooms with comfortable beds. Very clean. Pastries and coffee in the morning. I was concerned after reading some of the reviews but we had a wonderful experience. Would stay here again!

title: Clean room
text: The location here is great for me - easy to get around the city. I’d return because of it. Rooms are small and dated, but they are clean. The only thing I didn’t like was housekeeping banging on my door at 3:30 when my do not disturb was on and I was in the middle of a work video call. I had a 4 pm checkout. Across the Marriott brand I think they need have a system in place that tells housekeeping when folks actually do check out.

title: Don't stay there, it's a bit of a dump.
text: The property was dirty, noisy and significantly poorly manage.   We also had significant issues with the room, i.e. shower leaking water all over the bathroom floor, noisy toilet (high pitch sound), broken safe (which they ended up replacing, with one with low batteries, so they had to come back to the room multiple times to fix issues.    Bottom line, DO NOT STAY THERE, it's a bit of a dump.

title: Good value for money
text: This was a really nice hotel in a good location, and easy access to everything, especially the subway station. The room  was the perfect size for a family and allowed us plenty of room. However all the essentials were here, very comortable bed, efficent air conditioning, good wifi.

title: Best Customer Service
text: A fantastic experience! Especially elevated by the customer service- Golden, the Concierge, was kind, welcoming, and helpful the MOMENT I entered the Lobby! Great Guest Stay and the best option in the area! Thank you, Four Points!

title: THEFT!
text:
My Apple Watch was stolen out of our locked room. Hotel Staff entered our room to leave an extra pillow and blanket. Otherwise no one else had a key. 
Staff pretended to care but did nothing after 3 days in a row of me asking to have it investigated. Supposedly they have no cameras in the halls of the hotel. 
DO NOT stay at this hotel!!

title: Great hotel!
text: This was a really nice hotel in a quiet location but with easy access to everything. The staff were attentive and took care of requests immediately. The penthouse suite was the perfect size for three people and allowed us plenty of room. The views were amazing!

title: Exceptional staff
text: I have stayed at this property over 100 nights over 5 years and find it an exceptional value.  The staff, especially Golden who works nights, is always exceedingly welcoming, providing the comfort that is needed on the road. I can not provide enough high praise  It would be nice to have the restaurant/bar open later, but there are many options for food and drink just steps away.  The restaurant staff is also very welcoming and willing to accommodate the needs of a weary traveler.  While there are other Marriott/Sheraton properties close by with perhaps more comfortable rooms (the bathrooms are a little small) I always choose this property over the others because of the staff!

title: Heart of SoHo, great value for comparatively low cost
text: Nice hotel with a bit of an obscured entryway (though I think it's under active construction). Really great location with proximity to shopping and restaurants -- we picked it to be in the heart of SoHo and it delivered. Absolutely a 5 star review because considering the hotel quality as a function of price/value, it's the best I've had in NYC given its cost. I've stayed at more expensive hotels within this star range and this one has them beat. Beautiful view from our room on the 18th floor. Absolutely planning on booking it again if I travel with friends in a similar context. Definitely recommend!

title: Great location, great service
text:
We originally planned on staying at this hotel for 2 nights, but stayed 2 additional nights due to the cancellation of our flight.

The manager and employees at this hotel are excellent! They are very accommodating and attentive to guests.

The hotel itself is in a great area that's walkable to the subway and many parts of the city. My only complaint is the rooms have a bit of a musty smell. Other than that, it's comfortable and budget-friendly (by New York standards).

title: Fit for purpose great location budget style hotel
text:
I wasn't sure how to rate this hotel as it isn't perfect but it is good enough.  Great location just on the edge of the vibrant Soho area.  Very close to good subway lines, walking distance from downtown and midtown areas.  Staff are friendly and efficient, check in was quick and easy.  Room was tight but we are a family of four.  However all the essentials were here, comfy bed, great air conditioning, quiet room.  
 A few niggles hence not a full rating shower is good enough but is only warm not hot and gives out a good jet but not the best.  Our bathroom needed a few fixes - the shaving mirror was lose, the wall covering was coming away round the shower and the bottle of shower gel had fallen off.  
On arrival the carpet outside the bathroom was damp but it dried up quickly.   
So it's a fit for purpose hotel which has the essentials in place but if you want a less budget approach spend more money - this place does exactly what it needs to

title: Needs Were Met
text:
Second time staying here, both times were for one night only.  Hotel itself is in a mixed use, unexceptional neighborhood - businesses, residential, a few places to eat (Chipotle, Shake Shack, deli, pizza, McDs) in the immediate area.  I didn’t try the hotel’s small restaurant and bar.  It’s very convenient to the subway.  Not a neighborhood with much to entice you to explore however easy walking distance to more popular areas of Soho as well as Greenwich Village and Tribeca.

The hotel itself is rather basic with a  small, poorly lit lobby and registration area, awkward access to elevators (pillars impede direct entry) and merely functional.  My rooms were identical for both of my stays.  Bland decor, adequately sized but certainly not roomy.  Night stand on only one side of bed which seems odd.  King bed was comfortable.  Bathroom was fairly tight and very clean.  Overall, the room worked perfectly for one night but not sure how it might be for several days when more time might be spent there.  All things considered I feel as though it was fairly priced for what was provided - my basic needs were met.

title: Not a good service
text: I had sent them an email saying that my wife and I were celebrating 20 years of marriage, and I asked for a room on the highest floor with a beautiful view and a bathroom with a bathtub. They replied saying that I should make my reservation by myself. I explained that I had already made the reservation, I was only asking for one. nice view and a bathtub. They didn't answer me anymore. I sent a message through the website and was ignored. Upon arriving at the hotel, I asked if it had a bathtub and the attendant said no, and said that the reservation was on the third floor, although I had asked for a high floor. My last hope was to have a nice view even from the third floor. And we literally found a WALL as a view. See my view in the photo I took! At least the wall was painted. Definitely their concern is not to serve the guest well LOL

title: Better than a Park Bench
text: Meh.  No soap in the soap dispensers. TV didn't work right. It WAS clean. This place is much better than sleeping on the bench by my wife's office. People at the Rescue Mission down the street are friendlier. Staff could use a courtesy upgrade.

title: Not the best hotel but I’m sure you could do worse!
text:
My daughter and I stayed here for four nights. The whole experience was pretty middling. The hotel is dark and camped. There are a couple of chairs in the lobby but that’s it for seating, and I never wanted to hang out there as it felt crowded and stuffy. They say there is a restaurant but it looked pretty defunct. The rooms are typical size for  Manhattan at this price point but they really need some updating. Peeling wallpaper, carpet that felt sort of sticky underfoot (why do hotel rooms have carpet??), shower was functional but difficult to turn the water on and off. The sink was so tiny and the faucet placed so high above it that water splashed everywhere every time we turned it on. View from our window was just the blah back of another building. The walls are a little thin and we could hear neighbors coming and going but it didn’t really bother us. 
The one saving grace of the place is the location. We easily walked to and from SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy and the West Village. Lots of great cafes and restaurants, and easy access to subways. And the beds were pretty comfortable. I wouldn’t stay here again, but I wasn’t horrified by anything either.

title: You get what you pay for
text:
I needed a hotel for one night that was conveniently located for my meeting. This place was by far the best priced for my criteria. 
The good: aside from the price- very good location, the 1 train is nearby, lots of restaurants and bars a short walk away. Coffee shop across the street and others short walk away that open at 730. Spacious room with two beds. Three towel sets. free coffee and muffins/pastries starting at around 530 am. Any staff I interacted with were very nice and helpful. Stored my luggage without issue after checkout. 
The bad: while the bed sheets and towels were clean, the bathtub was not (showered in flip flops) and room floor was not. The curtains and some other furnishings looked dingy. The room was very dark even with all the lights on. Most of the toiletry dispensers (like the hand soap and shower gel) were not functioning so I had to improvise with shampoo. I didn’t bother reporting that to the staff. Overall I just didn’t enjoy being in my room. 
Bottom line, if you just need a place to sleep for a night or two and don’t want to spend a lot, it’s doable. For longer stays, the room is spacious enough, and has a wardrobe closet, but it’s just not an enjoyable room and the lobby is tiny so you can’t really relax at the hotel. However it’s possible they give nicer rooms for longer stays. Mine was a last minute one night booking from a third party.

title: Excellent value in SoHo.
text:
This is the best value in SoHo hotels that we have experienced over about six trips in the last eight months. We have stayed at this and three other hotels in SoHo and West Village and this is usually the lowest price. Along with being the most affordable price the hotel is clean, bathrooms are updated and the front desk staff is friendly and accommodating.
He location is good for walking to restaurants and to two different subway stations, Spring St and Houston depending on which train line you need. 
This is very typical in terms of room size compared to other NYC hotels so don’t expect a lot of room but why be in your room much in NYC.

title: Exhausting
text: The hotel was dirty, and the room smelled like cigarette smoke.  When I complained, the front desk person said, "There is nothing I can do for you."   The window would not close, and the noise level from the street and other rooms was very noticeable.  Lastly, if you are a women trying to get ready, the bathroom has zero counter space,

title: Very Uncomfortable Stay
text:
TL;DR - the only saving grace for this property is the location.

My partner and I currently checked in to this hotel for five nights and we are strongly debating checking out early.

To start, we’re on a redemption stay, and what does that mean? It means we’ve spent many paid nights at Marriott hotels and enough to redeem a vacation! So what does every Marriott hotel give me time and time again? The worst room on a redemption stay. 

This hotel feels incredibly claustrophobic, even for NYC standards of tiny hotels and rooms. The rooms are broken and dated - closet door handles broken, drawer handles broken, you can feel the springs in the mattress, and I heard pipes clanking all night and woke up to 6am drilling outside my window which faces a brick building. 

Had it not been for my amazing reflexes, a much bloodier incident would have occurred in the bathroom. As I was putting my toiletries down the heavy glass shelf fell off!!! Safety hazard and dangerous. The toilet is peeling, there’s no counter space, and they have gave just one bath towel so I had to call for an actual set at 11:45pm! 

Stand this for a night or two? Maybe. For five? Yikes! 

Save your points and your money. It’s shameful what hotels, esp “reputable” Marriott brands, get away with these days.

title: Assolutamente No, lo Sheraton dovrebbe essere un'altra cosa!
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato 3 notti nell'Agosto 2022 e posso dire che è stato un "quasi disastro"! 
Elenco le cose negative:
La camera era al terzo piano e si affacciava verso l'interno.
C'era un continuo rumore giorno/notte delle ventole esterne per la climatizzazione dell'hotel. Era talmente forte che non si riusciva a dormire. 
La moquette era sporca ed in 3 notti che abbiamo soggiornato non è mai passato nessuno a pulirla; l'unica cosa che facevano la mattina era fare il letto. 
Non esisteva un mini frigobar ma in cambio c'era la macchinetta del caffè americano (mai usata).
Appena arrivato ho trovato un grossa macchia sul lenzuolo inferiore (immaginate cosa sembrava); ero schifato nel doversi dormire sopra. 
La stanza era molto piccola e senza possibilità di disfare le valige.

Elenco le cose positive:
Il personale della reception è stato sempre molto cortese.
La zona dove si trova l'hotel è interessante essendo a pochi km dal fiume Hudson.
 
Personalmente non lo consiglio per colpa della pulizia, tutto il resto si può anche accettare ma la pulizia è essenziale.

title: There has to be better places to stay
text:
I won't be back. I stayed here for a work trip based on the rate and location but I just don't think I can come back here. 

The positives are:
Great rate, great location, super friendly staff at the desk, the bed was clean, there is a bar onsite

The cons:
The bed is not very comfortable, the pipes shake off and on all night so it makes it difficult to sleep even with the bathroom door closed, the vents and walls carry sound - so heard the neighbors often, the breakfast is fairly spendy, the room is only surface clean but I didn't feel comfortable not wearing shoes around.

title: Great Holiday Visit
text:
Great staff and great location and an unbelievable price for downtown New York.  Right by the RedLine subway to go up town or to the Battery.  Good food and coffee all within the block.  Also free coffee and pastry in tge morning
  A small lobby, so if you need an area to be with a group, you will be limited, but also has a bar for evening drinks.

title: Very good stay in a great location.
text:
Great location. Easy walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, 9/11 etc. Easy access to subway and Uber trips to most destinations are reasonable. 

Room was mostly clean. Beds and pillows very comfortable. Bathroom could use updating - some wallpaper peeling and small stains on walls, plus the bathroom door looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in a while. Those were small issues though. The sinks, toilets and bathtub / shower were clean and well maintained during our stay. 

Staff was very friendly, attentive and helpful. Overall a very good stay. I would not hesitate to book this property again.

title: Convenient and Comfortable Stay
text: Friendly staff, under slight construction but not an inconvenience.  My room was clean, spacious and I received consistent service. They have pastries available in the lobby in the morning, along with coffee.  It's conveniently located to many local subway lines and major avenues.

title: Bra läge och billigt
text: Vi var 3 vuxna som reste och bodde på ett rum med två queen size sängar. Fint och funktionsdugligt rum om du vill ha ett rum där du bara sover och kan byta om/duscha. Om morgonen serveras gratis kaffe och te, samt en mängd olika fikabröd. Har bra läge till Houston Street metro. Så om du vill ha ett bra hotell som inte kostar så mycket så se hit.

title: Tired hotel in need of an update
text: Hotel is a bit dated and could use some renovations.  The lobby kinda smells like bug spray. We stayed in one of the top floor suites which had a really nice view of the Empire State Building.  The bed was fine but the mattress for the pull out sofa was terrible.  All you could feel was the springs. The first night we kept smelling either cigarette smoke or weed coming through the vent in our bathroom.  Not sure where it was coming from but I mentioned it to the front desk and we didn’t smell it the 2nd night.  We could hear the elevator noise quite a bit from our room.  The room itself was dated.  Wallpaper peeling off the walls, random patches on the ceiling, random outlet covers on the floor, etc…. I expected better from a Marriott owned property.

title: Not a great idea
text: The front desk was very, very nice, but after a late arrival, I left at 10:30 at night to find another hotel.  They either need to get rid of the Sheraton name or clean this up.  It needs a full redo and overhaul.

title: Economy hotel in good location
text: Nice budget hotel in a good location close to Greenwich Village. Breakfast on site is rudimentary - just "grab and go" tea, coffee and pastries in the lobby. A good breakfast is available in the Essen food store around the corner. Buffet selection and seating upstairs.

title: Worst hotel ever
text: A filthy tiny hotel with antiquated furniture & televisions. The TV didnt work & it had remotes that worked randomly, filthy shower curtains and back splash,  headboards and the tub had mold and mildew

title: Great location and great customer service
text:
Great customer service by Golden the front desk agent! Also room was very clean. The hotel has a great location near all the restaurants and shops in Soho. 
It is a decent hotel for the price with some nice amenities.

title: Unprofessional
text: The hotel is okay, although I had questions regarding to my concerns but only to then get ignored by a rude staff member that works night shifts front desk, maybe he got too distracted playing hooky with his girlfriend hiding in the back, unprofessional if you ask me.

title: Great Location and staff
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights and yes, it is a basic hotel and a small basic room. But the staff was great, friendly, and the location is awesome ( Soho/Village is my favourite area of NYC). A short walk to the river waterfront, and across the street from the hotel you have Essen which is a prepared food/hot buffet style store for all your quick breakfast/lunch needs. Trader Joes is around the block as well.
Be sure to do the Color Factory Museum with the kids, tweens as well- great photos and instagram worthy content for some fun on a rainy day. 
We would stay here again.

title: Dirty, wall-facing room
text: I would not stay at this hotel again. My room was dirty upon check-in. Hair was flying all over the carpet. The 'window' faced a wall and overlooked a noisy airshaft and it was like trying to sleep in an airplane. The location was good and the staff seemed nice enough but there are way better options in Manhattan for the same price.

title: Dirty and Poorly maintained
text:
Rooms and hotel in general were dirty and very dated/worn.  Carpet and walls were peeling.  Bathroom had mold on the ceiling and around the shower tile.  

The upsides were the location, the friendly staff and the on-site bar.  The hotel is in a great location for visiting the city - very walkable and close to the subway if you do not want to walk too far.

title: Ralph Godoy Office Supervisor
text:
Ralph was excellent and provided leadership of the team that was excellent. Any questions I had, or any needs was handled very quickly. It was my wife's birthday and Ralph and the team recognized her birthday with a nice card and bottle of champagne.
Flat out our only stay play when we visit NY! Rob

title: Comfortable and convenient
text:
This hotel is very comfortable, settled on the corner of a quiet neighbourhood in Soho. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the check in and out times convenient and the room was well equipped and comfortable. 
It is well situated to cafes, restaurants, shops and some places of interest to visit. I was able to visit the Color Factory, an interactive art gallery, and took a 25 minute walk to Chelsea Borough Market. It is also within walking distance of Madison Square Park. There was an independent cinema I visited, also within walking distance, some small, pleasant local parks and the subway system is ideal for reaching Times Square and the Financial District. 
There was some audible noise in the room from the street, but nothing too disruptive. Free coffee was available from morning and during the day time in the lobby. 
The area itself is a nicer, quieter part of town, with friendly people and plenty to do.

title: Great NY base close to just about everywhere
text: Why is American plumbing so complicated? Mixer taps requiring the deft touch of a brain surgeon to find the sweet spot between frozen and scalding were an unforgettable feature of this hotel. That said, this is a surprisingly good budget hotel by Manhattan standards and, again, relatively inexpensive assuming north of $200 a night can be considered 'inexpensive'. Great location within minutes of the myriad bars and restaurants of the West Village, a few minutes from the Hudson River and the fantastic greenway and a short walk to the 1, A, C and E subway stations. Cleverly, they have made a virtue of COVID-19 and staff shortages by only servicing rooms on request which, over a long weekend, turned out to be a reasonable notion and we simply didn't bother them at all. The staff we did interact with were friendly and helpful. There are a lot worse and a lot less convenient hotels at this price point in the city in my experience. I think we may have found a new base for future visits. Recommended.

title: Wonderful base for exploring Manhattan!
text: We had a fantastic time at SOHO Four Points which is conveniently located in a fantastic part of Manhattan. Reception staff were excellent and upgraded our dad to a lovely room for his 70th birthday. We felt welcome and safe in this hotel, which has excellent showers and good water pressure. Beds were comfortable with firm pillows. Rooms spacious for New York! The hotel is a perfect base for NYC and we couldn’t recommend it enough! We will be back!

title: Unacceptable Marriott Standards BEWARE
text:
FEB 2022
MAJOR construction that starts at 6:45 in the morning (I MEAN LOUD).  I contacted the management and was told...sorry.
I'm a frequent traveler, and stay in hotels in NYC 1-2 times a month. First time to stay, and MY LAST. I booked on the Marriott App, and there was NO mention of major contruction. I asked for room cleaning one time (out of 3 nights) and was not able to get it.  The thermostat in my room kept reading "low battery" and asked for them to come check it.  I was told it would be "fine" so the heater (NYC in Feb), would not stay on.
The 'comforters" on the beds were more like thin paper.  Super COLD.
The front desk clerk was amazing, and the face you would want in ANY business.
I contacted Marriott, and was told they were directing this onto the Executive Team for the hotel.
NOT A WORD!
Please read the reviews on the internet about this hotel before booking
Extremely disappointing for a Marriott property.

title: Great hotel
text:
Clean, great location for what we wanted to visit. Great restaurant on property. Rooms a little small but its NYC, I didn't expect them to be large. Good service

Construction right next door so that was a bummer

title: Great location
text: This was the perfect hotel if you’re planning on being busy and not spending time in your room. Very small rooms without a mini fridge but we didn’t mind since we spent most of our time exploring NYC. Great location and close to the train. The front desk staff were super pleasant and helpful.

title: Unacceptable Hotel Security
text: My overall stay at the hotel would have been acceptable if it were not for a 2AM disturbance.   I woke to what I initially thought was another guest being loud in the hallway.   It turned out to be a homeless person who gained access to the building and decided to rip apart a garbage bag or something in the hallway outside my room.   Their loud rant went on for 15 minutes.   I called the front desk to alert them and they said that they were aware.   There are no card readers in the elevator and apparently they don't secure the doors at night.   When I discussed with the manager in the morning, he said that they had not installed these security devices because of the financial hardship of the pandemic.   I will not be staying here again until they address these security issues.   I am also filing an official complaint with Marriott.

title: Golden
text: We had an awesome experience at the Sheridan. Golden was an amazing help with everything. I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know. Thank you everyone at the Sheraton for everything. It was something I will never forget.

title: Funcionários super solícitos
text:
Escolhi este hotel a dedo pela localização e custo-benefício e não me decepcionei.
O que mais me surpreendeu foi a atenção dos funcionários. Sempre atenderam às minhas solicitações com boa vontade e paciência, além de darem excelentes dicas.
Voltaria a me hospedar lá sem sombra de dúvida!

title: NYC trip during Christmas 2021
text:
Overall, we were happy with the reasonable price that we paid for this hotel, as we have seen it listed for much higher.

Although we were there for numerous days (9), we were not offered an upgrade and had no view.  We did however get to check in early.

We know upgrades are limited to availability but on our last day we heard people being offered upgrades and late check outs (up to 3:00PM) when just the day before we were told they could only extend our check out time to 12:30PM.  This was annoying.

The room was very small and the bathroom was tiny, including the shower and sink area.  This is challenging for a longer trip, like ours.

There are two elevators for many floors so given this demand and Covid concerns (we were there during the Omicron surge), we often took the stairs to and from our 5th floor room.  This was fine except that housekeeping continually blocked the stairs with bags of garbage.  After we complained about this, it improved somewhat but was not consistent.  Was unpleasant and potentially a safety hazard.  

We did have a fridge for the whole stay and it worked perfectly- this was terrific.

We often saw employees without masks throughout the hotel, despite the mandate that we all have masks in common areas.  This posed a safety concern. On the whole staff were friendly and helpful.

There was no regular housekeeping but it was available if we asked.  We then however were concerned about unmasked persons being in our room.  We typically just had items replenished but given that we were there for awhile, this was not the best.

The coffee in the room was just ok.  Enough to get by.

The tv is a bit archaic- hard to turn on (had to turn on & off multiple times before a picture was present) and no guide which was odd.

We were able to get the complimentary water, which was nice.

I read that robes would be available upon request but was told they were not at that location.

The location for subway access was terrific and we do love Soho.  Would stay here again but only if the price was right (reasonable) and would prefer on a shorter stay.

title: Stay at Four Points
text:
Ideally located between to Metro stations. Helpful staff and clean rooms. Value for   
money. Drinking water was available on request and ice needs to be collected from the basement. Bonvoy members enjoy privileges of extended checkout but they are very rigid on flex.

title: Better than sleeping on the sidewalk
text: The whole place feels very cramped. The elevators are small, rooms tiny, lobby is small and often full of people. The rooms were ok although our toilet worked weird and overflowed. I asked for a new room and told one wasn’t available.  A maintenance person did come and wet vacuum up the bathroom but otherwise no offer was made to clean the room. We were on the 9th floor and you could hear everything going on that floor.  The front desk staff was very nice though especially Golden. He gave good info about the area and had waters for us when we got back from a late night on the town.

title: Gross! Not Clean and Very Noisy. Front desk had no mask and a runny nose that he wiped with his hand.
text:
This hotel is poorly managed and maintained.  I would not stay here again even for free.
I am a titanium member but due to covid has gone down to gold status.  We asked for an early check in and an upgrade.  Neither was approved which I understand but  we were not able to check in until 400pm.  There was no complimentary gold status breakfast available. 
The room was not clean and felt dirty.  The shower curtain smelled of mold.  The carpet looked like it had not been vacuumed as there was much lint on the floor.  It was pretty disgusting.  There were no hand towels in the room.  
The room they assigned us was near the elevator and very noisy.   You could hear the traffic outside until past midnight, lots of honking and ambulances.  We were on the 15th floor.
The hotel is supposed to be located in Soho, but it is on the outskirts and not near anything that is happening.  It near lots of tall business buildings.  The subway is about 1 and a half blocks away. 

When we tried to check out at 600am, the front desk said that his computer was down and that checking out was not necessary.  We had to insist that he write down our name and room number so there would be some information on who vacated the room.  This male had no mask on and had a very runny nose that he kept wiping with his bare hand.

title: Excellent location and staff
text: Just spent the weekend in NYC and 4 Points. The location is excellent in lower Manhattan. Subway access is just a block or two away. The room was clean and comfortable but on a little on the small side. The staff was superb. Bothe Giselle and Ralph were informative, cordial, and extremely helpful.

title: Unhappy people working here
text: Couldn't get coffee on Sunday morning which is okay if handled nicely. I was told coffee was being made and she was rude and not happy. 2 other people also waiting a long time when 2 of the 3 of us left for a Starbucks after much time. I was afraid to ask her how much longer the wait would be, she was obviously unhappy to be making coffee. Same type thing happened previous night at the bar and was forced to go elsewhere. Many people trying to get service and just not available at this hotel. They have a serious help problem at this hotel.

title: Can't beat the location with friendly staff
text: This location was great! Did a New York Minute shop and food trip with a girl friend and location couldn't be better for that. You're two blocks away from the main SOHO corridor and a few blocks away from West Village, Chelsea, NOHO, Nolita, Tribeca and even Little Italy/Chinatown. We never had the need to hop on the subway. The front of house staff was very friendly and helpful upon check in. The rooms could do with a fresh coat of paint, some dusting and the bathrooms could all use a deep clean but other than that, it's a good base for a short trip. Ask for a floor with the city view.

title: Great hotel location, great staff
text:
Had a great stay at this hotel but has a serious safety concern! Golden was golden! I had a bad smell issue with the initial room I was assigned, and he immediately found me a better one. He's also super friendly and welcoming!!! Kudos!

The safety concern (that I raised with the staff upon check out) is the bathroom glass shelf which is slightly tilted horizontally toward you and if slides out, can be a SERIOUS safety concern and result in bodily injury and broken glass everywhere. The initial room I was assigned had this problem and the second room I was assigned. Must be fixed ASAP.

title: Very nice property - excellent staff
text:
This property was more than adequate and actually on the nicer side for the price paid - which was very fair considering it was NYC.  The room was far bigger than expected, the bathroom all updated and very nice shower.  The king bed was fine - not like being at home, but certainly nothing to complain about.

What sets this property apart is the staff - every single person when WAY over and above to help.  Of particular note was Golden, who works the overnights - he was a fount of information on how to accomplish what I needed at the passport office, which is 1.5 blocks away.  His advice was a life saver.  Additionally, the morning staff were also very helpful, friendly and went out of their way to assist.

Again, for the price - this is an excellent value.

title: Stay elsewhere
text: The staff was very nice and accommodating but the rooms are not good. My room was dirty and run down. Mattress was old and the air conditioner was a super loud unit under the window. No real lobby space either so your small room is the only option.

title: Not bad for Manhattan
text: This hotel is well known to travelers for its great location in the SoHo/Greenwich Village area and a low enough Bonvoy class to accept free night certs.  The hotel is in a very old building...perhaps 1950s era or earlier.  Elevators appear to have frequent issues as I heard others complain about it taking forever, although I didn't have a problem.  Staff was nice, they held our luggage as we arrived early.  Room was acceptable, linens weren't completely clean (tiny hairs on them) and bathroom could use a remodel.  I did get bit by a spider, which I actually expected to happen being in an old hotel.  Four Points Sheraton is a notch below Hyatt Place, Hilton Garden Inn and Marriott Courtyard.  It's an acceptable place to stay for budget travelers and you can do much worse in Manhattan.  Newer...no.  Clean...not so much.  Comfortable...yes.  Good Service...yes.  Location...good right by the 1 line Houston St Station.  Near many restaurants...Bleeker St Pizza and John's Pizza.  I felt safe around the hotel at night.  Fine for a night, not sure about a long stay.  Just know that this is a budget hotel.

title: Customer Service, That actually serves the customer.  We are the last generation to give a damn
text:
I came here to recover after
Knee reconstruction surgery. Every single Sheraton staff team member, from the moment I made my reservation made me feel, they were going to do their very best to accommodate me on this road to my recovery. My few requirements yet many requests were all granted. 
Special shout-out to this check in team, they really set me up,
Thanks to:
Golden, Angie, Chris H, Christian & especially Gary,
And so many other incredible staff members who contributed to making the beginning of my recovery: restful, peaceful careful, thoughtful, attentive patient and beyond accommodating. 
They allowed an environment to exits that is/was conducive to my being able to begin the process of healing. 
It could be, they understand customer service and everybody’s nice.
Or it could be, they understand customer service and everybody and are genuinely engaged in the service industry. 
Whatever the case, it sure changes the atmosphere when you feel the people around you actual caring they’re doing there best for you!

title: Don’t come
text:
***Warning*** Do yourself a favor and Do not come!! 
We Never had so much problems in 6 days stay (and I’ve been traveling the world for 6 months) Their staff are so rude and  so unfriendly. First they had a WiFi problem in all the second floor, we told the girl at the front desk and she  belittled us and didn’t take care of the problem. Two days later we woke up in the morning to a nightmare! The whole room was flooded from the toilet. So disgusting! Our clothes and suitcases were Soaked in water. The hotel has serious problems with the sewer system and of course instead of apologizing for the damage that they caused us They focused on blaming us. In addition, the AC didn’t work in one room for two days. And that's why guys stay away from this hotel! We had a horrible experience and there’s so many better hotels in the city.

title: Five star welcome
text: I arrived late night from a delayed flight at Laguardia - Golden at the front desk could not have been friendlier even helping me get food at the midnight hour. A great first impression of Four Points

title: Ask for Golden at the front desk
text: Check in was a breeze. The rooms are small but efficient, can’t best the location! Golden was at the front desk helping us and he was super kind, attentive, and quick with checking us in. Helped us throughout our stay and made things easier for us!

title: Issues with elevators, hygiene and housekeeping
text: Issues with out of order elevators, hygiene during the Covid mandate and pandemic, and housekeeping.   Front desk staff very helpful and supremely accommodating but hard to overcome other issues at the property.

title: Great service
text: The service is really nice. All the staff are very helpful and nice. My sister and I arrived past midnight and Golden was very kind and helped us to check in. I would visit again and 100% recommend this hotel.

title: Ms
text: Look for Golden and you are all set. Great service and I am glad he could help me and fulfill my requirements. I have stayed here seven times. The location is great. Golden went out of his way to accommodate my needs.

title: Golden
text: Great service, very helpful. Have me and my family some hot spots to visit in New York while we were visiting. He gave us great restaurants to try and some unique stores to shop for shoes. Definitely made our experience better!

title: Great Customer Service/Hospitality
text: We were grateful to be able to come across the staff at this hotel. They extremely friendly and welcoming in a way that’s truly down to earth and real, an attribute I wouldn’t normally use for staff at other hotels I’ve visited. Golden and Chris H. we’re very helpful and provided us what we needed for our stay in Manhattan.

title: Friendly, Clean and Convenient
text: I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The location is superb - walkable to all of mid to lower Manhattan, easy to find, and with relatively quiet street noise at night. The room was larger than expected, and the bed/pillows was remarkably good for the price-point. Front desk was friendly and efficient, and had free water bottles on offer. The clerk was also more than helpful in storing my suitcase on my last day and retrieving it quickly on request. The associated restaurant had a nice outdoor bar with good Happy Hour specials. Bartender Jora (name I may have wrong, but she was a beautiful young Albanian woman)) poured a mean gin & tonic and was super friendly and storied.  This place is a gem.  My only complaints - stingy on the thin bath towels, no individual toiletries, and miniscule bar of subpar soap took away from the otherwise pleasant showering experience.  I suggest that Marriott step in with better products!

title: Comfy rooms and great service !
text:
This review is a little late, but I had spent a night at this location a couple weeks ago and was warmly welcomed and taken cared of.

Especially Golden, he was the only person working at the reception when I arrived a little after midnight and he kindly helped me out in getting me a room that was spacious and also had good recommendations on where to eat. He also granted me a late checkout as I had arrived so late. 

Overall the rooms were very comfy, the staff was generous and very kind and I would definitely come back again when Im in the city.

title: Atrocious Service, Shady
text: Ick, I hate writing bad reviews...I don't even know what to say but that staying here was such a horrible experience. There's seedy people that come in and out of this hotel. I was already creeped out by this, but then the lady working the front desk was extremely rude and disrespectful..I don't think I've ever personally gotten such terrible service by hotel staff before. This saddens me. She also didn't bother wearing her mask, and this is when cases were still high and not many people were vaccinated, yet.

title: Awesome Service, Good Location 4 Vegans
text: It's not often I would be able to find a good spot to stay in NYC which has ample food options for Vegans. Those who are vegans would know what I mean. Restaurants in the area are really convenient. From a quick morning breakfast across the street to something more elegant, You'll find it close by. That and whole foods. The service... well GOLDEN is the name of a receptionist who really made my trip smooth. I came with an injured leg for a last-minute booking. My Airbnb wasn't suitable. Although I booked this place by mistake I will DEFINITELY be back again. I came during covid restrictions. Because of stripped-down amenities in all hotels at the time guests really were left with the quality of the rooms and staff interactions. Based on my experience one wouldn't miss much between this property and a Westin or W in midtown. Only maybe a bit of peace and quiet. The streets did not load at night. It's located in more of a commercial area. Trust me, you'd be happy you stayed. Golden, thank you thank you thank you again for all that you did to make my stay comforable. **ELLIS**

title: New York Vacation
text: My recent New York Vacation was fantastic. The Four Points Soho was perfect and fit my needs in every way. Check in by Angie was quick and efficient! Check out by Golden was smooth and just as fast. This review would have been 5 stars if the people in the room next to mine were a bit quieter. All in all the experience was great.

title: Four points was great
text:
After a late flight arriving to New York, we ran down to a he foupoints and were instantly accommodated by golden at the front desk.
He was lovey from the moment we walked in and even offered us water. Great service and great experience. Will definitely recommend to friends and family back home

title: Credit Card Scams!! Four Points by Sheraton is a black hotel!
text: I made a booking through booking.com. Although booking.com did not require a security deposit and explicitly stated that no amount was due until after staying at the hotel, but they got my credit card information I paid the hotel by debit card when I check in. but the hotel charged my credit card again!, BEWARE!!!  And they never refund even they admited that they have double charged me! and they will rudely hang up on my call when I demand on refund! Fraud!! call the police when it happens to you too!! and contact other victims to sue them together.

title: Best Service, Nice Rooms, Great Value
text: This was a really really great experience for me in NYC. One of the few hotel rooms are going to wear in the evening he got used to noise for party yes location quick access everything one would need. I came to the hotel last minute because the Airbnb able to close inadequate. I had a leg Andrea and moving around listen obstacle. It was the closest Bonvoy hotel to my airbnb so I booked it. I didn’t have to go far from the hotel to access good restaurants, customer services and even the subway to my final destination one I checked out. *Great Vegan Options Nearby* There’s a receptionist named GOLDEN who really stood out. Thanks again man. During Covid restrictions I stayed at five star Marriott properties like the W HOTEL Boston and others in Midtown and LA.  Stripped of perks and amenities all hotels were pretty much limited to the the experience in the rooms and guest engagement with staff. I truly didn't miss much from The W which was surprising. Rooms were stylish enough, big enough and the property values outstanding service. Although it was a random selection staying here originally, I will surely book again the next time I'm in Tribeca.

title: I always enjoy my stay at the Four Points Sheraton
text: I've stayed here quite often and I've never had one issue ever. The staff is always very helpful. Golden, Ralph, Lisa and Julie (Judie?) always take great care of me. I always know I can call the front desk and be treated with respectful service. Thanks for everything.

title: Clean and courteous in SoHo!
text:
Staff very courteous and kind at check in and check out - Christopher and Golden! 

Room was very clean, slept well and would stay again! Shower was spacious and hot, loved the easy toiletries in the shower too. On-site bar very cute, Instagtam moment for sure. Great location with easy walking access to shopping and restaurants in SoHo. 

Only recommendation for hotel is fluffier pillows!

title: Golden made our stay memorable
text: Our stay was absolutely made by golden. You need to give your employee a raise. We asked several times about local bars and different things to do and golden suggested everything. We loved staying here and felt looked after! Rooms were clean and noise was nonexistent.

title: Good location in Soho
text: Good location in downtown Manhattan!  Walking distance to everything!  Check-in was fast and contactless.  My room on 16 floor is great.  Everything is clean and nicely maintain.  It's not really a view in this location.  You get a view of surrounding buildings.

title: Stay away from this hotel
text:
It’s does not deserve the name Marriott at all , Managment is terrible when You walk in night time you ll find front desk guy with foot on the front desk l!!! Cleaning team very load in the morning talking and playing Latino music !
I found a bug in the room when talked to the manager what’s going on she said she can do nothing until investigation, there is no really investigation, if you are a respected personne don’t go there ! The only advice

title: Golden Employee!
text: This was our second time staying at Four Points Sheraton SOHO. It is a nice, clean hotel in a safe area. One employee, Golden at the front desk, made our visit especially memorable. He went above and beyond to make our visit pleasant. He and the person that hired him both deserve a big fat raise!!

title: Golden Employee of the Year!
text: My second time staying at Sheraton Four Points SOHO was again a very pleasant experience. I would like to commend one person especially, a very pleasant and accommodating front desk employee named Golden. He went out of his way to make sure our visit to NYC was outstanding. He was the epitome of a good employee and he and whoever hired him both deserve a big fat raise!

title: Amazing customer service
text: I just want to say Thank you!!! the customer service was amazing. I spoke with a guy by the name of Golden he helped me out in a emergency situation he was calm kind and smoothed the situation over. He went above and beyond to make sure I was all set. This is the kind of customer service I would expect anywhere I visit. Thanks!!

title: Great view, great location
text: My friend and I stayed here when we were between apartments. We requested the city view room and wound up with an incredible view of the financial district and the World Trade Center. The gym here has a full set of free weights and is 24/7, and the neighborhood is full of nice coffee shops and restaurants. Good access to Soho, Tribeca, na Hudson River. Also, Golden at the front desk did a good job taking care of us. Lastly, the rooms were more spacious than other manhattan hotels. Thanks!

title: Great Hotel and Great Staff
text: I arrived at the hotel after a long day of layovers and changed flights due to storms. Golden at the front desk was very attentive and helpful and made sure I had what I needed for the room. He also suggested food places that were open and helped me to pick out a great spot in the area! The room was nice and clean and everything worked as it should! Golden was truly the highlight as he went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable after a long day! I hope everyone here is like him!

title: Great service
text:
Ralph in the Frontdesk was amazing, from the beginning He helped us with everything that we needed.
The room has a good size and the view was amazing, the location is great, we had metro station close to the hotel.

title: Muy bien ubicado
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado y las habitaciones son muy cómodas y agradables. La atención del personal ha sido muy buena con una excelente
disposición.

El proceso de reserva fue muy fácil y seguro. 

Totalmente recomendado.

title: 手軽に泊まれるホテル
text:
アゴダで予約して一泊80ドル。一週間滞在。

利点としては、立地はソーホーやトライベッカ辺りに徒歩で行ける圏内で、地下鉄の駅も近く便利。部屋は最近リノベーションされたのか、家具・照明は新しめ。スーパーは10分ぐらい歩くが、ドラッグストアやデリ、カフェであれば2、3分のところに数件あり。受付スタッフが親切で好印象。短期旅行であれば十分。

欠点としては、騒音。隣のビルが工事中で、日中はチェーンソーの音が四六時中していたので、部屋にいるときはうるさかった。電話会議とか難しいかな。あと、エレベーターの隣の部屋だと、上下音がする。また、アメリカ人の宿泊客が夜うるさいこともあり。（話し声が大きい）

部屋には冷蔵庫がなく、ポットもコーヒーメーカー。（お茶を入れるとコーヒーフレーバーになる）夏場はちょっと不便。

また、デポジットの課金が50ドルと言っていたものの、実際課金された金額が異なった。（30ドル位）フロントに聞いてみたものの、システムだからよく分からないとのこと。チェックアウトの際にきちんと返金されていたので特段問題はなかったが。

コスパがよく、短期滞在であればおススメ。長期滞在はちょっときついかな。

title: good rate but no amenities
text: This hotel featured a very competitive rate for downtown Manhattan.  I’m assuming it is due to the pandemic and they had very limited services. There was no daily service in rooms, you were pretty much on your own once you checkin.  We had to empty trash ourselves and go down each day to the front desk to get more coffee, cups, towels, etc.  The showers have shampoo/bath gel dispensers and they just handed us 2-gallon jugs to refill ourselves.  Also, no microwave and mini-fridge in the room, and only one Ice machine in the basement.  But the biggest complaint was, almost everyday, several times a day, a very strong odor of cigarette smoke and marijuana smoke would fill our room (supposedly fully nonsmoking hotel).  We reported this several times but they said there was nothing they could do...?

title: Two nights during lockdown
text:
I stayed at the property at the beginning of the NYC lockdown between March 16-18, 2020. I basically got stuck in Manhattan as my youngest needed a new passport and the passport office was only a few minutes walk away.
Booked from my Marriot Bonvoy app standing in front of the hotel. Because of Covid-19 the hotel was understaffed and many services like the bar and gym closed down. I was one of 5 check ins that day. The check in was wonderful and being a SPG now bonvoy memeber was upgraded to a room with a view.
The staff were very friendly and courteous. My son became a big fan of the Janitor a Hispanic gentleman whose name I can’t recall now. Apologies for that. I guess they entertained each other a lot but he was very cautious to keep the social distancing at height. There was no cleaning service but they did provide us with fresh bed sheets, towels and unlimited water. 
No food either. However there were vending machines and microwave at the basement and a closed gym for the lockdown.

Rooms and bathroom was very small and the bathroom is very small for a Marriot brand. Smallest I came across actually. I guess that’s Manhattan hotel size of that class. 

I wouldn’t recommend the hotel for a family stay, a business stay is what the hotel was intended for.

title: Perfect place and excellent infrastructure
text:
I was there during the start of the coronavirus outbreak, even with mostly everything closed, I was happy with the hotel service, I need to get back there when all this mess is over.

Too bad I wasn't able to use all the hotel infrastructure, the common areas were closed due to the virus outbreak

But I'll return there after all this is over and will stay there again.

The hotel employees are really thoughtful and the room I stayed was really comfortable

title: A Fabulous Night..
text:
Originally a New Yorker. Wanted to hit the Village and hit some of the old Jazz Clubs. Searched Marriott.com for Hotels downtown. Remember the hotels across from SOB's. Picked the 4 Points SoHo.

In my 20+ years of Marriott loyalty, (Titanium for life), this was the best stay in years. 

Chris at the Front Desk was a gem. Great personality and he actually seemed to like his job. He offer us an upgrade due to my status, and Wow, was I Suprised when we actually got to the room. A beautiful view of the city from the top floor of the Hotel !
My girlfriend loved the room and the view.
Kudos Chris..Thanks..!

Had a fantastic time walking the Village and remembering the old spots. Stopped by SOB's on our way back to the hotel, and realized that I'm getting older, as there were just kids standing in line. The Door men didn't even know who Phyliss Hyman was. Oh.. She packed the place back in the 80's. Doorman told me he was born in 1990..Ha..
Back to the Hotel.. Girlfriend loved the view, and a great night of sleep, after a great evening out.

Hit breakfast the next morning, and saw Chris again back at the Front Desk during check out. Again, the guy seemed to have everything under control as some European guest were checking out and end.

Was a quick one night stay.. But, the upgrade, simple hospitality, and cozyness of the hotel will be in my memory banks for a long time. 

I've been to two other N.Y. properties since.. Both nice.. But, not memorable.

To the hotel Management- Chris is a keeper.. Hope it works out well for him and the Hotel.

title: Friendly Staff and Good Location
text: Great staff. Stayed here and although I had some issues the hotel General Manager was very professional and handled my concerns very well. The location is very convenient , especially to NYU visitors.

title: One Night in SoHo
text: Nice little property in the heart of SoHo; rooms are small, but that’s expected in this part of the city. Clean rooms, amazing shower water pressure & comfy beds. Exactly what I expected & a great value for a weeknight stay in February.

title: Great beds, fantastic staff, good location, no frills hotel but clean
text: I wanted to explore Soho and Greenwich Village - the shopping, The Whitney Museum and the High Line - and the location of this hotel was perfect for that, a 15 minute walk from Soho and walkable to High Line.  The rooms are basic but comfortable, renovated and good for New York, very comfortable beds, standard bathroom but clean.  The staff make up for the lack of facilites downstairs - the restaurant is dark and therefore unwelcoming, but I had a nice French Toast breakfast there, and the lobby/bar area is very small, without any nice seating.  Front desk, wait staff and bar staff all exceptionally friendly, with very personal level of service.  They booked me a car to airport and were immediately helpful with any queries.  Nice baked cookies in afternoons, plus complimentary bottled water in rooms were both nice touches.  Decent gym facilities.  All in all, very good value for money

title: Great Base of Operations
text:
Quick overnight stay for early business meeting.  My room was very well appointed, spotlessly clean and very comfortable.  The front desk staff worked very hard to make sure all my needs were met and their dinner recommendation was absolutely spot on!

There is no onsite parking so I opted to use the valet.  They worked hard to help me get checked in and out. 

I would stay here again.

title: 👍🏻
text: Nice hotel with great staff. The bartender, Caroline, was very friendly. The front office staff was very accommodating. The location is perfect. Short walk to Soho shops and west village. I really enjoyed my stay.

title: A good hotel, but the construction next door makes it impossible to rate highly right now
text:
This hotel is conveniently located and easy to get around.  It is a pretty standard NY hotel room, not fancy but I did not feel unsafe or dirty in any way.  I found the staff to be incredibly friendly and always greeted me. 

The challenge for this hotel is the construction right next door.  I can look out my window right now and I am just few feet away from the construction site.  The delivery trucks start around 6am and I am sitting her before 8am listening to a circular saw that is so loud I cannot hear the TV.  

Unfortunately, I would avoid this hotel until the construction next door is done.

title: Top Notch Customer Service
text:
Seriously... these people are GREAT. I work in the customer service industry and wished they lived in Dallas as I would try and steal them. I had just had a terrible experience at the Courtyard New York Manhattan SOHO and found this around the corner and was relieved. Chris and Hash were amazing! 

The hotel was clean and nice. Small but its NYC so expected. The restaurant was good as well! The construction does suck but in most cities, there's construction lol. Other than the exterior objections due to the constructions, I didn't notice the noise really. 

Definitely will stay here again. Thank you for making my NYC trip so much better!

title: Great place!
text:
Loved the staff and experience here! So attentive and welcoming. It was a great location and I really enjoyed coming back here everyday.
I highly recommend for solo travelers and families .
Everything was clean and tidy as well!

title: Bare-bones but clean
text: Clean, comfortable, but not too much more else. Room was of course small (that's NYC). The doors were incredibly badly soundproofed and it was possible to hear everything anyone said in the hall. The staff I interacted with at the front desk were all great and very kind. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, but it was a great rate and a good location. Didn't hear too much noise in the room (other than from the hall).

title: Condo being built next door next two years
text: We were pretty ticked off when we were awoke by construction noise on Dec. 26th as a full condo building is being erected right next door. AT OVER TWO HUNDRED PER NIGHT which has DROPPED to EIGHTY PER NIGHT (through booking.com) way to gouge the Christmas Traveller Sheraton! Watch how fast I now go to Hilton. I was offered some POINTS for the inconvenience but you could have offered a free breakfast at the very least. Soho is a great neighbourhood, but there is a Hilton Doubletree down the road without a condo going up for the next two years.

title: Clean, comfortable, nice staff, very nice stay.
text: The hotel staff was very nice, always helpful.  The coffee maker in the room is SO nice - allows me to have an early or late cup of coffee.  The fitness center served our purposes, a must for keeping with our exercise regimen while on the road.  It's priced nicer than other hotels in the area.  We were pleased.

title: The worst experience for my husband and I and our two year old daughter.
text: Let me tell you about the worst experience I have ever had with a hotel and why I will NEVER stay with a Marriott again. I am now only loyal to Hilton. My family and I arrive at this hotel at 9:30pm after a long day of traveling. It was my husband and I and our two year old daughter. We are so excited to get settled and get our little one to sleep because it is her bed time and the front desk people tell us that they sorry for the inconvenience but that they overbooked us and that they have no room available.  Mind you I never received any email or call absolutely nothing!!! It is mid December so it is freezing outside and there are no hotels available within a 100 mile radius. I am crying with my tired two year old baby girl in hand. My husband is frantically calling all hotels in the area and it is not until almost midnight when we find a Quality Inn that can take us in for the night all the way in Jersey in a very dangerous part of town. I felt sick to my stomach putting my daughter in danger and my husband felt awful doing this to his girls but we had no choice. It wasn't till 2am by the time we got to the hotel and were settled. We called Hilton which we are reward members with and they stayed on the phone with us for an hour desperately wanting to help us find something.  Thank goodness they did and we were able to check in the next morning to a Hilton in the city. I can tell you that I never write reviews but I felt inclined to do so. I hope you all never experience what we had to go through.

title: Highly Recommend
text: If you want to a great hotel in Manhattan for good value look no further. Can’t say enough good things about Charles who works at the front desk.  Will stay here every time. Exactly what your are looking for when traveling for work.

title: Great even under construction
text: While this place was under construction throughout our stay, I would still highly recommend this hotel. The staff were wonderful; very helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean and suited our needs. The bar was great as well. And location, location! Though it was a little loud in the mornings with construction, that couldn't be helped and it was still very pleasant.

title: As expected, reasonable value
text: I recently stayed at this property for 3 weekend nights, in a two-queen-bed room. The front desk, cleaning and restaurant staff were very pleasant, and I felt that had I had any special requests, they probably would have helped me out. As for the property itself, it is a reasonable value if you are getting a decent rate. The room was as small as I expected for a NYC hotel room, with a worse view than expected (of an alleyway). The fan was extremely loud, but worked to effectively block any and all noise. The beds were very comfortable and there were plenty of outlets. The bathroom was very, very small, with a counter that wouldn't fit much on it and an odd faucet setup that made it virtually impossible to wash one's face without getting water everywhere. But, the water pressure was excellent -- better than home! There are only two elevators, which often meant a bit of a wait. The lobby gets cramped easily during popular check in and check out times. The fitness centre has good equipment, but not much of it; however, I didn't really see more than one person there at any given time, so probably not an issue. Most importantly, the hotel was very well located -- several subway stops nearby, an easy walk to Soho, Tribeca, the Financial District and Midtown.

title: Convenient location to subway
text: It is probably pretty typical for a New York hotel and room. The lobby is small and cramped. The room was very small and the bathroom even smaller. For 2 people it was a bit tight. The shower was all black which made the small bathroom seem even smaller. I guess black hides mold well if there is any? The bed was comfortable though and all employees except for one were super friendly. I would recommend this hotel if you can get a good rate. I also thought the location was very good because it is so close to 2 different subway lines.

title: Solid hotel
text: I don’t really have any complaints. The room is small but it’s NY. It is expected. For the size of the room, they did pretty well. The beds are extremely comfortable. Service was good all around. Exceptional staff. There are minor improvements that can be made i.e. I went to the gym three times and most of the time there were no towels or there were temperature issues. Sometimes the staff was a little slow to respond. Overall, it didn’t change the experience too much. I would have liked if there was a microwave in the room. There is one in the basement, as well as a filtered water machine in the basement. I would stay again for the reliable service and excellent location.

title: Fabulous location and fabulous staff
text:
We recently stayed at this hotel on my first trip to NYC.  We found the hotel to be in a great location, the team at the front desk couldn't have been more helpful, as were all the staff we interacted with during our stay.  The rooms were lovely and very clean and the beds were amazing.

We would definitely recommend staying here :)

Thank you so much for a wonderful holiday

title: Mike
text:
I have been staying here for about 6 weeks now. Twice they have billed my credit card while the room was paid through my company. This second time it was for 2,662.78. I’ve complained at the front desk. My office called. Showed them receipts that it was paid. They billed me Monday it’s Friday still not reimbursed. I’d stay as far away from this place as possible. 

The cleaning people block the elevator doors constantly. So you wait a while to get up and down. The rooms are small. The hotel windows are horrible you can hear everything. Honestly for the money your better off sleeping in a tent on the street. 

Not a happy customer at all.

title: Really friendly staff, unbearable street noise
text:
The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and definitely deserve 5+ stars, and the hotel is quite nice as well. I wouldn’t even describe the rooms as small (I’ve stayed in smaller in NYC), and I love that the color scheme is light and modern. The elevators are quick, too!

My only pain point is that the noise from outside is terrible, and is ALL night long. There is some noise from within the hotel, but that’s not too bad (and pretty much expected for a hotel stay). Definitely bring ear plugs for everyone, or you’ll be listening to trucks backing up and horns blaring all night. It’s not something a TV or white noise app can drown out.

title: Good location close to soho
text: Good location in the city and the rooms are pretty good. Staff was friendly and there is a lot close by. Some rooms have a good view. There is a lot of construction in the area but that is true for most of Manhattan. You also get coffee in the room and lobby for free.

title: Great and Friendly Service!!!
text:
Here is the story- My girlfriend was going out in the city with her girlfriends to celebrate a birthday. I couldn’t make it last minute so I wanted to send some champagne. It became a title bit of an issue since I wasn’t there to use my cc. I got a call back from Hash who took care of EVERYTHING! I looked like a hero. I even got a picture so I saw what the setup and note looked like. Above and beyond... and greatly appreciated by me.
Part 2- my GF said that the staff was extremely friendly the whole visit, really helpful and the rooms were VERY clean. 
I will definitely stay here when I’m in the city to visit.

title: Truly exceptional and personalized 5-star service, our second home!
text:
My father and I spent several extended stays at the Four Points Soho. We were blown away by the extraordinary customer service we received - by the end of our stay, we were joking it felt like we’d stayed at the Four Seasons ;) 

We especially want to thank Chris S. and Hash at the front desk, whose friendliness and genuine warmth made our stay here so enjoyable. Chris and Hash did an exceptional job of making us feel at home, and went above and beyond in their problem-solving skills and hospitality to ensure that we had a smooth stay during high tourist season in New York. 

The hotel manager Christopher set the tone for this Four Points location, lifting his staff to a level of service that is on par (or even better!) with the five-star hotels where we’ve stayed. Huge thanks to all of you for making your hotel feel like our second home!

title: Reservationist Elliot went above and beyond
text: I had been working 3 nights straight and haven't slept and Elliot Stein went above and beyond to make my stay perfect. He greatee me so friendly like I known him for years and made me feel at home. I spend nights at hotels a lot because my work schedule and because of him and the location I will be staying here more often.

title: Excellent Soho Hotel
text: Great location, close to Spring St and Houston St subway stations. Clean, spacious room, friendly staff. One block to soho shopping and restaurants. Reasonable room rates for the location.Will definitely stay there next time!

title: Good location, great staff but small room, small bathroom and thin walls.
text: We stayed here for three nights. The location is good as it is located in the Soho area (away from the chaotic Times Square area) and close to subway stations. However it is quite a walk (20mins) to Chinatown/Little Italy.  Check in and check out were smooth.  No added surprises (like resort fee charged by some hotels in the area) in our bill.  The staff were great. However the room is very small and so is the bathroom. Bathroom has issues. Shower curtain is too short so water dripped all over the bathroom floor when you’re in the shower. The sink area is very small with no space for toiletries bag. The bathroom needs more hooks. There is only one tiny robe hook next to the bathtub. Love the large dispensers for shampoo, conditioner and soap. No mini fridge or microwave in the room. If you have food that needs refrigeration, you can check them with the front desk. Walls are very thin. Our room was on the 18th floor but we could hear sirens and traffic noises which affected our sleep. We could also hear people talking and walking in the hallway. Valet parking is available at $55/night. There is a shared microwave in the basement next to the gym. Ice and vending machines are also located there.

title: Personalized, warm reception
text:
We recently stayed for one night at the Four Points SoHo Village to celebrate our anniversary. The reception staff welcomed us warmly and wished us a happy anniversary, upgraded our room, and left us an anniversary surprise waiting for us in our room.  We had previously booked ourselves to change hotels for the rest of our trip to stay a little further uptown and we regretted it! The staff at this hotel were much more personable and responsive to us. The surrounding area felt much more vibrant and safe than our Times Square hotel, with a much better nightlife.  In the end, we found ourselves taking the train back into the Village on our other days to check out the Comedy Cellar and to take in some music at the local venues in the area. The downstairs bar at the hotel was nice for a couple of drinks--we enjoyed the fresh air concept, even in the pouring rain.
