It was easy to access the hotel using the subway from LaGuardia, and we really enjoyed our stay here. We were warned of construction noise, but we didn't notice anything from our room.

title: Decent location for a short stay
text:
Located in Soho area and near a subway station.
Rooms are quite small but had all the amenities needed.
Room was clean and neat and in general hotel was in quite good condition.
Staff were friendly and check-in/out was fuss free and a breeze.

title: Good deal but that is about it
text: We were lucky to want to go to Soho when most of the world was going to beaches so ended up with a remarkable $100/night rate. I will not be picky at that price anywhere, especially Manhattan. However I would not pay over $200 for this hotel....The location was great -- an easy walk to the Village or Soho. All the front desk staff were amazingly friendly and it was nice to have lemon water available for guests all the time. Just don't expect much. The hotel bathrooms show their age in the grout and I hate those air conditioners that are almost like window units spewing out relatively cool air but so much humidity at the same time. The room just felt a bit icky but for one night just fine. Should also note that picky sleepers note rooms not that soundproof and mattresses not that supportive. Very white plush towels though!

title: Excellent location, but tiny everything and uncomfortable beds
text: Not my favorite four points.  This wasn't cheap - pretty sure we paid upwards for $500 a night for the room.  I can deal with tiny, I expect that in the city.  But the beds were uncomfortable.  Next time I'll go further out from where I'm meeting and book a better Marriott brand.

title: Couldn't have picked a better spot!
text: We had 4 adults in our group, first time to NYC for 2 of us. We had just a quick 12 hours to see a few of the sites and decided SoHo would be a great neighborhood to stay in. Four Points was a perfect choice. Check in was quick and efficient, the rooms were very comfortable and clean. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and the drinks were delicious in the "partially open air bar" . Even though the hotel is undergoing some renovation, it didn't stop us from having a wonderful, although brief, stay.

title: Otima localizaçao
text: Estive neste hotel em Julho/19 com minha familia e gostamos muito. Os quartos são bem confortaveis, limpos e as camas muito boas. O Hotel fica proximo de 02 linhas do metro o que ajuda muitissimo na locomoçao, nao usei taxi e nem uber nenhuma vez, vim de trem e metro do aeroporto JFK com tranquilidade. Vizinhança bem tranquila, tem um Dunkin Donuts na esquina e um MCdonalds ha 2 quadras.

title: Overnight
text: A really good overnight location for a quick weekend in New York.  Perfect location in Soho and west side.  Close to Holland Tunnel for easy in and out.  Close to subway.  Great foodie location within quick walking distance to Bleecker street pizza slice legends.  Rooms functional and clean.  Coffee downstairs for free in the AM.  Well staffed and friendly.

title: Mostly good
text:
I spent five nights at this hotel and mostly enjoyed the stay. 

Front desk staff are excellent but the housekeeping left a bit to be desired.

Housekeeping was very hit and miss, good some days and negligible on other days and the Wi-Fi speed was disappointingly slow.

The rooms are on the small side but not a surprise for New York and nearby construction is quite noisy.

title: Amazing one night stay
text: I only stayed here for one night but was so impressed by the hospitality and the staff. They are willing to go above and beyond for you. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I’m not use to New York and it really did a number on me. I was sore from head to toe. They let me stay a little longer in my room even after I was suppose to check out to rest and I will forever be eternally grateful for that.

title: SMALLEST ROOM - NO CLOSET
text: I was told the rooms were small but this one set the bar for the smallest.  I could live with it being smal,l but the bed was awful.  The mattress was covered with what felt like a loose piece of plastic.  It was removed but the mattress was so old, and hard, as it didn't have a pillow top.  To make matters worse the fitted bottom sheet would not stay fitted and kept coming loosing, making it an effort to put it back in the dark.  I don't know how they got away calling it a room without a closet.  They did have a hanging cabinet but not a closet?  The bathroom was modern but the shower so narrow it was very hard to take a shower.  The towels were small and not very soft.  If this was a budget hotel I wouldn't expect more but was rated four stars and based on the price I paid I was upset.

title: Front desk agent
text: Chris S at the front desk was phenomenal he helped me with all my problems and was very professional. I would recommend this hotel! Such a genuine character he really made us feel at home. My first selection always from now on when booking in the city.

title: Great spot for a budget friendly trip!
text: My two brothers and I really enjoyed this hotel for a few nights on a long weekend trip to NYC! The hotel is small in general so expect the lobby  to fill quickly. There is a nice bar there though and my family said the restaurant was fantastic! The rooms are small but were fine for a few nights. Water pressure is great and soft towels! Beds were surprisingly great. Construction noise was loud but you’re going to find that a lot in NYC. Would definitely come back!

title: Don't return until noise is gone. Nearby construction noise is unbearable all night long. They work 24x7
text: The room is nice for NYC standards. Free coffee and water is nice touch. Spacious bed and everything is clean, but the noise of machinery, trucks backing up with that hideous beep, beep prevent you from falling sleep. I had to use ear plugs and not even then was reasonably quiet to fall sleep

title: Best place in lower Manhattan
text: Since 2010, we've stayed at this hotel whenever we can; during our annual Christmas visit or, most recently, at the end of June. The staff has always been amazing and the rooms are excellent. I couldn't recommend the Four Points Soho Manhattan highly enough.

title: Cleanliness and Convenient
text: I am so glad I chose this place to stay, considering i had no real idea which area I was staying as I hadnt been to New York previously. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are very clean albeit a little dated. The position in SoHo is perfect for whatever you wish to do. Whether its for business or pleasure. The Subway is one street away and the waterfront 5-8 min walk. I would recommend this place for any type of traveller.

title: GREAT staff, lousy hotel
text:
I want to preface this review by saying the staff is some of the best I’ve come across - they remembered my name and greeted me each time I came and left. Couldn’t ask for better!

Everything else about the hotel was sub par at best. The room - and especially the pillows - smelled moldy and old and the space was tiny even by NY standards. The AC was so noisy you couldn’t hear the TV when it was running. 

The bed was hard as a rock. The elevators were so slow there was a line to get on one from the lobby. 

The room I was in was near a service door that slammed and woke me up several times a night. Possibly the most concerning - I woke up covered in bug bites. 

Hopefully this amazing staff can transfer to a hotel worthy of their hard work. I won’t be back.

title: Nice stay, close to NYU
text:
Pleasant check in by a very polite and helpful young man. Parking close by, walking distance. I chose self Park, but they also offer a valet. Nice little bar downstairs with good wine selection and pleasant bartender. There is also an adjacent restaurant with a great Italian menu.
The rooms were small but clean, and had everything we needed. Convenient location, close to water and close to NYU. Will likely stay again.

title: Mr. Haka concert
text: Good location. Friendly. Complimentary water and coffee in yhe room. Small room but clean and nice city view. Recommended. Walking distance to many restaurants and taberns. Subway station in the corner.

title: Fun Visit to Soho
text: This Four Points offers comfortable and quiet rooms with easy access to the restaurants and clubs and theaters of Soho, one of the best parts of New York.  The hotel staff is super friendly and accommodating.  My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our visit.  Highly recommended!

title: Quick Trip 2019
text: Stayed one night before dropping off kid for summer internship.  Service was very responsive.  Bathroom could use new grout.  Beds were very comfortable.  Location walking distance to many restaurants and points of interest.  Would be willing to stay here again in the future.

title: Nice stay in New York.
text: Stayed here for 5 nights in may. Had a great stay. The staff where great and friendly. The weather was warm so we needed the aircon, it was a bit noisy when it kicked in. The rooms where a bit small, but we survived fine we where 3 persons in a room with 2 queen size beds. The beds where great and the rooms clean. And perfect location in SoHo. Close to the shopping streets and there where a lot of good restaurants around the hotell. The gym where small, but perfect if you wanna have a run along the Hudson river.

title: Amazingly Broken
text: This is the second time I stayed at this property.  I fought with the room for 3 days, particularly the heating/AC which required a PhD to operate, and was dysfunctional.  Too hot, too cold, could not stabilize.   The closet was so small you could not hang close without crunching up shirts, jackets, pants at the bottom.  I raised all this and they tried to fix but could not.  The closet was not a standard size.  Also, the blinds were not working.     I run a business as was very surprised at the response.  I told them I was going to report this unless I heard from someone by today.  No response.   I was part of a group and will recommend that this hotel not be used next year.   Four Points:  Pay attention to your guests.   You ignored me and my request to resolve.   Not a good business practice.    With that, I will say the restaurant there is superb.

title: Molto confortevole
text: Una camera con arredi semplici ma molto nuovi pulizia accurata e letti comodissimi la double perfetta per le famiglie. La metro a pochissima distanza per raggiungere la New York più turistica. Alla reception personale molto gentile

title: Comfortable stay with super friendly service
text: Just spent three nights in Manhattan and was lucky to get a room here for a very reasonable rate. The staff were extremely helpful and the facilities were amongst the best in this class of hotels. I would highly recommend this place as a central stay for anyone visiting NYC.

title: Construction Central
text: My room was decent and the front desk and housekeeping staff were very friendly.  Had a couple of nice dinners in the restaurant along with good service.  This would have been a good stay if they didn't have so much construction going on.  Constant horn blowing between construction in front of the hotel and the tunnel traffic.  The worst part was that on a rainy weekend, it was very difficult to get picked up and dropped off at the hotel.  If I hadn't of stayed here before I would have never found it with all of the construction and scaffolding in front of the hotel.  I was excited to see they were taking the scaffold down on Friday evening and it went right back up Monday morning.  The hotel needs to have some type of doorman to keep vehicles from parking in front so guests can get dropped off or picked up.  This alone would keep me from returning in the near future.

title: Meh
text: For a Four Points Sheraton, this is nothing special. Titanium Elite get a free breakfast, but nothing else...rooms are mediocre, there is a lot of construction so be prepared to get up with the dawn patrol. The Sheraton Tribeca down the street is much much nicer and often cheaper. No lounge here, Sheraton Tribeca has nice lounge and bar, plus they give you free drinks. No such luck at the four points. If you’re using points, stay at the Sheraton Tribeca.

title: Terrible experience with Jessy at front desk
text:
I am a frequent Marriott / Sheraton customer (~40 nights / year).

I was stunned with how rudely I was treated by the front office staff while trying to check in.  

Two separate issues.  Details are below.  The tl;dr is that the staff was rude and completely not helpful.

----

Issue #1.  I had two one-night reservations.  I called ahead to combine them into one reservation so I would not have to check and check out.  No problem, I was assured.  When I arrived and tried to combine, Jessy refused.  I asked politely.  She said it was "impossible".  I asked again.  Then, I called Marriott.  With pressure from corporate, Jessy magically found a solution.  It wasn't impossible.  Jessy just didn't want to help.

Issue #2.  The hotel staff demanded that I pay with a "PIN" for a credit card.  There is no PIN associated with my credit card.  They refused to run the card by hand and

title: Close to piers
text: Walking distance to the piers. Situated in the heart of Soho.  A short cab ride to broadway ( 20.00). Hotel has a small bar located in the lobby. It also is located near several restaurants. A coffee bar is a short walk away.  Hotel room was clean and the staff was accommodating.

title: Soho Nice Despite Construction
text: With hotel rooms so very expensive in NYC, we were happy to get a great price because there was heavy construction right next door.  The hotel soundproofing was pretty good, and the jackhammers weren't too bad, and didn't go on too long, at reasonable times.  The only issue we had was that we made a 6 pm reservation for the San Marino restaurant, and they had a party that ran too long with loud music they didn't have the nerve to shut down so we could eat there. Not the hotel's fault.  They have blackout curtains, which is nice.  And they have shampoo, conditioner and body gel hanging in the shower for the eco-green minded folks!  Also if you don't change towels and linens, you get a credit for your Starwoods card (Marriott has taken over Sheraton).  Worth it.

title: Second stay and again satisfied
text: It was now the second time that I stayed in this hotel. The first time I got upgraded to a Suite in the upper level which was nearly nice. This time I had a standard room which is for sure much smaller but still very comfortable and spacious (at least for NYC standards). I liked in both rooms that I had a walk-in shower and not a bath tube. The bar in the lobby area is OK. This time the breakfast restaurant was closed (not sure why). Momentarily there are construction works in the neighborhood which may bother people that are very noise conscious; for me, it wasn't a problem at all. The location of the hotel is ideal for my purpose and I will pick it again when I have to do business in this area of NYC.

title: Great location - too bad the walls are so thin!
text:
My husband and I stayed over the Easter weekend. You couldn't ask for a better location. So centrally located in Soho and close to West Village. Incredible restaurants and night clubs within five to ten minute walk. 
Unfortunately during a recent renovation a few things were overlooked, namely insulating the walls. We could here everyone coming and going at all hours of the day and night. We could even here the elevator bell! Also, there are very small armoire type closets with perhaps five hangers where nothing longer than a man's shirt can hang. We had to put our coats over the desk chair.
The in-house restaurant is lovely and the food very good. All of the staff in the hotel were great.
There is construction beside the hotel so staying on a high floor would be recommended.

title: Visiting my Niece at college
text: My sister planned this trip.  This hotel was very nice and very clean.  I guess all hotels in New York City have small rooms but this room was still very clean and the bathroom was very clean.  The only complaint we had is that there was no fan in the bathroom so it got very steamy.  The view out of our window was of One World Trade Center and the Jenga building.  The staff was also very friendly.  I would definitely stay here again if in New York City.

title: Decent for the price
text: The hotel is nothing special and the reception does not indeed gives a good impression. Rooms are small but clean and acceptable for New York standard and the price is quite all right for what you are offered. People working there are pleasant and the location is good for the area.

title: Clean rooms, good staff, close to conveyance options and peace of mind
text:
WHAT THEHEEBEE SAYS ABOUT FOUR POINTS BY SHERATON MANHATTAN SOHO VILLAGE:

I visited New Your in Feb-2019 on a business trip from India. During that trip, I stayed at Four Poins for a week and I am very happy with the overall experience that I had.

Location etc:
Four Points is located on Charlton Street and has very easy access to all conveyance options. Apart from the easy availability of cabs, Subway and Path stations are at walking distance from the hotel. Also, the hotel is close to many Deli shops, grocery places, restaurants and also from the Hudson River Front. 

The room and my stay:
My room was on the 17th floor with a fantastic view. The room was very clean and the staff would regularly clean it daily and refill the complementary provisions and bathroom accompaniments. The room consisted of a big bed with soft pillows and quilt and a comfortable study table. On the front facing wall, there was a big glass window from where I used to enjoy the mornings. A coffee maker and complimentary coffee making ingredients would help me to burst my stress after the day at the office. There was sub-zero temperature in New York with snowfall during my trip. The hotel room's heater would help to keep me warm and get a peaceful sleep. 
They have also installed a television with many interesting channels. 
The room also consists of a closet, an iron, iron board, and a safety locker. Water was complimentary for me and I never faced any issue in requesting for as much as I required.

The bathroom consists of a bathtub with 24 hours of hot water supply, a toilet commode and a wash basin with mirror. The provisions include soap, shampoo, conditioner, towel, napkins, toilet paper, cotton, etc. There are plug points for hair dryer/shaver.

Each room has electronic keys which are assigned to the guests during check-in. The hotel also has an ATM machine, a snack vending machine, and a complimentary ice-vending machine in the basement apart from a convenient small gym.

The staff is very professional and helpful. They are soft-spoken and always smiling. I need to mention that such good staff creates a good stay for travelers. 

There is a decent restaurant where daily I used to have breakfast before heading for the office. They offer very healthy breakfast options at reasonable cost.

I loved the fact that the whole hotel premises is a no-smoking zone.

I would definitely recommend my friends to stay at Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan SoHo Village and if I am again traveling to New York, then I would also look forward to staying again here.
 

Signing Off
Hiral Amodia
(TheHeeBee)

title: Excellent Service - goes above and beyond
text: In January, my family visited New York and we stayed at this hotel.  It was clean, well kept, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  A special thank you to Brian Matos, Director of Rooms.  My daughter left some jewelry in the room.  Not only did he ensure that housekeeping found it, but he also took it upon himself to send it to us.  He went well above and beyond!  Thank you

title: Nice, modern hotel in a great neighborhood
text: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and cleanliness of this hotel given the price point. The room was comfortable and fairly noise free. The space was small but not so small that it felt claustrophobic. The hotel is super close to great bars, several subways, restaurants and Trader Joe’s. The staff was really nice and our check in/check out were as smooth as it gets. This is a really nice option for a comfortable and economical stay in one of the best Manhattan neighborhoods.

title: Not the quality that Four Points properties once boasted
text:
Excellent location for the performances, museums, and restaurants we scheduled for this tightly-scheduled two-night stay in the Village, with welcoming and helpful front desk staff, chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon, and an urn of decent hot chocolate all afternoon and evening. The charm ends in the lobby, though.

It's Manhattan, and an older building at that, so one expects small rooms and bathrooms. One does not expect an old, uncomfortable mattress and a badly engineered bathroom. Example: the single towel or bathrobe hook is located directly above the light switch (so if a towel is drying there, you have to grope around for the switch) and behind the shower door opening (you have to exit the shower to fetch your towel from either the toilet seat (the handiest place to put it) or exit the shower and close the shower door to get your towel off said hook. At least the inconvenient towel hook has an alternative, the toilet seat. The mattress has no alternative. 

OTOH, the king-bedded room here was $40/night less than the boutique hotel slightly farther north in the Village that offered only queen beds. I'd tell myself that the queen mattress would have been just as uncomfortable for us, but my husband and I like each other quite a bit, so we'd have slept better on a more updated mattress.

title: Just an OK Place to Stay
text: I guess it is the old adage, you get what you pay for. The hotel itself is ok - no great shakes - the rooms are large for NYC standards.  I am a Marriott Platinum for life member and thought I would at least give this place a try, I wish I had stayed at the Courtyard around the corner.  The sad part is the lobby is so small that we actually went to the Courtyard just to have conversations.  The restaurant is under staff and was not good at all, breakfast was the worst.  If you are in town on business and have a schedule, I would not recommend the restaurant - you have to be very flexible with your time as they are so understaffed.  I doubt I will come back - the neighborhood rocks with a subway stop a block away and so much to see and do within walking distance.  The bathroom was extremely small (college dorm room small) and the windows were drafty.  If you are looking to save money - this is an ok place to stay.

title: Great location for Soho shopping etc.
text: Stayed here for the weekend with out of town visitors. Great location for spending time in Soho.  Hotel (lobby and rooms) are a bit small. Only 8 rooms on each floor so it’s a bit load as well-can hear the elevator and hall conversations. But all in all a nice hotel with great location, would definitely return. Staff was friendly as well.

title: Everything you could want - comfortable, clean and great service
text: I wasn't sure what to expect based on some of the reviews, but I was overjoyed to find this is a real treasure and a great value for the price and location. The front desk staff is exceptionally friendly- they make you feel very welcome. The rooms are small but very well appointed so you can easily move around and work if you need to. I really liked that you could open the windows to get fresh air. Beds are extremely comfortable and the bathrooms VERY clean- impeccable! Only feedback is that the sinks are very exuberant in their heat and rate of spray so be careful. Room service was fast and good and the hotel restaurant nice and an easy option. An easy walk too, to many great things. I am already looking forward to my next stay- I'll be back!

title: Decent SoHo option, BUT
text: Rooms are clean and larger than most in New York.  The TV is old and the remote barely worked.  The bathroom is clean but needs updating and the toilet needs some work.  The construction 30 feet out my window is a bit much.  I'm wearing earplugs in my room now so I can hear myself think.  It starts at 7:15 every morning.  Would return post-construction but no way I'm coming back any time soon.

title: Exceptional customer service and clean well appointed rooms
text: Just an incredible staff of hospitality professionals and a wonderful location in SoHo. Led by General Manager Patricia Caruso, I was very impressed. The backstory. . I called to get an email address for the concierge as I wanted to get some recommendations. The person answering gave me an email address to pose my questions. Very personable and helpful on the phone. I sent my 6 questions and got a gull page of recommendations and narrative from the conciege. Upon arrival the "concierge" was gone for the day. The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. On the third day I asked for the concierge "Patricia" as I wanted to thank her fo all herhelp. The front desk personnel gave me a kind of funny look and said something about checking with.the general manager and went off to find Patricia.  A few moments later I put it together as Patricia approached. Patricia Caruso is THE general manager of the Sheraton Four Points Soho. She told me She was passing by the front desk when I called and was happy to help. She sent me a  full page six paragraph email of things to do, restaurants to try and even checked into where I could get a baked potato and soup close by for a friend with special dietary needs! Who does that!? Patricia Caruso THE general manager of the Sheraton Four Points Soho that is who. And the rest of the staff from front desk to maintenance to housekeeping were just as personable and friendly and helpful. This is great customer service and so rare these days. Great job to all. Clean, nice rooms and showers.

title: Good Service
text: I travel to New York often. I enjoyed the stay here at this location. Everyone I encountered was extremely friendly. The guy who checked me in was very friendly and professorial. The vending machine had took my money downstairs, the candy got stuck. The girl at the front desk she had blonde hair refunded my money. She gave me the 1.00 and the 50 cents from her own purse. She apologized for the inconvenience. I had requested a wine opener they had brought it too me within a few minutes of asking for it. The bartender was also friendly, the wine was a little expensive. It was 28$ for two glasses. The room was very clean. I would recommend this hotel and will be a return guest here.

title: near WNYC Greene space
text: This hotel is conveniently located near the WNYC Greene space. I've stayed several times and the room is great, but the bathrooms could use some work. They look luxe, but they turn out to be cheap. The sinks have these long goose neck taps, which look great, but the water splashes everywhere when you turn them on. The shower curtain came unhooked easily from the rod, but using closeable loops would mean that didn't happen. No matter how I try, I always have water spill out from the shower onto the floor. The I feel guilty and use the bath mat to wipe it up.

title: Nice stay
text:
The hotel has a good location. We are gold members so we got an upgrade. The room was clean with a beautiful view. Even with the upgrade the room was small, but I guess this is normal for New York standards. Also it was a little noise, we could hear everything from the other rooms. 
Very friendly staff!

title: Hotel disappoints!
text:
The room was extremely small. I booked this hotel as it was a double queen bed room as we had 4 in our party. I had to book another room as it was impossible to stay with 4 in this room.  

Previously stayed at the Marriott Marquis and staying at this Sheraton was a true disappointment. It is not convenient to anything. Absolutely no SoHO “charm”. 

Additionally, I suspect our entire family got very sick at this hotel-possibly from dining in the restaurant upon our arrival. Our trip abruptly ended due to our family getting sick. I had to pay for the additional night stay even though we checked out early-I initially thought to myself how this hotel could have vacant rooms days before Christmas—we certainly know why. 

As a Platinum Elite member with Marriott, the merger with the Starwood brand has not been positive. I have stayed at 2 Sheraton’s since the merger and will. It stay in another one. 

The Manager upon check out seemed to be more interested in being on the phone (or pretending as such). He certainly was not willing to consider waiving the fee for another night even though we checked out early—and, I had to get this 2nd room because the original room was too small. 

Poor service from this hotel!

title: Great location near Soho and the West Village
text: Only stayed at this property for 1 night for a business event.  Very expensive for what it was, but it was NYC in Nov/Dec.  Very friendly hotel front desk staff.  Small but efficient room, spacious bathroom with stand up shower (although water wasn't very warm).  Comfortable bed and sheets.  Ask for a high floor, I was on the 8th floor and the street noise was very loud.  Will definitely stay here again, my office is right in the area.

title: Macy's Day parade
text: Great hotel and in the perfect location! This hotel is right off a Subway stop, down the street from the heart of Soho, Chinatown,  and Little Italy.  The Management of this hotel is very lucky to have Jullian at the front desk. He was super friendly and very helpful. I hope he is there when we go back.

title: Expensive (but we stayed during Thanksgiving holiday)
text:
Location is ideal as there is a less than 5min walk subway nearby. Loads of restaurants and deli, the coffee shop across the street is splendid. 
Bathroom needs improvement. The toilet is hard to flush. You have limited hooks to hang your clothes, it takes some time for the water in the shower drain to subside. 
No ref available in the room. 
They do provide complimentary water.

title: Stop in for the Pizza But Don't Stay There: Their Overpriced Room Was Freezing - Heater Did Not Help
text:
I stayed here for a work visit to NYC in early December and expected a regular Sheraton experience but was disappointed. I had a great meal at the hotel restaurant and would say that their pizza is some of the best I've ever had, even in NY City.  Stop by for pie, but find another hotel.  

The no-frills room I had (306) was horrible for two main reasons: 1) It was designed for handicapped access, which sounds good but the floor was uneven throughout the entire room; I can't imagine how a person in a wheelchair could navigate that without getting caught in ruts - what were they thinking?. 2) The temperature control is useless; the bathroom and heater were on the opposite sides of the room and the bathroom was FREEZING, to the point that I was shivering even before I got in the shower even with the heater on its highest setting for 5 hours. All it did was heat up the closet (which is half-sized, by the way; if you have a long coat or dress, it will crumple up on top of the safe). The ice cold stone bathroom floor doesn't help, nor did the tub, which didn't drain.  Asking a handicapped person to move from a wheelchair to the tub and back in those conditions is just plain cruel and unconscionable.  There's no refrigerator either and I could hear everything going on in the room next door. The cost of the room was extremely high for what it offered too: try the Hampton Inn on  Watts or the Arlo on Hudson or the James if you need to stay in the area.

title: The very best thing about this hotel is their staff - especially the Front Desk.
text: The location is great - the West Village bordering on Soho and Tribeca. The rooms have been recently redone. Very good Italian restaurant off the lobby and a gym in the lower level. If you want to feel pampered with excellent guest services - this is your hotel.

title: Very common place at high price
text:
I like Soho. And I usually try to find a good accommodation, changing depending on the price of the room.
The four points in SoHo has nothing special, at the border of Soho. The room has a good size, clean, and not too noisy. The staff was friendly, as usual, but nothing very particular.
And the price was more than 200 bucks, without breakfast, not really a place to go, too Anonymous. I could find better, looking more seriously, in this district

title: Good location but very uncomfortable.
text:
I'm an SPG gold member but was told no upgrades were available upon checking in -- this is fine and normal except when I looked at availability online through the normal booking site upgraded rooms were available. 

I wouldn't recommend ordering anything from the hotel restaurant as the food is not that great and there are many better places in walking distance with comparable prices. 

Lastly, the bed was so uncomfortable that I had a hard time sleeping and woke up with a pain in my lower back. I stay in many hotels and travel a lot for work and this is probably the least comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Overall I wouldn't stay here again and booked another SPG property for my last night.

title: Comfy beds and clean
text: Great location and staff very accommodating and friendly. Room 1007 was small and not the greatest view but very clean and bed was so comfy and the shower pressure was awesome. Room service was fast and food was tasty. I will definitely go back.

title: Nice renovations but very noisy room
text: The hotel has been recently renovated, so the rooms and lobby are nice albeit small like many other NYC hotels.  The service was good at check in and check out.  My room was clean.  However, the window was partially open when I checked in and although I tried to close it, it wouldn’t close all the way.  This meant the normal NYC noise was even louder. There was construction across the street, which seemed like it went all night.   I didn’t sleep much either night I was there.  It was the least expensive room in the area but for over $400 per night, I would have liked a slightly quieter room.  Will think very hard before staying there again. Perhaps a room on the other side of the hotel may be quieter.

title: Great Weekend Stay for Large Group
text: We stayed here with a large group for our wedding at City Winery and it was nothing but pleasant from the start. Working with the team to set up the room block was made so easy by the incredible staff. Upon our stay, everyone at the hotel went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed and were welcoming and friendly. The hotel has recently renovated the rooms and the lobby/check in area is much more inviting than it was before. Being in NYC, hotel rooms are usually pretty small but I thought these rooms were a good size. I moved into the suite for two nights and that had great views and was big enough for my bridal party and I to get ready in. We hosted brunch on Sunday in the private room at San Marino restaurant next door and it was the perfect send off for our guests. We heard that dinner at San Marino was excellent too, which is also where the room service at Four Points comes from. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay!

title: The perfect
text: A large number of family and friends stayed here for our wedding at Houston Hall. We were treated like royalty by the hotel staff. Location was perfect and all of our guests were treated well. We also hosted a brunch on the Sunday following the wedding at the San Marino restaurant within the hotel, which was convenient and very cost-effective (Sunday brunch for 100 guests in Manhattan....) No issues whatsoever.

title: OK hotel, but I feel ripped off
text:
If you want to be in Soho/Village, it is a good location.  The subway is convenient.  The front desk was friendly and check-in was painless.  There's free coffee in the room and in the lobby.  

The room was clean enough, although very small, even by NY standards. The bathroom was also very small.  The A/C and TV worked fine.   I would say this is just basic "tourist class" accommodations.

The pricing issue I had was this:   After I made the reservation, but before the day of check-in, I saw online that the price had gone down, for the same date and room category I had booked.  So I called to get the lower rate.  To my surprise, the hotel refused to honor the lower rate.  I guess they might have the legal right to do that, but it is a "sharp business practice" and will generate ill-will from customers.  I guess they can be happy that they ripped me off for an extra $40, but the price for doing that is that I would never stay there again.

title: Seriously Needs Improvements
text: Was supposed to stay for 2 nights and checked out next day to move to Courtyard next door.. Bathrooms are extremely small with broken tiles, towels with holes in it and old blankets with thread coming out it.. would u expect this for 450$ hotel? If yes, then go ahead.. I would never stay again..

title: Poor service, mediocre room
text: Platinum Marriott member. First time at this hotel - I usually stay at the Courtyard around the corner. Poor check in experience - was given a key that did not work, had to come back down with bags to get a new key. Arrived in room to find no bar soap at the sink, and the sink did not drain properly. On the second day, no soap provided and no wash cloths. The sink still did not drain. Asked receptionist for the nearest mailbox and the receptionist offered to mail my letter for me the next day. I gave it to her and thanked her. I'm checking out two days later, I see my letter right there on the counter. Really? They cannot even bother to mail a letter. My advice to Marriott - ask the management at the Courtyard next door to train the staff here. Oh - and the AC unit in the room is loud. Overall a very poor experience.

title: Location was excellent - service was not
text:
We stayed here for 6 nights and had issues. For the first 3 days we had a toilet that did not work properly. So we had to go to the basement (down 24 floors) if we needed to do anything more than a wee. Each day when we went out we would ask the hotel to fix it and each night when we came back it was still not working properly. 

We were then moved to another room where the pipes rattled. We then got moved back to the original room and this time the toilet was fixed. This all took very expensive NYC holiday time, packing and unpacking and took a toll. To the hotel’s credit they did reduce our bill to compensate us for all this mucking around.

The hotel is in a very good location and we selected it as it was close to our daughter’s apartment. It is also close to the subway and there are lots of good restaurants in the vicinity. It is also quite close to Trader Joes which is a supermarket. 

There was no fridge in the room but we asked for one and this was provided free of charge. The rest of the room was fine and comfortable. Even though we were close to a busy street where the traffic often became jammed, the noise did not affect us. There was no noise from neighbouring rooms. The air conditioning was food during the day but we turned it off at night.

One night they provided meatballs and snacks in the reception/ bar area for guests and this was good. They also had cookies at the counter at a certain time of the day.

title: Nice service
text:
I and my friend stayed in July.  The hotel is so quiet. Our room was so nice and clean.  I'd like to know about the information about the refrigerator and the laundromat service in advance.  As for laundromat service, the hotel has laundry service and so nice.
We'd like to say thank you the hotel and technicians because the door knob of the bath room was sooo fast to repair! We asked the knob at the late night, but the hotel service tried to repair at the time. 
The moment was a great memory of our stay, especially my friend was 1st trip to USA!
Thank you so much for the help!!!

title: Good value, location and staff
text: This is a very basic, no frills hotel. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only downside (if you have a car) is this place is hard to find and even harder to park. Even using valet parking is not easy due to the fact that there is construction near the drop off point in front of the hotel. Would stay again if I didn’t have a car.

title: Clean, comfortable, updated Four Points
text: Stayed here for a night during summer 2018 while on business trip. The rooms are small but not exceptionally so compared to what one would get in NYC. The prices fluctuate week to week but the Four Points generally offer value for money if one is looking for something basic. This property is either new or recently updated - the rooms are clean and there's little wear and tear. I like how the entire room is well illuminated with a couple of switches (less common than one would think!). There are only 2 elevators which can be a problem during peak hours but thankfully there are less than 20 stories in this building. Overall a decent stay.

title: Close Quarters
text: Everything about this hotel is small; from the room, to the bathroom, elevators and the bar. It was nice, the service was good, but it's small. The fitness center is under construction & inaccessible.

title: Clean and Comfortable, but Small
text:
First off, the hotel is undergoing some major renovations, so please be prepared for some construction noise. It isn't any worse than normal NYC street noise, just something to note when booking the hotel.

My husband and I were both traveling for work and got a room on the 21st floor that was already renovated. It was cute and had enough room for both of us, other than the bathroom. This is a teeny tiny bathroom and the shower is small as well. A large person would have trouble maneuvering. Toiletries were nice, but smelled a little manly.

It was much noisier than I expected (not counting the construction), but that may have been because the window had an issue and didn't close all the way. We got a lot of street noise (surprising from that high up) and it was rough during rush hour since room 2101 overlooks the entrance to the Hudson Tunnel. The noise in the hotel was more than what I would have expected also, considering there were only 6 rooms on the floor. A lot of doors banging throughout the evening.

The bed was not very comfortable. Every time my husband would shift in his sleep, the whole bed would move. It was also not very firm, so if you like a soft and jiggly bed you may enjoy it. 

We also were supposed to have bottled water in our room but housekeeping must have missed that, so I had to ask for it at the front desk (along with an extra towel). Everyone at the front desk was super friendly every time we interacted, and the gentleman bringing us towels and water almost beat us to the room.

The lobby is pretty tiny but we didn't spend much time there. The elevators were actually pretty quick for us on the 21st floor; I was pleasantly surprised.

Overall, I would stay here again if the price is right. Convenient to the 1,3 and the ACE lines, short walk through a cute neighborhood to get to Broadway, plenty of restaurants nearby (and a Starbucks!) but away from the smell and traffic of Canal. I also got a glimpse into one of the penthouse rooms down the hall when two of the staff went in - it looked VERY nice if you can get an upgrade!

title: Great Hotel, Wonderful Service!
text: I frequent NYC several times a year. Every time I go to NYC, I usually stay at the Four Points by Sheraton. I stay at this hotel because the staff is great, the hotel is reasonably priced for an amazing location, and the rooms are clean! I have never left a review for this hotel, however, I was prompted to do so this time around because of the exceptional service I had last week. After a long day of travelling, my husband and I were rather tired, and grumpy, however, upon checking in we were greeted with a warm smile by a gentleman named Julian. He embodied the definition of hospitality. He was kind enough to help us with our bags, and even recommended great shows and restaurants. Furthermore, when I had quipped about how I was too tired to walk to Starbucks for a cup of coffee, he sent additional coffee to our room (which was delicious!). In a day an age where customer service staff remains to be mediocre, this man went above and beyond for us. My husband and I will certainly be returning to the Four Points and recommending it to ALL our friends and family. Thank you four points, and most of all, thank you Julian for making our stay a memorable one!

title: Good hotel for the price!
text: We stayed two nights at the Sheraton four points after a very long flight. The hotel is easy to get to from the subway station either Houston or Spring st. Not a great location if your wanting to see the major sights in NYC, but it is close to the Fire station museum, supermarket & subway. The beds were very comfortable, nice hot shower, and the room was cool and clean. The room was small but for the price it was great value for 4 people. No refrigerator in the room, but complimentary bottled water and tea/coffee. The Reception staff were very friendly and speedy at checking us in. There is a Starbucks and Pret N Manger around the corner. I would highly recommend this hotel if your on a budget in NYC!!

title: Très bon hôtel bien situé, à proximité du métro
text:
Nous étions 4 et avons trouvé cet hôtel qui fait un prix intéressant pour le Week-end; notre budget limité nous a contraint à dormir à 4 dans la même chambre. Excellente literie; propre, salle d'eau impeccable. 4 valises dans une chambre assez large pose néanmoins un problème de place. Nous en avons mis 3 par terre. Certains hôtels proposent plusieurs supports de valise pour les avoir à hauteur.
Notre chambre, au 10ème étage donnait sur l'arrière avec vue sur le haut de la Liberty Tower. Wifi excellent. Personnel très agréable à la réception. Nous gardons l'adresse, si les prix sont intéressants. Il faut que le prix corresponde au service et au confort apportés; à New York, les prix sont sujets à l'offre et à la demande; payer cher (forte demande) ne correspond plus au service rendu. Il faudrait compenser en donnant des services supplémentaires quand les prix sont hauts. Faire du win-win.

Dans un quartier très agréable et vivant. A proximité du métro (Houston). Des restaurants dans le quartier. 

Adresse retenue,  et utile si prix agréable.

title: Great staff, good hotel
text:
The four points Sheraton was a good deal. Located in Soho it was within walking distance to the village and other points of interest.

If there were any negative, and believe us, this is just suggestion, it did not take away from the visit at all, beds should have a fitted sheet instead of just a tucked in top sheet, it kept coming loose all night until we were wrapped like a cocoon and maid didn't replenish coffee or sugar....again, these are petty suggestions...the hotel and desk staff overall were wonderful and the room itsel was perfect and quiet!!

Definitely a location to look at when visiting Manhattan!

title: Great all-around place
text: Was just there for one night but I truly enjoyed my evening and sleep there - what an awesome welcome at the front desk! Truly courteous people, very clean hotel and there definitely is nothing to say about the location - great, great, awesome! I would go back for sure!

title: Mooi hotel in een geweldige wijk van NY
text: Mooi hotel met voor New York ruime kamers. Gelegen in SOHO op loopafstand van het Meatpacking district. Hotel is netjes afgewerkt met nette kamers. Prettige service. Voor herhaling vatbaar en een aanrader voor toeristen

title: Location advantages and confident staff enough to overlook room limitations
text:
Arrival / check out - helpful, professional and efficient front desk.  Two considerations if you come in by car: (1)  if your arrival time is during afternoon / evening rush, there will be Holland Tunnel related gridlock to try to navigate through to hotel entrance; (2) current construction across the street means there is no place in front of hotel to pull over without blocking traffic.  Tiny lobby / slow elevators.

Regular rooms have small footprints - good for sleeping unless you are bothered by air / heat unit noise  since unit is necessarily right on top of you but you won't want to lounge there. No real place to sit other than bed.  Nice modern shower-only space in bathroom; comically small sink  and tiny work desk.  
Very convenient access to subway (1 and ACE each within a couple of blocks).  I had multiple destinations in Manhattan and Brooklyn to travel to / from and it was easy back and forth.  Multiple enjoyable places to eat and drink in walking distance.  I tried and enjoyed Aquagrill (oysters), Boqueria (tapas) and Kenn's Broome Street (pub).

All in all -- I enjoyed the location advantages enough that I would return despite the property limitations.  Helped that I got a reasonable rate (under $300) .  At  higher number, I'd expect more from the room and common areas.

title: New York small, big on service
text:
From check-in to the service at the small lobby bar, this place is above average. This is especially true of the the bartender, Elvira, who was both professional and personable. Not always the case with bartenders these days.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, albeit small roomed, hotel. There are great restaurants nearby (try the Trattoria Spaghetto on Bleecker and Carmine for an outstanding veal marsala) and it is in a cool NY neighborhood.

title: Great location for visiting Soho at a great price!
text: We recently visited for a quick one night stay while looking at colleges in the area.  Our son wanted to stay in Soho to go walking and shopping.  This was the perfect location for doing just that!  Out the front door and a quick two block walk!  Julian at check-in was very friendly and helpful.  Keep in mind that this is a Four Points Hotel, everything was simple but tastefully decorated.  For New York, the size of the room was what we expected (and I have stayed in a smaller room in NYC before).  If you are an SPG member, take the points rather than the complimentary drink.  It ended up being a $10 voucher and each of our drinks at the very tiny bar were over $10/each.  Loved the chilled lemon water in the lobby.

title: Good but good be even better if not for the overpriced teeny tiny room.
text:
The staff are fantastic! They made the place worth it. 

The onsite restaurant offers italian fare and is outstandingly good!!! Plus the ambience was perfect for either business or personal dinning. Waiters are excellent. 

The room was by any other standard, other than one is in NYC, very, very small. Cozy would be a polite way to phrase it. 

Given NYC prices its hard to say if the value is there; however the front desk staff and the restaurant peeps all make it an overall wonderful guest experience!!

title: Un hotel pequeño pero cómodo en el SoHo
text: Es un hotel pequeño, con unas cuatro o cinco habitaciones por planta, muy bien ubicado porque está al lado de la línea 1 del metro y muy cerca de otras dos líneas más. Es un hotel cómodo, limpio y con buen servicio. Nos hospedamos durante 5 noches y quizá lo único mejorable es el ruido del aire acondicionado (calefacción) y el aislamiento exterior de la ventana.

title: Es muy bueno
text:
+Limpieza excelente
+Buenos baños
+Buena cama
+Excelente ubicación en el Soho de Manhattan, a 2 cuadras de la linea E y de las 1,2,3 de subte.
+Personal super atento

-Falta un poco de iluminación en las habitaciones
-Precio un poco elevado para no incluir desayuno en el plan

title: comfort in SoHo village away from "times Square"
text:
A conscious choice for this location for traveller who had been to New York City before and prefers to avoid the "mad" Times Square area.
A close walk to Greenwich Village or little Italy to enjoy late night dinners at many popular little Italian restaurants. patrons are seen enjoying themselves till about 10pm. A far cry from the hustle and bustle of Midtown tourists' eateries.
The hotel is under subtle interior renovation which the always polite and helpful staff apologised. 
We were offered a recently renovated room, thought small but comfortable and clean.
Unfortunately, the subways in this area are undergoing some reconstruction and improvements which disrupted the late night trains, this did not affect the quality of the location of this hotel.
I have no complains, for there is a good Italian restaurant on site, San Marino which even offers good breakfast, wines and meals to your room at reasonable price

title: 下町情緒あふれる宿
text:
客室改装中工事で業者出入りしていたが、作業者は非常に丁寧で感心した。
無論コンシェルジェもいないホテルだがリセプションの対応が良い、これも感心した。
建物が古いが清掃も行届いていて好印象。客室タオル高品質。
ガウンは付いていたがスリッパが無いのが難点といえば難点。
朝食はプラチナメンバー専用に2つのオプションから選べる。
最上階(21階）からの眺めが良くワンワールドビルが目前に見える。

title: Soho NYC
text:
Nice clean room, a walking distance to Subway stations, friendly staff. Room size is adequate, considering you are in Manhattan. One minor issue, we stayed 8 nights and 3 times they forgot to give us a new bottle of water.
After calling the frontdesk, they supplied us with plenty bottels of water.

title: Great location and staff, So-So Facilities
text:
You couldn't ask for a better location - very close to the charms of the the quieter streets of Soho and the West Village. 

Staff was extremely friendly, efficient and knowledgeable. 

Small but well-maintained lobby. The elevators are very busy, especially with the construction going on. Hallways were tiny. Rooms were tiny and didn't have a lot of light, even by NYC standards (and I've stayed in many New York hotels). The walls are very, very thin. You can hear everything going on in the hallway and the rooms next to you. 

I would definitely stay here again - would just request a room with a better view and more light.

title: great Soho location-- beware of construction
text: First off, the location is great, if you want to stay in Soho. It is close to shopping, restaurants, cafes, and to several metro stations. The rooms are ok. Almost big by NYC standards. Other pluses: You get a bottle of water and a coffee maker. The downside: construction and only one functioning elevator and their is dirt from construction of the floors. Room cleanliness was good, except for the carpet, which was not vacuumed. But overall a solid choice for the area, pleasant staff, no hassles. Best to get a room in higher floors and out the back. The front tends to be a bit noisy.

title: Second stay, very convenient location
text: This was a very short stay at the Sheraton Four Points SoHO last summer. I had a room on a high floor with open views. Location is always central in short visits. This is excellent if your interests are downton-driven. You can walk to shops and restaurants in SoHO. Staff was friendly. I was double charged, but after contacting them the issue was solved. Would stay again.

title: Excellent location, good rooms and friendly staff
text: We had a great stay at the Four Points SoHo in Feb 2018. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. The location was excellent within walking distance from lots of areas and very close to the subway.

title: Cramped, bare-bones Sheraton property
text:
We stayed at this property for two nights in January, mid-week. The site at this time is undergoing renovations (currently 2nd-4th floors), and some of the inconvenience of our stay was due to the workers tying up one of the two elevators during the day for freight. The construction also makes the hotel quite messy, with plaster chips on the carpets. I can work around the inconveniences and mess caused by renovation, but other issues mean that until it's done, I would not recommend this hotel to others.

Things I appreciated. 
1. The front desk staff. Unfailingly friendly and helpful. Helped us resolve a room issue with speed and two breakfast vouchers in apology. 
2. The housekeeping staff. Friendly and funny. When you're all sharing a single elevator you get a little esprit du corp. 
3. The bed was comfortable--nice range of pillow types.
4. The makeup mirror was mounted at a height that made it usable. 
5. Shelf in the shower that is perfect for a coffee cup.
6. Good blackout curtain. 

Red flags:
1. My biggest gripe with our room was that the big industrial power strip (that we plugged all our tech into) is controlled by one of the wall switches by the door. No sign tells you this. When we turned out the lights for the night, we inadvertently turned off the power strip as well--and in the morning woke up to completely dead phones. 
2. The bed is a good size--but the room is not. Probably okay for one, very cramped for two. 
3. The shower is narrow, further constrained by a metal grab bar on the wall, and a metal door handle on the door. I estimate about 2 feet of clearance between these two bars, which makes drying off tricky. 
4. Our shower did not drain promptly-could have been just our room.
5. No valet or doorman on staff. They use a local service to valet the cars, but when you arrive you have to go in and ask at the front desk to have your car valeted, then leave the keys. 
6. The exercise facility in the basement  is one of the smallest I've seen. 4 machines (1 each of treadmill, elliptical, regular bike, reclining bike), and a set of hand weights. 
7. No Club level, though that just may be the Four Points brand. 
8. Ice and vending (for 22 floors) in a single location (the basement). 
9. The blackout curtain in our room was hard to pull up--the metal chain had no gripes so you have to wrap it around your hand to get a good hoist. 
10. The water in the shower is baffling. Turning the knob counter clockwise turns the water on, then off, then on, then off. The markings of Hot and Cold don't correspond to anything on the knob. It takes a while to find the right position for a good temp, and you just have to go on intuition and have patience.
11. The hot water is scalding hot. Be careful. 

Some reviewers have pointed out the convenience of location, and we did find that to be true for points in Lower Manhattan. But there are a lot of other hotels in the area, and we'll be looking there next time.

title: Loved the location
text:
I am a walker and I loved that I could walk to so many places -- High Line, Greenwich Village, etc. -- and when it was too far to walk, the subway was nearby, and it's a good line that will get you to a lot of places with few or no transfers. 

The room was fine. It's NYC. You squeeze around the bed to get to a small bathroom. I never spend any more time in a hotel than I have to when I travel. I'm either out exploring, or in the bathroom getting ready to go out, or in the bed. I don't need a lot of room, just a comfortable bed. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and serviced daily, the a/c worked (it was July), the coffee pot didn't work and it took a few tries to get one that did, but there is a Starbucks a block away. What I disliked was that the woman at the front desk kept telling me my coffee pot worked and kept trying to explain to me how to turn it in (seriously?) and I had to insist that she send maintenance up AGAIN (she didn't want to do it) and when maintenance arrived, it took him all of 30 seconds to determine that the coffee pot did not work and promised to get me one that did. It took that third try to get one that worked. 

I might stay there again, but for my next trip to NYC (planned for May 2018), I've booked a different hotel, not because my coffee pot didn't work, but because the woman at the front desk treated me like an idiot who didn't know how to turn on a coffee pot.

title: 4 nights in NYC
text:
I was a little worried about the hotel due to some reviews but I was pleasantly surprised.
The hotel is in the process of renovations but the most we were affected was there was only one accessible elevator during the day but honestly it wasn’t a big deal.
The room was small but clean. It met our needs which was a bed to sleep in.  There is some street noise, which I wasn’t surprised about and occasionally I did hear the television from next door.
There is a restaurant that was overpriced considering how many amazing places that were around the area. 
Subways were easy walking distance to and Google maps really helped with navigation of all transit.
The staff was very pleasant and helpful.
I would definitely come back if I’m ever back in the city.

title: Great location, personal service
text: When I visit New York City, I typically stay in Midtown at another SPG property, however, I always enjoy visiting the Sheraton Four Point in  SoHo.   It is in an outstanding location, and the employees provide incredible service. Elliot Stein at the front office is very personable and professional and has always helped me with anything that I need. Also, Elvira  at the hotel bar and restaurant has always provided incredible service with great food and drinks.  I never hesitate staying at this property. I also understand they are going through a complete renovation so it should be even better in the near future.

title: Everything you need and a great location!
text:
I loved the location of this hotel. It was near several subways and a lovely stroll from others. It's also at the end of my favorite neighborhood in NYC, SoHo. There are lovely places to eat and shop nearby and it's also close to the West Village, which also came in handy. 

I liked the size of the room and the comfortable bed. The bathroom had a tub and the wifi worked well for me. My husband had problems connecting, though. But we were told it had something to do with having an iPhone.

There were numerous channels on TV and the room was quiet, since it was facing the inner part of the block. Not much of a view, but I'd rather have quiet than a view. The heating unit was loud and made our throats extremely dry. The hotel itself looks a lot older in person than in the photos.  It's perfectly fine, though and I would certainly stay there again.

title: New Year winter trip
text:
Stayed three days/two nights. Excellent service, the room was great. Breakfast at restaurant was good also.

Location is excellent, many subway stations and places to eat nearby by walking distance.

Excellent option to consider if staying out of the usual most popular spots (Times Square, Theater District, etc).

title: Excelente personal
text: El personal fue buena onda desde el principio. Nuestro vuelo se canceló y ayudaron a prolongar nuestra estadía sin movernos de habitación. Servicio a la habitación muy bueno (comida era excelente y el personal 10 puntos). Limpieza excelente. Único problema fue que desapareció una balanza que utilizamos para las valijas pero nos hicieron un descuento y con el dinero compramos otra balanza. Lo recomiendo!

title: Hotel Basico
text:
El Hotel cuenta con lo básico para pasar unos dias en Manhattan. No hay desayuno, el calefactor suena muchisimo y entra aire frio por las ventanas. Las piezas estan viejas y algunas cosas no funcionan.
Para ser "Sheraton" la verdad es muy malo.

title: You can do a whole lot better than staying here
text: Booked into our room- toilet didn’t flush, carpet was wet because the shower leaked into the main room, windows not sealed properly so construction side across the road sounded like it was in your room. Heating was either too hot or too cold. The King room was tiny. The excuse was that it was a room for people with wheelchairs so the shower doesn’t seal properly. Not the nice part of SOHO- cheap rate but still too expensive for what it is. Refunded rest of our booking but would not refund the night we spent as we didn’t complain at 11.30pm at night about the toilet not working properly. Four Points by Sheraton should be ashamed by this hotel.

title: Rooms are not well insulated, cold air all night, AC couldn't keep up.
text: Good location but needs better maintenance overall. The room had terrible insulation so cold air was coming in all night. The AC couldn't keep up with the cold air coming in. The AC is an old, loud unit. The restaurant has good pasta but not good for room service. I had a cheese and fruit plate, and it had very small cheese pieces, no bread or crackers, and fruit. Seemed like the person that prepared it, just came up with something based on the description, but not what you expect from a proper room service restaurant.

title: Excellent location, great staff, value for money
text: We stayed here for the location, love soho. The hotel is well located just a short walk from Spring, Broome and West Broadway. Staff charming and helpful. rooms comfortable but basic. Nice and clean. The hotel could do with installing better double glazing as there is a lot of traffic noise, but it wouldn’t stop me staying there again.

title: Discreto Hotel in SoHo
text:
L hotel di medie dimensioni si presenta con una Reception gentile e accorta al cliente.
Camere pulite con bagno e letto comodissimo. Il riscaldamento è elettrico a ventola e risulta essere  rumoroso .Consiglio se  non con temperature proibitive di tenerlo spento ( Ottimo il piumone a corredo )
La posizione dell hotel è in un piacevole quartiere di Manhattan. Sicuramente da visitare . Prezzi in linea con la media di New York .

title: Small, well maintained, great hood.
text: Great staff here. The rooms are nice, however, very small. GREAT location, walking distance to great shopping and dining. Has a small Italian restaurant attached and a very small cocktail bar - probably 6 or 8 seats max.

title: Very good location - hotel was average
text: The location was very good for a few days of exploring Soho. Within walking distance to great stores and restaurants. The hotel is clean enough and I would stay here again if I couldn't find another hotel in the area. However, the room was small for a family (even though we had the largest corner room), and the windows didn't fare well at quieting the street noise. There was nothing about this hotel that stood out.

title: Eh, wouldn't recommend unless you're looking for a deal.
text: The lobby is deceivingly nicer than the rooms. Many elements of the room felt dirty and not cohesive. Lamps were not plugged in when I arrived, and several pieces of hardware and paper materials looked old and raggedy. The first room I checked into had a really strong smell of chemical cleaning products. I just opened the door and knew it wouldn't be a good situation for me, so went back down to the lobby immediately and the gentleman at the front desk apologized and immediately checked me into another room - which did not have the smell thankfully. From what I heard in the lobby, sounds like they run deep discounts and specials - so if you're interested in getting a deal in a GREAT location (Soho/lower West Village) - the hotel is nice enough - if you really just need somewhere to stay and lay your head.  But don't come here for ambiance, or the cleanest rooms.  The bathroom was renovated, nice, and clean.  You can hear everything going on outside the hall - from other guests, to maintenance - even at night.

title: Just OK but do not use their recommended parking
text:
L’albergo ha una hall molto piccola e le stanze altrettanto piccole. Lo staff è gentile e preparato. La Pulizia mi sembra leggermente al di sopra dello standard che trovo in questo tipo di hotel. Il bagno piccolo ma confortevole. Due grandi issues:
1 - i letti scomodi e forse da rinnovare (rapidamente)
2 - raccomandano un parcheggio per il quale nn ho realmente capito il vantaggio economico (nn è quello più vicino) e per 4’ mi ha addebitato una intera giornata invece delle sole due ore in più! Al mio paese questa la definiamo davvero unfair (per nn dire altro)

Non penso di tornarci e forse a quella tariffa ci si trova di meglio.

title: Budget friendly in a great location
text:
The location was perfect for a weekend spent shopping, eating, and visiting sights in lower Manhattan.  We walked almost everywhere we wanted to go. 

Room was small but neat. Location was easy to get to with minimal driving through the city. We valet parked but they also have a self park option 2 blocks away. 

My only con was that on the 4th floor, we could hear quite a bit of sirens for whatever was going on nearby in the middle of the night.

title: Excellent location + service!
text: Location is fantastic. We come to NYC 1-2x a year to visit friends who live in East Village, and we loved the location of this Four Points. We're SPG Gold members and the front desk were more than accommodating. We flew in from a red eye flight from LA and they did everything they could to get us an early check-in. Jesse from the font desk was a pleasure to work with and made our stay very pleasurable!

title: Just ok. Good service does not make up for it.
text: As part of the SPG brand and as a gold member, I was expecting a little bit more. While I appreciate the rating of this hotel, as a gold member, there should have been an offer of an upgrade or at least discuss my request for a higher floor; and I had to request a late check out rather than them offering it to me. The rooms are SMALL. The walls are THIN. I am on the 2nd floor and this room is taking a very long time to heat up. I can hear all conversations in the hallways and with my neighbours. Strange plumbing noises that can be heard next door and within my own washroom when you flush the toilet and use the faucet. My safe now does not work and waiting for engineering. Front desk have been helpful but really, they should not have to overcompensate for the hotel. Lounge is SMALL. Waiting area is SMALL. Very close to the tunnel which makes vehicle access during the week days terrible - be very mindful of this. But I appreciate how helpful the staff are trying to be.

title: Good spot to stay
text:
Lovely staff, easy check in/check out, good restaurants in the surrounding area.
Reasonable rate and rooms.  My first time at this location and would consider again as I usually stay mid town.  Houston St subway is at walking distance although I had no trouble getting a Lyft or Uber.

title: We will come again
text:
Perfect location: near coffee shops,minutes walk to nightlife area,restaurants, Soho and the village. A block from subway no.1.
Nice Helpful staff, big rooms ( in NY size).
Cleanf. Comfy bed, big shower.

title: Correct comme hotel
text: La proximité du Village est sympa, sinon l'hôtel en soi, bien que confortable n'a pas grand attrait - bar et resto tristes! Chambres plutôt bien. Lit confortable. Il devait y avoir une machine à café mais il n'y en avait pas.

title: Our Home in New York City
text: My wife and I spend more than a month each year on business in New York City and this has been our home there since it opened 10 years ago. General Manager Patricia Caruso, front desk manager Brian, front desk supervisor Jesse and associate Chris always go above and beyond to provide superb service and take care of everything we need and want. The housekeeping department, particularly Aaron, Lee and Estella, are also superb. We could stay almost anywhere but we always choose Four Points Soho Village and always will.

title: Great value, nice location
text: The location in Soho is perfect; right near lots of things to do and my clients. The value is there too, right in line with lower cost hotels in the area but with just the right amenities to bring it above the no name hotels. The staff at the desk is nice and helpful and the restaurant/bar was friendly. My only gripe was the sound. The room to room sound was fine, the hallway was a bit loud (I'd expect maybe a bit more sound proofing) but it was the window. Now I have been in the City many many times (at least 2 time a month) but for some reason the windows in this hotel seem to be open even when they are closed. Yes the City is loud and construction starts at dawn, but I could hear peoples conversations on the 14th floor. I kept going to the window to see if it was open. There is also a live band across the street and around the corner is a temporary Haunted House for Halloween so it might have been just that, but that was my only issue with an otherwise great place.

title: Value for Money
text:
The hotel is a bit outdated, but still acceptable. There are only 2 lifts, so waiting time is long in the peak hours. The gym is well-equipped but being in the basement, the 4 walls make it very claustrophobic. 

I was given a twin room, so I love the extra space available (else it may be little small). There was no white light available in the room, so I treasured the daytime when the light could come in. 

The hotel is within minute to Houston St #1 metro. But there are a lot nearby at Spring St, 5-10min walk, including #C & E, #R & W.

title: Good location, good beds but some minor things can be improved
text:
The welcome was warm and quick. The staff is really nice and helpfull. The location was very central, close to different subway stations and lots of bars and restaurants just around the corner. The bed and shower were really good, which I think is very important when you only come to the hotel to sleep and shower. 
For a New York hotel, the rooms are pretty spacious so you could actually lie down the suitcases somewhere.
On Wednesdays there is a free beer and snacks in the bar for the hotel guests. 

Bathrobes, soap, showercaps, bodylotion and whatsoever were available, but you needed to ask for it. It would have been nice if it was already in the room. They were not very generous in the coffee, tea and water supplies in the rooms. We only got one bottle of water every day while we were two. 
We were at the 4th floor and had to keep the blinds shut all day because everyone from the office across the street could see straight into our room. I guess that might be better on a higher floor or on the other side of the building. 
The aircon/heater made a hell of a noise so it was quiet warm in the room during the night. 
The room was good isolated from the other rooms, so you couldn't hear your neigbors, but the windows and the door were not. So you could hear everything that happened in the corridor and outside, and New York is noisy! 
The smoke alarm was covered with a plastic bag, I think because of the steam coming out of the bathroom that was right next to it, but nevertheless, not very safe in the case of fire.

title: perfect location for fashion week
text: this has the feel of a small boutique hotel. We had a room with a view of the city below and i would highly recommend a room with a window. we used the window seal for shoe storage and for the light it gave.  the room was small but we managed easily with two women.  I doubt we would have managed so well with more people. The staff was very nice and helpful.  The room service eggs Benedict was amazing.  I would definitely stay here again for fashion week.

title: Great Anniversary Night
text: The staff was very friendly and even dropped a bottle of prosecco in our room since they knew it was anniversary (booking by phone via SPG has always helped me with little perks).  The location was fantastic, easy on/off from the Holland Tunnel for you drivers, and worth the cab from 30th to be close to SoHo.  The rooms are good size for NYC and the price point.  And I can't say enough about the staff - whenever we called from something like an extra blanket, they were there in five minutes.

title: Friendly staff, clean hotel
text: I was impressed by the staff at this hotel..They were very accommodating and friendly. As NYC hotels go, the price and location were perfect for us, as we were moving my daughter into NYU.  Which was about a 15 min walk away.  The room couldnt have been much better..it was comfortable and clean. I wish I would have had time to sit at the bar, or at the outside restaurant..which looked quaint and people were having a good time..I will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect location, great, friendly service
text:
Beautiful lobby, located in the middle of Soho, an amazing area of NYC.  Will at the front desk is super warm and friendly, helpful and makes you feel welcome. He gave us a tour of the amenities and explained the property perfectly- he is a star!  

We will be back!

title: Not coming back
text: I travel up to NYC often on business and try to stay in different hotels around the city.  Unfortunately, I won't be coming back to this property.  The room was musty and smelled dank everytime I walked in, there was an issue with the toilet so I could hear it running literally all night, I barely slept.  Construction from the street also going on at odd hours of the night.  Besides that, service was subpar.  The front desk was fine, but when I called on a Monday night to ask that water be sent up to my room the woman on the line gave me a hard time and told me to try calling the front desk for water...huh?!  Then I prodded her some more and she said ok she'll have someone come up.  No one came up.  I was parched all night. Completely unacceptable. Also while waiting for the elevator in the morning I could hear a couple fighting loudly on my floor.  It was as if I were in their room with them!  Probably need to invest in some noise-canceling insulation. I am a loyal SPG member so I was pretty disappointed that this happened.

title: Trip to NYU
text:
15 min walk from Wash Sq Park.  Not the most convenient to NYU, but can walk.  Also walked to a parking garage.  
Clean & Lovely.  Near good restaurants .  We ate at a moderately priced Italian place.  Neighborhood is nice.

title: Great location and kind staff!
text: The location is off of the entrance to the Holland Tunnel which is not glamorous but a 6 minute walk to the Village where there are several charming restaurants and shops.  I was on the 11th floor and unfortunately heard lots of horn honking (tunnel traffic) during the day but fortunately not at night.  The rooms was clean and spacious for one.  The power outlet for the coffee machine didn't work, so I had to make my watery coffee by the bed :) But the coffee and bottled water in the room were free which was nice.  The gym was also clean and simple.  The front desk staff were very courteous and made sure I was comfortable.  The price was also right!  I would definitely consider staying here again.

title: Always a great stay.
text: I have been coming here since they opened. Consistently good. Great location to wander into SoHo, subway a block away. Staff is fantastic. Kudos to Patricia the GM. Always friendly and Brian at the front desk couldn't be more helpful. The onsite restaurant is very good if you don't feel like going out. Highly recommend.

title: No no no
text:
Prenoti ad uno sheraton e ti aspetti il meglio ma qui decisamente no
Partiamo dalla moquette è vecchia non pulita,abbiamo soggiornato per 4 giorni in tre ,abbiamo dovuto chiedere le asciugamano e gli accappatoi noi perché nn ve ne erano in camera,un piccolo armadio per tre!
Le valige non e stato possibile disfarle non sapevamo dove mettere i vestiti tanto e piccola la camera,le foto sul sito sono state fatte in maniera che sembrano grandi ma fidatevi non e cosi,
Non c'è un frigo se vuoi del ghiaccio te lo devi anche andare a prendere tu !!! Pulizie la mattina zero ti rifanno solo il letto stop!!!
Colazione inclusa mangi sempre le stesse cose alla fine preferiamo andare altrove.
