Mi spiace ma non lo consiglio assolutamente.
V.u.

title: Great Place!
text: Nice location!  I had a great time here at this hotel.  The location was close to everything that I wanted to go to in SoHo.  I basically walked everywhere.  There was a deli across the street as well which made getting a quick snack very easy.

title: Great location and great Customer Service from the Front Desk
text:
I stay here for business multiple times a year...the Customer Service at the Front Desk is on point with Christopher Fiumano.  He is truly a seasoned professional.  Chris welcomes me back by name and and remembers my room preference every time!  I saw him handling many difficult guests at a time with ease and professionalism.  He is a great example of outstanding Customer Service.   As a Starwood SPG Platinum member, I truly appreciate above and beyond service like this because the SPG brand has made me very loyal over the years, and this property is a great example of that.
   Thank you!  We will be back and recommend because of Team Members like Chris.

title: Great weekend away
text: Came to Soho for a bachelorette party. We had 4 rooms for 10 girls which worked out great. The rooms were clean and a bit small, but to be expected for NYC. The hotel is a great value for the incredible location and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again, everyone in our group was very happy with the accommodation.

title: Great location - quiet for Manhattan
text: 2nd time staying there. I used my points so I can't comment on price, but I felt I got a good value for my SPG points. Short walk to Greenwich Village, Chinatown, and what's left of Little Italy, among other notable tourist locations, 1 block from the subway. Clean, large enough room. I'll stay there again.

title: Great Location and Staff
text: Awesome spot in Soho. I wasn't able to walk everywhere easily. The staff was so helpful and I was able to check in early. I'll definitely stay here again.  I would recommend a stay here if you're traveling to NYC and don't want to be in midtown craziness.

title: Great stay & helpful staff
text: This time around I took care of the things I needed to make my stay comfortable (I am disabled) and had a great stay. Brian, the manager, was very helpful and I am very grateful for his assistance. Room was comfortable and clean, staff helpful as always, good coffee, and you can't beat the location. Recommend this hote as a very centrally located and pleasant stay.

title: Friendly, affordable and perfect location.
text: Loved my stay there. The young ladies Judith, Tabetha and Vanessa at the concierge desk were wonderful so sweet and so welcoming. The bartender Jazmine was amazing, her Green Teas drinks are amazing. I look forward to coming back again.

title: Very good, quiet hotel
text: The hotel was such a pleasant surprise for New York City.  It is quiet, clean, and comfortable. The hotel front office staff are extremely nice and helpful in every way! I had business documents that needed to be scanned and sent , on addition to some that needed to be faxed. The front office staff helped me get everything sent.

title: Great SoHo Hotel
text: This hotel is great.  The location is near great dinning and nightlife, and near the Subway, plus its near the Holland tunnel.  The staff is very nice, and efficient and the Italian restaurant is basic but high-quality.  The gym is tiny and in the basement, but there's plenty of fitness classes nearby.  The rooms are cozy but are a good size for NYC and the location.  A great, friendly hotel.

title: Clean and Efficient
text: Room, Staff and Soho location all above average for a NYC hotel. Easy walk to gorgeous Washington Square and super Macdougal St & other neighborhood restaurants. Lobby and room very clean and corporate; serve their purpose well.

title: Very good and central option
text: Good hotel in excellent location close to west village transport links and central NY. Rooms were good although furnishings a bit dated. Good service and decent exercise room. Overall very good value for money- would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Location - Excellent Service
text: We stayed at the 4points in Soho, and were extremely satisfied with the location and the quality of service. If you plan to spend time in the room around 4/5pm, we would recommend asking for a room facing away from Charlton. There is a lot of noise coming from the intersection at Charlton and Varick (cars honking constantly). Otherwise, great value, very clean, knowledgeable staff.

title: OK - location and staff
text: A good choice for a short stay in Soho - mainly for location and staff. Rooms are small, but clean and bathroom is even better. Staff at the reception and bar are nice and very helpful. I'll keep the hotel on my short list for quick stops in Soho.

title: Totally Spoilt
text: We spent seven wonderful nights in our penthouse on the 21st floor of the hotel. This came about because on our first trip to NY we had booked a cramped flat in The Village and didn't want to repeat that mistake. The suite was very comfortable and had full height picture windows to provide a wonderful view that included the Hudson River, Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. The hotel staff were very efficient and helpful.

title: Deceiving 2nd stay
text:
Hotel is perfectly located, near to Metro station and Soho. Room has a food size, not too small and modern. View on a building wall is terrible, but at least there is no noise. 
My 1st stay was perfect. This 2nd one was not!
I was in Room 607, that smells dirty, pluming was noisy, pillows were oldish, but the worst is that I came back home with ... besbugs!!!! 
And I'm a hotel network member... ups.. must take care of clients!

title: SoHo Four Points
text: The hotel is a tall, narrow building, just 8 rooms per floor, I think. The rooms are nicely decorated and comfy, a reasonable size for NY.  The fan in our bathroom was not working which made it rather humid. We should have complained sooner, but didn't inform them until we left. Hopefully that was not a normal situation. The staff was helpful and the location was good - very close to a subway line. Would stay there again.

title: Nice room, great staff.
text: We stayed here on top floor for two nights.  Room was fine. AC worked very well.  Room hwas updated with comfortable bed/bedding and bathroom.  Service was excellent.  The people all wanting to encourage a nice stay from front desk to the bartender.

title: Weekend in Soho
text: Good Location, yet construction on the street makes it hard to locate the hotel.  Room was very small and noisy  - could here people in next room and when air conditioner kicked on it was very loud and woke us up each time during the night. The bathroom vanity had no space to place toiletries etc.  Hospitality service never stocked coffee for the coffee maker.  Requested a cot for the room, the extra bed was very uncomfortable - could feel the coils as you laid on it.  Room was either very warm or very cold - thermostat did not work properly.

title: 3 day stay in NYC
text: The concierge (Brian) was great to my wife and I during our visit. Every time we've been to NYC, we've stayed at the same hotel due to the service provided by Brian and the staff. Great Service! It is much appreciated as you don't see that type of service these day.

title: Review
text: The view from our room was terrible. We were facing a construction site. The sink kept getting clogged. The air conditioner made loud noises all day and night. We had gnats flying around. Staff was friendly and nice

title: Bon hotel tres bien placé
text:
hotel tres bien situé abec stations de metro à proximité 
chambres propres et personnel tres agréable 
proche de west village avec ses petits restaurants pour manger le soir
pour le petit dejeuner du matin, vous avez Essen à côté et son choix incroyable 
literie confortable et climatisation agréable en ce mois de juillet a New York ou il fait chaud.  A conseiller

title: Very friendly!
text: This hotel was very accommodating. They shuttled our car to a parking garage. There was an on site bar and restaurant that were very convenient. Staff was pleasant. 2 blocks from the subway.  Overall a great place!

title: Pleasant Stay
text: The property is nice...very well connected if one wants to take the local transport...a few days stay is worth your money...whenever I visit again i would.love to stay at this property...very comfortable

title: Great location
text:
I had to go stay here for a few nights for business 
It is a great location - it's about 2 blocks from the Javits centre

You can walk to timesquare as well as the NY High line 

Delicious breakfast 
Great gym as well - its all new equipment 

I would stay here again

title: I love the atention and the room was perfect! I definetly recomend it!!
text: I came with my mom, the service was perfect, the room was very clean, people atention was very kind! Mostly Kimberly Rojas. The location is very good! Close to the Hudson river, one block form the subway!!

title: Good Option
text: The hotel is fine, basic in terms of services but in a good location where you can move easily everywhere in NY. Room is OK in terms of space, but the AC seems to be a little bit old and makes a lot of noise so you can't sleep very well

title: Localizaçao excelente
text: Escolhi esse hotel para estar perto do SoHo e do Village, que sao os lugares que eu amo em NYC. Excelentes restaurantes, ruas charmosas e vida noturna a apenas duas quadras do hotel. Staff super atencioso e gentil, recebem as encomendas/compras feitas com antecedencia pela internet sem problema algum. Nos deram ate um early check-in, pois chegamos no hotel ao meio-dia e exaustos após uma noite de aviao! Enfim, vale por tudo isso! Maaaass nao espere luxo! O apto é pequeno, sem vista bacana e tem carpete, que eu particularmente detesto!! Apesar disso, a cama e o chuveiro sao super bons, ao menos no apto que fiquei, um duplo king size.

title: One night in Manhattan
text:
The hotel was clean and convenient.  My only challenge was with the parking lot.  The attendant managed to lock my keys in my car just before I came to retrieve the car at 7:15AM.  

As I walk into the lot, I see the attendants trying to break into my car.  This caused me concern.

Keep in mind I had a 9AM business meeting to get to.

15 minutes later I drove out of the lot with a few more scratches on my car.

I am glad I allotted extra time to get from the hotel to my meeting.

Parking cost me $39.

I only recommend this hotel if you don't bring your car.

title: Wonderful location and staff
text: I was in NYC to visit sick friend. Staff was amazing. Ask for high floor with view. Soho location is great if you expect to be downtown during a lot of your stay. Subways close. West and east village within easy walk. Quiet.

title: Smacked in the middle of the lovely SoHo neighborhood
text: Stayed here for 3 nights for work. Absolutely fine experience. Room was OK, little outdated but I actually liked the colors and furniture. Fine gym, albeit small. Very close to the Hudson for runs or SoHo for going out and having dinner. And also very decent restaurant (same menu as Sheraton in Brooklyn), with small outdoor seating area. Very close also to the metro to head up or down Manhattan. Oh - and they gave me a nice letter and chocolates for my 50th stay at SPG.

title: Flyttade fram incheckningen 2 gånger
text: Helt okej hotell med bra läge. Rummen ganska slitna men finns vatten och kaffe på rummet. Kom dit kl 14, de sa att rummen inte var färdiga utan bad mig komma till baka om en timme. Kom tillbaka 15.30 och då var rummet fortfarande inte färdig utan jag fick vänta ytterligare en timme, inte uppskattat.

title: Run down rooms/property
text: This hotel has seen better days. Probably the worst shape hotel in 2 years I have stayed in over 150 nights. The walls were damaged in the both main room and bathroom. It did not feel very clean, and the decor is very dated. Not very comfy beds either. The prices were absurd for this quality, and I am a SPG/Marriott member Platinum. The windows also were not very good, with so much loud sounds in the city, these are cheap and did little to help keep the outside sound levels down. I would not stay here again.

title: Great location, and staff with great attitude
text:
I stayed at Four Points Soho for 3 nights when a business got extended and no other hotels were available. I can therefore compare this hotel to the Westin in Times Square, the Westin Grand Central. Unexpectedly, I preferred this hotel much more to the two Westins. The location is really great, right next to the heart of Soho and close to many restaurants and lots of shopping, as well as places good for a quick lunch. The hotel has a really good Italian restaurant on site which does great room service. The restaurants and room service at both the Westins were more expensive and less tasty than this one. The Westins were also much more cold and had longer wait times, while the Four Points had very friendly and genuine staff. 

The hotel is very dated though and rooms are small and not at all fancy, though the bed and linen was fine. The walls are thin and I could hear the TV playing next door.

title: Work travel
text: I have stayed in this hotel several times while traveling for work and was very pleased. Front desk agents and bell men are always very helpful. Great location is just a cherry on the top. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Perfection
text:
We loved our stay at the Four Points Sheraton in SOHO. Location could not have been better and the room was clean and updated. The bathroom was very nice and was very pleasantly surprised. 

We were going for the long Memorial Day weekend traveling from San Francisco. Upon our arrival early on Thursday morning, the hotel front desk informed us that they had a room ready but they suggested that we wait for a better one and they would hold our bags (loved the honestly!) The front desk staff was awesome and recommended us a place to eat for breakfast and which streets to go for good shopping. They were super helpful and printed us out directions if we needed it over the next few days and always helped us figure out what subway line to take. The room was pretty quiet, and left free water bottles in the room which was great. Would definitely recommend to a couple on a budget and wanting a super cool and convenient neighborhood to stay in. Lots of great non touristy restaurants and bars in the area as well as shopping! 

Thank you for the fantastic memorable trip!

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text: Très bien situé à une dizaine de mètres du métro (Houston). Tout ce dont on a besoin y est. Le personnel est charmant, les chambres suffisamment grandes et la literie parfaite. Greenwich village tout proche, plein de restaus et d'endroits pour sortir à deux pas.

title: Wedding Weekend
text: Wonderful attention was shown to me, my family and friends while we stayed at the Four Points SoHo Village for my daughter's wedding the weekend of May 19-21, 2017.  The kindnesses were truly outstanding from the very first moment, starting with advance notice about the street closure on May 19, to the check in and assistance with luggage, parking, the cleanliness of the rooms including my suite, the gym availability, the friendliness of the staff, advice on local activities, the private Sunday brunch, and the easy check-out process. I can't say enough good things about the Four Points and its staff!

title: Small but solid
text: I stayed here on a recent business trip and had a fairly pleasant experience. Check in and check out were both quick and my room was small but comfortable. The restaurant on site has delicious food and does offer room service, though the one time I placed a room service order the staff member attempted to deliver my meal to the wrong room. I happened to overhear and went out to the hallway to flag him down. Other than that, I had a good experience and would stay there again.

title: Nice
text: Very good located and very cozy. for families and Business. as for a room facing north in higher floor. Pay attention on restaurant bills: it include tips. two blocks from subway but the way is a dream

title: Tiny lobby but comfy stay
text: Enjoyed our stay here in Soho at Four Points.  Nicely located.  Very friendly & accomdating staff allowing us to check in early and storing our bags so we could squeeze out a few more hours to sightsee.  Beds very comfy.  All for a decent price in NYC!

title: Fräscht hotell - trevlig personal
text: Ett mycket trevligt hotell på Manhattan. 6-7 minuter till t-banan. Stora sköna sängar, rent och fräscht i hela hotellet. Trevlig restaurang med en del ute och en del inne. AC på rummen som tyvärr väsnas en del. Dörrarna slamrar mycket då folk kommer hem på natten. Liten trevlig bar med mycket trevlig och kunnig personal. Gratis och snabb WiFi. Serviceinriktad  personal i receptionen.

title: avoid this hotel
text: this hotel is so cramped and the amenities are so old, i can't believe it. In the description it states "ipod docking station" which only fits the old ipods (iphone 4 outlet). Not only that, it was broken too. The aircon are the old big units that are almost bordering the bed and very very noisy. The carpet is smelly, the hallway smelly and the bedding is old and way over its overdue date. Next to that add the cramped room with barely space to move (if you bring a suitcase). Very disappointed. Paid over 200 euros for this room and highly regret it. The staff was very friendly, locations excellent.But it shouldn't be so old and overused.

title: Amazing Staff
text: The Staff was amazing from Check In to Check Out. The reception staff was so sweet and friendly, Christopher was great when checking me in he set me up with a wonder room and was so warm and endearing. Judith was so sweet and helpful, she assisted me with fast and easy directions every night of my stay and was always smiling and polite and greeted me ever time, so lovely and friendly. The view from my room was lovely, the bed was so comfortable. The room felt so homely and the housekeeping staff was amazing a gentlemen named Aaron would kindly assist when ever i needed something for my room or myself. Definitely my go to hotel for my New York work base.

title: Convenient, decent room, polite staff.  Mid-level value in NYC done well.
text:
I saved money by booking this hotel through Priceline.  Sometimes you win that way, sometimes you loose.  For the price, this hotel was a winner.  It's not luxury or glamor, but my room was clean and decent size (for NYC), the staff at the desk were courteous and helpful.  It's on a quiet street in a quiet area, which can be hard to find in NYC.  

But it's just a short walk NYU, Bleeker Street, and endless interesting and great restaurants.

title: You can do better for the price, even in NYC
text: At $260 a night the Four Points is moderately priced and well located for anyone working or playing downtown. Beyond that, there's nothing to recommend the place. It's shoddy -- my room was appointed like a hospital room, the wallpaper was torn and stained, the caulking in the shower moldy, and the comforters threadbare.

title: Good location, helpful staff.
text:
We were visiting New York for the first time and wanted a hotel that was in an area not too loud or busy so chose this one.  It was about 40 minutes walk from the main attractions in Midtown and 30 mins from the main sites downtown, ideal.

The room was good, our room had a view of the Empire State Building on the 15th floor and the room was well furnished and comfortable.  The staff were very helpful, dealing with the minor requests we had and helping with luggage storage or transfer bookings.  The bar, although small, was fun.  The two bartenders, Judy and the young lady from St Petersburg (so sorry, didn't ask her name) were polite and social and the drinks were great.

All in all an great hotel in a fab location if you want away from the bright lights and craziness of Times Square and Central Park.  We would definitely book again.

title: good room, good location and Great service
text:
conveniently located close to Soho and countless good , hip restaurants and the Line 1 metro .The reception staff was unbelievable. We had some packages delivered to the hotel but by mistake, they got delivered to another hotel around the corner. Alfredo at reception went above and beyond his duty to locate the lost packages for us. We are very grateful for such wonderful service at the Sheraton 4 Points.
Complimentary water and Wi-Fi in room. The walk in shower was very nice in our room. The bed was very comfortable .The rooms look newly renovated.
The hotel served all our needs for our trip to New York City. Will definitely stay again

title: clean straight forward hotel
text: I Stayed there one night last fall with my boyfriend for his birthday.  we were celebrating his birthday at the Ear Inn. we got Nice large bed with great linens. the in and out was easy and there were no drama whatsoever.

title: Quite ok
text: On the whole, a good hotel. The room was of an adequate size (for NYC standards) and clean, as well as the bathroom (with a very good shower). I could take advantage of a discounted price so I ended by paying 350$ for two nights, quite ok in NYC. It is located on the west side of upper Soho, so if you walk eastward you hit an area with many restaurants, bars and music joints. The personnel were nice and helpful. Good wifi. The only minus for this hotel is the heating/air conditioning, which is provided by a quite old-fashioned, very noisy unit; and the wall control did not really seemed to work: setting it to 72 F after a while the temperature of the room was tropical.

title: ubicacion perfecta
text:
me encanta este hotel cuando voy a NY siempre me quedo en Soho. Tiene el standard Sheraton, limpieza, calidad de las habitaciones, optima ubicacion, buen precio.
A dos cuadras hay metro y puede llegar a pie.
A 10 minutos caminando esta en la famosa Spring street en el corazon de Soho, donde podra encontrar muchos restaurantes

title: Lifesaver
text: After a terrible day my mum and I had, we had to book this hotel last minute for an extra night in New York, we were greeted by the smiling face of Brian who asked how our day was and we explained to him what had happened to which he immediately offered us an upgraded room with two separate beds, instead of the one queen I had booked in a hurry. We said yes and thank you to the room change and he showed genuine concern for my mum who had an incident that morning which was the cause of us spending an extra night in New York. We had dinner in the hotel and the staff were very attentive and friendly. The food was delicious for dinner and breakfast. In the morning of us checking out the lady asked if we needed a lift to the airport and we said yes, and there was a car ready to take us straight away. This hotel was spacious and very clean, the beds were very comfy! I would definitely stay here again.

title: Relaxing Stay
text:
Stayed here for only one night after a long day and night at work. Had SPG points to use and didn't wanna drive home after a bad snowstorm. 

The bed was super comfy and the room was quiet and very inviting. I was surprised how quiet the hotel was considering their hotel in Chelsea can get loud from time to time. Staff was friendly and made everything easy and pleasant. If only I could stay here every night after work and not make the commute back to NJ. Haha

title: A friendly and efficient hotel - great location.
text: This was my 4th visit to NYC - the last visit was at the Trump Soho and I was made far more welcomed here! The staff were knowledgeable, attentive and the wifi was free!! The location of the hotel is great for Washington Sq and Soho nightlife and a short walk to nearest subway.

title: Uh, Ok.
text:
Stayed there one night. The staff was seriously nice... and attentive. The roms wte small - typical gor New York City.  But, DO NOT EAT THERE. The food is ho-hum and the service sux. 

Good hotel. 
Not a repeat. 
NO on food.
OK on bar. 

Do the math.

title: Nada acorde a lo esperado de un Sheraton
text:
El hotel está bien situado si vas por trabajo ya que está en una zona principalmente de oficinas; y por buscar lo positivo, además de la ubicación son las vistas si estás en un piso un poco alto (a partir de la planta 14); ya que en caso contrario tus vistas serán un muro del edificio de enfrente. 
El hotel es pequeño, está desactualizado por completo, las habitaciones son pequeñas, con puertas metálicas muy ruidosas y mobiliario de hace por lo menos 20 año o más. Para ser un hotel perteneciente al grupo Sheraton, deja bastante que desear y más aún después de los precios que manejan en las estancias. He estado 8 días por trabajo y menos mal que se hacía cargo la empresa porque si los tengo que pagar yo de mi bolsillo, me hubiera cambiado el 2º día aunque me hubiera supuesto más dinero. El servicio del lobby es agradable cuando quieren venderte algo, que incluso te hablan en castellano perfecto; si no, el idioma es el inglés y no muy amable. 
Consejo, el shuttle al JFK te lo venden por 65$, a eso hay que añadir el tip(18% como mínimo); habla con cualquier taxista y acuerda con él día y hora, te saldrá por poco más de 50$ más la tip, en total unos 60$.

title: Para ser un Sheraton, deja mucho que desear
text:
He pasado 8 días por trabajo en este hotel y quitando la ubicación con respecto a la oficina a la que tenía que ir que era estupenda, el resto es un hotel más. Las habitaciones son pequeñas, con mobiliario de hace ni se sabe los años, la calefacción es una máquina de AC que hace un ruido horrible. En cuanto al personal, al hacer el check-in nos atendió una persona que habla castellano estupendamente pero que no lo supimos hasta el último día que nos quiso vender el shuttle al aeropuerto ya que hasta entonces sólo nos hablaba en inglés y en cuanto rechazamos el servicio, volvió a dirigirse a nosotros sólamente en inglés.
Para ser un hotel perteneciente a la cadena Sheraton, deja bastante que desear y no creo que vuelva salvo que sea por trabajo y sea mi compañía quien lo reserve.

title: Clean safe hotel in great location!
text:
I booked this hotel last minute on Hotels Tonight for a good deal (under 100). I needed to get to Hoboken easily for a sports event and love Soho, Tribeca and the Village. This was the perfect area to stay. You can walk everywhere and the train is one block to get to most other parts of the city. It's a great base for bike-riding as well since the west side bike path is 2 blocks west. I was able to take advantage of it in Feb when the temps were 65! I parked for free on the street across from the hotel on the weekend, and could walk to the village, and Soho for meals and entertainment at most hours. The hotel was basic. Theres only like 10 rooms on each floor so its intimate. I needed to ask for a remote control which I've never had to do before, I think it was lost, but the staff brought i up quickly, The bath was renovated, but small, The toiletries were fine. The linens were clean ans crisp. I was out late (3am) and had a great night sleep. The coffee maker in the room was ok, but theres not enough creamers and sugar for more than one cup and the hotel did not offer replacements. There's free coffee in lobby in the morning til 10 though, and there a small restaurant and bar on site which I did not try but smelled good. 

I thought this hotel came with breakfast, as it did if you booked through hotels.com or their own site, but apparently the cheap rate on Hotels Tonight did not include it. The desk staff was not particularly helpful explaining it, and did not mention alternatives, or even where the restaurant was if I wanted to go anyway on my own dime. So even though the hotel was fine, the staff were not particularly enthusiastic. For the money and location this place was fine though.  There are trendier places around, but prepare to pay much more for those. They had a gym, but I did not use.

The hotel is under construction but I did not hear a peep, probably because it was the weekend (Fri night - sat)

title: Rooms need a good facelift but not a bad place
text: Was not as clean as it should have been. It's in a great area but for the price, a little attention to detail is warranted. Doors and walls were scuffed. Bathroom was tiny & needed attention. Not so bad that we left or anything like that. I stayed next door a few weeks ago & it was cleaner & less $.

title: Quick stay
text: The hotel was easy and quick to book for our last minute overnight stay in the city.  It was very affordable and clean.  The rooms are pretty small but I guess I expected that in NYC.  The service was fast as well, we checked in and out without trouble.

title: This is an OK Hotel - nothing special but nothing bad either
text:
I had five nights in this hotel while on a business trip. The room was on the small side but perfectly fine and had all of the facilities that one would expect such as a desk, chair, coffee making facilities, ironing board and iron etc.

The bathroom was clean and well lit and the shower was large and worked perfectly.

The bed was large and comfortable and had plenty of pillows and blankets.

If there was anything I did like about the room it was the AirCon / Heating - it was noisy and kept switching on throughout the night but as the outside temperature varied from -5c to +5c from night to night I was needed to stay warm.

The Lobby was small as was the Bar and Restaurant but in each case the service was very, very good and although the food in the restaurant was limited (Italian) I found the quality, speed and service very acceptable.

Overall there is absolutely nothing really to complain about this hotel - it is perfectly acceptable in almost every way - but here is the crunch - it was by far the best value in the area!

I would happily stay here again. The hotel is well located and you can easily travel up town or downtown on the subway at Houston Street - only 15 mins from Time Square and 5 mins to One World Trade Centre and a little more the Statten Island Ferry or Battery Park and the Liberty Island Ferries.

title: Average hotel
text: This hotel is located in a safe area but not necessarily in the best area. The service at the front desk was good. The rooms are very small, but that is common in New York. Overall this is a good hotel for the price, but probably you can find other options.

title: Caveat Emptor / Buyer BEWARE
text:
My wife and I chose this hotel as a last minute option on a whim because we wanted to hang out in Manhattan over the weekend. We actually used the app Hotel Tonight and on that app, their users rated it at 87%, so we figured, it'll suffice. We only booked a 1 night stay but in just 1 night, we came to the realization we should've spent a bit more money and could've avoided possibly one of our worst stays in hotels ever! Now, don't get me wrong, we didn't book this hotel expecting a boutique experience, but there are just some things we have complaints about that shouldn't be present in ANY traveler's experience regardless of the $$ bracket of hotel. List is as follows:
1. NOISY hallways/rooms...If you cherish quiet and sound, consistent sleep, DO NOT STAY HERE!
2. Uncomfortable beds...if you have even the slightest back problems, pregnant or are used to a nice, comfy bed, DO NOT STAY HERE! (The seats in my car are more comfortable than the queen bed in our room was, no joke!)
3. Scratchy sheets...if you love slipping into a bed with sheets thread count >200 DO NOT STAY HERE! I swear the thread count on these sheets were 30..we could've used cardboard box panels and that would've felt smoother. 
4. Lobby bar does NOT sell water bottles....they offer 1 complimentary bottle of water with your stay & that would be fine if traveling solo, however, it was my wife & I staying there, so when we ran out of that, we went to the lobby bar to buy another bottle but they told my PREGNANT wife that they don't sell bottled water.. WTH! Love someone to explain that one to me. DO NOT STAY HERE!
5. Cleaning staff too loud in the morning for turning rooms around...check out time is at noon and while that's pretty standard for any hotel, if you've read all the above grievances, you're expecting to sleep until pretty much 11am at latest. NOPE, not in this hotel! The cleaning staff must have been trained by paramilitary assault troops because at 9am it felt like the SS Troops were hollering and banging through rooms and the hallways waking you up (if you even were asleep still at 9am in the first place) DO NOT STAY HERE!
6. Pillows are like flapjacks FLAT...Ever had to sleep on the floor without a pillow? Ever fall asleep on your desk pulling all nighters for college and your neck hurts because you didn't have a pillow? This is pretty much what you can expect of the pillow selection at this hotel. When you walk in the room, the bed has like 8 pillows on a queen size bed, but its a moot point if all of them are as flat as bar codes. DO NOT STAY HERE!
7. Air Con unit leaks water...the entire time we had the A/C unit on or the Heat on the system leaked water onto the carpet below. Since the room is already a small fit for that queen size bed, one MUST walk directly by that leaking A/C unit so unless you keep your shoes on inside the room, you're pretty much playing in puddles by the window not to mention what mildew must grow in that room daily! DO NOT STAY HERE!

title: Great front desk staff, clean and comfortable hotel
text:
Great inexpensive hotel in the heart of Lower Manhattan.  Clean and comfortable.  Normal room size for this type of hotel.  

Jesse at the front desk is absolutely amazing at his job.  Super friendly.  Super helpful.  A rare quality in this absolutely insane city.  He remembers guests names and makes sure to greet with a smile.  Jesse makes this hotel something.  It doesn't stop there either.  The cleaning staff is also very nice and friendly.  Thanks to all of you for making my trip that much better.

title: Birthday celebration
text: Heading into the City for a birthday celebration we knew we wanted to be in Soho because of our Stones museum visit and dinner restaurant choice. We found this Four Points in the perfect location and gave it a shot- not at all disappointed- check in/check out were fast and easy, room was clean and the staff- Jesse specifically-  was great making sure our room was on a high floor and ready when we needed it. All said we would definitely return here when staying in this area of the City

title: Comodo, niente di più.
text: Monlto comodo vicino alla stazione della metro. Vicino a molti locali sia per la cena che per la colazione. Camera piccola e bagno piccolo ma complessivamente accoglienti. Non molto silenzioso. In camera non c'è il frigobar che ormai hanno tutti.

title: Meah...basic and sufficient
text:
Pretty standard, low frills spot to stay in soho. It's very close to great bakeries, good restos, and of corse top shopping (if you need that sort of thing). 
I staid in a 'delux king' on the 15th floor:
The good: Bed was super comfortable - though they always are with Starwood. Bathroom was gleaming and pleasantly sufficient. Room service is quick and not too bad. Check in was delightful. 

The bad:
Toilet didn't work!!!! I jiggled the handle added water to the reservoir, and prayed. Later that day it worked again. It may have had something to do with the interruption of water that happened during my stay. Finally, a room service tray sat out on the hall way for 26 full hours - through an entire cleaning cycle. No biggie if you don't mind that sort of thing. It kinda grossed me out.   Check out was uncomfortable. When lady asked how was stay I asked, "do you really want to know?" She said yes, so I proceeded to give her the three items. She then began to admonish me!!  

I would choose another Starwood property.

title: Just Alright
text: The staff is friendly and the front desk is pretty responsive.  The beds and bathrooms are descent, but nothing to rave about.  Overall the rooms look cheap, but its okay for a quick in and out.  The wifi is free, so that's a step in the right direction.

title: Pretty nice hotel in a great location!
text: Rooms are a bit small and pricey but the location in SoHo is prime. Walking distance to restaurants, shops and more. It is located a block away from our corporate office which is convenient. Friendly staff!

title: Excellent Property.  Love the location.  Love the people.
text: Close to West Village, Greenwich Village and Soho and bus and subway.  Close to hundreds of restaurants and designer shopping.  Rooms were small but large enough.  Very quiet except for hallway.  Didn't hear any sounds from other rooms.

title: Good location, friendly staff very reasonably priced
text:
Overall a pleasant enough stay at the four points SOHO.
Staff were friendly enough, location is superb.
Although not smartest or coolest of hotels it is priced accordingly.
They're is certainly more attractive hotels within the SPG group in Manhattan.
But for the price four points SOHO probably wouldn't be beaten

title: Overraskende godt
text: Havde 5 dage i NYC med konen inden bryllupsrejse i Mexico. Tjekkede ind på four points, og blev positivt overrasket over standarden. Vi blev oven i købet opgraderet til et nyrenoveret værelse på en af de øverste etager, da de opdagede at det var starten på vores bryllupsrejse. Havde smuk udsigt over Hudson River med kig til Midtown's skyline. Rigtig god service, pænt or rent og venligt og serviceminded personale. Vil bestemt komme igen! Meget værdi for pengene.

title: Well positioned hotel with very friendly staff
text:
We were really pleased with the location of this hotel, a short walk to little Italy, Chinatown, west village and all the restaurants and bars they offer. We had a room with two double beds for three of us and although small was just as we expected, the coffee machine was a welcome addition and the beds were comfy. 
We used the restaurant on our first night and the service was great and the food very good. We found it excellent value for money and would stay again.

title: Good room in good location
text: It is a very short walk to Greenwich Village and lots of good restaurants.  It is also a short walk to subway stations.  We stayed on the 17th floor and had a decent view.  The room is very small for a family of four.  Also, we were not thrilled with the frosted glass bathroom door.  It is pretty see through and can be especially awkward  in a tiny room.  The room was very clean and updated.  We were happily allowed to check out an hour later, when our flight was delayed. This was a nice room in a good location for a decent price.

title: ottimo per visita city
text: Hotel in ottima posizione, vicino alle principali punti della città. Camera pulita un po piccola (però ci stai solo per dormire), se torno a New York alloggerò di nuovo qui il prezzo mi sembra giusto per la location a Manhattan.

title: Really disappointing stay
text: I have been staying in this hotel for several years and on the whole, despite one or two negative experiences, have found it to be an inexpensive and pleasant place to stay, with a generally helpful staff. I am disabled and had made prior arrangements for an item to be installed in my accessible room. Though I called about it several times, the accommodations were inadequate and led to my checking out earlier than planned. Additionally, the quality of the rooms has deteriorated: the bed was lumpy, the floor bumpy, and the bed cover stained. I was with family, for whom I had rented an extra room, and regretted staying there on what was meant to be a holiday get-together. I will say that the general manager was very helpful. This is still a good budget hotel but for anyone who needs any additional help other than the room reservation it is not recommended.

title: Nice hotel for the budget and classification
text: This is my regular hotel in Manhattan...about 20 nights this year.  You won't be blown away by the venue however it's a consistent experience, the staff is just fine and the rooms, while small, are OK.  The room service food is pretty good, and the very small bar is always staffed by friendly types.  Considering the location and the overall experience, it's a recommend.  There are other Starwood properties that charge much more that aren't as nice.

title: ottimo per soggiorno nella city
text: hotel comodo alle principali parti della città molto comodo per visitare la metro si trova a pochi passi. pulito con camere piccole ma confortevoli. come tutti a manhattan non è economico ma si trova in un bel quartiere che offre molte attrazioni, bar e ristoranti

title: Buena ubicación, muy simple hotel
text: Este hotel tiene poco brillo en si, las habitaciones son simple y el lobby es chico y funcional.  Eso sí tiene una ubicación muy bien para el verdadero NYC atractivo.  Esta a cuadras del corazón del West Village con un montón de restaurantes excelentes (varios los mejores de NYC).  A pesar de su sencillez, tampoco fue tan barato. Su sacan buena oferta, vale la pena.  Hay un bar chiquitito a lado en el Lobby que tiene también es bien básico, pero sirve para tomar algo ya que no hay mucho espacio en las habitaciones.

title: Don't use your points here
text: We are Starwood members and love the chain but were verg dissappointed with our stay and this hotel.  We changed rooms two times because of leaks in the ceilings and a small sized room (we were staying a for a week and a half and our suit cases didn't fit). It was the first time we tried a Four Points and we won't be trying them again any time soon.  Don't expect coffee in the lobby past 10, no breakfast, small reception, rooms are not very clean, etc...  The best part of the hotel is it's location.

title: Outstanding Service!
text: This was my first stay at this hotel, but I will definitely return when visiting my home office in SoHo. It is right around the corner from my office, a block from a subway station, and within walking distance to a ton of restaurants and shopping.  The service is phenomenal.  Upon early check in, my room was ready.  The rooms are small, but every NYC room is small.  It was clean and served the purpose.  Hi-speed Wifi is free for SPG members.  There is an onsite restaurant, and I ordered take out the first day as I had to work immediately upon arrival.  It was fine. Every person I encountered there was super friendly, warm and welcoming.  Jasmine, the bartender took excellent care of our group, and she felt like an old friend by the end of our stay.  I am looking forward to my next visit, and stay at this hotel.

title: EXCELENTE OPCION EN SOHO
text: La habitación resulta un poco chica, fuimos 3 personas con un poco de extremo orden es llevadero. Pero dentro de las opciones que teniamos resulto muy buena. Excelente atencion. El Bar es muy bueno y posee un restaurant de comida italiana.

title: Great Mid-range hotel for a lower than mid-range price!
text: I have stayed here on several business trips, at least six times by now, and they have been very conistent and provided a great stay. The hotel is clean, quiet for Manhattan, and the rooms are on the larger side as well. They give free internet and free bottled water with your room. The only downside are that the pillows are not very comfy for me but that is a minor issue. Some of the room shave excellent views of either the Empire State building or the Freedom Tower. Hotel restaurant is very good as well.

title: Service impeccable but details questionable
text: The location of the hotel is extremely convenient right in Soho. It has easy access in and out of the city being right by the Holland Tunnel. Cabs are readily available on the Main Street 40 feet away. Or at most times right in front of the hotel. Service, from the second I walked in the door to the moment I left, was absolutely superb on every level. I was greeted immediately and checked into the hotel and overly accommodated with anything that I could possibly have needed. I went up to the room and everything was very well-appointed. It looked fantastic but a little tight and small. Rather immediately left the room and went on to some appointments I had in the city. Upon returning later that night I started noticing some of the details and it was definitely not up to the level of service that I experienced earlier. There were two windows behind the bed that were completely filthy and stained with cement. And were literally directly against the next building, not uncommon in NYC. It looks as if the hotel is under renovation on the upper floors. Which I guess is ok and a hotel needs to update so that's fine. But the noise from it definitely woke me up quite early around 7 a.m. The room itself when I reentered that night was freezing with the thermostat set on 70. I raised it up to 72 and the room became extremely hot....there was no balance. I think there were just some issues with the way the heater was operating. But it was one extreme or the other. Everything seems very very clean so housekeeping definitely doing their job. There is a portable closet in the room which for some reason absolutely stunk and I could not figure it out. That is where the safe was so I needed to go in and out of it but it really was bad as to some strange odor. Once again the room itself just lacked on some of those kind of details and the service is absolutely perfect. Most likely, I would return to the hotel and I am hoping that all the Kinks work themselves through once the rest of the renovations are done. There is also a Lobby restaurant downstairs that serves Italian and it has a bar. It isn't ok restaurant as well....Service sensational, food very good....needs a little attention to atmodphere of the restaurant. For NYC, the rate both for the motel AND the restaurant were VERY FAIR! !

title: Serves a purpose
text: The main thing about this hotel is it's good location in Soho.  The streets immediately surrounding the hotel are not that interesting but a couple of blocks away there are great restaurants, dive bars, shops etc etc.  There is also a subway station one block away although we just caught ubers or taxis everywhere, so access is good.  The walls are quite thin and the doors are metal and if you don't close them softly they slam quite hard which can be noisy.  Use it as a place to rest your head (our bed was very comfy) and don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed - go expecting a four star hotel and the trimmings and you will be.

title: Nice room, good SoHo location, noisy until late
text: At nearly $500 a night this is a pricey place to stay but if your business is in SoHo and the stay short, it is very convenient. The rooms are nice, and recently updated. My only warning would be that it is right next to the entrance to the Holland tunnel where cars and trucks honk at each other all afternoon and evening, so don't plan on a nap or a quiet workspace but it was quiet by 11 PM for bed.

title: Usual story: when in NY, quality drop...
text:
I already experienced that: average accommodation quality in NYC is worse than everywhere else for those big hotel chains and Sheraton four points is not an exception...
Rooms are nice, but way smaller than average.
One elevator out of the two available was out of order for most of my stay.
no restaurant. no place for breakfast.
Anyways, room was clean and hotel's location is great if you want to experience some of the Greenwich's village "movida"

title: Pleasant Stay
text: I went for a long weekend and the hotel was compact but comfortable.  Staff was friendly and the rooms were fine.  Not very fancy but well kept.  Only had a pizza from the restaurant and it was okay.  I enjoyed the service of the two different barmaids that were working when I was there.  Construction is a little annoying around the outside and the traffic going to the tunnel is worse. Only negative would be that when the hotel had a lot of people checking out, the elevators took way too long.  I would stay again.

title: Great location but man that hotel is awful!!!
text: The location is great, lots of restaurants around which is good cause the food at this hotel is horrible.  There was a lot of construction outside during our stay as well which was loud and annoying.  The inside is old and run down and I found most of the staff were not friendly and didn't know much about the area.  One girl didn't know when the Empire State Building opened nor an estimated time how long it would take to get up.  These are pretty standard bits of info. that any good hotel working will know.  The room was small but was clean.  The shower was not good and had to function the water back and forth to try and keep a manaegale temperature.  Again, not impressed with Four Points and SPG is done as far as I'm concerned, all the properties are old, run down, and in embarrassing states really!!  We were welcomed by a friendly lady but did not see her again, the rest of the staff were useless!!

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: We travel often.  We are BIG fans of Starwood properties…..W-Westin-St. Regis.  We did not know what to expect w/ Four Points by Sheraton. We chose this hotel primarily because of it's close proximity to SoHo-the Village-Chinatown and Little Italy  However, there is so much more that this property has to offer.  The location is ideal.  The staff was wonderful.  Allison at the front desk is a rock star ! The valet services was quick and easy. The rooms were reasonably priced given the location/proximity to SoHo. The rooms were basic, clean, comfortable and a decent size for NYC standards. The bathrooms were stylish. We initially had concerns that the rooms were not adjoining because we were traveling w/ kids.  All fears were negated as they provided us w/ rooms on an SPG preferred guest floor where the entranceway to the respective rooms were literally inches away from one another.  I would certainly stay here again and would probably choose it over those properties we have historically stayed at before when visiting NYC.

title: Good standard hotel, disappointing shower
text:
I had a pleasant stay at this hotel.  The staff were very friendly, the room was clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable.

The location is excellent, with many great restaurants and bars within a short walk.

The big minus for me was the en suite shower, which was very low-powered and felt important feature of a hotel.

title: Tucked away in Soho...This is the hotel to stay at !!!
text: I wanted a hotel near the Winery and I found the Four points....with its very reasonable price I figured that this place would be a little Sketchy....On the contrary, this place rocks. clean, convenient I will stay here again if I need to be in lower manhattan.

title: Standard New York hotel
text: Very friendly staff (reason for my 4 stars), pricey .. like every other hotel in NYC, nothing special about that and a very standard NYC hotel room like other hotels. Comfortable bed. Everything went as planned during my stay. Nothing extra ordinary that I found to give a five star here.

title: Great Staff!
text: Staff is great, polite and efficient. The only thing you need to know is parking-the lot is 2 blocks away and its $55 / night. Also, this hotel is very close to the holland tunnel surrounded by gridlock and you will hear the traffic. It took 40 minutes for uber, 5 blocks away to get to me. but if you need a clean and affordable place to sleep , this will do it.

title: Great hotel
text: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Four Points. The location is terrific: In a great neighborhood and close to the subway.  The staff were very accommodating and helped my sister order a car service to La Guardia. The room wasn't as small as I thought it would be and everything was comfortable. It was great to stay in SoHo.

title: Great stay, friendly staff
text: We had such a nice stay at this hotel. Great location, nice comfortable room and very friendly staff. I can't give enough praise to the front desk staff, especially Brian who was very helpful and welcoming. Jasmine at the bar was also a sweetheart. Kudos to the hotel and it's exceptional staff.

title: No!
text:
Camere squallide, hall terribile, brutto insomma soprattutto per quanto costa a notte! Su Booking c'erano foto bene diverse della struttura ... abbiamo cambiato hotel. 
Unico punto a favore ....La zona!

title: Fine for what it is
text:
The rooms are tiny and depending on what floor you are on, you stare at a wall out of your window. The AC works great. The bathroom had no storage place and no bath mat. The toilet flusher was not in the best working order. The bathroom door is frosted so if someone turns the light on in the middle of the night-you will know it!
When I had called to ask about parking I was told I had to park at 575 Washington Street-they did not offer valet parking. When we walked in the front door, after schlepping our suitcases from the parking garage, there was a sign at the curb saying valet parking-not good that the front desk clerk didn't even know that! 
The price was good so for that reason I am fine with what we got.

title: Desactualizado y poco servicio
text: El hotel esta muy bien ubicado, es todo. La decoracion general es descuidada, vieja y muy poco estetica. El restaurant decadente. El hall de entrada sin espacio suficiente y la recepcionista Berkley malhumorada.

title: good value
text: I have stayed in many of the boutique hotels in this area, and this is a good value. The rooms are small but that is to be expected in this neighborhood, but the service was Outstanding! From the check in, to coffee in the morning, I was very impressed with the people who staffed the front desk. They were personable and incredibly easy to deal with, which is not always the case in NYC hotels!

title: I was billed for the room 3 times!
text: Their billing system is terrible to say the least! I was billed twice for the total amount before my visit and it took a whole month of phone calls to correct this. During my stay, I was billed a 3rd time! I thought I resolved the issue with the front desk person  ( while I was checking out) who told me I was issued a credit. No credit received and they even increased the amount they debited! What a mess!

title: Convenient, clean and friendly
text: This is hotel is convenient to transportation in SoHo, just 2 blocks south of Houston St.  The staff is very friendly, rooms are very tidy and the hotel is well kept.  Rooms are small, so quarters will feel very cramped if more than 2 people share a room.

title: Functionally fine but not very special
text: This hotel had all the neccessaries - hot water, bathroom worked, comfortable bed - but nothing at all special or fun.  Minute lobby with maybe one chair, tiny bar in attached restaurant closed at 11pm on a Friday night,  no concierge desk.  Bathroom is REALLY tiny.  Location was good for exploring SoHo; several subway stops within easy walking distance.  Weird inconvenience:  switch for light over the bed (the reading in bed light) was placed so you had to get out of bed to turn it off.  Lots of good places for coffee/ breakfast/ lunch were very close.

title: Buono
text: struttura con spazzi comuni un po ristretti, anche in camera lo spazio non è tanto ed il bagno piccolissimo. Posizione abbastanza vicino a Washington square ed al Village. Esagerato il costo di una notte di garage (60 dollari), Sinceramente un po troppo.

title: Nice place for the money
text:
It's a little bit off the beaten path which is nice, they were doing some construction on the building next door, but didn't hear a sound. 
The rooms aren't huge but for NYC prices it's more than fair,the staff is very friendly and accommodating. 
It's a short walk to SoHo and there are a variety of restaurants and bars and shops in walking distance. 
The hotel itself is clean and the rooms are neat and clean as well as the bathrooms. 
I've stayed there about half a dozen times and would stay again.

title: Neat
text: This hotel located in a very convenient place. Top New York attractions are within a walking distance or can easily find your way to them. Staff were very helpful. Rooms although a bit small they are clean and comfortable. Good value for money.

title: Buena opción
text: Buena ubicación en el soho, con estaciones de metro muy cerca. Además una agradable habitación limpia, con cama king y un lindo baño. El servicio es muy bueno, no tuvimos ningún problema. Buena relación costo calidad.

title: Comodo
text: Albergo molto comodo per la posizione: si può raggiungere a piedi freedom tower e zona sud Manhattan in 10/15 minuti. Vicinissimo alla fermata di metropolitana da cui potersi spostare per tutta la città . Ha tutti i comfort tranne il frigo in camera perciò se qualcuno vuole acquistare acqua fresca (ho soggiornato in agosto con caldo afoso e temperature più elevate della media stagionale) ...È ... Destinato a berla calda ... Disponibilità di macchina per ghiaccio al seminterrato per immergere la bottiglia e tenerla al fresco.... Ma in caso di generi alimentari .... La soluzione  ghiaccio non va bene. Albergo molto pulito (sebbene dotato di moquette che non è certo garanzia di igiene) dotato di TV radiosveglia phon cassaforte macchinetta per caffè in stanza aria condizionata Wi-Fi ...avevo stanza con vista su freedom tower molto suggestiva. Letti comodi e ampia doccia.

title: Nice hotel
text: I would recommend this hotel if you want something clean, basic and near soho. Rooms are a bit small, the bathroom is big. Location is really close to soho, world  trade center and shopping. Lobby is tiny but the front desk staff like Allison and the other guy from the morning staff are great. Super friendly!

title: Friendly staff, nice lication
text: Had a layover in NY for a few days. Chose this hotel since it was close to SOHO. The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming when I checked in and throughout the stay. They even were able to extend my room at checkout which was great! The room was average, but a decent size for NY standards. Had free coffee and a water bottle which was nice. The location was great, pretty quiet neighborhood and walking distance to fun restaurants and shops. Worth staying mostly due to the staff!

title: Good hotel for a good price
text: I think this is a very nice hotel even though it's not too high of a price. The lobby is sort of small but I don't care. Also, the restaurant there is actually really good! The rooms are like regular hotel rooms but a little smaller. One thing I didn't like was that the TV remote was dirty, but I'm still giving it 5 stars.

title: quick getaway
text: Went for a sporadic visit to see my daughter in NYC. The Sheraton was a great location for us to travel around SOHO, Chelsea and Brooklyn.  It is neat and clean, the front desk people were lovely. We had a drink at the bar in the evening.

title: Great value
text:
We spent 3 comfortable nights here and we're very impressed with the friendly and helpful reception we received! Brian was there with helpful ideas and one staff member ? took the time to walk us to the metro and show us how to get passes!
Clean room/ bath, fresh coffee in morning, adjoining bar with outdoor seating and a buy one/ get one free beer!
Safe, walkable area with metro close by.
We paid $30.00 a day to park our car.

title: Horrible Customer Service
text: My family had an exciting weekend staying at the FourPoints, celebrating my mother's 70th birthday, where we had several rooms booked and spent several thousand dollars with the hotel. The hotel staff failed to send out a package for me via UPS, which ended up costing me nearly $200 in late fees from the company my package was going to. After contacting the hotel staff with proof that UPS was never given the package until almost a week after it was to go out, the hotel refused to reimburse me for the fees and simply stopped responding to my emails. Rather than handle this graciously, they have infuriated me and my family, and none of us will ever stay in a Starwood property ever again.

title: Summer in US!
text: Love the lady at the front reception, she was gracious enough to let us check in really early in first available room and transferred us a street front view room the following day. She always gave us tips where to go and places to see.. So sad i never her name. It's a great hotel, clean and really accomodating, totally recommended!!! Very near to Soho fashion district for all the fab and glam resto and bistro of Ny!

title: Sanctuary
text: A passport snafu forced me to spend a fantastic weekend at the Four Points. I was welcomed by each staff member from the front desk folks to the doormen. I usually stay in mid town, but I am sold on this solid property with a neighborhood feel.

title: Prima hotel op een prima plek!
text: We verbleven voor een stedentrip in dit hotel. Het personeel was zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam. De kamer was niet groot, maar wel erg netjes en schoon. De airco werkte prima, het bed lag heerlijk en de badkamer was erg luxe. Een prima uitvalsbasis voor een stedentrip, metro is om de hoek, dus je bent overal zo!

title: Not sutch a nice room
text: The carpet was a bit wavy, some fungal bloom in the bathroom, and the remote control was empty. For this price not what we expected. Though they had free water and coffee in the lobby. You could hear the tv from the neighbors clearly. An OK  New York  experience.

title: Buena ubicacion. Buena Relación costo calidad
text:
Relación costo calidad: buena
Atencion: excelente
Ubicacion: buena , cerca de metros y de soho
Calidad hotelera: buena. Tamaño de las habitaciones y baňo pequeňo.
Restaurant: muy bueno, precios accesibles
Recomendacion: buscar habitaciones altas. Se ve el empire state.

title: Not Bad But Really Not that Good
text:
The facade of the building is really amazingly underwhelming . Don't expect a valet service at the hotel. Pull up to the loading zone , check in, and leave your keys with the front desk people. Front desk folks are actually the best part of the hotel. They are helpful, friendly, and polite. 
 The rooms are an okay size and are clean. I had two rooms on separate floors and they both had a little funky smell to them. Bathrooms were okay but bath products smelled like a 13 year old boy selected them. Super "Axey".
 The location really isn't Soho proper but more like a 10 to 15 minute walk which wasn't a problem . You are kind of between the West Village and Soho. 
 I didn't hate the place but In all honesty I was using Starwood points and only selected it because it was closest to the Saturday evening restaurant. We stayed one night so basically short of a disaster we could deal with it.
 I think it is a pretty good choice for a person going to New York City who is on a budget or just needs a place to throw their head down for the night.

title: Great location and helpful front desk
text: I have stayed in New York several times, however; this was my first time staying in Soho and I really like this area. It's about a 20 minute walk to NYU area and a 45 minute walk to Times Square. The room was quite basic, moderately cleaned, but I did love the shower! The shampoo & shower gel dispenser was a great touch and so easy to use! The staff were friendly and very helpful when I needed to change the length of my stay.

title: Front desk was amazing!
text: I stayed here for one night just for a short trip to nyc. Very basic hotel- great price for a decent location. However, 5 stars for their front desk agent Alfredo. What a true gem Starwood has in him! I have traveled the world and he was one of the friendliest and most helpful front desk agents I have come across. He made my stay better then average!

title: Great location
text: Good location but rooms are very small. Front desk is terrific & helpful, especially Trinita & Allison. Lots of places within walking distance, including the subway. Minutes walk away from SoHo, Village, Little Italy, Chinatown & the Hudson River. The location is probably the best thing about the hotel.

title: Lovely hotel great stay
text:
The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and several "local eateries" along with several chain type restaurants. I love the style of the hotel and the service was impeccable. Not cheap but if you are in NYC, you are not going to find cheap!
I would strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Well located, and okay for the money
text: Stayed over Memorial Day Weekend - Thursday to Monday. Nothing really bad to say - about what was expected for a three star hotel in Manhattan.  The  room did have a strange smell to it but looked clean.  The best thing about the hotel is the location.  Lots of restaurants within walking distance and well located for sightseeing in Chinatown, Little Italy, Lower Manhattan, and Chelsea - all within walking distance.  Construction at adjacent building but the noise was not bad while we were there.

title: Awesome staff!
text: First off, the staff was amazing. Very friendly and helpful and just all around pleasant. Great location. The rooms are small but if you're in NYC and doing it right, you won't be spending much time in your room. It was very clean and comfortable. I will most definitely stay here my next time in NYC.

title: Construction
text: Be careful not to stay on west side of building as there is massive construction that started very early and it was so loud that I couldn't even hold a conversation.  Also, the restaurant was terrible. Front desk staff were nice and friendly and tried to accommodate.  If you need to stay the night in Soho this isn't the best choice right now

title: New York at its Best
text: New York is such a fun town ... You have to try the speak easy in town.  This hotel is located by all the action (restaurants, shoppers, Starbucks, bars, and walking) and its amazing!  The Sheraton Soho is access to it all and we enjoy it so much .... Wow!

title: Where to stay near SoHo
text: The staff of this hotel is fantastic!  They answered many questions, including restaurant recommendations and travel tips.  The building is tucked in between other high-rise buildings, so don't expect much in the way of charming architecture or views of the city.  However, it seems convenient to the subway station and very convenient to SoHo and Little Italy.  I found the room to be small but sufficient since most of our time was spent sightseeing.  Ask for a room on an upper floor and at the back of the hotel.  Rooms on the back side of the hotel are quieter.  Your view will be a brick wall but the rooms on the front of the hotel don't have much of a view anyway.

title: No Frills, but nice location.
text: This hotels is a not frills hotel, but located close to shopping and dining.  The hotel staff was very friendly and the hotel room was very clean.   The beds were not Westin, but I slept well.  Make sure you bring your own shampoo unless you want to use the pump one located in the shower.

title: Great staff, mediocre facility . . .
text:
There are limited hotel options in SoHo and the Four Points had the strong selling point of a convenient location for my trip.  

The hotel is tucked on Charlton Street in a sliver of a building. The hotel is 21 floors, 8 rooms to a floor, with very narrow halls. There are two elevators and the wait for an elevator can be fairly long. 

I was on the top floor in a room that brings new meaning to the word "cozy." Other words that come to mind? Tiny, cramped, cell-like . . . you get the drift. On a cost-per-square-foot basis, this may have been the most expensive hotel I've ever visited in Manhattan -- and that's saying something. 

I was less than thrilled when, in my "cozy" shower, there was very little water pressure at 6 am. And that was after a poor night's sleep due to a LOT of outside noise. It didn't seem to me that the architect designed in the noise reduction attributes I would have expected in a 24-hour city.

The property seems to have taken a fair amount of guest abuse -- there are lots of scratches, dings and scuffs.

The lobby works -- if you're the only guest. With two people waiting and their luggage, there was little room to spare. The "fitness room" is in the basement (subbasement?) with very limited space and equipment.

Compared to the physical appearance and lack of charm of the property, the staff simply was awesome. Everyone I came in contact with had a wonderfully positive attitude and a genuine willingness to help. When a guest told the woman tending bar of a problem in the men's room (which is in the subbasement), she responded quickly and enthusiastically to get the engineer on it. When I mentioned a wi-fi connectivity issue to the front desk person, he had the Wi-Fi rebooted in minutes.

title: nice spot
text:
it was a nice hotel, like expected for the brand. Only thing i would warn you about is the 
PARKING!!!!! $60 to valet. Which is insane! Hotel was only $100 for this night which by the way is a steal for NYC but I guess they robbed me back for the parking. 

otherwise its a cool hotel if you don't mind the noise but people this is nyc its noisy everywhere. enjoy the city. more of a business or couple or single thing, wouldn't suggest for young family members

title: Terrific friendly staff but small hotel so noisy
text: This is a very good hotel - unless you are noise sensitive.  The doors are heavy and the rooms close to each other so you hear people coming in and out of their rooms.  There was also construction next door, but the staff went above and beyond and moved my room which I was grateful for.  Price is worth the value of the hotel.

title: Smallest hotel room in NY
text:
I have visited New York, NY a few times, both business and pleasure and have stayed in different hotels in NY. this has been the smallest room I have lived in. I think it was smaller than my room on a cruise ship.

To make matters worse the view from my building was a concrete wall of the other building only above 25 feet away.

For a claustrophobic person like person for me, not a comfortable time at all!

title: Good Location
text:
Had everything we needed. It was clean. It was close the the subway and very easy to get to from the JFK via train and subway (use the Vanderbelt exit at Spring Street on the E train).
The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was great and had fabulous view.
Noisy only when you opened the window.

title: Decent place if you do not need a lot of room
text: We stayed here one night as we were visiting family in NYC. The property is on a quiet street in the SoHoVillage area, with a close walk to Greenwich Village and NYU. The rooms were small, even for NYC rooms, but the property was nice.  Great location, the bed was comfortable, the shower had good water pressure, the staff was excellent. May be a little pricey compared to places I have stayed in Midtown East, but maybe it was supply and demand on this particular weekend. Small room, so not great for a family, but a single or couple may like it.

title: Ms
text: Very friendly staff, clean and suitable rooms, price very good, location perfect near to hop on hop off, very central, near to the best Restaurants, due to central location the taxi prices are payable

title: Nice Room, Friendly Staff
text: I stayed here for a business trip and really enjoyed my stay. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room wasn't as small as I expected for a city hotel. It was pretty spacious and comfortable.

title: OTTIMO HOTEL A SOHO E PERSONALE GENTILISSIMO
text:
L'Hotel è in una posizione strategica per visitare Soho, Lower East Side, Greenwich Village e Downtown senza prendere la metro. Comunque la fermata di Huston street è vicinissima. Le camere sono spaziose e pulite considerando gli standard di Manhattan, ma la cosa piu importante è che lo staff è veramente gentile e disponibilissimo, in particolare Alice simpaticissima e gentilissima. 
Da rifare al prossimo viaggio a NYC.

title: Pontos positivos X Pontos negativos
text:
+: localização perfeita para o meu objetivo. Fica entre Green Village e Soho, mais ao Sul de Manhatan. A 1 quadra do hotel fica a linhas 1,2,3 vermelha do metro. Atravessando a Varick street, que é continuação da 7 avenida, subindo direto uns 4 quarteirões você estará na Prince street com a Broodway. Região badalada, com muitos restaurantes, cafés, lojas de grifes ( Vuitton, Prada, Fendi, Apple.......etc) e a linha laranja do metro, outra boa opção. O quarto que fiquei hospedada foi 205, cama ótima, chuveiro maravilhoso, limpeza excelente, tamanho bom. Pessoal da recepção tentam ser simpáticos ( maioria é). No box do Banheiro tem sabonete líquido, xampoo e condicionador.

Negativos: o aquecedor super barulhento, vaso sanitário a descarga não funcionava direito, carpete do corredor um pouco mal cheiroso.

title: Good location, nice room, friendly staff
text: We wanted a hotel room in the West Village, and this worked well.  Room is small, but typical for NYC.  It did have everything needed including a coffee maker, wifi, iron, safe and a basket underneath the bathroom sink for your toiletries.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Hotel is a few blocks from the subway (#1) takes you uptown to Times Square or Macys and walking distance to lots of restaurants in the West Village.  Short walk to the Highline or the new Whitney Museum.  Hotel is off Varick St so it was surprisingly quiet at night.

title: Good solid central stop
text:
Check in - informative, cheery, quick smooth. A pleasurable checkin with attentive humerous staff.

Bar - Small, however there are plenty in the area. Used more as a quick meeting place before going elsewhere.

Rooms - clean, secure. AC wifi router in each room with free access. Safe . Hairdryer. Iron and the usual toiletaries. Large TV. No apparent noise from neighbors. Bathroom clean and grout cared for. Slight signs of wear and tear in the room. Furniture solid but dated. Bed very comfortable. 

Overall a very nice 2 night stay within 15 min walk of 911 monument etc. Staying away from the normal times square area. Definate advantage both in cost and the more relaxed pace.

Breakfast was more than adequate with the dishes adapted to your needs.
Would definately stay again..

title: Comfortable hotel with great service
text: Came here to visit my daughter at NYU.  This hotel is within walking distance of the university and all of the great restaurants in the West Village area.  As soon as we got in the attendant at the desk told us about a nearby parking garage that only charged $39 for 24h, pretty rare in Manhattan.  Our room was very clean and the beds were comfortable.  I slept very well.  Great place to stay in lower Manhattan!

title: Well located
text: Stayed here for a wedding weekend. The hotel was pricey for our tastes but competitive with the area. The desk staff was very helpful with directions and special requests. One complaint is the lack of decent breakfast restaurants outside the hotel. A lot of rehab construction is going on with many buildings close by and that may be part of the problem. Room was small but comfortable and met our needs of a safe place to rest our heads. One thing that could make it better would be 24 x 7 coffee in the lobby and a little m o re room in the lobby for someone who wants to read, have a coffe/tea and let their mate sleep in.

title: Nice room for a reasonable price
text: Room was clean and well-maintained.  Small but not cramped.  Totally served its purpose.  Soho location was fun for a change.  Subway nearby. Staff was helpful with directions.  Reasonable price.  Nice bedding. Would stay here again and recommend to others.

title: The best choice
text: The staff alone makes this place unlike any other. We have three kids and they went out of their way to help us. Gave the girls goodie bags with snacks water and cookies. The rooms aren't super fancy or anything but they are clean and the beds are comfortable. Disney channel included on the tv. And free shuttles to lax. They also gave us a $20 uber gc! It's just been such a great experience. Not to mention so reasonably priced. Only regret is not bringing a bathing suit. The pool area is gorgeous!!! We will definitely be staying here again

title: Don't expect any courtesy from the front desk.
text: They could not find my reservation on check in, I showed her the reservation on my phone.  She insisted she couldn't find it, no other offers of help.   They were able to give me a room but come to find out I had booked a different Four Points, in Midtown.  They charged me for a no show fee of $300.  Still battling with them, no one is willing to discuss it.    They were not the least bit helpful.  The hotel smells like urine and fermentation .   Great location though.

title: Good choice in the area
text: The hotel was nice enough and the staff very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are a little dated but mine was clean and functional. If you are looking for a reasonably priced simple hotel choice this would work. Spent two nights and I would stay there again.

title: Time for Some Upgrades
text:
The Four Points Sheraton Hotels are generally modern, clean and have a great vibe. The location in Soho has a great location however the rooms are somewhat dated. There is lot of construction in the area that starts up pretty early so if you're looking for peace and quite, this may not be the best location. However if you want to be in walking distance from the Village and the many restaurants, cafes and shopping it offers, this is a great location.

The staff are incredibly friendly and accommodating....its hard to get by the front desk with an acknowledgement or some sort in the form of a "hello" or "how is it going". They have valet parking for $48 per night with no in and out privileges. If you don't mind a short walk, you can park overnight for $32-$36.

The bathrooms are also tiny but not completely out of line with the average size of an average NYC hotel. We asked for a fridge in the room and they hauled up this old mini fridge that had some cobwebs on it.

Don;t think I'll stay at this location again. If I want an economy hotel in the village, The Mulberry is a good choice otherwise I would look at the Four Points on Canal or mid-town.

title: NYC in March
text: Stayed here in early March for about a week. The hotel is conveniently located close to metro, shops, restaurants, and bars. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The reception stuff was friendly and knowledgeable about the city and the neigbourhood. I would stay here again.

title: Good placing, nice and tidy
text: Neat hotel and very friendly staff. Nice view if you get a room up high. Gym with one treadmill and a broken bike and minimal other equipment - you could do yoga there, because weights were far too small. Just over the street from WeWork building

title: Okay, but seen better days
text:
Sadly, the list of bad points about this hotel is longer than the list of good points.

On the plus side, the staff are all friendly,  rooms are clean, bathroom and shower are fine,  in-room wifi is fast and reliable,  beds are comfy, and the rooms are an okay size.   I also like the free coffee in reception in the mornings, it's nice to be able to grab a cup on my way out.
