Location is also good, in a quieter area of Manhattan, but a five minute walk from Bleeker Street, and a ten minute walk from Greenwich Village, with all their bars and music venues.  Two minutes walk from a subway too, which leads directly up to Times Square and beyond.

On the negative side - don't stay here if you like to relax with a quiet drink in the hotel bar at the end of the day.  The bar is embarrassingly small - literally a bar with six bar stools in a corridor-like set up, and no other tables or chairs.  The walls are thin, and I could literally hear people coughing next door, and the ping of the lift being called during the night.  The air conditioning is really old-fashioned and terribly noisy.  There was a "knack" to flushing the toilet to stop it constantly flushing afterward. Even my TV was irritating - there's no "menu" function and it takes a couple of seconds to change channel, which is really annoying if you're just trying to flick through to see what's on!   I was travelling for work, so I had a room to myself, but it would be a bit tight for space if there were two people in the room, and the wardrobe is tiny.   

Overall,  it's fine,  and I certainly didn't dislike coming back to the hotel,  I just suspect there are better hotels out there for a similar price.

title: Buena opción de hotel en excelente ubicación
text: Es un buen hotel promedio, pero excelentemente ubicado en la zona del Soho cerca del metro y lejos del ruido de la zona centrica de Manhattan.  Para quedarse a recorrer la zona que es de mis preferidas en New York con excelentes bares y restaurantes..

title: Great hospitality
text: The front desk staff are friendly and helpful. The room was clean although NYC typically small. Great location and easy to catch a taxi from here throughout the day. Walking distance to some great restaurants and Starbucks for morning coffee. Restaurant inside the hotel is average at best unfortunately. Windows are a bit thin but not horribly noisy at night.

title: Excelente hotel en una excelente zona de Manhattan
text:
Cuando llegamos a Nueva York nos dirigimos a nuestro hotel, al que habíamos reservado cuando planeamos todo este periplo por los Estados Unido. Ese hotel era el Pennsylvania. Pero ahí sólo duramos una noche y fue horrible. Al despertar en la mañana pedimos la devolución del dinero prepagado por 7 noches e hicimos una búsqueda rápida. De los hoteles en que encontramos disponibilidad nuestra intuición nos llevó al Four Points de SoHo. Nuestra decisión fue inmejorable; el hotel es más bien pequeño, sus habitaciones también, pero decoradas con gran estilo y con todo en perfecto estado.
No hay mucho por decir, todo limpio, cómodo, servicio muy amable y un rico restorán en el mismo piso del pequeño lobby. En cuanto a la ubicación, es donde más me gusta quedarme en Nueva York, lejos del ruido extremo del midtown, cerca de montones de cafés, bares y lugares increíbles, cerca del metro donde se puede ir a todas partes.
Lo primero que está decidido para nuestro próximo viaje a Nueva York es el hotel: Four Points by Sheraton SoHo.

title: Not great.
text:
I was so disappointed with my 3-night stay at the Sheraton, but I'll start off with the only positive--we were warmly welcomed by Allison at the front desk. She was so kind and accommodating. Definitely a nice start to the trip. 

When we got up to our room, things kind of backtracked. It was a shoebox. I'm not usually picky when it comes to hotels--all I care about is cleanliness--but the space was so tiny that it was even a challenge to get around the bed. We barely had room for our suitcases. Also, I was put off by how dusty and scuffed up the walls were. Not the nicest sight. 

The worst of all was being woken up in the wee hours of the morning ALL three nights we stayed there due to a very loud group of drunken women. I had to call the front desk several times. An apology of some sort would've been nice. It took a while to get the women to stop yelling and running around. Also irritating--the sounds of the elevator were also SO astoundingly loud. Very odd. 

Anyway, although I got a good deal on Expedia, I wasn't able to enjoy it. I barely slept and didn't even have the energy to bring up my grievances as I was leaving. The lobby was overflowing with people who were off to a convention, so I wouldn't have been able to grab an employee anyway.

I won't be going back.

title: Amazing staff
text: Stayed here last Friday night with a group of friends and the best part about the stay was the staff. The property itself was nice and clean- the size you would expect from a hotel in Manhattan. From the moment we walked in the staff was attentive and friendly up until we checked out. Really happy with the stay because of that, and I would definitely stay again.

title: Comfortable Stay in SoHo
text:
My room looked out on the front of the hotel.  There was some early morning noise which sounded like construction even on a Sunday but that didn't bother me very much.  Be aware of this when you book a room.
The front desk staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are large by NY standards and very clean.  There are soda and snack machines in the basement as well as a small workout room.  The hotel is well located.  It is walking distance to Soho, the Village, and is near several subway lines.  I felt safe walking to the hotel alone even after dark.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Happy with our stay
text: I stayed here with my husband for the second time in October 2015 and both times, we've been satisfied with our stay. The location of the hotel is great - a short walk to all the restaurants and shops of Soho/West Village. The staff have also been very friendly and helpful each time we've stayed here. The free bottles of water and free wifi are also a bonus! My only complaint is that both stays, I've found it a bit loud and have needed earplugs to sleep (although I am a light sleeper and NYC is loud generally). I would request a high-floor and ask for the quietest room possible. We would definitely return and have been happy with our stays so far.

title: Earplugs required.
text:
As someone who formerly lived in NY and understands what it takes to live in a city that never sleeps, this hotel is in a great location but doesn't exactly offer the quietest surroundings.

With paper-thin walls and windows, you will hear every door slam as well as any action on the street -- so it's great if you do not need to sleep. I was on the 12th floor and can repeat verbatim what was said outside. Fortunately, I was warm enough in my room after cranking the heat up to almost 80 degrees (it's 40 degrees outside). 

At the end of the day -- it is the same cliche, "you get what you pay for" and this is absolutely no different.

title: Week-end visit.
text:
A perfect hotel for a week-end visit. Convient down town location to walk to Soho, West Village, China town & Meat packing. 
Simple and clean..no frills..
Great views of NYC water tanks & one World Trade Center if you get a high south facing room.

title: Very nice stay!
text: My husband and I booked a room for this past Saturday for a one-night stay.  We arrived early, and were thrilled to find out our room was ready.  Like most hotels in NYC, the rooms are very small, but it was very cozy, very clean, and had great amenities in the bathroom.   The hotel is in a great location, and within walking distance to many things we wanted to do.   The people at the front desk were very accommodating.  My only complaint is the noise during the night.  The heating/AC system is very loud as is the plumbing (you knew every time a toilet flushed).   Other than that, no issues whatsoever.   I would definitely stay here again!

title: Pleasant Overnight Stay
text: We arrived at 11:45 am on Saturday and was pleasantly surprised that our room was ready. Like others have said, the hallways, much like the rooms are narrow. I couldn't see how guests would be able to manuever around if there was a maid's cart in the hallway. The room was immaculate with nice amenities in the bathroom. We had a Sixteenth room floor overlooking the city with a fabulous view ! Like I had stated before, the rooms are small and the walls are thin. We could hear conversations through the wall and I don't believe our neighbors were talking the loud. Every employee we encountered were friendly and helpful. The best part about this hotel is its' location. There is nothing that you would need that isn't within walking distance. Not to overstate the obvious, but parking is EXPENSIVE in NYC. We paid $39/ night (It was $44/night but if you tell them that you are staying at Four Points, they will deduct $5) We would definately stay again during our next visit.

title: An absolute steal!
text:
My wife and I have stayed here 3 years in a row on what has become an annual December trip to New York City. We paid a stellar rate of $95/night. I am SPG platinum and tried to use my suite night awards to guarantee an upgrade to their suites, but they were sold out. My success rate is 1 out of 3 tries. We got a north-facing room on the 20th floor though, and I love the view of Empire State Building and Chrysler Building.
Once again, I will say that I really like the location of this hotel. Very close to the #1 subway, and just a few minutes to the heart of SOHO, which we really enjoy. Also, I get the breakfast as my platinum amenity, and they give us $20.50 per person credit per morning – which we can put towards room service, which is absolutely awesome! It helps us to save time.
The room is cozy, yet comfortable, and clean. It’s not terribly quiet as you can hear the neighbors talking, yelling, or whatever it is they’re doing over there. The construction is directly next door as well; however, we didn’t notice noise, just people looking into our room from the construction elevator! However, for what I paid, and the tremendous value I receive in return, my wife and I will not hesitate to return to this hotel time and time again.

title: A convenient, cozy, and friendly spot to stay
text:
This was my first hotel in NYC for a 7 day visit.  I chose this location mainly for its proximity to work and things I wanted to do.  It's next to Greenwich village and is just a few minutes to walk to multiple subway stations.  There's also a Citi Bike rental nearby, a shared public bike rental service that makes for an excellent way to get around and see the neighborhoods quickly.

When I stayed here in early November, I found the hotel staff and even the guests to be very approachable and friendly.  It was nice to enjoy a night cap at the bar and have some good rest.  Be aware, however, that this hotel does get a fair share of noise.  As other reviewers have indicated, there's construction during the day and you'll hear it on 3 of the 4 sides of this hotel.  The 4th side faces a busy road (Varick St).  If you're a light sleeper then you may need to choose between the constant noise of the busy road and the daytime construction.  The construction site is active at 7am and closes generally by 4pm Mon-Fri.  I was out of the hotel most of this time so the noise from the work site didn't affect me, and I was very happy to not be on the farthest end and facing the busy road.  A nice touch I found is that the hotel leaves ear plugs on the night stand by your bed even though New York is inherently noisy.

As to the quality of the room, I think the size is par for the course.  In fact, when compared to similar rooms by price elsewhere in NYC, Zurich, and Lima, the rooms in this hotel are a bit larger.  My stay was on the 10th floor and my room didn't feel updated but neither did it feel run down.  My only complaint is the loud air conditioner/heater and the awkward shape of the shower.  I was unable to use the shower without bumping both sides, and it was made even smaller with the large mounted soap dispenser.. the bathroom by comparison is very large and the shower could have easily been a foot wider, but for some reason it wasn't designed that way.

All in all, I would stay here again.  The location to the restaurants and shops on MacDougal St and the subway stops made my visit much more enjoyable, and the staff at this hotel are both personable and friendly.

title: A wonderful stay
text: I had not been to this hotel for about a year, and my stay was wonderful. The room was clean and comfortable and administration and staff went out of their way to be supportive throughout my visit. I felt like I had come "home" as I've stayed there so frequently in the past. The restaurant manager bought a free glass of wine for myself and my friends who met me in the restaurant to celebrate the holidays. The location is central, and there are great restaurants in the area, both in the West Village and in "Noho". I am really looking forward to a return stay.

title: Great Service!!!
text: We visited the city the 23rd of December.  I usually don't write reviews, since I work in a competitor brand hotel (not in the city, though).  But the experience I received at this hotel very much impressed me.  I have stayed many times in NY, and usually I left hotels not too happy with the service.  This time around, I was greeted with a friendly and helpful agent named Allison.  In the morning, I then met Trinita, who was also very courteous and patient.  I thought the rooms were a bit small but of course, we're talking about New York rooms.  I stayed at other NY hotels and the service just could not compare with this one.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends in the future.

title: Larger than normal NYC rooms
text: Great location for westide and bigger than normal rooms make this an ideal, good value hotel for NYC. Bedding was also good and surprisingly quiet. Wifi was also good and fast. The neighborhood is excellent for food and shopping choices.

title: Nice but....
text:
Pros: good location and clean...very accommodating staff...and comfy bed. 

Cons: very small rooms (even for NYC), bathroom has a very small sink for hair and makeup.  

My recommendation is to look around, but if using points or building points this will do.

title: Nuevamente una grata  experiencia
text:
Volví este año después de la buena experiencia del año pasado.
La limpieza principalmente en los baños, es el punto para destacar. Las camas y la ropa de cama 10 sobre 10. Lo mismo las toallas y batas. La ubicación es excelente. Siendo miembro SPG tuve q reclamar el up grade de habitación. Quizá tengan que revisarlo. Resto OK!

title: buen hotel
text: Si bien las habitaciones son un poco mas viejas que lo que me tienen acostumbrado los Four Points, la atención y su ubicación justifican lo pagado. Se encuentra a pasos del metro y cuenta con varios restoranes cercanos. Lo recomiendo!

title: Excellent location
text: A simple, yet comfortable hotel in an excellent location. A short walk to all SOHO shops and restaurants. Although the address says Soho, it's more of a Village hotel. Very quiet, with amazing views (choose a "room with city view"). Nice, helpful staff. Rooms are small as in most hotels in NY. A good choice for downtown lovers.

title: Great hotel, very reasonable price
text:
Comfortable room. Staff couldn't be more helpful. Excellent location. Front of building under construction but once inside, not noticeable- small lobby but super cute, did not affect our stay. 
They let us check in early and out late without questions or hassle. We had a very reasonably sized room - a find in Manhatten.  Finally n

title: Credit card fraud!!!
text: We made a booking through booking.com. Although booking.com did not require a security deposit and explicitly stated that no amount was due until after staying at the hotel, they hotel charged my credit card, not just one (1) time but three (3) times!! BEWARE!!! They will claim it is a "system" issue, but if you aren't vigilant over your credit card charges, they will hijack your card.

title: Good value for the money
text:
We stayed here for a quick weekend trip to NYC and used Starwood points to pay for the two nights. Considering the price of hotels in New York, the conversion rate of points for dollars to cover the stay was a great value!

If you plan to be out and about in the city, this hotel will get the job done: clean, comfy room, good view (we had a corner room on a high floor with good views looking downtown) and decent service, but if you are looking for a place to relax and spend a lot of time in your room and lobby, this isn't the place for you. The lobby is quite small (check-in desk, small seating area and two elevators), there is construction going on next door, and the hotel itself is tall and narrow, so when exiting the elevators, the floor layout could seem a little claustrophobic.

All things considered, it was perfect for our travel needs and I'd stay again.

title: Basic but serviceable  - Hotel is being renovated
text: The caveat being, of course, that the hotel is being renovated.  It's located in an area convenient to SoHo and the West Village, as well as the Piers.  The front-desk staff is very friendly and helpful.  The room I stayed in was a typical, Manhattan hotel-sized (read: small) room.  The view from the upper-floor room was lovely - Empire State Building - but the room itself was unremarkable.  Once they complete the renovation, I'm sure the tired feeling will be wiped away and the rooms will be updated and refreshed.

title: Beware Loud Noise - Construction
text: I have recently spent time at the Four Points in Soho.  It was very nosy as a condo building is being constructed next door.   It's very difficult to get a cab out of the hotel due to the street being blocked.   The rooms were very small and the air conditioner/ heat is extremely loud.   It doesn't accommodate people taller than 6 feet tall as the ceiling is extremely low in the basement.

title: Stretches the SoHo boundaries, but hey it gets the little things right.
text:
I gets Free water, free Wi-Fi. Which I likes. I also liked that really small Sushi restaurant. The whole hotel had a pretty good feel. 

However, I have to knock off a point for having 'SoHo' in the title. The hotel is not in SoHo.

title: Good stay!
text: We had a great 4 night/5 day stay here.  The guest rooms are not huge but are adequate and very clean. House cleaning service and restocking of supplies every day were excellent.  The desk staff were courteous and professional.  The bartender Julie was great. Special compliments to Jesse and Perry at the front desk who offered special and friendly assistance on our departure day!

title: Great location with excellent staff
text: I stayed at the Four Points SoHo for three nights over Halloween weekend. Conveniently located in SoHo, just a short walk between two subway stops (Houston and Spring) it was a great spot to use as 'home base' while exploring the city. Less chaotic than Times Square but still very central. (Also just steps away from a Starbucks - or for East Coasters, Dunkin Donuts - to conveniently get your daily coffee fix.) From initial check-in to check-out, I was very pleased with the quality of the service provided by the staff - very helpful and friendly. Our room on the 20th floor was great (not huge, as is to be expected in Manhattan, but not small like European hotels). From the window we could see a glimpse of the Empire State building, which was great, however the view on lower floors may be lacking due to nearby construction. Having arrived early Thursday morning and staying through Sunday, I never once heard noise from the construction during normal sleeping hours. The hotel provided ear plugs but we never needed them. I think the noise would only be problematic if you have small children and/or are an adult that requires midday naps, Complimentary wifi and coffee/tea in the lobby in the a.m. was also a nice touch. Overall very pleased with our stay and hope to return soon!

title: Reasons to Avoid This One
text:
Four Points has a few redeeming characteristics such as the location and the staff.  The location is close to the heart of Soho with plenty of great shops and restaurants.   The staff was generally energetic and helpful although the front desk staff doesn't seem to communicate well with each other.   More on that in a minute.   The problems with this Four Points are many, starting with the room size.  Think crackerbox.   If you want a view, you won't get one here.  Our room on the third floor offered intimate viewing angles of the construction project going on right outside our window.   As an added bonus, we experienced loud construction noise starting before the rise of dawn.  Our request to move to a higher floor was eventually given a pledge that we would be upgraded the following morning.   Somehow, I wasn't surprised when front desk personnel the next morning was unaware of this commitment and had no other rooms available.   

The term "upgrade", in this case, did not mean we could get a larger room.   I was assured by staff that all rooms at this Four Points are equally small.   An upgrade does mean that you will be on a top floor, with at least a modest, peek-a-boo view.  At an extra charge, of course.   

Our friends in the adjoining room experienced flooding into the rest of the unit whenever they used the shower because the threshold was very low----an ADA room apparently---but without going to the expense of providing extra drainage, something clearly necessary in such cases.

Another budgetary practice at this Four Points was to use refillable containers for shampoo, conditioner and gel in the shower.   Our conditioner reservoir was empty.  The reservoir should contain enough conditioner to last a week, so this means they aren't refilled routinely and perhaps only when guests complain.  At a rate of over $300 per night, this hotel is a poor value.  With so many hotels in NYC, there is no doubt that there are many better choices for about the same price.

title: Great Service and Value
text: In a city without many bargains, Four Points offers comfortable, clean rooms in a great location within walking distance of Soho, Meat Packing District, West Village, and the financial district for less than $250. Rooms are New York sized, but ample for what we needed. Most of all, the hotel is run by very friendly young people who act like they want to succeed in the hospitality business. Special shout out to Elizabeth, who safely held my keys for two days while I remembered where I left them and then FedExed then to me. We've been there twice and would certainly go again.

title: Bad smell. Noisy.
text:
We arrived late and I wanted To change hotel. The room had a terrible smell. The bed was nice and white but everything else wasnt. 
The peolpe was trying To be nice because the hotel wasn't. Wouldnt go again

title: Business trip to NYC
text: The hotel was fine. I don't have any major complaints but the construction was very loud. We ate at the restaurant and the service was excellent. The view from the 8th floor was just another building. It was fine for what I needed, but I wouldn't go out of my way to return.

title: Not up to SPG standards
text:
There are a few positive things I can say about this property:  good location if you want to be near SoHo, the Village or lower Manhattan; convenient to the subway; the bed was comfortable and my room was ready when I arrived. 

None of that made up for the actual stay.  The room was the smallest hotel room I've ever had, and I travel to many large cities known for small rooms. It was a handicap accessible room (I'm not).  I was told that this was an "upgrade" as a Gold member.  I can't imagine what a lesser room might be.

The window was open, and I was unable to close it.  I called the front desk at 1:30 asking if they could send someone up to close it. When I left at 3:00 no one had shown up. I mentioned it on my way out and was assured someone would close it before I returned. At 9pm when I returned it was still open. I went back down to the desk and she radioed maintenance and they did show up and close it. 

The shower was a roll in with a plastic bench and handheld sprayer. The water pressure was minimal, the shower barely sprayed and the floor got soaked due to there being no separation between the shower and the floor. Although there was a drain in the middle of the bathroom floor, large puddles formed on the very shiny tile floor, causing it to be EXTREMELY dangerous and slippery.  It took all of the towels and the bath mat to absorb the water.

There was construction being done on the building next door that started early in the morning on Monday (not too much noise on Saturday and Sunday, except for street noise being on the 4th floor).  I was aware of the construction when I made the reservation (it was stated on the website), and I knew I wasn't going to be in the room much during the day, so didn't really mind.

When I was in NY in July, I stayed at the Westin Times Square(fabulous room, great view, high floor).  Next time I'm in and need to be downtown, I'll stay at the W Union Square.

title: Excellent service and staff
text:
Stayed at the Four Points for 7 nights, and while there was construction, I was able to negotiate with the courteous and helpful for a room change. 

I was impressed with both the service and level of professionalism the staff handled my request.

title: lovely hotel
text: We booked this hotel on Hotel Tonight an hour before we got there. Once we got there, they we so kind, friendly and helpful to us. Our room was ready upon arrival and there were beverages ready to quench our thirst in the heat of the summer. Our room also had two bottles of water ready for us, free of charge. Our rooms were clean and up to date. I had no complaints.

title: Nice hotel in a great area
text: Rooms are modern and clean, view is amazing. Near the village and soho, which are my favorite areas in NYC. Near subway station. Plenty of places in the area to get a nice breakfast. Good place to stay for a visit to this amazing city.

title: Kakerlaken + mieser Umgang damit = Aufenthalt vermiest
text:
Zunächst einmal allgemeines:
Mir kam das Hotel durchschnittlich vor, nicht super-sauber, aber in Ordnung. Kostenloses WLAN und Wasser fand ich gut.
Bar und Frühstück finde ich teuer bzw. nicht lecker, direkt am Eck ist ein "Pret a Manger", kann ich mehr empfehlen.
Das Hotel ist LAUT, zusätzlich ist noch eine Baustelle nebenan, in 2015 wird die bestimmt nicht fertig!
Umweltschutz kennt man nicht, alle nur angefassten Handtücher werden sofort getauscht.

Meine Kakerlakenprobleme:
Über Nacht wachte ich zu 5 Kakerlaken im Badezimmer auf. Widerlich, aber nicht untypisch für New York, wie man mir sagte. Nur dass die meisten vielleicht mal nur 1 Kakerlake haben, nicht 5.
Bin also sofort runter zur Rezeption (aufgrund der frühen Stunde war da noch der Nachtmanager) und habe das gemeldet.
Ich habe ihn darüber informiert, habe ihm gesagt dass ich nicht in dem Zimmer bleiben will UND dass ich unbedingt duschen muss, da ich es sehr eilig hatte.
Long story short - er hatte nicht wirklich Interesse an meinem Problem und sagte mir, dass ich nur in meinem derzeitigen Zimmer duschen kann (oh danke!?). Ein neues Zimmer bekäme ich frühestens um 15:00. Außerdem könnten mir seine Kollegen später besser helfen.

Also, etwas beleidigt und wütend, bin ich zurück in mein Zimmer und fand immer noch 3 Kakerlaken im Badezimmer. Habe erstmal Fotos gemacht.
Anschließend musste ich da drin irgendwie duschen. Habe versucht, die Kakerlaken mit dem Spülbecher zu fangen, die sind dann aber irgendwo in der Wand verschwunden. Immerhin ;)
Habe anschließend in Rekordtempo geduscht und bin zurück zur Rezeption. Da war mittlerweile das Tages-Personal anwesend. Die wussten aber von nichts, der Nachtmanager hatte natürlich nichts gesagt. Gut, habe alles nochmal erklärt - das Personal war aber auch kaum interessiert und überrascht (Gruß an alle nach mir Kommenden!) von den Kakerlaken schienen sie auch nicht.

Kurzum, wirklich entgegengekommen ist man mir nicht, man war auch nicht besonders hilfreich. Habe dann nur für die letzte Nacht ein neues Zimmer bekommen, was interessant stark nach Insektiziden roch ;)

Für mich ist das Hotel glatt durchgefallen.
Qualität zeigt sich erst, wenn etwas schiefgeht, und das war hier mehr ein Fiasko.

Meine Firma hatte mir den Aufenthalt gezahlt, deswegen bat ich auch um eine Kompensation, ein Entgegenkommen, irgendwas. Es gab ja nicht mal eine Entschuldigung.
Mir wurden irgendwelche Punkte versprochen - aber ganz ehrlich, zum einen habe ich die nicht erhalten und zum anderen weiß ich nicht, ob ich in dieser Kette jemals wieder buche.

Habe dem Personal gesagt, dass wirklich nervlich am Ende bin und das alles auf Tripadvisor & Co landet. Hat sie nicht interessiert, also bitte, hier ist euer Eintrag inkl. Beweisfotos!

Und das alles war HÖFLICH von meiner Seite. Ich war weder agressiv noch fordernd. Aber vielleicht war das das Problem.

Fotos habe ich angehängt.

title: Great base for our first NY adventure
text: Everyone dreams of their first trip to NY.  I always wanted to stay in Garden Village and spend time mooching about the shops, cafes and restaurants there, however, it's expensive and the hotels here are limited in number, so I cast my new further and found the Four Points in SoHo.  It was perfect, the room was on an upper floor and had amazing view to south Manhattan.  It was a bit of a trek to the local subway station, but NY was made for walking! We could easily walk to SoHo, TriBeCa and Garden Village so evening meals were always easy to organise! (Bubby's in TriBeCa was a highlight). I'm surprised this hotel ranks so low, we had a great time using it as our base to explore the city for the first time!

title: Week trip to NYC
text:
Stayed at the Four Points for 5 nights. Location was great and easy to access from the subway, which we took everywhere. Check in was easy and was upgraded to a higher floor room on the 19th floor with a view towards midtown. Room was small (typical of Manhattan) but in good shape. Bed was a little firm for my taste but still got a good nights rest. Construction woke us up in the morning each day but we knew about this ahead of time. Otherwise is was a very quiet room.

Nice stay and would stay again if I wanted to stay in Soho.

title: Second stay at this hotel, there's not going to be third time
text:
In 2011 I stayed in this hotel and had good memories, so I've decided to go there again.

The staff was really nice and I felt welcome at the hotel. The room was not in a good shape though:
- The toilet flush did not always work, mentioned it twice at the reception. I think they fixed it only temporarily as it tended not to work again at last day. 
- There was no cold water, only warm to boiling hot. Trying to get cold water, only "air" would come out of the tap and the toilet would start to make funny noises.
- The battery for the door lock went empty at Friday midnight, and we were locked out for 2 hours (got compensated with a voucher for "complementary breakfast" at the hotel's restaurant. The breakfast was mediocre)
- Finally, there's a construction site right next to the hotel (until December 2015, I read somewhere), so on workdays it was very noisy, but I don't blame the hotel for that. They provide earplugs as a countermeasure.

The good things were: 
- Location! Very close to subway stations, restaurants, Hudson river, etc.
- Again, friendly staff!
- Might be insignificant, but I liked the free complementary water bottles in the room. I think every hotel should provide free bottled water.
- Free WiFi (Speed ~ 2 mbit/s download)

title: Good budget choice for location
text: We usually stay at the W in SoHo, however our trip was so fast we opted for a budget hotel instead.  While not right in the heart of SoHo, it was about a 20 minute walk to the main shopping area of Soho.  Our room was clean and the service was as good as a four star hotel.

title: Tremendous Service, Lovely Room
text: Such a pleasant and courteous staff not only accommodated my mother and sister's last-minute reservation (after their horror experience at Blue Moon Hotel in the Lower East Side - AVOID), but they also were able to provide a room fitting my mother's requests. They were just so wonderful and amiable - everything you could hope for from a hotel staff, especially in comparison to what we dealt with earlier.

title: This is a Good budget conscious choice
text:
This is a clean hotel in a happening neighborhood.  Nothing fancy.  This is pretty far west so if you plan on walking to sites on the east side like the Brooklyn Bridge or the South Street Seaport, you need sneakers.  The employees at the desk were very polite and helpful.

right now there is construction going on at the building next door.  If you are out touring all day it doesn't matter.

I would stay again.

title: Bom hotel
text: Bom hotel, bem localizado, quartos confortáveis e de tamanho razoável. A uma quadra de metro, com restaurantes, lojas a pequena distancia. O café da manha é fácil de achar em locais próximos. Sugiro o Chobani.

title: Construction Next Door
text: The hotel is nice and the staff was very friendly.  It is located a bit away from the high traffic areas (although subway access is farily close), so once the construction next door is completed, there should be some solitude to be had.  In the mean time, you should expect some construction noise throughout the day and consistent noise each time a car passes over the metal plates on the street out front.  The project does not appear to be near completion within the next few months.  To help along those lines, they did provide ear plugs at check in.  The rooms were good size, fairly clean and had been recently updated.  The mattresses and linens were fairly new and the pillows were above average.  The bathroom was smaller in size and lacked adequate counter space.  That said, it was updated with new tile and fixtures.  The on site restaurant has an outdoor eating area and attentive staff.  However, the quality of the food did not meet our expectations for the price point.  They do offer discounted parking but the garage they use is a few blocks away, so the valet may be the better option for some.  The bottom line is a decent hotel with an associated reasonable price point.

title: Construction!
text:
I made my reservation 30 mins before arriving and they did not have my room type available.  Then with the last room left they placed me next to a construction zone with a work zone right outside my window.  I'm gold spg and they could not find me another room in the area.  I've been on hold with customer service for almost 30 mins. They can't do anything to help here and I have a meeting first thing in the am. 

Epic fail.

title: Bien situé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé dans le quartier de Soho, à proximité de Washington Square. Proche de stations de métro. 
Confortable, très propre ; eau, café et produits de toilette dans les chambres, renouvelés chaque jour. Personnel sympathique et accueil chaleureux.
Il y a certes des travaux en ce moment dans le bâtiment voisin mais la gêne est minimale ; elle nous a permis de commencer nos journées tôt - point plutôt positif quand on veut faire un maximum de choses en quelques jours seulement.

title: lovely location, nice rooms
text: This hotel offers easy access to Greenwich Village and Soho, but is off-the-beaten-path enough to offer some rare solitude (well, except for the construction). The staff couldn't be nicer, the rooms are spacious by NYC standards, and good restaurants surround this hotel.

title: Nickel !!
text:
Hôtel situé dans le quartier de soho 
Les chambre sont de taille moyenne mais pour NY elle sont déjà grande !
Lit a l'américaine ! Immense on s'y perd !
À proximité plein de petit Resto pour le petit déjeuner 
Bouche de métro à proximité 
Très bon rapport qualité prix!

title: Excelente Localização!!!!
text: Primeira vez que fui a NY, minha unica exigência:  Ficar em Manhattan. Minha surpresa foi descobrir esse hotel que é uma delicia, em uma localização privilegiada (muito próximo do metro, starbucks, e têm várias opções de comidinhas perto)!! O atendimento é bom, mas tivemos um probleminha no final da estadia! Achei no geral nota 9!!! Ah...no quarto tem cafézinho e chá a vontade!!!

title: マンハッタンの中ではコスパよい日も多いホテル
text:
ウォールストリートやソーホー、ハイレーンあたり予定が多い場合には、使いやすいホテル。
ホテル代が高いマンハッタンの中にしては値段も安めと言えます。
部屋は狭いですが、清潔でベッドマットレスも快適でした。

title: マンハッタンの中ではコスパよい日も多いホテル
text:
ウォールストリートやソーホー、ハイレーンあたり予定が多い場合には、使いやすいホテル。
ホテル代が高いマンハッタンの中にしては値段も安めと言えます。
部屋は狭いですが、清潔でベッドマットレスも快適でした。

title: Decent room sizes for NYC & great view!
text: This is a great hotel if you want something basic yet comfortable, in a decently good location and very reasonably priced. I was lucky enough on arrival to get an upgrade to a higher floor which had a great view of the city. Something I did not get to enjoy in my last 2 visits to NYC so it was definitely a highlight of my hotel stay! The bathroom looked fairly newly renovated which was a nice touch as properties in NYC can look dated fairly quickly. The staff at this hotel were attentive and always greet you with a smile as you leave and return each day. The only complaint I have about this hotel is the air-conditioner and the loud sound it made. If the hotel can address this issue and keep everything in good working order, then it will still be a very good hotel for any visitor of NYC. The hotel is close to 2 subway stations which is a definite plus!

title: 場所が良く、NYのホテル料金にしては高評価
text:
JFKからAir Trainとsubwayで移動。
Air Trainは＄5、subwayは一律＄2.75。空港からはそのまま Air Trainに乗り、subwayに乗り換える所で双方の料金を払います。券売機で＄1でプリペイドカードを作り(この＄1は返金されません)、乗る度にチャージします。支払いは現金でもカードでも出来ますが、表示された以外の金額をチャージしたいときはコインのみ。窓口では現金のみ中途半端な金額のチャージが出来ます。カードの残金は返金されません。
深夜だったため、本数が少なくハワードビーチで結構待ちました。A trainに乗り、Fulton駅で乗り換える予定でしたが、深夜はかなり途中駅をスキップし、気が付いたときには乗換駅を過ぎてしまい、結局 W4 st Wash sq 駅で降り、そこからタクシーで行きました、＄7。最寄り駅はHouston st.と思っていたのですが、Spring st.駅からも近いので、乗換無しでA trainのSpring st.駅を利用する方が便利と思います。しかし、週末は Spring st.駅は、スキップされるので、週末  ヤンキース観戦のときは  W4 st Wash sq 駅を、空港へ向かうときはCanal st  駅を利用しました。
どの駅も徒歩圏内です。
マンハッタンから遠いように感じるかもしれませんが、CHELSEA MARKETや自由の女神クルーズ乗り場にも近く、周りにはお洒落なバー、24時間営業のスーパー(そこでビールとお寿司と枝豆、つまみを買って、イートインスペースで食べました。面白い経験でした！ちなみにお部屋には冷蔵庫がありません)などあり、便利です。空港寄りなこともタクシー利用者にはよいと思います。フロントの方も親切で地下鉄の乗換など詳しく教えてくれました(英語)。
広いとは言えませんが、昼間観光をして寝るだけと思えば清潔感あり、ホテル価格の高いNYにしてはまあまあと思います。by Sheratonは全く関係なく感じますが(笑)。高層階をリクエストすれば、景色も良いと思います。私たちは2階でしたので、コンクリートの壁越しでした、到着が深夜でしたので、交渉する気力がありませんでしたが、連夜ホテルに帰って寝る、でしたので特に不満はありません。

title: Bring Your Ear Plugs!
text: The staff is very friendly and so helpful.  Bring your ear plugs for morning construction, afternoon slamming of doors and late night zombie bands in the warehouses across the street.  The construction starts at daybreak  with loud bagging of hammers on metal and continues throughout the day. About noon, doors start slamming consistently for a couple of hours.  We were only in our room one afternoon in a week's visit, so I am not sure if this happens daily.  The warehouses are rented by bands and play late into the night and can be heard in the rooms even on the opposite side of the hotel.  The location is great.  Cheers!

title: Construction zone
text:
If you want to sleep past 7.00am do not stay here whilst construction is going on next door, Despite ear plugs, fan, and tv on the noise is deafening.
Apart from that the hotel is ok, certainly nothing to write home about.

title: Bad rooms,  weird bar,  nice staff
text: I travel to New York at least once a month for business. I've stayed in many hotels at this brand level and frankly... the hotel is just not that great. Elevators are slow, the rooms are small and very dark, lobby is really small, and the bar/restaurant is like a side car. There are lots of other hotels in this price point that would be a more comfortable stay. Fine if you are going to spend very very VERY little time in the room.  But, when I travel for business, i often need work time either in the room or lobby- and it just was not pleasant. Location is great if you need to be in Soho.

title: Everything but the personell and location wrong
text: The room is HORRIBLE. They say its a nonsmoking hotel, but the rooms stink of old smoking rooms. The aircondition is so loud you can not hear the TV and the room is so small you can not fit your suitcase anywhere. Its not been painted in a long time and its just bad in so many ways. We booked it thru Hotels.com and prepaid for 4 nights but left after one night.

title: Good hotel, construction noise is an issue
text: Good hotel, very well located. However construction goes on through the day, and so best would be to use this as a base to explore the city or leave for work. Rooms are small but comfortable. Tiny bar/restaurant, but the location more than makes up for it.

title: Solid hotel, some construction noises
text: The hotel is clean, well furnished. Definitely caters to business travelers more, in my opinion. The water pressure is super strong and the shower give you a good exfoliation. I don't mind it but my wife finds is too strong. There is a coffee machine in the room (important to me!). The bed is not too hard and not soft, just right. The climate control could use an upgrade. It works fine but has a variance of a couple of degrees and is a little bit noisy. There is construction outside that will last until the end of 2015. The noise is from 7am to 4pm weekdays. Did not bother us but be aware.

title: Good Hotel for the Price, but beware of construction
text:
There is construction going around the hotel right now so be careful on what room you get. I had a room facing the back, which was relatively quiet, but my friends that had rooms facing the front and the side experienced a lot of noise. There were earbuds in these rooms to help you sleep, but the construction can be loud. 

The rooms are actually pretty clean, good size and comfortable. While the hotel is not in the middle of Soho, there is a lot within walking distance, so location was pretty good.

title: Spent half the trip waiting for the elevator!
text: The staff at this location is wonderful. They were friendly and happy to make suggestions. The room was small but clean. The only downside of this hotel was the elevator. We ended up using the stairs ( despite being on the 11th floor) on the way down most of the time because the wait typically exceeded 10-15 min. Once the elevator situation is solved this will be a great value.

title: Not bad
text: Not a bad place to stay to explore SoHo and downtown. Rooms were very clean despite being in need of a fresh coat of paint. My only real conplaint is that the Subway lines surrounding the hotel are not stops for the majority of trains. I would stay again.

title: удобный отель для путешествий
text:
В целом отель понравился, но есть одно но) небольшой номер и мало места для вещей. Если путешествовать в холодное время года и останавливаться более чем на несколько дней, хранение вещей становится проблемой, что собственно получилось у нас
Очень приветливый персонал, дополнительно заряжал положительными эмоциями))
Понравилось расположение, достаточно тихо, но недалеко до основных туристических потоков.

title: Excellent economy hotel in Soho!
text:
We are an SPG member and know the Starwood hotels well.  Four Points is the economy arm of Sheraton so expectations should be kept in context.

This hotel is in a great downtown location, very convenient to the 1 and C-E lines.  Staff were super friendly and helpful.  Our room was indeed small but very clean.  The A/C was rather loud and we had trouble getting it to reset to a higher temp (the default is 71 degrees) so we just left it off at night which worked fine for us.

There is a major building under construction next door.  Noise starts at about 7am and is really loud by 8am.  

We asked if we could be moved to a higher floor, farther away from the noise, and they were able to accommodate, and then some.  We were moved from a 5th floor to a 20th floor room.  Wow!!  

For the price, this hotel was terrific.  We would definitely stay again.

title: Comfortable and clean
text: The hotel staff were extremely lovely- always greeting you on your way in. The location is ok. Close to a subway station (though not the best station- good to catch then transfer as many trains don't stop at this one) and not too far to walk into the heart of soho. It does feel a little out of the way at night. (I usually like a place closer to a variety of cafes and restaurants.). The room was very clean and comfortable, but very small and could definitely do with an update (old paint and furniture, a VERY old and loud aircon system on the floor).  There is a lot of construction going on next door but thankfully we were on a higher level so the noise didn't bother us. Overall we enjoyed our stay as the price was good- especially for New York!

title: Im Prinzip super, aber Riesenbaustelle daneben
text:
Das Hotel ist eigentlich super - Top Lage, neue, saubere, aber New-York-typische kleine Zimmer. Frühstück so lala, Service top!

ABER:....Neben dem Hotel ist gerade eine Riesenbaustelle - und das heißt in NYC 24/7 Lärm und Terror. Wer das ignoriert - alles gut.

title: Superlage aber klein.
text: Die Lage im SoHo ist wirklich genial, man kann in Downtown fast überall zu Fuss, und die Subway ist um die Ecke. Leider wird nebenan gebaut, und der Baulärm fängt morgens um 7 Uhr an, nicht um 8 wie auf Hotelseite beschrieben wird. Die Fenster sind schlecht isoliert, man kann nicht unterscheiden ob Fenster zu oder offen sind, man hört die Autos, Feuerwehr und Ambulanzen aber vor allen Dingen die Baulärm. Wie üblich in NYC, sind die Zimmertüren auch nicht isoliert, also man hört vom Gang fast alles. Es hilft nur Ohrstöpseln zu tragen, die finder man günstig überall in den Drogerieläden. Zimmer sind etwas grösser als normal, Betten gross und gut, Bäder sauber. Weil ich in meinem Bett ein langes, schwarzes Haar gefunden habe, kann ich die Sauberkeit nicht sehr hoch werten. Personal am Empfang ist sehr bemüht und freundlich. Terrasse neben Eingang kann man wegen Baustelle nicht geniessen. Lobby ist sehr klein, den engen Fitnessraum im Keller haben wir nicht getestet. Es gibt keine Dachterrasse.

title: Perfect Location and Lovely Staff
text:
My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel in Soho from June 22 to June 26, 2015. 

The location-The hotel was a 34-40 minute ride from La Guardia airport and located on Charlton Street just north of Hudson. The hotel is within walking distance of most things you would want to see in Tribeca, Chelsea and Soho. The High Line, Meatpacking district, Chelsea Market, Freedom Tower etc etc etc are all a 20 to 30 minute walk away. The hotel is also very close to many restaurants and bars. 

The facilities-Like most NYC hotels, the rooms here are small. They are however well appointed. Beds are comfortable, bathrooms are renovated and the cleaning staff does a wonderful job of keeping everything looking great. The only downside is the air conditioner is super loud. I suggest ear plugs. 

The Staff-This is the friendliest hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff were great. Yang and Brian at the front desk were super helpful, always greeting people and providing answers to any questions. I cannot stress enough how kind, warm and welcoming they were. They seemed to be able to handle the pressure of people showing up early for reservations and people checking out all at the same time.

title: Fine hotel good location but LOUD!
text: Hotel is fine and like most other Four Points. Staff friendly and helpful BUT -   You need to check the "Announcements" on Starwood's site carefully (only on SPG.com not on the FourPoints site).  This hotel states construction next door may cause noise starting at 8am.  That would have been ok but it actually started at 6:30am.  They left earplugs in the rooms but didn't mention the noise when we checked in, so we didn't sleep well here at all.  I'd avoid this hotel until the construction is done or unless you are going to be up early anyway.

title: Good, quiet hotel in NYC
text: I enjoyed the location of this hotel, as SoHo is much more quiet then most of the city.  It is surrounded by great restaurants, and good subways lines are very close by.  Front desk staff were quick and made the check-in easy.  Rooms were a normal size for NYC, and the bathrooms looked recently renovated which was nice.  Gym was definitely small, but had what was needed.  Downstairs also has vending machines, which took apple pay which was nice if you didn't have cash.  Overall a good stay here.

title: Sentralt, Hyggelig, Supert!
text: Fantastisk hyggelige og hjelpsom betjening. Det gjelder for både de i resepsjonen og rengjørerne + de i baren og i restauranten. Fikk feil rom første natta, men de visste ikke hva godt de skulle gjøre for oss grunnet dette. Fikk gratis mat, gratis drinker i baren m.m. Sentralt i SoHo. Noen minutter til utallige restauranter, t-bane og ikke minst shopping. Gleder meg allerede til å dra tilbake dit!

title: Good location
text: This hotel served its purpose. Stayed here on my birthday after a delicious meal in Soho. The hotel itself is small but very convenient location. The front desk attention was very good as well and the whole process was smooth.  There was lots of good coffee places in the morning to choose from and overall a great stay.

title: Avoid this place if you want to sleep past 6:30am
text: My worst experience ever with a Starwood hotel. And I stay in them a lot. Shoddy old furnishings, grimy dirt in corners of the room. But what made me physically ill from sleep depravation was the following: Right next to this tiny hotel is a big put where major construction is underway. The noise is deafening and begins at 6:30 am. One night just when I thought I would have quiet in the evening after a long day of meetings, the company that occupied the building directly across the street opened the first floor garage doors and blasted music into the street that echoed into my room on a high floor. Also inconvenient was that one of the two elevators was broken the whole time and so waits were long, tho the sign by it said repairs would be done in May. the staff never thought to change the sign.

title: Bon choix !!
text: Pour mon 1er voyage à New-York nous avons choisi cette hôtel part hasard et nous n'avons pas été déçu à proximité d'une bouche de métro chambre correct et Tres bon accueil, bien situé et rapport qualité prix correct je le recommande sans soucie

title: Carino
text: Ho alloggiato per due notti. L'hotel é carino e in una buona posizione vicino al meatpacking district e soho. Unica nota negativa: il Wi-Fi andava molto male in camera (anzi non andava x niente se non in bagno) prendeva bene solo nella hall e la zona é parecchio rumorosa.

title: Good location and Tiny Rooms
text: The hotel is well located. Is a couple of block from good restaurants and shopping area. The rooms And bathrooms are tiny. Only one elevator was available on aproximatelly 17 floors building . The service was good.

title: ベターロケーション
text: ソーホーという言葉は知っていましたが、泊まって初めてこんな楽しい場所だと知りました。飲食店には事欠かず、ジャズクラブありラーメン屋あり。これらはどっちかというとビレッジかも知れませんが、十分徒歩圏内。深夜まで遊んで帰ると静か。周囲も安心でいうことありませんでした。部屋は狭すぎず、眺望も合格。タイムズスクエアよりこっちが好きです。

title: Godt hotel !!
text:
Til nu det bedste hotel vi har boet på i NYC. Både pris og beliggenhed er i orden.
Hotellet er ikke stort men rart og frem for alt rent,pæne værelser og flot badeværelse.
Det er et godt område at bo i,ikke langt fra alt det sjove. Shopping,restauranter,seværdigheder. Anbefales gerne.

title: Four points sheraton soho
text: This hotel is nice and clean. VERY SMALL ROOMS THOUGH. Walls are thin as well .  Elevator broke a lot when we were there. People had to wAlk up stairs.  Ugghhhh .  Close to subwAy. Nice to keep our luggage after check out though so we could still sight see before heading to AIRPORT.

title: A great base
text:
We have now stayed at Four Points Soho twice with our family as it is a great base for good restaurants, shopping and convenient travel on the subway.
Rooms are clean, tidy and obviously compact for families but you spend so much time outside the Hotel that it really isn't a big deal.
Staff are always professional and extremely helpful and we would have no hesitation in booking this Hotel for future visits to the City.

title: Excellent weekend
text: This is a great hotel for a trip to NY. The room was terrific, bed very comfortable. There are a lot of normal NY issues like construction, street noise, small lobby, etc. so if you want massive lobby, huge room, whatever get out your wallet and stay somewhere else. But if you want less than a block to the 1 subway, which stops at 42nd street and also by the WTC, nice little restaurant attached (San Marino), very friendly staff, little things like lots of outlets for charging stuff on your desk in the room, bottled water... this is the right place. I'm an SPG member and I think this one's a winner, we easily did 3 shows in 2 days from here. Competition for affordable hotels in the city is really tough, but they have done a great job with 4 Points Manhattan Soho.

title: Great Place ruined by Room Service
text: It's a very nice place to stay ~ clean, neat with very comfortable beds. It's a bit pricey and it's worth it just don't get take advantage of. We live close by in NJ across the river so we usually just go home when we are done with the city. This time for Spring Break my young daughter wanted to stay. I found this hotel online with decent reviews and it was ok price wise for the area. We travel a lot and when we go away we sometimes order room service. She asked for room service and we agreed since it was a special stay. Well 2 pancakes, an orange juice and a tea went from about $20 to over $45. $25 of the bill were for service charges. I had to call and question the breakdown after my husband had paid for it The best part is that my daughter gave the service boy a $5 tip when he had already received $6 on the tab so he made $11 on $20 pancakes. Next time I think I will stick with Marriott which is where we usually stay. At least they don't extort you. By the way, most of the staff was very nice and helpful. Of course the was one front desk person that was on her cell phone texting the whole time while the phones were constantly ringing. She then stated that she was there by herself.

title: PERFECT LOCATION
text: The hotel is in a GREAT location and the staff was wonderful! The room was clean and small (but probably average for NY). We did not use any of their dining services so no comment on that. We were on the 2nd floor so the elevator repair was not an issue for us. Overall - a great stay!

title: Superbly located, clean with comfortable beds
text:
The hotel is conveniently located in the SoHo area of NY, great shops and restaurants being located just a 5 minute walk away, with the metro stations close by too. (line 1 - Houston is just around the corner).  
The hotel beds are fantastic and the bathrooms modern and clean. Just be aware that the hotel is located next to a construction site, which is noisy. The room a friend of mine was in (room 808) was noisy due to the construction going on.  The room my daughter and I shared was fine (Room 1602); we were not bothered by the noise.  If you can avoid a room on the construction-site side you’ll be fine. 

I found the staff at reception really helpful and friendly – a particular big thanks to Brian for keeping an eye on my daughter to ensure all was OK with the car I had ordered to take her to the airport.

title: Not Sheraton Quality
text: We were in town from Wednesday to Saturday.  This is a relatively small hotel, with only one bank of elevators - two elevators total.   One of them as out of commission the whole time; the other was not working over half the time.  Our room was on the 8th floor; the hotel has 21 floors.  Had to walk it several times.  Staff was great, restaurant was very good, and the room was small and dated.

title: Hotel com excelente localização!
text: Tive cerca de 15 dias em NY e optei por ficar nesta zona que está com uma movida interessante. Zona do Jazz e dos bares contemporâneos tem imensos cafés e lojas ao redor. Ficámos no ultimo andar com uma vista fabulosa para Manhattan com a nova torre Freedom mesmo em frente! O pessoal do hotel não é muito atencioso e os quartos são pequenos, mas a localização e todos os serviços que prestam merecem esta nota.

title: Clean comfortable accomodation
text: Stayed here on a Saturday night while visiting friends. Check in was fast, one of their elevators was broken for repairs but that was not a problem. I got a small corner room on the 11th floor. The room was small but well laid out, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was modern and everything was very clean. The rooms are cramped together in the hallways so you can hear when other guests doors open and close, but I guess that's part of the NYC Hotel experience. I really liked that we had to use our key cards to get into the hotel after hours, and the night staff make sure we showed our room keys when we got to the lobby as well. Made me feel extra safe as a solo female guest.

title: Das einzig Gute ist die Lage
text: Die zwei Punkte gibt es nur für die Lage. Das Hotel ist extrem laut- auch für NY. Bauarbeiten auf beiden Seiten, Klimaanlagen, vom Nachbarhaus. Aus meinem Fenster konnte ich ca. 7 Meter gucken, dann kam eine Wand. Ich fragte nach einem ruhigeren Zimmer, bekam dann auch ein neues, das noch lauter war, da es ein Stockwerk tiefer lag und damit näher an der Baustelle. Dabei ist auf wundersame Weise mein Handyladekabel abhanden gekommen. Zum Glück gibt es gut zu Fuß zu erreichende Cafés, da der Frühstücksraum max einem 3 Sterne Standard entspricht

title: Boa localização!
text: Pertinho da Times Square, este hotel é um achado. Os quartos são super limpos e aconchegantes e o custo benefício é excelente considerando os preços exorbitantes da hospedagem em New York. De lá você pode ir a pé para vários pontos turísticos, inclusive para o Rockfeller Center.

title: Friendly staff, well located
text: Stayed for business in April 2015. Great staff (particularly Leon), decent Italian (San Marinesse) restaurant downstairs and well located for Chinatown, Little Italy, Bowery and the rest of Manhattan. Recommend.

title: Not bad
text: Our room was decent and cleanly. The bathroom shower was a little faulty but nothing too major. The toilet paper roll did constantly fall off which was a little bit of an annoyance but again, nothing too intense. The service was nice and polite. Ordered a tomato, mozzarella, and basil sandwich for dinner one of the nights from room service and it was a bit mediocre, not exactly worth the seven or eight dollars I paid for it. Other than a few minor things here and there we were pleased by our stay. It is in a good location with easy access to the Subway stations and not a bad walking distance to Little Italy! (yum)

title: Good option in Soho
text:
As we were travelling with a 17 month old baby we were keen for a hotel option which allowed us to have two separate rooms within a reasonable budget (given the premium on square footage in Manhattan hotels) and the Four Points seemed to offer a feasible option. The location is great, close to the beating heart of Soho but down a quiet side street: we pulled up quite late but check in was easy enough (albeit they had forgotten to put up the travel cot, despite our having reminded them the night before, and could not send one up for fifteen minutes) and we were sent up to our suite on the top floor.
Considering it was reasonably priced for a suite we had not been expecting much but were pleasantly surprised, especially when drawing the blinds in the morning: the suite had massive windows with great views over Manhattan. The bedroom and living room were both of decent sizes for New York and we were able to put our baby down to sleep in the living room every night and have some quiet time in the evening to ourselves. Wifi was also free and good (multiple devices supported without any problems). One slight niggle was the air conditioning/heating which was a bit patchy: it worked but, by design, allowed the rooms to get relatively chilly before kicking (noisily) back into action at random points in the night to heat the room up before switching off again to start the process once more. Also as a note the door separating the two rooms was not great.
All in all however a good budget conscious option for someone needing a bit of extra space in Manhattan, providing a quiet base from which to explore the bustle of Soho with the unexpected wow factor of some spectacular views.

title: Ideal gelegen.
text:
Das Hotel liegt ideal. Nur wenige Minuten von der Subway Station Houston in unmittelbarer Naehe von zahlreichen Bars, Restaurants und kleinen Geschaeften mitten in SoHo. Unser Zimmer war sehr geraeumig (erhielten allerdings auch netterweise ein Upgrade), modern eingerichtet und sauber. Toller Blick ueber New York. Das Personal war stets sehr freundlich und sehr hilfsbereit. Trotz der kalten Temperaturen im Februar war es im Zimmer nie kalt. Die Heizung hat gut funktioniert.
Gutes Preis-/Leistungsverhaeltnis. Kann das Hotel sehr empfehlen.

title: Decent but not remarkable
text:
This was my first time staying in a hotel in New York, so I can only compare it to hotels in other cities, which I completely realize is not a fair comparison given the constraints of NYC. But regardless, the stay was pretty good, but nothing spectacular. When checking in I was told I was in the hotels' "luxurious and spacious corner suite", but it was anything but spacious. The room just barely fit 2 queen beds with hardly any space to walk around. But yeah, I understand that is the norm in NY.

Other that that, the heater was ridiculously noisy. We had to have it on because it was cold outside, but it sounded like a train was in our room whenever it turned on. Luckily, I'm a pretty heavy sleeper but it really disturbed my mom to the point where she turned it off in the middle of the night, but then we both froze.

The toilet was also hard at flushing. We would have to hold the handle down for multiple seconds and even then, it barely flushed all the way.

There was also construction going on during our stay -- so if you are a light sleeper, I'd recommend trying to find out if the construction is complete.

The hotel was in a great location for this particular business trip, so that outweighed most of the negatives. The bed was super comfortable (probably better than my own at home) so I had a great night sleep even with all the noise from the heater and construction. The staff was super friendly and helpful with our questions. Overall solid stay.

title: Muy buena ubicación y atención
text:
La ubicación es muy buena, al lado del Soho con estación de subte cerca y muchos lugares donde cenar alrededor.
Las habitaciones son chicas, pero en Manhattan es generalmente así!
Muy limpias y funcionales con agua, te y café de cortesía. El personal muy amable

title: Very Good
text:
Comfortable and well located this hotel has helpful and kind staff. 
The rooms are not large but has enough space for a couple without a lot of luggage. 
The neighborhood has plenty of bars and nightclubs and restaurants.

title: Perfectly comfortable
text:
I stayed here for 1 night on business.  Location was perfect for walking around Soho & Tribeca, close to restaurants, shopping, and 25 min walk to 9/11 Museum.  Room and bathroom were very clean, comfortable bedding, and all amenities I needed for a brief stay.  Room had a king size bed and was definitely on the larger side of NYC hotel rooms.  Free wifi in the room was super fast.
Hotel itself was relatively quiet on a Sunday night.  My air conditioner in my room could probably use a tune-up since it rattled a lot, as did the window which didn't quite seem to latch all the way, but by no means more than a slight inconvenience.
Reception staff was super helpful and friendly, in particular Leon who was quick with a recommendation and tips on the area- greeted me by name whenever I went through the lobby.

Great restaraunt Westville half a block away which was convenient, and recommend it if you're dining alone since it seemed quite popular with single diners reading.

Would definitely stay here again.

title: Clean hotel tucked away from the busy Manhattan streets
text:
I stayed at this hotel due its location between the Financial District and the Village to attend business meetings.  I stayed in a deluxe standard room on the 20th floor.  The room was smaller than what I am used to, but it is Manhattan where space is a premium, thus it is to be expected.  The room was clean and comfortable.  Hotel noise was a minimum, however, the was plenty of outside noises (emergency vehicle sirens, construction, traffic) throughout the night.  Although this is the city that never sleeps so on some level it is to be expected and tolerated.  If you appreciate a quiet night's rest, I would recommend bringing along some ear plugs.

I ordered room service while I was at the hotel.  The food was delivered promptly and at the correct temperatures (hot foods hot and cold foods cold).   This implies that the food wasn't sitting around until someone to found time to deliver it.  This is greatly appreciate after a long day of travel.
 
The staff at this hotel were friendly and helpful.  Leon and Nick were great employees to interact with.  Both were very helpful, whether it was obtaining additional items for in-room coffee or schedule car services to my meetings. There wasn't a moment of hesitation, as they were putting forth excellent customer service.  I find that it is not always the hotel property I will book repeat stays at a hotel property.  Instead it is how comfortable the hotel staff can make a guest feel.

title: Great location to explore Greenwich Village!
text: We stayed here for five nights. Service was very nice. We good a room at the 19th floor. The room was large, with a pretty good-looking bathroom and breathtaking views of the One World building and some of the skyline of southern Manhattan. The location of the hotel is really good, very close to the Financial District, in the midst of Greenwich Village and very close to the Houston St. subway station. Five minutes by subway of Times Square and ten minutes away from Central Park.

title: Nice Surprise in Happening Area
text: If you are looking for a clean, inexpensive hotel in Soho, NYC then the Four Points Sheraton fits your bill.  Beds were super comfortable, room service was fast and offered really tasty 3 meals a day and staff was friendly and attentive.  Walk 2 blocks and you are in the heart of everything from Soho, to the Village to the WTC Memorial.  Holland Tunnel traffic and noise were about the only negatives but put the fan on and you're in white noise heaven.  No reason to pay zillions elsewhere in the area when all you need is a comfy bed to sleep in and a good breakfast to rev your engines for a day in New York.

title: Two Day Stay
text:
I recently traveled to NYC for a two day business trip.  I used SPG points for two nights at the Four Points in SoHo , so cannot comment on the standard room rate.  

After a full day in midtown, I arrived at the hotel just before 5PM.  Check in was swift and friendly and the front desk person offered some dinner suggestions in the neighborhood. My room was on the 15th floor and had a northwest facing view. It was a king room and surprisingly maneuverable despite the limited floor space.  The bathroom was also full sized ( for a Manhattan hotel) and had a deep shower stall with a strong shower head. The bed was very comfortable and I slept well each night.  

The hotel itself is a narrow building and the hallways are small and tight. expect to hear every footfall and door slam if you are lounging in the morning hours when the maids are on the move.  The area it is located in is just below W. Houston and Varick.  I found it very convenient for taking the #1 train uptown for meetings and for walking to and from the Soho and Bowery area attractions.

I would certainly stay at this hotel again. Its proximity to the subway line made it very easy to make appointments during the day and to navigate around in the evening for dinner, drinks, and shopping.

title: Good value in NYC Soho
text: I travel to NYC for business frequently. The Four Points is always the best value for Starwood members in Soho. Close to lots of food choices. Friendly staff. In lobby bar. Coffee in room. Good internet. Room Service. Restaurant is a bit limited an could use a facelift. Bathrooms have small vanities with no place for cosmetics that they won't get wet from the sink. Small gym. Really slow elevators but floor accessible stairs. Close to subway.

title: Rooms good, Staff not friendly...
text:
Room was good for price and last minute booking, good space for NYC hotel and I have lots of stays in lower Manhattan hotels. Friend and I checked in very late and hadn't planned to stay in the city but cause of weather and time of night (2am) we decided it was safest. Got to hotel desk as a Platinum SPG member and front desk attendant was rude and didn't seem thrilled to be at work. 

I was also traveling with an ESA canine with papers. Was told immediately they don't allow dogs, told him I had needed paperwork etc... He wasn't very accommodating or friendly in this topic either although he knew he had to continue to check me in. 

Would I stay again? Maybe if I were stuck in a last min crunch again but never for a planned trip into city.

title: Excellent Hospitality
text:
I stopped by for directions after many other places were unhelpful. The gentleman at the front desk on March 12th was courteous enough to help me even though I was not a hotel guest. He was friendly and greeted me with a smile. His act of kindness should be recognized if not by this review then by management. 

I will recommend this Four Points to all my friends.

title: Great hotel!
text:
Cannot say enough great things about this hotel, stayed 3 nights recently and had such a good experience. The room was lovely, clean and the bed was very comfortable. Every member of staff we encountered was friendly and helpful and actually gave the impression they cared, which is rare these days! Special mention to Corey who went out his way to help us get a taxi when we left - much appreciated.

Located 2 blocks from the Houston St subway and with only 4 stops from Penn Station, it makes it accessible to all the tourist attractions.  However, it's also only a short walk to Bleeker and the high end shops of Soho in the opposite direction, so it really is in a perfect location to cover everyone's vacation needs!

I will return for sure!

title: Prima verblijf gehad!
text: Een prima verblijf gehad in dit hotel, we hadden een 'upgrade' gehad naar een hoekkamer wat een extra ruime kamer creëerde. We hadden uitzicht op het One World Trade Center en een deel van een leegstaand kantoor. De bedden waren erg goed. Het personeel was vriendelijk, maar niet te overdreven. We hebben een fijn verblijf gehad. Het bijbehorende restaurant is ook aan te raden, wij hebben daar goed gegeten.  Daarnaast is de ligging van het hotel uitstekend. De winkels zijn nog 5 a 10 minuten lopen en ook het metrostation is om de hoek. Vanaf hier is een directe verbinding naar Times Square en naar het One World Trade Center. Het enige nadeel aan ons verblijf was de geluidsoverlast in de avond (luide muziek) en ochtend (bouwplaats). Maar afgezien daarvan is het hotel een aanrader!

title: Small but efficient hotel; friendly staff!
text:
I'm a regular at this hotel - at one point, I lived out of their space for 6 months straight - and even though the staff have turned over, I commend management on keeping the mood friendly.  They were a big short-staffed when I checked in most recently, but the folks who did assist me were friendly and kind and talkative.  Plus, he offered to change my room for a quieter side of the building.  Big plus!

The gym is small, but if you go early enough it's not a problem to get the machine you want.  It's cold down there, though, so be prepared.  Breakfast is quick and pretty standard - the staff is ultra-nice too.  They've always let me sit there as long as I want, finishing my coffee.  

The rooms are pretty standard NYC size - meaning, yes they are small.  But there's room to hang your clothes and the desk lets me spread out.  I could use some more shelves in the bathrooms - there's never enough space to put all of my belongings. In general, I have no complaints about the space.

One caveat:  the elevators are a little wonky.  I did get taken for a random ride the last time I stayed.  On my way to breakfast, the elevator had a mind of its own, and we went to the bottom and back to the top a couple of times before it stopped to let me off.  Not sure what the story is there.

Overall, a decent place to stay in what i consider a great area of the city!

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: It may not have a lot of frills, but this is a great hotel to use as a base for a short trip to New York. It has pretty much everything you need or expect; restaurant, fitness centre, bar, etc. But what really makes it stand out are the price and the staff. The latter make the hotel feel like a small, family-run establishment. They are universally friendly and helpful. Finally, SoHo/Hudson Square is a vibrant, busy part if the city but without the crowds of midtown. Recommended .

title: Wonderful experience
text:
So I escape to NYC every now and then and I found that this property is really charming
The perk of this hotel is Corey, he solved issues that I got with my reservation prior to my arrival, helped me with all the details, absolutely amazing !!!
Got pasta for dinner, one of the best I had recently
Overall great stay

title: Noisy, noisy, noisy!
text:
Between the amateur drummer in the apartment next door who plays from morning to night and the construction that starts-- even on a Saturday morning at 7am--- forget about having a relaxing stay. 
I'm a Starwood hotel member and like to stay in the chain hotels wherever I go, but I'll NEVER be back to this one.

title: Excellent value for the price
text: I booked a Friday-night stay on Travelocity and got an exceptionally good price, I thought, for the location - $110 plus the usual assorted fees. I was "upgraded" upon check-in at no extra cost to a corner room on a higher floor (I had to take two queens rather than the one king requested: not a problem as I was traveling solo). Given the building's layout, I rather suspect that most rooms are corner rooms, so it probably isn't really an upgrade, but it's always nice to pretend, isn't it? The front-desk staff was very friendly. The room was quite big by NYC standards, I thought. And everything was very clean and modern. Great neighborhood and not too noisy. My only quibble would be with the two, very slow elevators.

title: 4 Points Sheraton SoHo A Great Value
text:
"Boutique" equals "small" in the hotel biz..But 4points Soho was clean, looked brand new, convenient, affordable & a great value if you want easy access to the Village, Soho or Little Italy. The staff, however, is not particularly familiar or up to speed on the neighborhoods; i.e.; recommended places to eat etc... So, without benefit of concierge service or local knowledge @ the front desk; research ahead of time will be invaluable for your trip. 
Our room was very nice, bathroom/shower small but amazing finishes! We did not get our City/Skyline view as booked, but the view downtown was OK in the AM...Free Wifi is not something you see everywhere & if we were to have business in the area, would certainly stay @ 4 points again!

title: " Very Attentive Staff"
text: I do a lot of traveling and I must say this trip was one of my most memorable so far to NY!!! The staff made me feel like I was the most important guest staying with them. From the moment I arrived at the hotel, I was given personal assistant.  I even received daily calls from  the Director of Housekeeping inquiring if there was anything that I needed. I plan on making this hotel my only destination for any future stays in NY!!!

title: Nice hotel but location is not really SoHo
text:
This hotel follows the same format as other new hotel properties in NYC ie. Holiday Inns and other Four Points properties. Mid-size in height and skinny, basic hotel chain. The room was clean and the front desk staff were helpful. 

Now this location is far west soho. It's only a short walk to the middle of Soho so its not a big deal and you have easy access to metro (A, C, E, 1, 2) trains. The property is in an area that is kind of industrial and lots of traffic because the Holland Tunnel is nearby. The hotel is near the Trump Soho property as well.

title: Don't Forget Anything Here
text: The stay was fine, but don't forget anything at this property. You can call and leave numerous messages for the housekeeping department, but they will never respond. This has completely changed my opinion of the stay.

title: the Front Desk Staff  is the Best !
text:
Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan SoHo Village,

the Staff here is one of the best in SPG !

they went above and beyond to make my stay Great !

The Outstanding Staff, & Location,make this property stand out !

if you are looking fo an great place to stay this is the place !

Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan SoHo Village,
66 Charlton Street, New York City, NY 10014

Amber DeLuca

title: Nice mid scale chain hotel
text: Despite being mid scale and part of a chain, this hotel comes with wonderful staff that make you feel as though you're staying in a 5* property.  The amenities are also great with complementary wi-fi and if you're looking to be within 5 mins of the best bars and restaurants that Manhattan has to offer then you're in the right area.  I stayed in the Penthouse (I could have moved into the Penthouse), it has everything you need, great coffee machine, well laid out living area, light and airy with wonderful floor to ceiling windows that offer spectacular views over the city. The only downside of being on the top floor is that you need to be prepared to wait (and stop at every floor) as there are only 2 lifts.

title: Ideal location
text:
I asked the question? where should i stay in New York? id stayed in the Broadway area previously so wanted something different.  yes obviously budget is key but i was thinking more towards location.  
Four Points hotel is situated ideally to explore the villages, in the South of Manhattan, Greenwich Village, Little Italy, China town and so on.  there's a Subway just around the corner so getting around is easy quick and convenient. 
the room we had was small but clean with complimentary tea, coffee and free wifi in the room. the staff were excellent and couldn't do enough i really have no complaints. they asked if they could help but were not pushy at all, so thanks to all.

title: Great location, friendly staff, perfect stay
text:
I was looking for a good value near Soho and the West village.  I could not be happier with the value we received.  Upon checking in we were upgraded to a corner room on the 29th floor.  The room as spacious for a NYC hotel room.  It was clean, quiet and the staff was very friendly and helpful. This was neither a fancy full service hotel nor did it feel like a cheap value place.
