It is really the perfect place if you want comfort and safety but not the night price.
The location is great too.  You are a five minute walk from the West village, a little farther to heart of 
Soho and a few more minute walk to china town.  For tourist or visitors not interested in midtown or the theater.  A great find and will return again with confidence .

title: A great place to stay for a short trip! Everything is at your footsteps! Location! Location! Location!
text:
We came up to see our son who is a sophomore in NYC. This property was our top pick because it was just steps from the 1 train which we would take to get to the Upper Westside (UWS) where our son is at school!

You could also walk around the the Village, which we did walking to Saint Lukes Place and checking out all of the cool townhouses on that street! The West Village is the place to be.

Now as for the room, well it was clean and had a full sized King bed not some scaled down version of it. The room was small by anywhere else in the US other than a select few cities like New York or San Francisco. 

The staff was most helpful when we were looking for a place to place our bags since our room was not ready yet and we wanted to go out and explore that part of the city.

Starwood Properties Never Disappoint!

title: Quick Trip with Friends
text: I planned a two night trip for NYC and we were trying to do a lot in a short amount of time.  We stayed here because we wanted to be in Soho.  This hotel was in a good location for our plans.  We walked to the West Village for dinner and an event at a local theatre.  The room was efficient and clean, bathroom was very clean and new.  Beds were quite comfortable and we had everything we needed.  Hotel staff were very pleasant and welcoming.  We spent most of our time out of the hotel but were comfortable while there.

title: Couple of quirks
text:
Pros:
The shower head and water pressure were unbelievably awesome!

Plenty of light in the bathroom.

Plenty of electrical outlets on the desk.

Friendly staff.

Cons:
The room was small, but I guess that's typical for NYC.  There was barely enough room for the small armless chair which was wedged between the bed and the wall.  Not very relaxing.

When I checked into the room I discovered the window was open by almost a half inch.  No amount of effort on my part could get it closed so I had to call for the maintence guy.  He showed up with a giant screwdriver and nevered the stuck sash into the fully closed position.  So not only was this an unresolved maitenance issue, housekeeping should have known about the window and reported it for repair before my arrival.

There was no open electrical outlet at the nightstand for my phone.

The bathtub drained slowly.  I view any hotel that allows this to occur as third-rate.  Certainly unexcusable for a Starwoods property.  Housekeeping would have known about that and should have reported it for repair before my arrival.

Even though I had arranged for a 4:00 PM late check out, there was a rap on my door about 1:30 while I was changing clothes.  It was the housekeeper wanting to know what time I was leaving.

title: Pleasant surprise
text: I booked three nights here using my spg free nights. Warm welcome by Jennifer on reception and we received an upgrade. Room was large by NYC standards and was clean and warm with the Empire State Building in the distance. Bottled water replenished every day which was great. Was perfect for a city visit when you're not spending a lot of time in a room but need somewhere in a good location, clean and warm. Could do with a little updating but didn't affect my stay.

title: Two times too many
text: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the past several years and have always had a good experience. However, the last two times, there were serious inconveniences (the most recent was an elevator not working for a significant period of time with no notice to guests). I missed an important meeting because of this. Ultimately, and after some trouble, I was refunded the charge. However, I will not be staying at this hotel again.

title: GOOD GOOD GOOD !!!! BUT.....!!!!
text:
Hello there...

we stayed in this hotel for 6 nights during new year time....It's deffo a great value, good location, the staffs are very nice. But just be careful when you are going your check out! double check your statement. In US they have this tendency to extra charge very easy specially for foreigner .....they happened for us 3 times. !! BE CAREFUL!
A part that this hotel it's perfect.

title: Great value, well located
text: I booked this hotel via Expedia for my husband's birthday night in the city. I paid $150, which is a deal. The exterior and immediate environs of this hotel are nothing to write home about, but it is well located to many subway lines and cool walking neighborhoods. We had drinks at Downing St bar and dinner at Mas (recommended). The front desk staff was super nice (very friendly and upgraded us to a corner room on the 18th fl when they found out about my hub's birthday) and the room was clean, comfortable, quiet and modern. Bed was super comfortable and the shower had good pressure. Great selection of movies. Overall a really good value if you don't care about a fancy lobby, etc.

title: Pleasant, pleasing and clean; convenient location.
text: Although I've stayed in NYC many times, (business, pleasure, former resident), this was my first stay at this hotel.  I couldn't have asked for more!  The front desk staff were friendly, courteous, professional and helpful.  They weren't stingy with their smiles, either.  The housekeeping staff also did an excellent job!  My room was very clean and smelled fresh! (No overpowering air freshened/chemical smells).  The bathroom was fully stocked with the usual amenities and clean.  The location is also very convenient.  The #1 train (subway) is just 1.5 blocks away and there are plenty of taxi's driving by on Varick Street.  I stayed in a single room, with a king bed, which was roomy, by New York standards and included a desk, with ergonomic-type chair, desk lamp, wifi, flat panel TV.  Night tables on both sides of the bed and on one side there was an upholstered chair and standing lamp, while over the bed were multiple small lamps.  The lighting allowed for either a bright room or softer light and the bathroom was also very well lit, (no issues applying make-up).  I would definitely recommend this hotel and would also stay here again.  I was very satisfied with every aspect of my stay.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: We stayed here from Dec 20 - Dec 27, 2014.  The hotel was well located in the SoHo/Lower Manhattan area.  We were always able to get a cab and the Metro is also close by.  The front desk personnel during our stay were very friendly and helpful as were the housekeeping, restaurant/bar and room service staff.  Our room was on the 17th floor and had a view of the Freedom Tower.  The room was clean and well appointed.  There was construction going on the building next door but we were not bothered by the noise (if you are a light sleeper in the morning you may want a room facing the street).  Our WiFi reception was great.  The only issue we had was there was no small fridge in the room, there is space for a small one under the desk.  We had to get ice everyday by taking the elevator to the only ice machine in the basement :(  If no fridge there should be ice machines on every second or third floor.  Over all we enjoyed our stay and I would recommend this hotel.

title: My Stay in NYC
text: I stayed at the Four Points Sheraton in early January.  I was with my daugter and two teen-age grandchildren.  The location of this hotel was perfect for our needs.  We walked to the subway, restaurants and my sons "home away from home".  The hotel was spotless.  The rooms are very small, bathroom tiny.  The beds are extremely comfortable.  The rooms are very, very loud, doors slamming all night long.  Did not find the staff overly friendly except for the women who cleaned our room and the maintenance man named Daniel.  The only person behind the desk that spoke to me was the man who checked me in the first night.  Other than that it was all a simple "HI".

title: Value for Money City Spot
text: This was a decent hotel in the city. There was nothing that good or really bad about it - truly an average experience. The rooms were quite small but clean and very comfortable. The shower and amenities within were surprisingly  good. The highlight of the hotel was an awesome receptionist by the name of Corey who made our stay pleasant and comfortable and was very accommodating. We got a very good deal and I would definitely say that we got our money's worth. Just don't expect too much - it doesn't have the splendour of an NYC high end hotel but still worth the stay.

title: Ottimo hotel , consiglio...
text:
...La camera con vista, merita molto! Noi avevamo la camera al 19esimo piano.
La stanza non è grande e il bagno è piuttosto piccolo. Per il resto tutto ok, buone finiture e letto molto confortevole.
Il personale alla reception è disponibile e cordiale. Non abbiamo provato il ristorante. Come location è a due passi dalla linea rossa , molto comoda sia per uptown che downtown.
Do' 5 stelle anche per il rapporto qualità/prezzo.

title: Moyen!
text:
Nous avons aimé son emplacement et la proximité des métros. Nous avons trouvé le personnel gentil et souriant. Les chambres sont confortables et propre. Par contre la tuyauterie au 8e étage est très très bruyante. Chaque fois qu'une chambre voisine prend sa douche ou encore utilise les toilettes un bruit fort bruyant sort des murs. Pas très reposant! Le wifi est gratuit.
Est-ce que nous y retournerons. Non! 

Attention voyageur 2015... Le bâtiment voisin est en construction. Nous avons eu le droit au marteau piqueur très tôt le matin.

title: Really tight space
text: Recently stayed here in a room with two double beds......very, very tight quarters along with an odd frosted glass bathroom door which doesn't provide as much privacy as one would hope.  Respectable place but be prepared for a tight squeeze.

title: A Melhor Relação Custo Benefício de NY
text: Hotel excelente localizado entre o SoHo e West Village, na melhor região de Nova York para quem quer fugir do roteiro turístico. O hotel está a poucos metros de uma estação de metro e a poucos minutos da Prince St., a mais badalada rua do SoHo. Quarto muito aconchegante e com bom espaço, com banheiro amplo e bem equipado. Cama e ducha excelentes. A equipe do hotel é muito atenciosa e eficiente. O Hotel é seguro e tem cofre com espaço para notebook.

title: Great customer service... Jasmine is the star!
text:
Stayed here for a business trip. The staff were great. They couldn't do enough to help us to make sure we had a great stay. Jasmine at the bar is fantastic. She made us feel welcome in the evenings and suggested new drinks and food to try on the menu.
The rooms are comfortable and big (for New York!). They are very clean and my room was changed and cleaned daily.
Will defiantly stay here again and recommend it to anyone who's looking for a hotel in New York.

title: Just what I expected
text:
so this was clean, a little expensive but that's whee it is.   All good to be honest.

It did what it said on the tin.

Room was clean and looked well looked after, free coffee, tea and water in the room was appreciated

title: Gets the Job Done, and Then Some
text: As a solo traveler, this is my favorite place to stay when in NY. The rooms are furnished and decorated with modern style, everything is spotless and clean, and all staff members (from front desk to housekeeping) are above and beyond friendly, more so than anywhere else that I've stayed in NY. There's also free wifi, reasonable incidentals deposit fees, a great fitness room, and a bed and pillows so comfortable, you'll find it hard to want to get out of it every morning. Close to subways and walking to restaurants, spas, salons, and shopping. I did encounter a number of issues, however, during my stay - more than what is acceptable for the price I paid. The 1st room I was assigned to had a cold draft (window hole?) coming from outside, so I was quickly and kindly assigned to another room, and upgraded. When I went to the fitness room, which looked untouched, the temperature was at 60 (freezing! felt colder than outside!) and the TV remote controls didn't work; a maintenance man quickly came to fix the problems with a smile. As I was getting ready to go out, the sink handle wouldn't turn. Again, someone came to fix it right away, though that took longer and, as a result, made me late for where I was going. At least the maintenance man was extra friendly and apologized for the problem! Finally, the business center printers weren't working, and while I was glad to be able to email the front desk agent to print my boarding pass, it would have been a stressful affair had he been busy. One last one: my clock radio wouldn't turn on and off with ease, after (again) a maintenance man came to check it out. So I just left it on the whole time, turning the volume on and off, instead of the power. Good for me; not so much for the hotel's energy costs. Hope they get those clocks fixed. What a wonderful place, a wonderful property, and above average staff. I can't say enough about the friendly, jovial staff. I hope that the management works on fixing some of the issues throughout the hotel so that the staff can shine at doing an even better job on customer service, instead of troubleshooting hotel upkeep issues that they probably have nothing to do with. Overall, a great experience for the price and location. I'll be happy to stay here again.

title: Excelente opción en NYC
text: El Hotel esta muy bien ubicado, a metros de la estación 1 y 2 y la E. A pocas cuadras del centro neurálgico del Soho. Las habitaciones son pequeñas como en casi todos los hoteles de la ciudad, pero si sos miembro de SPG podes acceder a un up Grade. Tiene café de cortesía. Las habitaciones y Baño  impecable. Excelente relación precio calidad. Volvería!

title: Excelente atención.
text: Es destacable la atención que resolvió absolutamente todas mis solicitudes e incluso me salvó de  tener que esperar 1 hora en el correo sugiriéndome otra alternativa para el trámite que necesitaba realizar. Las habitaciones son pequeñas pero funcionales y la ubicación es óptima. El precio que conseguí fue excelente, aunque tuve que pagar una noche extra para quedarme hasta tarde considerando que mi vuelo salía por la noche. Recomendado.

title: Close to Subway, Clean, but Everthing Small
text:
What's Good:  If you are going to be visiting Times Square, Penn Station, theatre district, NYU or anything on the route of the #1 train, this is very convenient; It is one block from the Uptown or Downtown #1 train, so traveling is not difficult, even in the rain as it is so close.  It also is close to Greenwich Village, where there are amazing small restaurants (see review of Vin et Fleurs), shops, clubs, and a plethora of everything great about he city.  Staff are very pleasant, attending, will do everything you need or explain nicely policies or why the elevator was broken, give directions about cab locations, extra towels, package delivery, and the repairman was up within 5 minutes to replace a toilet part to stop it from running). We did eat breakfast in the hotel restaurant, expensive but very good.  We had drinks at the bar:  the young man who served us (bartender) was excellent (the woman bartender the next day was NOT very friendly at all; we felt we were inconveniencing her).  The bar essentially is only 8 seats or so, tucked on the side of the lobby inside a glass wall/door.  Cute, but very small, although they could make specialty drinks.  

What's to be Considered:  the whole place is small, like  miniature for a New York Hotel:  it was very expensive, but I believe any hotel in NYC increases rates in December.  Lobby has 3 chairs, two elevators, a small check in desk; it can get crowded if three parties are checking out at the same time. There are 2 elevators (one was broken, and I heard another couple indicate that one was broken the last time they were staying there), so it is very slow to wait to go up to your room.  The room:  small; one-person bathroom, can't go by a person sitting in the chair at the desk to get around the bed.  Very clean, however, and linens were very luxurious and comfortable, each bed gets 4 pillows.  Rooms have room-darkening shades and it was quiet sleeping (no traffic noises).  Heat is loud and goes on and off to maintain the heat you set on thermostat, so to sleep with no noise you'll need to turn it off.  Shower had 3 units for use:  conditioner, shampoo, and bath gel, so you didn't have to use those little bottles.  Very small paper cups are available, as well as a hair dryer stored in a basket under very very small sink.  Room we had included 2 beds, a desk, and a standalone closet that holds maybe 8 clothes items.  There is a safe in the room, on bottom of closet but we did not use it.  I did go down to the small gym, and quality of the few pieces of equipment were very high quality, TV on wall, weights.  Wish I had that treadmill at home!  

I would stay here again if price was more realistic for the space of the room size, due to location and efficiency of staff.

title: Four Stars for Four Points Soho
text: My partner and are stayed here for Thanksgiving and found a new gem in lower Manhattan. Great location, not too crowded, easy walk to sightseeing, restaurants, bars and historic neighborhoods. Only complaint was construction next door (see recommendations for choosing a room below) and rooms could use a little touch up. Overall, great value (free coffee, wifi and bottled water in the room!), fantastic staff, fitness room on premises and decent sized rooms for Manhattan. Also, Kudos to the staff for their superb handling of a really drunk and extremely rude guest who happened to interrupt our check in with a uncalled-for profanity filled tirade. That sort of thing can happen anywhere, but they responded with grace and aplomb. We'll be back!

title: Beware of noise from construction next door.
text: The Four Points by Sheraton in Soho neighborhood of NYC is in a great neighborhood but has only two small elevators and one didn't work. The rooms and bathroom are very small. We had constant noise from the construction next door. The loby is extremely small and the restaurant is small. Nice people in the front desk but very expensive for what you get.

title: For what it is...good value
text:
The product is almost a 1 2 1 of the Four Points in Chelsea. Affordable rooms and a decent location. In all fairness, staff are friendly and helpful, within their means so anything that isn't perfect isn't their fault, its what they work with.
Pros: High floor and a decent sized room (I gather we were upgraded) Location, Location, its only a skip to the West Village and SoHo
Bathroom compact design, but usable....(not soundproof, your roommate will hear every fart, amplified!), 
CONs: there was construction going on next door and the noise from the power hammers at 7.00 am was enough to wake the dead (no info on hotel site, or on arrival) . The Gym is useless other than free weights.
Lamps over bed are ridiculous, and one has to get out of bed to turn them on or off. No lamps on side.
Might come again, but will do more homework next time.

title: No Frills, Budget Friendly Hotel in SoHo
text:
PROS:
For the price/location it was excellent! Rooms were small (but what can you expect from NYC), but clean! This location is right next to the subway. We did not use a single cab (other than to/from the airport) as the subway was sufficient enough,

CONS:
Unfortunately we got a room located in a crappy location (next to construction). We had to close our windows most of the time since the construction workers were literally in perfect view of our window (they could walk up if he wanted to). Be sure to request a room with a street view!

My biggest pet peeve was that although there were rooms available (checked online the night before and morning of), they were very stern on not letting you get in your room before "early check-in" time. Even to the point that they lied saying no rooms were available. We went on a red-eye flight, barely got any sleep, and sat in traffic for 2-hours. 

OVERALL:
I'd say this is a definite YES if you don't mind a no-frills hotel in SoHo (I'd rather spend my money doing activities/eating out rather than putting all my money in a hotel)! Just be sure that your arrival time is in the afternoon. If you could book the Marriott nearby at the same price, I'd definitely go for the Marriott though!

title: Off the beaten path
text: Tucked away from the main busy streets. Walk to tons of places to eat. Really quiet. No views. Small rooms. I'd rather stay at the Sheraton mid town but this is less busy.  Took forever to get a cab. Mid town always has cabs.

title: Good Hotel Great Location
text:
I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. From the moment I checked in the entire staff were very lovely. Christine was at the front desk and she always made a point of making sure I was happy. I had forgotten to specify an allergy room and they had this corrected within 20 minutes. Every time I entered or left the building I was greeted and checked on. They always asked if I was happy or needed anything.

The only thing I would say that needs attention is cleanliness. My table and couch had crumbs on them when I first entered the room, like they hadn't been vacuumed. The bathtub had mold around the caulking I didn't want to take a bath because it was so close to the edge of the tub. The walls in the bathroom were splattered with something resembling hard water or soap. 

I wasn't in my room much so I didn't really want to deal with the hassle of having to move rooms or such. This is the only thing that would prevent me from giving this hotel a 5 star rating.

The room was super small, but in this area of town that is kind of expected. I barely had room to turn around and I thank goodness we weren't in there very much.

The location is awesome and very central to everything we needed. I really enjoyd walking around the neighborhood and it was just a short taxi ride to all the sights and shopping I wanted.

I would definitely stay here again but I would want a better room.

title: tight squeeze in the room, but superb location
text:
I have stayed at this hotel about 5 times so far.  Having stayed at similar hotels in other areas of Manhattan, this one is,without doubt, the best value for money.  It's a sheraton four points so don't expect high end luxury.  What you will get is a nice, clean, well-serviced hotel with the perfect location.  The rooms are nice - pretty compact, but sufficient space for two people. The closet is a decent size, as is the bathroom.  The elevators are a little overworked and can sometimes take a while to arrive, but apart from that I have never had any problems or reasons to complain about this hotel.  Front desk/concierge service is always friendly and willing to offer advice about the city.

Location is the real beauty of this hotel.  Nestled amongst a combination of commercial, industrial and residential areas, the hotel is tucked away on a somewhat quiet street (as quiet as a street can be in Manhattan). It is a short walk (5 minutes) to the nearest subway line which will take you to Times Square, Central Park, Upper East/West side, Brooklyn, Grand Central Station and Penn Station among other places. It is easy walking to Soho, the Village and Tribeca.  A short walk or run to the river front and the walking/cycling paths which run along the river.  Going to a Broadway show?  No problem - 15 minute subway ride to the theatre district. Dozens of great restaurants and bars are at your doorstep - easily walkable.  Tons of fantastic shopping of all sorts - luxury boutiques, antiques, quirkier shops, and of course Canal Street. 

The best part for me is that coming back to the hotel provides an escape from the Times Square chaos and the crowds of people you have to fight in many areas of Manhattan.  It's often a welcome relief after a day spent amongst all that energy. It provides a respite and the chance to recharge before heading back out that evening or the next day.

title: Can't wait to come back here
text: This was our first trip to New York and our stay was made so much better by staying here.  The staff were wonderful - so friendly and helpful.  Brian and Jennifer on front desk were a delight.  Will definitely be staying here again next time.

title: Please Fix the Elevators
text:
Have stayed at this hotel many times, in fact, we stayed here the first week they were open, so have seen the hotel "brand new" and also in its current state (which is a bit shabbier).  

Pros:  

Location - this place is in a super location, right off the 1 line.  Next to Soho and the Village.  I love staying here for the location.

Price - for the money, this place usually offers good value as long as you understand what you are getting. 

Rooms - small, but generally clean.  They are starting to get a bit tired/worn, however, especially the bathrooms.

Cons:

Location - 7th avenue next to the Holland Tunnel is not the most attractive neighborhood.  Although the neighborhood has improved, it is pretty industrial.  That said, Soho is a few blocks away.  Because the neighborhood is "improving" expect construction.  

Appearance - When this place opened, it had a very modern and clean vibe.  Yes, it was a Four Points, but it was hip (in a way).  The lobby now is so cluttered with brochures, stickers on the windows, various marketing materials, and a misguided attempt to "decorate" with various crapola - it definitely makes the place look budget, which is too bad.

Elevators - I can't tell you how many times I've stayed here and one of the elevators is out.  This turns something that works into something that doesn't.  On our last stay, the elevators worked for 3 days. On the 4th day (when we were leaving) they only had one elevator and we waited for about 15 minutes and almost missed our train.  Given our past experience this is obviously a recurring problem. 

It is not a dig at the hotel, but I would never eat here - you have the Village and Soho within 10 minutes and so many great restaurants.  I don't see that as a negative at all.

title: Friendly staff
text: The staff was wonderful to deal with.  The rooms are exceptionally small but clean.  Unfortunately, there is construction next door which was counter productive for a relaxing sleep.  The restaurant in hotel was very disappointing.

title: GREAT value in a hot neighborhood
text: Everything about this little gem on the corner of Varick/Charlton is friendly.  The people at the front desk are friendly and helpful, having a cool bar/restaurant in the lobby that spills over to outdoor seating is fantastic.  And an on-call valet service is OUTSTANDING< especailly for this part of NYC.  Our room was small but large enough for us to move about without tripping. Clean and comfortable was what counted for us and this place delivered.

title: Soho So Good
text:
Christina at the front desk is a total delight.  She even called after we were in the room to make sure that everything was okay.  The room and bath were both clean and neat.  The layout was a good as you can have for such a small place.  We had no problem with two people - never got in each other's way.

Location: The location is terrific; south of the Village, west edge of Soho.  It is generally quiet.  The 1 train is only a short block away.

Hints: 
1. The shower is difficult to turn on logistically with getting burned or cold.  Move the point of the four pointed handle that is a 4 o'clock and turn it to 12 o'clock as a starting place.

2. The street can be a little noisy.

3. Breakfast was just okay, but the waiters did not have a clue. 

Suggestion:  Add a small table between the chair and the bed.

title: New favorite downtown hotel
text:
When we first arrived I was underwhelmed by the street and hotel front (there is a construction site next door).  But it only got better starting with the check-in which was lovely, everyone so welcoming - like a small city hotel.  Even though our room was small (the norm for NYC) it was spotlessly clean and very well appointed.  
The kicker for me was the comfort of the bed and the ambiance of the room.  As a very poor sleeper I was thrilled to find that I had two blissful nights.  As if this all weren't enough it's two blocks to the restaurants and shopping of Soho's main streets and 2 blocks from the Hudson and the beautiful gardens along the river.  Thank you staff for making this a terrific weekend in the big apple- I'll be back!

title: Great Location in the Big Apple
text: Spending five nights, enjoying everything about the city, we found the location handy to all.  The rooms were adequate, clean, quiet and restful.  The front desk eager to assist us with any requests.  The bar, in the lobby, and the outside patio, made it homey.  There is a restaurant, however, our group did not partake.  SoHo has many interesting, and diverse bars or restaurants, all so close to the hotel.  Will certainly will be sure to book this one again.

title: Great location, good hotel
text:
I could not have asked for a better location in terms of walking or public transit connections.  The hotel room was small, but functional.  The bathroom needed maintenance due to wallpaper clearly  coming up from wall and dampness causing wall to deteriorate near the tub/shower and plaster to crumble onto the floor.

The desk attendant in the evening was fantastic and directed us to a great restaurant, Dutch, a short walk from hotel.  This was just what we needed after a long day of travel to NY from San Francisco.

title: Terrible terrible terrible
text:
As you can see from the title of the review, we didn't like this place and neither will you. The name Sheraton might suggest quality but this is far from it. Apart from being close to Soho village there is literally nothing I could recommend about this hotel. Here is a list of the things that went wrong in our ONE NIGHT stay.
A) the air com system broke on one of the hottest nights of Summer
b) it's not family friendly in the slightest despite being advertised as such and we arrived with two kids.
C) on arrival we had to wait two hours before we could get into our room even though we arrived at 3pm.
D) they promised us a family room and then denied they had ever done so.
E) the manager was totally unhelpful and we had to fight him for a grudging apology. Their compensation, such as it was, was breakfast. However...
F) the breakfast was over priced and the service slow (and the amount they offered us in comp was feeble).
G) it is utter no frills and cheap feeling. I heard one of staff say to another that they should spray something to mask a smell. Nice.
H) the wifi was terrible. I had to sit by the door to get a signal.

Unless you are desperate, my strong advise would be, find somewhere else.

title: Solid hotel.
text: I have stayed here on mult trips. It's hard to find a good hotel with decent pricing in NYC. It's not super fancy but it is clean and will maintained. The rooms are small so you might have to fit for space for large bags.

title: Meh...
text:
This place is paying the bills via its location which is awesome but the rest of the experience fell short. 

Pros: front desk staff- helpful and quick, location is very good
Cons: rooms are small with thin walls- elevators slow and often filled with staff- in the bathroom they have dispensers for shampoo etc rather than little bottles (awesome/less plastic) but not as awesome when after a day it goes empty and doesn't get refilled for the rest of your stay. 

Restaurant also lands solidly in the Meh category. Not bad, but a long way from being the place you want to pick again.

For the money and location there are other properties nearby I would return to before going back here (W highline, Hugo)

Nothing horrible- but nothing about my visit made me want to come back.

title: BOM
text: Quarto bom e limpo, atendimento e serviços funcionando perfeitamente. Possui uma boa localização em um lugar bem tranquilo, ideal para após um dia de correria, poder ter uma noite de sono longe da agitação.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Rooms were clean, updated and typical size (small) for New York City.   Hotel front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.   Near the Village and Soho but it is a hike walking to Times Square.   I was on a high floor but the elevators (two of them) came quickly.  Overall, good experience for business travel.

title: Good stay
text:
Free wifi, free water, comfy bed, clean, free coffee in lobby and room. Really good location for the village, 10 min slow walk (bring a map, it's easy to get lost in this part of town). Lovely guy Nicholas checked us in and seemed to be a genuinely nice guy and wanted us to enjoy our stay. 
Would have given it 5 stars only the air con was too loud to sleep with it on which left the room very hot and the windows let in a lot of street noise (bring earplugs and you'll be fine). Also taxi drivers seem to never know where charlton street is so bring a map to show them.

title: Nice Hotel in Soho
text:
First of all the aroma that greets you when you enter the lobby makes you want to inhale and order a box of whatever type of air fragrance that was for your own home. Although the room and bathrooms were smaller than what I'm used to (I hear that's typical in NYC) it was a very comfortable room. The hotel is away from the hustle, bustle, and loud noise of Time Square, but close enough for you to take a hour long walk through the different villages on the way to Time Square. Or, just catch the number 1 train to 42nd St. (about 8 stops). 

One night we walked all over Soho trying to find a restaurant that did not have a long waiting line just to wind up back at the hotel to eat dinner and to our surprise the food was excellent. So have dinner at the hotel one night you will enjoy it, especially the lobster ravioli.

As we walked through Greenwhich Village one morning we stopped at a little place called Waverly's (I think that's the right name) for breakfast. The food was good and reasonable for NYC. Try the spinach and feta omelette, or the silver dollar pancakes.

title: Great Value!
text: We stayed at the Four Points for only one night, booking last minute. We were shocked that we could get a room in Soho, on a Friday night (Labor Day Weekend) for less than $200. The room was small (as to be expected in NYC) but it was designed in such a way that it didn't feel cramped. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, and the bathroom was in great condition.  The staff was friendly and greeted us every time they saw us come or go. Overall a great experience!

title: Great location, friendly service, good choice in Manhattan
text:
We stayed at the Four Points for six nights, partly to attend a conference at NYU and partly to enjoy New York as tourists. The location is great - close to a metro and walking distance to really nice areas for restaurants and shopping.

While the room was small, it was comfortably furnished and had everything we needed, with decent free wi-fi. The hallways are small so expect door closing noises from adjacent rooms and there's the constant buzz of NYC just outside your window, but that's the price you pay for location perhaps.

Reception were always friendly, with a hello every time we passed there. The bar/restaurant space is small but has an outdoor area which seemed popular.

We enjoyed staying here, it was a great spot to base ourselves for everything we needed to do.

title: Convenient hotel in SOHO
text: This hotel was convenient to the places we wanted to visit while we were in NYC.  Lots of great restaurants and shopping and a block and a half to where we got a great deal to park for 3 nights.  Hotel staff were courteous and helpful.  It was also nice to have the restaurant/bar with outside seating downstairs!

title: Great Place in SOHO
text: Great view. Great location. Just a minute away from the subway station, five minutes from the famous NY Chinatown and the Canal Street, few blocks from the Broadway with the great shopping experience and the most important the hotel is in the heart of SOHO. Cozy bars, designers delis, nice people. Just a lot of fun. Friendly stuff. great place and very quiet. Breakfust sucks. Just go out and eat better.

title: Great location
text: Pretty much every time I travel to NYC I stay at this hotel. Its a great location for going up or downtown NYC. I also really like a lot of the restaurants in the Soho area. The rooms are a little small & make sure you ask for a room on a higher floor as NYC roads a noisy 24hrs a day !

title: Excelente opção.
text:
O hotel fica muito bem localizado, numa rua tranqüila entre o soho e o west village. Próximo a duas estações de metro. Atendimento cordial e eficiente na chegada e saída. Quarto limpo, silencioso, banheiro com chuveiro excelente. Cama confortável. 
Vale muito a pena.

title: I like it just fine, thank you!
text:
Stayed just one night.  It was clean, we got a corner unit which admittedly is slightly larger than some of the smaller units that some have previously complained about on Tripadvisor, but most importantly: Everything from the lobby to our room was very clean beyond my expectations, the beds were made crisply, the carpet in our room had little or no stains, and everything in the room was in perfect working order.  The room safe was an unexpected welcome surprise that we used to stored our iPad in while we were out having fun in Soho & Greenwhich Village.  Kudos to Nicolas and his colleague stationed in the lobby, as they made check-in at 3:40PM an easy pleasure, and they even followed-up with a call to our room to see if everything met our expectations after we were settled in for a little while.  Got back to the room at 3AM, and from the 11th floor, overnight street and traffic noises that should be fully expected by any rational human being while staying in the largest metropolitan area in the United States were frequent, but as I stated earlier were fully expected, and were absolutely acceptable within the context of our stay.  So all you nay sayers from the UK or the "fly-over states" in the US that have unrealistic expectations of what an urban hotel stay should be like, need to get real about staying in a large city.  Staying in a large urban center will not necessarily include a rooster calling out in the distance during the early morning while the dew is still glistening on the grass!  (This coming from someone who lives in a rural area located in Southeastern PA)  
As some have complained about, the AC wall unit was admittedly loud, but hey... Forgetaboutit!!!  Tripadvisor's overall rating system would not allow me the granular resolution to pick a 4 1/2, so my four dots in my overall rating is really a 4 1/2.  If your expectations are what one would experience by staying at that Waldorf, then this hotel is not for you.  But if you are realistic, and enjoy clean accommodations, then I recommend that you stay here if this part of town is where you want to be.

title: Great four points, great location
text: This is a very good location, close to subways, restauarants, bars, etc.  Nice change from the midtown madness where many hotels are located.  Rooms are small - but reasonable by manhattan standards.  Also, rooms are furnished in a way to make the best use of space - wardrobe- corner desk set up.  Bathroom very tastefully decorated with wallpaper, nice tile, in a black, white, grey motif.  Patio area with about 10 tables in front of hotel - used by the bar by night, might be normally used for the restaurant, but the restaurant was closed when I was there.  My rating of excellent is intended to mean that this hotel is an excellent four points (e.g., an excellent budget friendly hotel).  Clark at the front desk said hotel is often booked solid.

title: Awesome Visit
text: Is there anywhere else to stay?  OMG we arrived in New York on a Friday morning.  I have always stayed in New Jersey or near Times Square.  This was a birthday surprise so I had no idea where we would be staying.  My boyfriend surprised me with Soho.............I will never stay anywhere else again!  Our hotel was central to everything! We walked all over New York.  If you enjoy walking and seeing all the different neighbourhoods it is great location. We had no issues whatsoever walking to Central Park from this hotel.  Soho is just buzzing with excitement.  Shopping, quaint restaurants, cafes, people watching....amazing!  Our room was small but not too small - nicely decorated and modern.  We had a King Room and the bed was like heaven - it was so comfortable and after taking in the city all day we slept like babies :).  The staff at the hotel was amazing.  They always greeted you coming and going and asked about your day.  They were very informative with any questions you had or any recommendations for tours, directions etc.  Check in and out was quick and they offered to book us our transportation to the airport on our final day.   We had a wonderful five days and will be returning next year for sure!

title: Good Location
text:
I stayed one night and thought it was a well maintained property in an excellent location.  When I arrived the fire department was in the lobby to deal with a smoke issue with the restaurant exhaust system.  The front desk handled all very efficiently.

Nicely furnished but small room. Very comfortable bed.  There was a small amount of street noise on the 12th floor.  The bathroom is nicely appointed with an excellent shower.  Like Four Points dispensers of shampoo, conditioner and body wash-ecologically sound.

Walking distance to the Village and Soho and great subway access.  An excellent choice.

title: Great location/got the job done
text: A lot of my work is in the financial district, and it is an easy walk to that location. It is also walkable to several nice restaurants and streets that you wouldn't necessarily walk down (such as downey street).   So this is a four points, and its a better four points than the one in times square. The rooms are small, this is really a hotel for business or couples, I don't recommend for families. That said, I would recommend giving this place a shot just to hang out in this part of soho/west village area, the hotel is clean/ service is helpful and polite.

title: Fine, no frills, clean comfortable, good value
text:
A comfortable bed and clean room, goo dvalue  very handy for where I needed to be. A good spot for soho. The staff were pleasant and free wifi. The room was very small, not much space aside from the bed and there was no hallway from the front door so I could everyone coming out of neighbouring rooms. There was no bath, just a shower but that was fine by me.

But it was good value and what I needed so I would have no worries staying there again.

title: Clean and Efficient
text: We had a number of problems with our room the first day we checked in, to the point where I was almost ready to write a bad review but then I realised that every time we had a problem the staff here took care of it immediatly. For instance when we first entered our room we noticed that the window would not close properly letting a fair amount of street noise in, but when we called down to the desk they sent someone up to fix it within a few minutes. They dealt with everything else just as quickly and efficently. This is a nice, clean hotel that is very convienantly located with only a block walk to the nearest subway. They greeted us with cold bottled water when we arrived the first day hot and sweaty from carrying our luggage (and there are free bottles in the room as well).  We were in NYC for a family event and when we visited family members who were in other hotels around the city we couldn't help but notice how much they were charged for everything. One day when we returned around five pm there was a free small buffet in the lobby and free beer !!  Meanwhile our family members were being charged $7 for a bottle of water across town. I'll definitely consider staying here again the next time I return to New York.

title: Посещение Нью-Йорка
text: Посещение Нью-йорка предполагает беготню по достопримечательностям и музеям, поэтому в отель приходишь только спать, но он больше похож на тесную общагу со слышимостью из соседних номеров. Вид из окна в офис напротив, но другого трудно ожидать. Зона рецепшен мизерная с улицы сразу в лифт, единственный плюс - все рядом

title: Great Location and Good Value
text: This Hotel's best features are it's location and value.  Short walk and you are in the best of SOHO, Chinatown & Little Italy and still walkable is the Financial District.  There are plenty of restaurants, clubs and attractions nearby to enjoy.  Rooms are clean, comfortable albeit "NY sized" and represent a great value for this area of the city.  I would definitely recommend and stay here again.

title: CANNOT WAIT TO COME BACK!
text:
Man oh man I have nothing but great things to say about my experience at this Four Points by Sheraton hotel. I have visited NYC many times and this was by far my favorite hotel experience and location. We were around the corner from a McDonald's that was open 24 hours a day which was nice when it was late and you wanted a snack. Houston St isn't far from the hotel and we found some great places to eat and bars with great atmosphere. AND you are close to the subway, Little Italy & China town.

Before arriving, I had a plane delay so I called the hotel to make sure i would not lose my reservation if I showed up too late. The woman was very pleasant and took care of my concerns. We ended up making it to NYC at a decent time and when I checked in it was the same woman I had spoken with on the phone earlier that day. She remembered who I was and since we had such a hard time she offered us a round of drinks at the hotel bar free of charge. Right off the bat they hit a home run in customer service. 

We stayed on the 7th floor, and the room was perfect. AC was very powerful & the Four Point beds are very comfortable. ( I am SO picky on beds....) 

The entire staff was amazing, everyone acknowledged us as we came and went from the hotel. Free water was a plus considering all the walking. A friend of mine from Long Island came to the city to hang with us and we stayed out later than expected so we asked the front desk for extra linens for her to make a pallet and they were up at the room in less than 10 minutes.

title: Great location. Friendly and helpful staff
text: Spent 4 nights in a comfortable room with a view onto wall. The entrance lobby looks a bit shabby and unwelcoming but the room and facilities were good. Best of all was the front desk staff, all of whom we're helpful and friendly. Took breakfast in the restaurant one morning and the food was good and service excellent.

title: Excellent location – Friendly Staff!
text:
Excellent location – Friendly Staff! My sister and I stayed 11 nights at the Four Points Sheraton SoHo. The best customer services I have experienced in a VERY long time! A special thanks to Elliot and Brian who were extremely friendly and helpful during our stay. Everyone we came into contact with smiled and acknowledged our presence.  The hotel is in a perfect location and is very reasonably priced. Whilst the rooms are not very big and the décor isn’t the prettiest – it’s a clean hotel and it’s central to everything! We were within close walking distance to many great restaurants and shops in Soho, and could easily walk to Greenwich, the meat packing district and Tribeca was just around the corner.  There are 2 subways close by and it’s a quick train ride into time square.
For those looking for a reasonably priced hotel, great location and friendly staff I would definitely recommend staying here. We will be back!
Helen - Sydney Australia
Stayed June 2014

title: Bom custo x beneficio
text: Fiquei por uma noite nesse hotel. O staff foi bem atencioso e solicito em relação as informações que eu solicitei. A cama é realmente bem confortável e proporciona uma excelente noite de sono. O banheiro tem um estilo mais moderno, tendo apenas ducha e não possui banheira - o que eu pessoalmente prefiro. A ducha é fantástica, super no padrão da rede Sheraton. O hotel é bem localizado, bem próximo a uma estação de metro, e próximo a todos os lugares descolados no Meatpacking District. Recomendo!

title: Great Location, Enjoyable Stay
text:
Spent three nights here in July 2014. It is a nice hotel in a good location. Front staff was always helpful, had water bottles whenever we asked after returning from a busy day. We had the king room, view was not great but it I did not care. We were so tired when we got back we did not even look out the window. We left in the morning and came back at night, who really needs a view? And yes, the room is tiny...but you're in NYC, you should not be hanging out in your hotel room! Bathroom was always sparkling clean, water pressure in the shower was perfect. 

Very convenient location. The number 1 subway line was a block away. We walked to the 911 Memorial, Broadway, and if you get the hop-on-hop-off bus, it drops you off on Broadway, about a 15 minute walk back. Street was quieter on the weekend (but the Starbucks around the corner was closed?!) Nice area with shops and little restaurants close by! 

We found a nice bottle of Prosecco on ice in our room which was a nice surprise (a cork screw would have been helpful but front desk staff helped there!) 

Air conditioning worked really well, we had humid weather and it was nice coming into the cool room and it was comfortable for sleeping. And speaking of sleeping, the bed was very comfortable. 

No issues with wifi in our room, everything worked, TV, hair dryer, coffee maker, clock/iPod docking station. 

I have no complaints about this property, I have stayed in far more expensive hotels, which could not hold a candle to this one. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a reasonable hotel.

title: New York City Independence Weekend.
text:
Decent location to Soho. Rooms are New York average but they are comfortable. I went with my girl for 1 night before independence day and I spent a valuable time there, exept for one thing!!. 3 hours before our check out my girl and I, we  decided to pay half day to stay longer there; when I spoke with the lady at the front desk she said that we can be there only until 4pm which was insane!!! They charged us $118 for half day and the only extra time that we were able to stayed there was 4 more hours!! This is insane, when I asked to the front desk agent she replied to me that the reason was because they wont have housekeeper available to clean the room after 4pm. Excuse me!! 

I been booking in different hotels in my life and I never heard something like this and what is worse is the fact that is located at Soho!!! Come on, give me a break, one of the greatest neighborhoods in NYC and they dont have housekeeper on independence weekend?

On overall the property wasnt bad compared to some upscale hostels that we scoped before booked there. Also they offer free bottled water for free which is a nice gesture. But I would say that Customer Service is their issue!!! I also wrote en email complaning about how much they charged me for only 4 extra hours and its been 72 hours and I didnt heard from them either.

In summary, the property is nice and the rooms are ok; however some members from the front desk department didnt do well their homework of keep guest satisfied and incentivate them to return to this property.

For better or for worse for me, customer service is more important than Gold; I think I probably wouldnt return and either recommend it to my clients or friends.

title: Not going back
text: I was excited for the hotel because of the price and location, but this was a horrible stay. When I first arrived at my room at around 9pm, it had an overwhelming smell of body odor. I thought I'd give it a while to see if it would disappear or if I'd get used to it (even tried airing it out with the windows on 90 degree weather) but it persisted for the few hours I ended up staying. The walls are PAPER THIN. I could hear the details of every conversation the men in the room next door were having (one liked to whistle). I had an early flight in the morning and really wanted to sleep so I called downstairs to see if I could switch rooms. The person who answered the phone said no but offered that I could come downstairs to get a pair of earplugs (as an experienced traveler I always bring my own, also I had already changed clothing). He offered to call the room to tell them that the walls are extremely thin but he never did (I could hear every word that was said). I turned on the AC, which as other posts have noted is disruptively loud (no joke) and finally fell asleep only to be awoken at 3am by a loud buzzing sound that made my entire room shake. At first I thought it was some type of fire alarm (sounded like an air raid). But after going into the hall, I discovered it was coming from directly behind my bathroom wall. I called downstairs to inquire about the noise and they simply thanked me for letting them know. I ended up checking out at 330 am because waiting at la Guardia was more comfortable. The elevator had a strong smell of natural gas. The night manager said sorry and offered to hail a taxi for me when he got off the phone but I simply left.

title: guzel
text: yeri konumu olarak guzel otel eski ama temiz bidaha geldigimde kalabilirim  herkese tafsiye edebilirim odalar buyuk olmazsada ıdare eder karabalık bi ailenın kalıcagı yer değil sakın ış için kalınabılecek otel

title: Good value, does the job
text:
Stayed here for a few days. 
Free water, coffee, happy hour on Wednesdays. Good location with heart of Village within walking distance. 
Rooms are small, but it's NYC. I was alone on business so did not bother me. 
Rooms were clean, which is important and service was good. 
Staff friendly. 

Restaurant attached I did not experience but had a drink at small bar. 

Good value for what it is.

title: This will be my last time
text:
Looks like I've reviewed this hotel twice already (great reviews) and I've probably stayed here about half a dozen times over the last 5 years. Sadly, I think this will be my last.

Nothing particularly 'wrong' happened on this visit - it's just that nothing was particularly great. I find this hotel is pretty average, a pretty bare bones product and the rooms are just tiny. TINY! I know this is typical for New York rooms - smaller than other cities but I really felt that I had it this time. My room also looked straight out at a brick wall. 

I really don't find any compelling reason to stay here except for the location - close to Broadway and my office but I am going to try elsewhere for next time - Marriot Courtyard nearby and some newer hotels around the corner on Hudson. I paid about $350 per night which is expensive and I really felt I didn't get a whole lot. Bathrom is tired but otherwise clean. 

Staff were nice but I could really have done without their unprofessional conversation about how shocked they all were that someone had just gotten fired. The whole lobby was privy to their conversation and all work had to stop in order for this gossip to be shared. Nice.

title: Horrible
text: this has to be the worst hotel I've stayed in. I paid $350 per night and when I arrived to my room it was dusty, the shower had water stains on the walls as if they had not cleaned it. Not to mention there was hair on my sheets and stains on my pillow cases. I called the front desk attendant and asked to speak with a supervisor for them to only put me on hold for 10min. Not only was I on hold, I was directed to a manager being told the supervisor was not in at the moment.  When speaking to the manager not only was the young man rude and snappy, I was constantly being cut off before he hanged the phone up on me. I was so dissatisfied with my stay. The only good that came out of this trip was the location. Everything was in walking distance, the food from the restaurant was delicious and the front desk were very pleasant. Other than that I would not think twice about visiting this hotel again.

title: Just perfect....
text:
I stayed here one night for a little shopping in SoHo.  The room was small but sufficient and the bathrooms are nicely decorated.  I received free water on check-in and after returning from a long day of shopping was given more bottles to get me through the night :)

The location is perfect if your primary area is SoHO - walking distance to everything is minimal. I would stay here again.

title: Stay in SoHo, Manhattan
text:
Very clean and very conveniently located hotel in SoHo Manhattan. I found this location very safe. Walking distance to Broadway shopping, restaurant. Walking distance to the Greenwich Village. Close to 2 subway lines.
The hotel was good value for money.

Some glitches with the TV remote (old batteries) and coffee maker (not working at all.)

title: Un bon choix
text: Bien situé pour visiter la Petite Italie, Chinatown. Tout le quartier se visite à pied pour découvrir des restaurants, des boutiques. La chambre était petite, mais propre. Un grand lit très confortable. Prévoir le stationnement (60$ par jour).

title: Overpriced, underdelivers
text: Very disappointed in my stay here.  I paid $350/night which is exhorbitant for the product being offered.  This is a $89 room in any other city in the US. Front desk staff were not particularly friendly, engaged or professional - everything seemed like a hassle.  Everything about the place felt cheap, except the price.   The room furnishings were of low qualtiy to begin with and are beat up.  There is a lot of noise from the elevators and from the garbage trucks outside.  The shower leaked and the bathroom amenities were poor quality. All the shelves/racks in the bathroom felt like they were about to fall off the wall.  Interior walls had splatters of some description all over them.  Air conditioning unit wasn't working when I got to my room - then noisy when it was "fixed". Next time, will find somewhere else to stay.

title: Great Location
text: The interior (and exterior) throw you some.  Tall but small (8 rooms per floor).  But all in all a nice, clean, friendly hotel in SoHo.  Plenty to do and see, and easy to get anywhere from the hotel, especially walking or using subway.  Just a "fun" neighborhood hotel.

title: Overall good experience
text:
Pros
------
> Quiet location
> one block from Metro 1, C, E
> Close to Battery Park, an excellent hotel to stay if you plan to catch the first ferry
> if you get to stay on the top few floors, views are pretty good
> staffs are friendly and helpful
> late check-out is possible if availability allows

Cons
-------
> downside of a quiet location is that the food choices are limited in close proximity
> the folding bed is not comfortable.  For a party of 3, if you are given a choice of a king bed with a folding bed instead of two double beds, make sure you know what you are signing up.  I definitely would not recommend anyone over 110lbs sleeping on the folding bed.
> each guest room's door tends to make loud noises when closing

Overall, this hotel worked out great for us because we planned to visit Statue of Liberty.  It only takes 15 minutes to get to Battery Park.  If you plan to catch the 8:30am ferry, my advice is to grab an early breakfast from Essen (corner of varick st and vandam st) before you take the subway.  Be warned that the food in the ferry are limited, not very tasty, and expensive.  Enjoy!

title: Uma experiência diferente em NY Soho
text:
Pela primeira vez em NY ficamos hospedadas no Soho. O hotel é super bem localizado, em uma rua tranquila e apenas a 2 quadras da Prince Street, uma das principais ruas do Soho. O clima e a vige do Soho são completamente diferentes de Midtown e da região do Central Park ou Times Sqare. No Soho as pessoas são descoladas e atuais, jovens e mais "leves".  Parece até outra cidade. Ficamos a 5 minutos do Meat Packing (must visit atual) e de Greenwich Village, uma delicia. E também aproveitamos a proximidade com o Brooklyn para passar o dia lá, no hype da NY de hoje !

O hotel é básico, o quarto é simples mas tem um espaço adequado e tudo funciona 100%. O serviço vai na mesma linha. Claro que como é NY, não se paga pouco pelo básico...

Recomendo !

title: Convenient, great location.
text:
I stayed here for a week as it was closet our office.
The front desk was very friendly and helpful.
The rooms have been remodeled so they're better than the average Four Points chains.
Good location, close to Subway station.

title: Fine; nice staff, but nothing special
text: Way better options if you're a frequent traveler.   I would not stay here again b/c there are better options. Staff was great and location is great, but it's very average.  Restaurant and bar onsite are really sub par and not what you'd expect from this level hotel.  Pricey too.

title: Nice, Friendly Hotel in Soho
text: My wife and I spent 3 days in NYC visiting family and touring around.  We enjoyed our stay at this Sheraton.  Our check-in was easy and the desk acknowledged our SPG status.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  Air conditioning was quite adequate.  Bed was real comfortable, making for a nice sleep.  The bathroom was a bit small, but  clean, modern and workable.  The door to the bathroom is painted glass, so it let a lot of light into the room, if we need to use the bathroom in the middle of the night.  Also, the shower had a lot of pressure and hot water, but the control was a bit sticky making it difficult for control.  Housekeeping was friendly and they cleaned our room during our breakfast.  One big plus is that on Wednesdays the hotel has a nice happy hour with good food and a a complimentary beer or wine.  The area is fine, but not touristy.  A few good bars and restaurants are close by: Westville, EAR, SOBs, west Spring St.  The subway 1 train is close by, so no big deal to get to sites.  We went to a Broadway show and we were in our seats within 30 minutes.

title: Buon hotel a soho
text: Buon hotel in buona posizione.. Vicino a molti pub e ristoranti.. Zona allegra e giovane.. Vicino alla metro..Molto bella e caratteristica la zona residenziale nelle vicinanze.. Una new York autentica consigliato

title: Average
text: I have stayed at this property before, but recently joined trip advisor. My stay was very average. The rooms are clean, hotel well kept, ice machine only in the basement ,very typical of all Four Points in manhattan. Location is "so-so". Venture onto Prince street which is quite close to get a feel of Soho and leads you to wonderful shopping on W, Broadway with all the brand name stores. As I said hotel location not that appealing but just venture two blocks! Not bad! Some additional issues warranting an average rating are as a platinum member I had to ask for an upgrade . There was a room upgrade available! Initially, I was told no, and then reception realized someone cancelled and placed me in a slightly better room. Also,( although I am aware of platinum amenities), I was not given a choice. Four Points are not the highest quality Starwood properties HOWEVER I had EXCELLENT stays at others, and in manhattan when additional effort was made. If the price is right, go for it, but again don't have high expectations.

title: Way too noisy
text:
I checked into this hotel only about a half an hour ago and already had to change rooms, and unfortunately that may have been a mistake.  

In the first room we heard some loud music coming from somewhere.  Turns out the building next door is a band practice space, and they're allowed to practice until 10 pm, who knows when they can start in the morning?  

Unfortunately in the new room we got the horns honking on the street AND could still hear the band practice noise.  If you're not sensitive to noise this may be a good option, however I think staying here was a HUGE mistake.

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed two nights this weekend - really impressed - great location, great staff, great view from 18th floor.  Room was a bit bigger than I expected, well laid out and clean.  I don't get to New York often but already looking to come back to this hotel at my next opportunity.

title: Good location, OK hotel
text: This is our third stay in New York - never been that impressed with hotel accommodation or value, so perhaps our expectations are unrealistic.  This hotel was reasonable, typical noisy in-room air conditioner, small room.  But of course, we weren't there to stay in the hotel - location in Soho was excellent - certainly gave a different impression of Manhattan compared to midtown and the financial district.  Price was pretty reasonable by New York standards, and the staff were very helpful.  Might stay there again if the price is competitive.

title: Great location, value, and staff
text: First stay in this location and hotel and I was very impressed. A great location, close to the shopping, dining, and siteseeing locations of Soho/Greenwich Village. It was a very quiet part of town, yet a short walk to the hustle and bustle, or to the tranquility of the Hudson River park areas and bike/walkway. The front desk staff was outstanding and very helpful. Parking was arranged and check-in was quick and easy. Room was very nice and clean. TV was rather clunky when trying to change channels or volume. Loved the black granite shower! Front desk arranged for a late 1pm check-out which was so helpful. Elevators (2 of them) were pretty slow, so being on the 3rd floor, I used the stairs instead. Lobby coffee was available first thing in the morning as well as complimentary newspapers, but coffee should have been offered throughout the day. Overall, a very nice stay and I would definitely make this my go-to hotel in the city!

title: Correcto. Buena ubicación
text: Es un hotel correcto, y bien ubicado, pero no puedo decir que sea un hotel excelente. Habitaciones algo pequeñas,  sin nevera o minibar. Las moquetas de los pasillos necesitan renovación pues dan un aspecto algo viejo, y las habitaciones no reciben una limpieza en profundidad. El personal de recepción es muy agradable y dispuesto. Servicio de té y café gratuito en lobby y habitaciones

title: Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan SoHo Village, is a Great place to stay ! ! !
text:
Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan SoHo Village, is a Great place to stay ! ! !

this is an outstanding property, very clean , staff is great, location is great, rooms are outstanding !

if your in the SOHO area and you need a place to stay,Give Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan SoHo Village, ! ! !

Sgt Eddie & Amber DeLuca

title: Wow – Pleasantly Surprised
text:
There are many different brands under the SPG umbrella and I never stay at a Four Points but this was the closest SPG hotel to where I was having my business meeting the next day. I typically book Westin, Le Meridian, Luxury Collection hotels within the SPG  family and sometimes will also stay at a Sheraton so I was a little nervous about making the booking at a Four Points fearing I would not like the quality of the hotel. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. 

The hotel is very well maintained. The lobby is small but welcoming as is the staff. Stephanie checked me in and was very pleasant and also made some great lunch recommendations that are near the hotel.

I was in a room on the 17th floor in a corner room so it had windows on two walls of my room which made the room seem larger. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom must have been recently remodeled. It was small but seemed brand new. There was even an umbrella in the closet in case of rain. 

I really enjoyed this hotel and would absolutely stay here if I was in the area again. Four Points SoHo – you definitely surprised me! I spent the next two nights at the Element hotel in Times Square West and really wished I had stayed here the rest of the weekend because I liked it much better!

title: Small clean hotel, great location
text: Very clean, affordable, excellent location between midtown and lower Manhattan. Staff was very polite, small Italian restaurant on site had good food. Close to some great restaurants. The small gym in the basement was convenient.

title: Anniversary stay
text: We just returned from a great time and stayed in this hotel. I like to stick with the Starwood brand when I can and now I think the reason behind it is that their employees are great.  This is not the most luxurious hotel but we were here for the location which could not be beat. The staff, such as Corey, made our stay wonderful

title: Good location, not a business hotel
text: The room was dated (worn carpet, beat up furniture, shabby couch), inconvenient outlets and limited work space. I was unable to plug in my phone near the bed, forcing me to rig up an extension cord using my laptop and a longer USB cable.  The room was also very noisy.  Each floor has very limited square footage, meaning the sounds echo throughout the small floor space.  The shoddy upgrades to the bathroom had clearly been done by an amateur.  I had to use a towel to wrench the faucet on and then precisely place it for some minimally warm water.  When I pulled the shower lever, the shower head sprayed water wildly all over the bathroom, soaking my pajamas and all of my cosmetics. I didn't bother complaining since my stay was very short.  I was staying at the hotel with other colleagues, but the lobby/bar area was not a suitable gathering space due to its tiny size.  I also did not receive my receipt automatically and had to call twice after being put on indefinite hold the first time.  The location is really good and all of this might be tolerable at the reasonable (for NY)  price point for a leisure traveler, but not for a routine business traveler missing the comforts of home and working from the hotel.

title: Wonderful!
text: Perfect Mother/Daughters getaway .... SOHO shopping, Washington Square Park people watching, delicious Little Italy dinner.  The Sheraton was a terrific home base.  Room was great; comfortable beds, excellent shower, decent view and friendly staff.  Highly recommend!

title: Great location
text: We stayed 2 nights here over a weekend. King bed in a typically small NYC room. The hotel is set for renovation in the coming months and needs it as it is worn out. The room was clean and service good. I would stay here again but only if the rate was the lowest that I could find in the area. Walls are thin and noisy. Towels are thin and not absorbent.

title: great location and staff
text:
My husband and I are just returning from a four day trip to NY that turned into a 5 day trip due to a storm in our home town, so we had the opportunity to stay in two different rooms.  Our first 4 nights were in a 6th floor king bed room facing Charlton, and the last night was in a 21st floor (top floor) city view two double bed room.  I would say that the upgrade is worth it.  In both cases, the bed was very comfortable, and this is something my husband is very fussy about so that's saying something!  Also, we didn't have any complaints about noise on either floor (just garbage pickup or something our 2nd morning, but that's a necessary evil).  The windows in the 6th floor room were very drafty though; the windows actually didn't close well, so it was always a bit drafty (although at night when you close your blind it blocks the draft).  Also, we were much happier with the bathroom in the 21st floor room.  It had a bathtub, for one thing; I know that the reason there was no bathtub in the 6th floor room is that it was designed to be "accessible" (although for the life of me I can't see how someone with mobility issues would be able to manoeuver in that very narrow shower stall), but did it ever leak!  There wasn't much of a lip, so you wound up with a pool of water on the floor every time you had a shower (and we're quick shower takers).  Also, as others have mentioned, the heater/AC is noisy, but it seemed to be much noisier in the 6th floor room; I sleep with earplugs and it was still quite noticeable.  Due to having the two double beds, the 21st floor room was also more spacious.  Overall though, I can't complain, it was worth the money we spent.

The big bonus was the location; easy access to both the 1 line and ACE line (1 is closer) and all the galleries, shops, restaurants and bars that SOHO and Greenwich Village have to offer.  Also, the staff was very friendly; front desk, restaurant, cleaners, etc. were all very professional.  Liz was very helpful getting us rebooked after we returned to the hotel following our flight cancellation, so that was much appreciated.  It would be a place that we would consider returning to on a future trip.

title: The Staff is Amazing!
text: I really enjoyed my stay here the staff was helpful Michael the front desk supervisor to Miguel the bartender. Was great every member was helpful to me! This is a great place to stay the rooms are  nice and spacious for New York!

title: Great bed
text:
I had a very nice and comfortable stay. The hotel is very quiet and well located, walking distance to Soho shops and Meatpacking. Subway station (line 1) a couple of blocks away.
The bed is really, really comfortable. Good shower too. Complimentary bottles of water everyday, plus complimentary coffee at the lobby every morning.
The staff is very kind. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Hotel bom e confortável
text:
A localização é muito boa, o quarto atendeu a 3 pessoas com conforto e tranqüilidade, camas extremamente confortáveis e o aquecimento era bom e foi suficiente para os dias frios. 
Recomendo também pela gentileza dos funcionários e pelo suporte que recebemos durante a estadia.

title: Comfortable and pleasant stay
text: My sister and I started a tradition a couple of years ago to take a sister vacation every year and our favorite city is New York City. We picked the Soho area for the shopping and the area. The Four Points Sheraton was the in the perfect location for that. The hotel was clean, decorated nicely and the staff was very helpful especially Stephanie. There was a big crowd of people that came in and had lots of questions and she handled it all in a calm manner and helped everyone. My sister and I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Disappointingly low quality.
text:
I would have given 2 stars had I not seen the duct tape at the bottom of the shower door trying to prevent water from spilling out all over the bathroom floor. DUCT TAPE!!! That's just unacceptable to me. Needless to say, it did not hold the water back, and instead the bathroom floor had a giant pond. At least the shower pressure was good, temperature was consistent, and the towels were pretty fluffy.

Whoever designed the bathroom either did not have a ruler, or had no experience using a bathroom. Why is the sink so tiny? Why is the faucet a kitchen faucet, so you can't really wash your face without having water flow everywhere? Why is the shower so narrow, but long? I'm a small person, yet still felt claustrophobic. To make matters worse, the shower was lined with black tile. And all the racks in the bathroom for towels and amenities were slanted, i.e. not installed properly. The sink also had dirty looking mold/mildew where it is attached to the counter top.

Outside the bathroom, I enjoyed the decent size of the bedroom. The bed was also pretty comfortable. But the rest of the furniture was aging poorly. There were a lot of chips and misalignment. And the top of the leather desk chair was basically completely peeled off. 

Noise was definitely an issue from my 7th floor corner room. Not so much other hotel guests, but street noise. Being able to hear a street conversation from the 7th floor is ridiculous. And the subway does rumble loud and clear. Thankfully I am a sound sleeper, so it only bothered me before I fell asleep. The a/c+heating unit was also pretty loud, but at least it maintained the temperature.

The overall impression is that management does not really want to invest to keep the hotel up to date, which is a shame, because the location is good, and the rooms are of decent size, and real fixes for small issues (better windows, proper shower door installation, new faucets) could easily bring this hotel up to snuff. 

But duct tape...really?

title: new york trip
text: This hotel was far better than I had expected.  The rooms were good size, the view was great, and it is located very close to everything I wanted to do.  Walkability was great!  The hotel had exceptionally reasonable rates.  We were there several days before New Years Eve!

title: Noisy rooms, cold at night
text:
The internet worked very well.  The bed was very good.  The hotel is relatively new and it looks like it will age rapidly.  Those guys are after the return on investment, rather than the comfort of their guests.

The hotel faces a small street next to Varick St., which is quite busy in the evening with Holland Tunnel traffic and at night Varick is abuzz with cars speeding town to the same Tunnel.  The window was not insulated to handle that level of noise.

The thermostat would switch back to the default 66F, unless you hold the button manually, so the room temperature stayed below the desirable level.

The shower valve worked so that you are either hit by cold water or unbearably hot.  I did manage to find compromise, though.

I am slightly surprised that the rack rate of the hotel (according to the front desk staff) is $350.

title: great service
text: We're very particular about where we stay and what we expect. At the Four Points Sheraton in Soho we definitely enjoy the rooms and value but we keep coming back for the great service -- people like Illia Jaquez (I asked her last name so I could write this). The whole staff has always been great to us, but Illia always goes way beyond in making us feel welcomed and cared for, always gladly trying to accommodate our embarrassingly difficult wishlist for room type and floor and floor location and so many other particulars that just make our occasional NYC visits so much more enjoyable. Including also little details/considerations like bottled water when we forgot to buy some on the way, fondly remembering us despite requests and even though we're not big spenders or frequent travelers, and often a quick call up to the room to make sure everything is as great as she surely knows it is. We really appreciate that and the rest, and it's one of the biggest reasons we keep coming back and highly recommend it to friends.

title: Great service from check in to check out.
text: Elizabeth at the front desk is an asset to this team.  From moving our reservation due to my wife not feeling good. Asking how she was at check in. And the wonderful fruit she sent us to the room.  This is what service is about.  My room was clean at check in and redone quickly on day 2.  Thank you Elizabeth because of you we will be back to four points soho when visiting nyc.

title: Fine for a short stay
text:
