This is a little hotel just off of Varick St.  Although it's immediate environs might not seem that charming, it is actually located just a few blocks from some great Soho and Tribeca neighborhoods where you'll find great restaurants and shops.  (For example, just head west a short walk on Charlton and it turns into Prince St. where you'll find places like Little Prince and The Dutch.)

The front desk staff are very pleasant.  One really nice perk is that they'll give you free bottles of water, which is really important for walking all around Manhattan.  I do wish they just offered, but it seems you have to ask.  The hotel has small NYC rooms that are clean.  Some parts are showing their age, though - the desk chair had peeling leather.  The bed was OK in terms of a comfy mattress.  The armoire smelled of mildew so we didn't dare hang even our coats in there (reported it upon checkout).  The bathroom sink/faucet are not designed well - water splashes onto the sink where the Kleenex box is.  

Most of the issues could be addressed and if they did it'd be a real gem.  As is, it's a fine place for a brief stay.

title: Steve S
text:
Excellent staff food very good
In restaurant great locations
Rooms small but clean and comfortable
Front office exceptional 
Head of housekeeping sofie
Called to make sure we are happy
I would stay here anytime I come
To Manhatan

title: Don't stay here if you want to sleep
text:
This is unequivocally the noisiest hotel I've ever stayed in. You can hear everything going on outside: car alarms going off, garbage trucks, and people talking. The heating unit is so loud it wakes you up every time it starts up.  The doors to the other rooms sound like prison doors slamming shut and also wake you up if you happen to fall asleep in between the other noise. Really unbelievable. 
I rated it average because it was clean, and the bed was pretty comfortable. 
Bring ear plugs if you're going to stay here.

title: Best Staff Ever
text:
On a week-end trip to NYC we stayed at the Sheraton Four Points Soho. While the rooms are average they were very clean and VERY comfortable. There was a large flat screen TV. The bathroom was clean, and there were  products  of quality provided. 

There is a cozy lobby and a quaint little bar. Breakfast was served in a dining room that was more than adequate and was just the right price.

BUT, the best part of the hotel was it's trusty staff. A big shout out to Corey and his friendly coworkers. I will be coming back to stay at this hotel where they make you feel safe an welcomed.

Sheraton!!!! A+ for you choice of employee's.

title: Good little hotel in Soho
text: Stayed for business in December so proximity to SoHo office of my company was key, but Four Points was a solid option for this area.  Rooms aren't huge but they are nice with a neat Sohoish loft architectural style and furnishing.  Not much of a view from low floors.  Good access to Subway, SoHo and Village, lots of restaurants around.  Gets the job done.

title: Nice hotel, great location, great staff
text:
I stayed here for the first time in January 2014, and would definitely look to stay here in the future.  The hotel itself is "good" - clean, decent sized rooms for New York, a little worn in some places.  There is a small bar in the lobby and a restaurant (didn't eat there).  The front desk was welcoming when I arrived, a nice surprise.  

The location is great for uptown and downtown locations - there are subway lines within blocks, plus you can easily get a cab.

title: Fourpoints Soho
text:
I have spent more than 400 nights in Starwood properties in the last decade and travelled the world this is their worst property (maybe after the Sheraton Heathrow in London) 
Rooms furniture are old and should have been replaced a while ago
Bathroom amenities are terrible
Water pressure is bad
Staff is disturbing you even when you have the Do not disturb sign on
I found a maintenance guy in my room when coming into it at 10am and there was no sign on the door (I'm pretty sure he stole 20 bucks from my wallet by the way)
You wait for the elevator as there is always someone from the hotel going one floor down (couldn't they use the stairs....)

In one sentence DON'T GO THERE

title: ottima posizione, molto buono il servizio
text: Dividendo in tre una doppia con letti matrimoniali (quindi, si, con qualche sacrificio) prezzo finale molto conveniente per essere a new york, in un hotel di questo livello e in una posizione così comoda. quindi promosso a pieni voti. viaggiando da soli o in due diventa forse un pò troppo caro, ma ny è così. Ottima posizione, a due passi dalla metropolitana, a pochi minuti a piedi da quanto offre Soho, dallo shopping di Broadway, da Chinatown e Little Italy, ma anche da Downtown se si ha voglia di camminare un poco di più. La zona immediatamente adiacente all'hotel in se non offre molto ma è comunque sicura e pulita. Camera, mobilia, lenzuola e bagno tutto di ottimo livello. Sufficientemente spaziosa. Personale abbastanza cortese. Sia all'arrivo che alla partenza hanno conservato le ns valigie per diverse ore alleggerendoci del peso. Poco simpatico il rifiuto di prestarci un adattatore per la corrente (si poteva solo comprarlo). Piccolo bar a piano terra e ristorante (che non abbiamo provato). A 1 ora di taxi da JFK.

title: Nice Little Hotel... Great Staff
text: Small little place in a nice locaton. I like the location for downtown restaurant hopping... away from the hubub of midtown. Rooms small but efficient. Small restaurant with bar that was convenient for a cocktail in evening and bkfst the next day. LIke the idea of accessing the hotel by car from the West Side Highway... so easy, and it cuts out all of the traffic problems of heading thru the city.  Really excellent staff... great attitude, friendly, professional. RECOMMENDED

title: Would recommend and return
text:
We chose this hotel for location - close to #1 line and also the price. Rooms are small but this is NY. Nice bathroom. Comfy beds. Always kept clean. Coffee available each morning in the lobby. Check in staff were always helpful and courteous. 
When we return to NY we will definitely chose this hotel if it is available again.

title: Good Downtown NYC Location - Poor Service
text:
I recently stayed at the Four Points, SoHo location.  This was my first exposure to the brand.

It was a cold weekend night in NYC, I love locally and am very familiar with that part of town.  I found a special online with a good price and the hotel is located within waling distance to good shopping, the subway, and great brunch locations for the next morning.

Upon arrival I found the hotel to be a solid presentation, as expected.  I went out about town and upon return from the cold, took a shower. This is where the problems begin.

The bathrooms are modernized, with glass doors... a very modern look.  Unfortunately the glass door does next to nothing to prevent water from escaping the shower stall.  As I stepped out of the shower the floor mat was soaked and there was a huge puddle in the bathroom (despite there being a drain in the middle of the floor). 

After drying off I used the only other towel in the room to walk on in the bathroom.  Then I called down to the desk to let them know the situation and ask for 4 replacement towels.  The front desk representative told me that towels would be sent up right away (9:30/10p).

11pm no towels
12a no towels

sleep.

4am I walked into the bathroom and into a cold puddle.  Imagine it.  Wouldn't you be furious.

I got dressed and caught the elevator to the lobby to once again ASK FOR SERVICE.  The night representative responded "Oh, they didn't bring those up yet?"

No, they haven't.

AT 4:15a I received part of my request. 2 Towels...

In all the location is very convenient and the rooms are solid minus the very flawed bathroom.  The service is low and enough to ruin a good deal.

title: New years eve crash.
text: So the only reason I stayed here was to have a bed to crash in on new years eve. When hotels in the city cost almost $1000 on nye, this hotel was very fairly priced for the night. It's a simple sleep in only hotel. Don't expect beautiful lobbies or art at this hotel.  The room was clean, bed was comfortable. The only thing I didn't like was the service checking in and out. I understand nobody enjoys working on holidays but the woman had the most sour look on her face, not a smile, no eye contact, no happy new year. Very rude. The room itself was good.

title: Efficient option for NY tourism
text:
Great location. Helpful staff, friendly bar as well. Clean rooms, good food. Lots of dining options around anyhow. Rooms slightly small (but it is NY!).Not
enough lifts and hence wait can be long to reach the room.

title: A great home in SoHo
text:
I have been to new york 6 times and have stayed at a wide variety of Starwood properties -- the former W Tuscany, Westin Times Square (back when it had a club lounge), Sheraton Towers, and twice at the St. Regis. So I've had a fairly wide spectrum of experiences in New York, and all of them have been very good.

Having stayed exclusively in midwotn, my wife and I were excited to call a new neighbourhood home for our 4 night stay. Prices were competitive all over (in fact, the Four Points Times Square was even cheaper), but we decided to stay here for $165/night. Given my platinum status, I chose the breakfast option as my amentity. I tried to use my "suite night" awards prior to check in, but, alas, the two suites (I think they have only 2) were occupied. 

We took Strusser's Limo Service in a nice SUV from LGA to the hotel. Our check-in was prompt, polite and efficient. They were kind enough to locate us on the 19th floor (1 from the top -- suites are on the top), with a view north. I quite enjoyed the view -- could see both the Chysler and Empire State buildings, and also the Hudson to the north-west.

The room was quite small, but welcome to New York. It had everything one could need, including electrical outlets next to the bed. The bathroom was a very pleasant surprise. Small, but a very nice full-size shower as opposed to an oppressive a nasty shower/tub combo I hate so much (Westin and Sheraton Toronto, I'm looking at you...). The room did have a bit of a smell -- I wouldn't say it was offensive or nasty, it just had a smell. Hard to explain. 

I must confess that I'm not the biggest fan of Four Points beds. I find them to be very hot -- and I hate being hot when I'm sleeping. However, I found the bed at this hotel to be extremeley comfortable. I did not over-heat, the pillows were fine (a litle over-stuffed), and the mattress quite comfortable. This was the best Four Points bed I have ever slept in. Walking miles every day also might have helped. 

Breakfast was served downstairs in the restaurant. The first morning, service was very slow -- despite there only being two other tables occupied in the restaurant. The lady serving I don't think had good organization skills. Now the remaining mornings we were served in a wonderfully efficient and friendly manner, and the experience was terrific. ;The platinum voucher, which is typically only for continental, was a dollar value that covered the main breakfast combo (3 eggs, meat, toast, hasbrowns, coffee, juice). I appreciated that very much. They didn't even bring a bill for me to sign, and when I asked for one to leave a gratuity against my room, the staff said it was included.

I REALLY liked the location of this hotel. I didn't hear club noise, or contruction noise. That said, the building is by no means sound proof, and one night was garbage pick-up noise, and it sounded like the truck was actually in my room (perhaps in the closet? -- oh wait, there wasn' one!) The view was great, and it was 1 block from the #1 subway line. We could go from our room to the middle of Times Square in about 15 minutes -- amazing! It was also a short walk to Prince and Spring streets, where all of the action, restuarants, shops are, etc. 

Because we were staying in a neighbourhood rather than a tourist mecca, it felt like we were living in New York. We really enjoyed our experience at the Four Points. If I was heading to New York and wanted to spend as little as I could on a hotel, but stay in an area I liked, and a place that I know will be clean and comfortable, I will looke to come back here. 

By the way -- New York in December is magical.

title: Promises much more than it delivers
text:
Location:
While the location of the hotel was convenient to the subway and a reasonable walk to a variety of restaurants it is actually located in Hudson Square and not SoHo. Within the immediate area of the hotel there is little to see or places to eat.

Hotel amenities:
There are two elevators servicing the hotel and the wait was at times excessively long.
The hotel bar is tiny, uninviting and on the one occasion I ventured in there, the service was absolutely terrible despite the lack of any other customers.
Free wifi is nice but very slow and at times did not even work at all.

Noise:
The hotel feels quite cheaply built and soundproofing clearly was not one of the building priorities. I could hear sounds from rooms, not only directly next to mine but also on the diagonally opposite side of the building.
The external windows do not block outside noise so the traffic waiting to enter the Holland Tunnel can be very loud during peak times. Having stayed in NYC a number times previous, traffic noise does not bother me but could pose problems for others.
Due to crazy weather I used both heating and cooling in the room. There is no central air so you turn on the individual unit in the room as required. The unit is very loud, so loud that I only ran the unit as absolutely necessary. The temperature regulation is horrible so you have to turn the unit on and off from that perspective anyway.

Room:
As per NYC standards, the room was small. This was expected and fine given I spent little time there.
Unfortunately, despite the small size due to the room layout, the TV could not be viewed from the chair in the room. Only from the bed. And speaking of the bed…

Bed: The highlight of the stay. My queen bed was super comfortable, so with the use of earplugs I did manage some very comfortable and restful sleep.

title: Aaa new york burası mı ?? Uzaylı görmüş köylü tipi..
text: Manhattan'ın göbeğinde, yüksek binaların arasında, times square, müzelere ve dahi tiyatrolara oldukça yakın bir otel. Konum on numara, hizmet beş numara.. Binalar kaç kat diye saymaktan boynum ağrıdı. Kapitalizmin merkezi olduğu için kullandığın internet, içtiğin su ve aldığın nefes parayla.

title: Great location BUT
text: The odour when you enter the hotel lobby over powers... Made me think they are hiding something.  Not sure if it is rodent related, sewage or other, but it stinks.  The elevators too.  Thankfully our room did not smell.  Rooms are small and crowded with furniture, a flat screen tv that should be wall mounted to allow more counter space.  Linens are good quality, beds are comfortable. Bathroom had been renovated in the fairly recent past.  Carpets are dated and need replacing.  The gym is quite small and busy in the mornings.  All four pieces of cardio equipment (1 treadmill, 1 elliptical and 2 bikes) were occupied 2 out of the 4 times I was in the gym.  Close walk to subway and to Soho neighbourhood.  Internet allows multiple devices, but is slow.  Front desk staff were helpful but are also responsible for all incoming calls, which makes for a hectic and congested reception.  The shuttle company the hotel uses to Woodbury Outlets is not comfortable.  I would recommend going online and booking your own transportation.

title: Solid hotel, rooms a little old
text: Nice hotel from outside, and the rooms are ok but are showing their age. WiFi was reliable but speed (1.5 Mbps) was barely good enough for voip calls. Other hotels had faster WiFi that was better for business use. The location was good, but other areas (e.g. Lower East Side) were livelier and had more restaurants to choose from.

title: Awkward? Strange?
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 6-days.  The front desk agent was very pleasant to greet me and was able to issue a room even when it was only about 1:00PM.

However, I simply don't understand the following:

*  The bathroom wash basin is regular small basin fitted with a kitchen use faucet hardware.  Every time I turn the water on, just even washing my hands - it's like I've been through a rain shower.  For a face wash, it's back to kindergarten kids, playground with water fountain splatting everywhere.  By the way, the kitchen faucet is able to turn the spout away from the basin, anyone could flood the entire bathroom and the room anytime.

*  All the track lighting in the room and bathroom feels like as if I'm an artwork in a gallery.  Is it necessary for a track of 5x spotlights?  Besides, there's no chance of reading in bed because I don't think I can even read a word on a page with lights in my face.  In the bathroom, I must be very happy with my body that I'd love to be Mr. Muscle to flex my biceps under all the lights, I don't really think so.

* Apparently, there's must be some sort of hidden alarm system that the guest can switch on for the room with a motion detector smack in the middle of the room.  Or, it's a device that detects motion of guests in the room for the security/management to see if the guests are burglars?

One of the days at the hotel, I've returned to the room with the door ajar early evening at about 5:00PM.  The housekeeping staff for that day serviced the room but didn't close it shut.  Thank God that I didn't leave anything valuable in the room.

The thing is does it matter how many stars that any given hotel was rated as?  Or is it the room rate?  It's suppose to be a place away from home that makes the guest feel at ease, secured, safe, comfortable - for the least in basics of hotel standards, in my point of view.

title: Great business hotel
text:
Overall, a well-managed property.  As others have mentioned, the location if not central, is at least convenient with with the 1 & 2 subway line (Houston) a block away and ACE lines (Spring St) two blocks away.

For a business traveler, room size is decent. In looking at the floor plan, there are only 8 rooms per floor and the rooms in the corners are slightly larger.  It would be a little tight for a couple on vacation, but it is New York.  Good size desk with a bunch of outlets conveniently located.  I was in room 608 which was facing the front directly over the hotel entrance.  Charlton is a relatively quiet side street and you're just far away enough from Varick that I didn't hear that much street noise...an occasional siren or horn and sanitation truck early one morning.  Very quiet compared to Times Square hotels I've previously stayed at.

As others have stated, free bottled water is a nice touch.  Decent TV channel selection.  No complaints about housekeeping.  The furnishing generally were good and I slept well (although I did notice the desk chair was **very** worn...almost looked like it was aged on purpose but I don't think so ;-)  Front desk staff were various degrees of friendly, but always appropriate.  I managed to leave my Sonicare in the room but housekeeping tracked it and I was able to pick it up the next day.  Good service there.

The restaurant is not bad.  I arrived very late, hadn't had dinner and the weather was bad, so decided to eat in the restaurant based on some pretty good yelp reviews.  Service was great, food was overpriced but decent and they had an OK selection of beers on tap.  I assume the same kitchen provides room service so room service would be a good option if you didn't want to leave your room.  We went here for drinks the next night and same great service.

I agree with others however about the bathroom.  Plenty of space, but in my room there was no way to keep water from the walk-in shower from forming a lake in the middle of the bathroom floor.  Shower drained very slowly and no matter how much attention I paid to keeping the door closed or the shower head pointed towards the wall...it didn't matter.  I don't think it helped that both the shower stall and bathroom floor were level (rather than sloping slightly towards the drain) so whatever water ended up on the floor didn't drain.  Also, beware that the walk-in shower is way too small for people of size (which meant I regularly knocked the shower door open).  A colleague mentioned they did not have a walk-in shower, but it might be something that is different from room to room.

And I also like to echo a previous posters comment about the amount of counter space in the bathroom (pretty much zero).  I didn't even have a place to put a normal sized toiletry kit.  This is unfortunate given the fact that the bathroom itself is decent sized.

Overall a great, dozy business class hotel with the only downside being the bathroom.

title: Amazing Staff & Location
text: I cannot say how great the staff at the Four Points Soho were.  They went out of their way to ask about our trip, and upon finding out we were celebrating a 40th birthday, sent a bottle of champagne to the room.  The view from the room was great.  The room was super clean. The location cannot be beat for Soho - a small walk to the main area of Soho, but a great bargain for the location.  Easy cab access - a great place!

title: SOOOOooooo QUIET
text:
This can't be New York City!!!!!!!!!!!
Such a great boutique hotel supported by a terrific staff at the front desk anchored by Stephanie and Co.
And I gotta tell ya, with just several rooms on each floor you don't have neighbor issues, and we never heard even one taxi Bronx cheer during our entire stay. One or 2 blocks from multiple subway options and within distance to the APPLE store and many more.
Cozy but for our MONEY, we much rather have cozy and fully functional than be paying for opulence and chandeliers.
FIRST CLASS, GREAT PEOPLE, REASONABLE.
Did we mention how quiet it was? :)

title: Don't judge by the street
text: This is a gem tucked away in Soho. There are two subway lines and a bus close by. 5 minutes up to Time Square. There are great restaurants near and lots of interesting walks around the area. Carrie's house and the Friends house make terrific photos. The restaurant is nice and Sammy was a charming host. All the staff were friendly and very informative. We particularly enjoyed the quiet neighborhood and less frantic pace of Soho.

title: Expected more from Sheraton
text: The location of this hotel is just fantastic - walking distance to lots of different attractions and close to a selection of restaurants. However, for a Sheraton branded hotel, I felt this was just not up to standards. My room was pretty dirty, full of marks on the wall and dust and the bathroom is a problem on its own, with water going everywhere the minute the shower is turned on and not enough space around the sink for your own toiletries. I was expecting more and think for the same price there are better options close enough (such as the Marriott just around the corner).

title: Walking distance
text:
Great location with all main attractions within walking distance of a couple of miles and in my opinion if your foreign tourist then walking is the best way to get a feel for New York and New Yorkers.
Room was adequate, nothing special but we only really slept there in our 3 days. The room came with complimentary water and coffee facilities. Bath room was a wet room which flooded after a shower my only real issue.
Good Value for money as room is clean, warm , good size, excellent location, friendly staff and not too expensive. If your here for a bit of romance this is probably not the best choice, It is more a place to get your head down after enjoying what Manhattan has to offer...shops, sight seeing and great mix of people.

title: Pros and cons
text:
I had a business-related two-night stay this property during a busy week. I believe I was assigned to an upgraded room type as it felt more spacious than I was expecting. I actually found the general quality and amenities at the property quite good. Free wi-fi, bottled water and coffee/tea plus a generous supply of bath and shower soaps in eco-friendly containers (mounted to the shower wall). Frankly, you couldn't expect much more from a Manhattan property than this and they do deliver on the Four Points brand attributes.

I did find the room to be quite loud. I was on the back of the property and was awakened the first night by what sounded like jackhammers. The second night there was a bad cover band playing in or around the building behind (hint: they apparently fought the law and, spoiler alert, the law won) which was quite loud and interrupted my evening.

The other issue that crept up was with the toilet flushing functionality. It was flowing poorly on my arrival and actually stopped up during my second day in the afternoon. I reported it to the front desk prior to going out for dinner and when I returned, although engineering had been in the room, it was only partially resolved.

Nevertheless, NY has its share of noise and plumbing issues. It's NY. You roll the dice and roll with whatever comes. I found this to be a generally reliable property and would return here again. The location is outstanding. It might not be my first choice but it's at least good enough to go on the list of potential candidates for a short stay in the city.

title: Ok hotel, good location
text: Staff were friendly and rooms were clean and nice. Looks like it's refurbished recently. Location is great close to good restaurants and shopping in soho and close to no 1 subway line. Don't go for breakfast at the hotel, you're much better off going to one of the excellent breakfast and lunch restaurants just nearby in spring or broom streets.

title: Top location, nice staff
text:
The hotel is close to nice stores, restaurants and metro stations.
The standard room isn`t big, but it was good enough for two.
The gym is quite small, with only 3 or 4 different equipment, but it was always empty so I could choose.
There is no refrigerator in the room.
Great staff, really helpful.

title: Great location pleasant service
text:
The hotel was well situated for a trip to New York. Close to bars and restaurants for easy access to food and relaxation and also within walking distance to many places of interest. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and polite. 

My room was higher up in the hotel and was quite, the bed was large and comfortable. I would definitely go back.

title: Excellent property, enjoyable stay
text: My husband and I have stayed at this location a few times for various reasons despite living only about an hour outside of NYC. The experience has always been consistent and pleasant. On our most recent trip we checked in about 5pm on a weeknight and were greeted with complimentary appetizers in the lobby and a complimentary glass of beer or wine each. The staff was very pleasant and despite our short stay, we had a wonderful time. Rooms are very clean, modern and well sized. Property is located near several subways connecting you to the vast city of Manhattan in just a few steps.

title: Nice location, but overpowering air freshener in the lobby
text: We stayed at the FP Soho in October while touring colleges with our daughter.  The price/value and location were very good.  Front desk personnel were friendly and helpful.  Room was clean with more modern furnishings - nothing special, but it did the trick. We were on the 10th floor facing the front of the building. Not much of a view, but none of the noise complained about by other viewers.  The one thing that I didn't like was the overpowering, musky air freshener used in the lobby. I'm not one who usually notices things like that, but this was like being trapped in an elevator with a guy who had overdone it with Axe body spray.  Thankfully, the scent did not appear in the upper floors or rooms.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Es un hotel pequeño pero muy bonito, tiene wifi, mini gimnasio (caminadora y un multifuerza) y un restorán en la planta baja. Lo recomiendo altamente por su ubicación, cerca de las estaciones del metro y de SOHO en dónde hay muchas tiendas con buenos precios para comprar. También hay muchos lugares cerca para comer todo tipo de comida y discotecas.

title: Noisy room, facing a wall ...
text:
I got a room in the lower part of the hotel. Rooms are vary small, and my panorama was a wall; but maybe that's NYC standard. In any case, it's hard to sleep well. Apart from the external noise, the airco/heating system is probably the noisiest I've ever experienced. It's impossible to sleep with it on (maybe at reception they should give earplugs?). 

Apart fro this, nothing really to write home about; personnel as nice and efficient; a bit long check-in /out process as hotel is not small and positions are limited. if I were Sheraton I would re-think the policy of adding their brand to these hotels. 

Location is very good but it comes with a price, not really justified ....

title: Noisy
text: Stayed in 8th floor but loud noise from a band rehearsing next building from 6pm until 9pm gave me headache. Reception admits the noise but couldn't accommodate me in a different room as all booked. Don't recommend

title: Great location but noisy!!
text:
I would like to give this hotel a 4 rating but our experience with noise forces me to just rate it ‘Average’ although we enjoyed our stay otherwise.

We stayed on the 11th floor overlooking the front of the hotel. The first night had continual outside  noise.  Our room overlooked a vent from an adjacent building which we thought might be the issue. The hotel is on a quieter street although close to the main street (Varick).  Despite there being no traffic outside on either street, the noise continued (it was like the hum of traffic).

In the morning the hotel was very accommodating to move us to the 12th floor facing the opposite side but the noise continued including construction noise from the lot next door.  We bought ear plugs and that made the difference - we were able to sleep for the remainder of our stay. The manager did suggest that they didn’t have double paned or insulated windows to block out exterior noise.  We had just left a Times Square hotel with no noise problems, it was frustrating that a quieter neighbourhood like Soho ended up being louder.

Despite this we loved the location. It was easy each morning to stroll Spring or Prince Street for a nice cafe for breakfast. It was also a great location to walk as far as the Financial district and Chelsea with ease and enjoyment.  Soho is amazing for shopping and Greenwich village, a short distance away (10 min walk), is a gem.

title: odalar çok küçük
text: 2çift olarak gittiğimiz New york seyahatimizde daha az para ödemek için 2 büyük yataklı bir oda tercih ettik. Odaya gerçekten yataklar ucu ucuna sıkıştırılmıştı. Valizlerle birlikte adım atacak yer kalmadı. Resepsiyondaki görevliler çok güleryüzlüydü. Fena bir otel değil tercih edilebilir.

title: Good Value in Soho
text:
New, clean Sheraton.  Good value and convenient location.
Coffee and newspapers in the lobby.
Modern small bar and restaurant, everything you need.
Service was good.  Nice big beds.  Two doubles which is hard to find in Manhattan.

title: Good, not Great
text: I am not snobby when traveling on business, but this hotel could offer a little more comfort.  I did like the gym and it's equipment.  I liked the coffee bar and thought that the staff was nice.  The location was close to my work, so I walked everyday.  It's not the Mercer, but it's a clean hotel.

title: Needs full soundproofing and new furnishings
text: The staff here is absolutely wonderful. From the manager all the way down to the cleaning staff. But when you stay in a hotel you want the rooms to be comfortable,clean and having the ability to be slept in. This is not the case at this hotel. We stayed on the 10th floor first. The room showed real signs of aging, the chairs were tattered and the paint could have been better as could the worn out desk. The toilet was broken and sprayed water on the wall. However, the sound coming from the construction site next door on Charlton Street made for an even worse night. We were then moved to a room on the 17th floor that was so small you could not open a piece of luggage on a luggage rack. This room directly overlooked the entrance on Hudson street to the Holland tunnel. Once again we pleaded to be moved. The third room was actually bigger. However the airconditioner huffed and wheezed all night. In addition the Special Halloween club that opened up that weekend for a month delivered noise all night. There were bullhorns in the street and street music and entertainment. The club itself extended through the building on Hudson Street and you could actually feel the heavy bass beat in our room. The club is around for a full month every night. I must say we fled the hotel. We were granted the ability to check out one day early and get a refund but I would have liked to have checked out even sooner. Yes you can't control street noise but you can insulate windows and walls. I should know as I live around the corner on the feed to the Holland Tunnel and have thick windows and walls. I barely hear street sounds. There is no excuse for this amount of noise leakage. This stay was one of the worst in my life. I was forced to stay away from my apartment as I was doing renovation and there was dust all over. I was forced to flee home and clean for two days instead of having a leisurely several days at this hotel.

title: Отличное расположение
text:
Прекрасное расположение отеля делает его интересным для туристов путешествующих самостоятельно. Отличный новый номер, прекрасная постель, удобные кровати. Нам очень повезло, наш номер был на 19 этаже и из окна была видна башня Эмпайр Стейт Билдинг.
Завтраки не брали, но это и необязательно, т.к. всегда можно позавтракать в близлежащих кафешках. Приветливый персонал всегда рад ответить на все вопросы. При заселении вручили небольшой бонус - капкейки.

title: Very nice hotel for the price/great location
text:
I was very pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed this hotel.  From the time we checked in to the time we left, the staff could not have been more accommodating .  The rooms are small, but very efficient.  We had a room with two double beds and it was perfect.  The room had the important essentials,  a large flat screen tv, a desk, a modern clean bathroom, great shower and very comfy beds.  If I had to say anything  negative I would mention that the fan in the bathroom is constantly on and it can get a bit noisy.
That being said I would not let that keep me away.  I would definitely stay here again. The  hotel lobby and public areas are not very big which I prefer.  The hotel almost has a boutique hotel feel to it. There are so many great  restaurants located nearby and of course great Soho shopping.,A good find in NYC.  Did I mention free wifi, coffee and water? Yep, a great find in NYC.

title: A great stay!
text: We needed a place to stay for my counsin's Soho wedding.  Four Points was PERFECT!  Great location.  The room was very clean.  The only problem we had was after the shower was used, there was a HUGE puddle on the bathroom floor, as there is only a stall (a large one, though) that's floor is flush with the bathroom floor.  The shower door did not keep the water in the stall at all.  The designer obviously did not take into account the mess that is made after one bathes.  We had to ask for more towels after we used the ones in the bathroom to clean up the floor.  Otherwise, it was a great stay.  Would stay here again....the shower thing wasn't enough to deter a future stay.

title: lovely
text: Great boutique hotel in a lovely neighborhood. Comfy bed, average size room, nice shower, free wi-fi, everything was really good in our room. Absolutely no complains . Besides beeing very close to Soho and Village, there is a subway station on the corner.   Front desk helpful and friendly. And if you are tired, the restaurant is a plus. Fair priced compared to other NYhotels. I could be a regular.  Loved my stay and would definetely come back!

title: Hotel no Soho!
text:
O hotel está bem conservado e nosso quarto era de bom tamanho para os padrões de NY.  Pontos positivos : máquina de café no quarto e internet gratuita. O restaurante do hotel é muito bom e tem preços razoáveis.
A localização do hotel é ótima , muitas lojas e restaurantes legais no bairro.
Fica longe do burburinho da Times Square mas o metro é bem perto .

title: Fantastic location, awful service
text: If you want a hotel in a great location but not with extortionate rates this is the place for you. The rooms are tiny but they have everything from large flat screens, to docking stations and all other amenities. If you stay here please eat somewhere else as the service is horrific ! Staff barely speak English in the restaurant and are just not interested in working ... Every request is an inconvenience and two waiters did not even know where the restrooms were located !! The location is superb but please just sleep and leave !

title: Excellent service!
text: A friend and I stayed here over labour day weekend and I loved the fact that it didn't feel like we were in a chain hotel but more like a boutique style hotel instead. The service was excellent. Front desk staff were always so personable, helpful and top notch! We were in the heart of soho just steps away and in the midst of it all. The neighbourhood feel made it that much more homey. Definately would come back and have already recommended it to a few friends heading that way soon. You can't go wrong here and trust me, I've always been spoilt at 5-star hotels across north America, Europe and Gulf regions via my employment so when it comes to spending out of personal pocket i Needed to be more prudent but not lose out on the service and comfort at the same time. This was it :)

title: Five Star Service++
text: Customer Service comes across as a top priority. The genuine attentiveness and friendliness of the staff was beyond our expectations. Room Service was surprisingly very good! The location was really convenient to SoHo / Tribeca. The rooms were spacious for NY standards with a clean bathtub to soak after long days of walking! I would stay here again!

title: Great location, Great staff, Great value
text:
This hotel is excellent. The staff made us feel so welcome from the moment we arrived until after we left. We had quite an ordeal getting to the hotel but were instantly cheered up by the tremendously friendly staff. Room was ideal and location is perfect. All staff from cleaners to bar staff seemed to genuinely enjoy their work and were always friendly. 

I even left something behind by mistake (a present for a friend) and the staff arranged to ship it to the UK for me which was fantastic. 

I have told several people how good this hotel is and would recommend to anybody. I will also be staying here whenever I go to New York in future.

title: Animarse al So Ho
text:
Alquilamos con algun temor por opiniones desfavorables en algunas paginas.
Realmente muy bueno para visitar Downtown y su ubicacion entre Soho y Tribeca
espectacular para conocer otra cara de New York

title: Never a problem
text: I've stayed here on business trips since they first opened and I've never had an uneven stay or poor experience. Rooms are clean, modern and quiet. Staff is always helpful. Restaurant has always had very good food and there is also a tiny bar which will serve food. There is a small workout room with free weights, bikes and treadmills. Subway is half a block away and restaurants are 2-3 blocks. The street is a bit industrial which is my only drawback. The Hudson River is nearby and about a 15 minute walk. Prices are usually higher during Fashion Week in September.

title: Good value for New York
text:
This is a good value hotel considering the location and the competition. Staff were generally helpful, and the rooms were relatively well kitted out.

The location is very handy and well served by subway.  It is a short walk into the main part of Soho.  

Minor quibble : I don't like the wall mounted heater - one would normally expect central heating for a hotel like this.

title: Just a terrific stay
text: Clean, comfortable, rooms and accomodating staff, Perfect Village/Soho location. Gym could be better; no real business center--just computer terminals next to bat--but hey--for $220/night--this till fits the bill. This is my my go-to place now, when staying in lower Manhattan.

title: Hotel bom
text: O hotel é bom , um pouco defasado no mobiliário , o bairro é ótimo e a localização tbm . Tem tudo pertinho inclusive metro p todas as linhas e um comércio excelente .Não serve café da manhã mais tem lugares próximos p tomar . O custo benefício é compatível com a cidade .

title: Great Location!
text: The hotel is located in a such great neighbourhood, and allows you to walk the streets of SoHo and surrounding neighbourhoods without having to worry about taking a cab. The staff was great, the room was very nice and clean. It was on the small side, but that's NYC for you. It was good for a couple. I would definitely stay there again!

title: Clean and pleasant place to stay in Manhattan. Convenient to two subway lines. Would stay again.
text:
We selected this hotel because we could stay here for a reasonable amount of Starwoods points. We were checked in quickly and efficiently as soon as we arrived in the early afternoon.  

As Starwoods Gold members we were upgraded to a room on the top floor. The room faced out the back of the building with surprisingly lovely skyline view, including the Freedom Tower.

The room was small but not atypically so by Manhattan standards.  Despite the built in desk and the wardrobe there's enough room to walk around both sides of the king size bed. The bathroom is also small but not tiny. One thing to be aware of is that the bathroom door is frosted rather than opaque, so if the light's on in the bathroom the room gets flooded with light.

The only real noise on the 21st floor was the slamming of other room doors which is unavoidable.  The air conditioning was very effective as well.

The toiletries are very basic with dispensers mounted on the shower wall rather than in little bottles. This got to be a problem towards the end of the trip since twice daily showers in the sticky August NYC weather drained our entire supply of shower gel.

No breakfast is included which is standard for American hotel chains. There is a perfectly acceptable breakfast/lunch/convenience store on the corner at which you can pick up a typical New York breakfast of an H&H bagel and a cup of coffee to go.

The hotel's area is convenient to SoHo as well as Spring Street shopping, including the home of the infamous Cronut. 

Best of all it is also extremely convenient to stops for the 1 and C subway lines. We would definitely choose to stay here again.

title: Pleasant Suprise!
text: Arriving on a red-eye from Los Angeles, we hoped to get an early check-in when we arrived at the hotel.  Unfortunately, they were totally booked so we left our bags and the front desk told us they would call us when a room was ready!  Wow- thanks. When we arrived back at the hotel- she said our room was ready ( it was around noon) and they upgraded us. As Starwood Gold members- that was a nice perk especially using points.  The rooms are a bit snug- but nice and clean. GREAT view from the room.  The thing I want to stress in this review was their attitude and service of everyone at the hotel- rare to find these days.  They get an A+ for customer service- we will be back!

title: Perfekt beliggendehed i SoHo
text: Et rigtig lækkert hotel med nogle dejlige værelser som ligger i SoHo. Værelserne er små men sådanne er det med de fleste hoteller på Manhatten. Dette hotel er perfekt hvis man er til shopping i SoHo og nyde alle de dejlige resturanter og det godt udgangspunkt til resten af Manhatten. Venlig personale, eneste minus er at aircondition maskinen sidder inde på selvet værelse og det larmer rigtig meget. Hvis man kan undvære aircon om natten så kan jeg kun anbefale dette hotel i SoHo.

title: Good location and price
text: We stayed there on 8/2-8/3.  We missed the hotel on the first pass, as it was hard to see, but once we found it, everything was fine.  We were in room 1502 and while the rooms were "cozy" they had everything you could need.  Good desk space, nice TV, the bathrooms were very modern and clean and the room was decorated nicely.  The only issue I had was how close the other room doors were.  I had the bed closest to the door and when the person in 1501 was entering or leaving it startled me because it sounded like they were coming through our door.  I didn't mind any of the city noise as other had mentioned.  I think our room was off the main street though (maybe?). The front desk staff was very nice and friendly and acknowledged my SPG status with a nice upgrade.  Also, valet is $55 for 24 hours, no in/out access.  Even though we called down for our car about 15 mintues prior to checking out, the car return took almost 30 minutes. Overall nice place, does the job, good location to subway, and good rates. I would return.

title: Good
text: Not a bad option if you want to stay in manhattan, time square just 5 minutes walking. The position of the hotel is very close to the bus station, no the best neighberhood but not so bad! Room are very small with not the best view, lobby not very nice and breakfast not the best.

title: Poor sound insulation windows, but would come back.
text:
Location: Not in the heart of SOHO, but it's only couple minutes walk.  The hotel is located in a quiet street with light traffic but I felt very safe walking there at night.  It's perfect if you are driving into New York City, it's right beside the Holland Tunnel and the parking we chose near the hotel was $35 per 24 hour which is reasonable. 

Subway: Nearest station is Houston station, 2 minute walk to the station and then about 10 minute ride to Time Square.

Hotel: Very small hotel.  Not your typical hotel with large lobby and hall ways.  The hallways felt kind of cramped.

Room: Not very large but reasonable size, did not feel cramped at all.  It was very comfortable.  The washroom is huge, too big in proportion to the size of the room.  Everything was clean and comfortable.  FREE WIFI which is a plus!

Complains:

**Poor noise insulation windows, when larger trucks drive by or when someone honks his horn.  It felt like the window was opened** They really need to put thicker glass on their windows.  TIPS: Get a room on the higher floor, we were on the 4th floor.  But as I said, the hotel is on a street with light traffic anyways.

Overall:

The price was great and I felt very comfortable.  The front desk people were very nice and I consider it a good stay.

title: Mucho menos de lo que esperaba.
text: Las habitaciones son muy pequeñas y para nada representan lo que se ve en las fotos.  Las paredes y alfombras están sucias. La salida del elevador hacia los cuartos es tan reducida que da claustrofobia. No volvería.

title: Great for the price
text: This is a small hotel which can be very good or very bad. Make sure you use your Starpoints card and insist on an upgrade or beware. They are very accommodating and really want to make you happy but are hindered by their space. They have a very small bar and a very small fitness room so it all works but do not bring your spouse here!

title: Perfect wedding weekend
text: We reserved a block of rooms for our son's wedding. All of our guests loved the location and their rooms were very comfortable and clean. We also hosted our post wedding brunch for 45 people at the San Marino Restaurant off the lobby. The San Marino Restaurant managers, Sami and Uma, were extremely helpful and saw that everything was done to perfection, the service could not have been better. The food was delicious and beautifully presented. The restaurant was perfect for our gathering and provided us with a nice space to bid our guests farewell. We will definitely stay at the Sheraton on our next trip to NYC.

title: Great location, clean, functional
text:
This hotel is just two blocks south of Houston St. and less than 1 1/2 blocks west of 6th Ave, making it a great location for visiting Greenwich Village and Soho. It is also easily reached by public transportation (a six block walk from the PATH station on Christopher St), so we were able to park in Jersey City, which is cheaper than parking in NYC. The front desk staff was very friendly upon arrival and at check out, and offered to store our luggage after we checked out in case we weren't yet ready to leave the city.

While the room was on the small side, it was very clean, functional, and had more than enough space for our needs, as we didn't plan on spending much time in the room. There was also no sign of bed bugs. The room was in the back of the hotel, so it was surprisingly quiet.

We would definitely stay here again.

title: No Frills With A Dash Of Style
text:
I think this hotel fits cleanly into a sub-four-star NYC hotel -- clean and comfortable, with everything you need, but nothing more. With that said, I had an enjoyable experience. The room was clean, small, and well-appointed. Everything you would expect from a big name 3-star hotel in NYC - above average in everything except space.

I checked in late, and the front desk was experiencing some difficulties with checking in. This prevented me from getting any SPG benefits. However, the service was very courteous. Plenty of breakfast and food options around the area, even if we only had time to go to IHOP's for breakfast.

The room itself was nice and stylish. AC was loud as other reviews said, but that's a price worth paying for AC in a wall unit. Great lighting, and plenty of pillows. Mad props for the soap and shampoo dispensers in the shower. Showers were strong and towels were of average quality. The view was also quite nice.

title: Clean, good value and location
text:
I have stayed at this hotel many times. It is a clean, honest and simple hotel. The location is very good. I much prefer downtown to mid-town. The staff is always welcoming and friendly. They are keen to suggest nice restaurants in the neighborhood. The rooms are clean, simple but cramped. There is barely enough room to unpack and move around the room. I was reminded of a cruise ship cabin. Bathroom was cramped as well. This is not a luxury hotel. They do give you a free bottle of water. That was nice. Major deficit here is that there are only two elevators for the entire hotel. There is a wait time to get up and down at busy times of day.

This is a nice place to stay if you are of the opinion that you are in NYC to spend time out of the room exploring and experiencing the city. If you want the 'luxury hotel experience', look elsewhere.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: I thoroughly enjoyed this property.  The lobby was small but the king room size was perfect, with the exception of the bathroom.  The bathroom nice but the sink area was small and there really wasn't room for my shaving kit, toothpaste, etc.  With the exception of the bathroom, the property was perfect.  The location was perfect.  We were within walking distance of nearly everything including Little Italy, Chinatown, and Greenwich Village.  The subway station was less than a block away with Times Square only 4 or 5 subway stops away.  When you are tired of walking around the city, the Four Points has an italian restaurant on location with a bar.  It was nice and refreshing to relax on the front restaurant patio and enjoy cocktails.  We were a little worried about the city noise but found that there was barely any city noise to be heard.  We couldn't complain about the value because we stayed free with SPG points!  There is no swimming pool or spa but there is a large fitness center downstairs.

title: Great location for Greenwich village
text: High quality for a reasonable price, has large rooms so can get 2 doubles which keeps price down if travelling with family.  Only 10 mins walk to Greenwich village centre, so great location.  Very modern, clean and comfortable.  Don't bother with the restaurant, as loads of choice in local family owned places.  Try Trattoria Spaghetto, No 28 pizza, Dennaghy's irish bar.

title: Fantastico
text: A localização do hotel é excelente, o custo beneficio tambem. Se você é Platinum aproveite o cafe da manha gratuito e consiga um upgrade para um andar superior com uma excelente vista da cidade. Fui uma vez e passei 8 dias e em breve vou voltar !

title: Friendliest Spot in NYC
text: The four point was one of the numerous hotels I stayed at during my project in New York. Though it's not the most luxurious hotel NYC has ever known, it still was the most memorable one of all. It's located off of broadway in Soho, within a walking distance of most restaurants and cool hangout spots. The staff, especially those at the restaurant/bar, made the stay very agreeable.

title: Noisy air con
text:
I will start with pros -
Good location a couple blocks from bleaker st
Clean rooms
Friendly staff at front desk
Cons -
Very very very noisy room! DO NOT stay in room 201 or any rooms that face the outdoor aircon units it is noisier than an aero plane and after a 12 hr flight not what I needed literally slept one hr that night. Complained to reception at 4am after toilet was blocked and leaking was offered a move but was only there for a night and couldn't be bothered at that time.

Would not stay again because of that experience make sure you ask room no before you book stAy away from 201!

title: Good Location Away from Times Square
text: This Hotel is in Soho. Lots of restaurants and shopping, subway close. Staff was attentive and friendly. We stayed during Christmas and the rates were reasonable. Away from noisy and tourist trap Times Square. But close to all.

title: Compact and clean
text: Clean and compact hotel.  Good location.  Near subway (Houston St) and Little Italy.  Not much in the immediate area, but you can walk to fun neighborhoods.  The rooms are very clean and neat, but tiny.   Bathrooms are very nice and modern.

title: Great location, good property at decent price
text:
The location is quite good. Subway is close, SoHo and village are close. Staff at front-desk is quite helpful and in our case went out of their way to help us plan our city tour. The free-wifi offered also has good speed.

Breakfast should have been complementary part of the room rent, but that's not an issue. There are a couple of Deli's and breakfast places around where you can drop by for a cheaper breakfast

title: looks new, good price for Manhattan
text:
I needed a safe, clean, decent hotel for my 2 sons and I.  Everything I checked was over $200 a night except for the Four Points SoHo so was concerned that maybe it wasn't in the best area, but it was GREAT!!  Looks pretty new, rooms are surprisingly a decent size compared to some closet size rooms you get in Manhattan.  Upon entry, the room and the decor are so well placed that I would have sworn the beds were queens instead of doubles (doubles being the norm in Manhattan).  The high quality beds and bedding also give the illusion that the doubles are bigger than they actually are.  I would never have thought they were doubles but management corrected me.

The hotel is very clean and well decorated.  Front desk staff was friendly, very helpful with directions and suggestions and ordered me an airport car that arrived on time.

However, the location must be odd because the two taxis that I used had trouble finding it.  The first taxi, a black car from JFK, had to use a GPS.  The second taxi, a yellow cab, couldn't figure it out by the cross streets I gave him.  I finally told him by the Houston St subway stop and he got me to the hotel from there.

I'm originally from NY and worked in the city so am familiar with subways and getting around to tourist sights so to me the location was good.  For someone new to NYC, this may be a little out of the way of the more popular areas....but for the price savings, it's certainly worth learning how the subways and taxis work and staying at the Four Points SoHo.  

You are next to Chinatown so some of the best Chinese food is in the area.  (Also close to Little Italy.)  We ate at Jazzy's restaurant located right on the corner next door to the hotel.  It's a really unique restaurant....half is chinese buffet (very delicious!) and the other half is split between a deli that serves fresh sandwiches and a grille where you can get several things like omelettes to BLT's.  The boys ate chinese and I had breakfast.  Where else can you get a combination like that except NYC?!  :)

So glad I discovered this hotel for future visits.

title: Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms
text: Fantastic location.  Subway one block away, the river two blocks away, and the Village and Soho within a five minute walking distance.  The staff were very helpful, especially Brian at the front desk and the breakfast wait staff were truly delightful.  I disagree with Mr Rogers' review below - the breakfast restaurant service was fantastic, and I was surprised at how excellent the food was, for a hotel breakfast.  Also, we were also able to get a taxi outside the hotel most times, and if not, the wait on the corner of Hudson was never more than a few minutes.   The rooms were clean.  There was construction going on next door at the time of writing, which was a little noisy, however the beds were so comfortable I had no trouble falling asleep.   Also free coffee in the morning in the lobby, which was surprisingly good and free wifi.   Overall, I was very impressed.  It seems rare to get consistent good customer service in Manhattan, however we got it at this hotel.

title: Pretty good but where do I review safety?
text:
Fantastic location, good wifi (very important to me), great staff. The rooms were well appointed and clean, the food great. 

The one let down is that the lifts (elevators) are so slow and not always working. Being on a low floor that was not too much of an issue but pity the guys on floor 21! 

As a result of no/slow lifts had to use the emergency stairs frequently and these were twice blocked with waste and rubbish in bags. 

Whilst these were removed on both occasions immediately this is really not a good practice and doubtless contravenes fire safety regulations, but also in the unlikely event of a fire could jeopardise escape. 

Overall a good stay though- the staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Perfect choice
text: I've stayed at a few hotels and I have to say I was very pleased  with Four Points by Sheraton at SoHo. The staff were courteous and professional.The room was bigger than any other hotels I've stayed at. Check-in and out was breeze. I also felt safe.

title: It does what it says on the tin
text: This is a really good FourPoints. They are a dependable brand that delivers. This one is no exception. Great service with a smile, good rates, decent sized rooms, the Gym is equipped but small and the restaurant is great.

title: Kind staff returned lost diamond
text: About two hours after checking out of the Four Points Soho, I discovered the centre diamond of my engagement ring was gone, claws and all. I was devastated and immediately began retracing my steps. I called the hotel to see if anyone had found it. Not only did a real human being answer the phone right away (a miracle!) but that person shared my concern and went off to see if anything had been found. It hadn't but she took my name and number and promised to call if they found anything. Ten minutes later, Patricia called back. Kenroy in housekeeping had found my diamond on the bathroom floor! We immediately returned to the hotel. Patricia and Marissa were on the front desk and were very happy to have helped find my diamond. I asked to speak to Kenroy to thank him in person. He came down and I thanked him profusely. But when I tried to give him some money as a reward, he refused, several times. He said he was just glad to have helped. I was completely impressed with these employees -- their kindness, their concern, their help and their honesty.  And besides all that, the hotel was a great place to stay!

title: Acceptable, but nothing special.
text:
Not in the heart of SoHo, but located a few blocks away from great restaurants, shopping and the train, so nicely convenient.   The staff is friendly and helpful, and the property is kept quite clean.  The rooms and gym are definitely on the small side, but it's New York, so that is to be expected.  Clean linens, modern bathroom, free WiFi, flatscreen TV... all of the things that you expect from a Starwood property.

The one thing I found laughable was the bar.  8seats inside a 12ft "aquarium".  My comment to my self is if you need to drink there, you should stop drinking.

All in all, it's a fine chain hotel if you're looking to keep the price manageable in a town of outrageous prices.  It's not a hip & swanky boutique... but you knew that when you clieked on Four Points.

title: Only minor complaints
text: Basically all went well. The rooms are small but well designed. I have a few minor complaints. The bathroom door is mostly plastic that doesn't block the light so if someone goes to bathroom in middle of night and turns on the light, the light shining through will probably wake the other person.  The A/C fan could have been quieter. And though it's a small hotel, it's tall, so you may have to wait a bit for elevators. Arrived on a Sat afternoon and found street parking so that was a big plus. I've lived in NY all my life, even went to NYU in Village and had never heard of Charlton Street. Turns out Prince Street ends at 6th Ave and becomes Charlton. There's no real reason to go to Charlton as there's not much around but a short walk takes you to either West Village or hopping Soho so location is really very good.

title: Não está no centro do Soho, mas está muito perto do metro que vai levar você para onde quiser
text:
A qualidade Sheraton se nota desde o principio. Nosso quarto era bem grande para o que esperávamos. O hotel tem restaurante, oferece água, máquina de café no quarto e internet gratuita.
O serviço de limpeza alguns dias não foram impecáveis, porém não tivemos nenhum problema. O hotel tem 8 quartos por andar, o que deixa o lugar com clima aconchegante.
A localização é ótima,perto da região alternativa do Soho Village, Chelsea, porém longe da badalação do Times Square (se é isso que vc procura, esse não é seu hotel). 
O metro vai te levar facilmente a todos os lados, não se preocupe.
Estou muito feliz com minha escolha.Ficaria outra vez facilmente.

title: Great value and service
text: I can't say much more than the previous reviewers. Keep in mind that four points is the lower end of the Starwood chain. That being said, the service was excellent. The location is good-close to soho shopping, Little Italy and Chinatown. The 1 train giving easy access to the upper west side and midtown is just a block away. The rooms are small as us the property in general, but this is Manhattan folks.

title: Great for Business Travel
text: I arrived in NYC on a Thursday morning for a business trip at about 11:00 am.  I was pleased to find out that my room was already available and I was able to move my luggage in immediately.  The staff was friendly and extremely willing to help with any request.  The bar on the bottom level had very good local beers and was a great way to end the night.  Gym facilities were small, but considering the size of the hotel it was not unbearable.  The free internet was a plus and the view from my room was gorgeous.  everything was very clean and the bathroom was very modern.  Even the desk area was much bigger than i had anticipated.  It is located right in the middle of SoHo so plenty of shopping in the area as well.  Overall, very pleased with my stay.

title: Friendly service, but costly.
text: The positives include location, location, and location. SoHo is a wonderful area of NYC and close to the 9/11 memorial. The staff were friendly and accommodating. Rooms were very clean, and the bathroom seemed newly renovated. Negatives include very small room and bathroom. We were 3 adults in one room and had trouble navigating if all of us were up at the same time. There were two elevators only that tended to be slow and rather small in size. The free coffee downstairs in small lobby disappeared quickly. (Found coffee there only once in three mornings; individual cup coffee brewer was in room.) And, yes, it was very expensive, but then everything is expensive in NYC. Three night stay cost $1,200.

title: Perfect NYC home base!
text: We travel up to NY to visit family.  The Four Points will now be our "home."  From the Holland Tunnel, getting to and from the hotel is a breeze with street parking on weekends a plus.  The lobby is small and Euro feeling as is the bar with a little patio.  The rooms was small, but not horrible - cozy.  Everything was fresh and clean.  Best pillows ever!  The neighborhood isn't the liveliest, but it is a short, safe walk to great dining and shopping in West Village, the Village and Soho.  Just loved it.

title: Top quality location, top quality staff
text:
You stay here for two reasons: location and the staff.

Location is ideal for most aspects of Manhattan, either business or pleasure. It's a 2-min walk from the subway with direct links to midtown and the financial district, Central Park and the Battery. It's walking distance to the great nightlife and restaurants of SoHo, West Village, etc.

Then the staff are just great. The layout of the lobby (long and thin) means that you have to walk past them every time you come in and out and they *always* say hi, every time. And not in an 'I have to' way, but in a genuine, friendly way. They know Manhattan as well as the concierge in any top hotel, they can sort you cars to the airport, you name it.

The hotel itself is fine, rooms are a good size for Manhattan, there is small restaurant and bar but I have to be honest and say that there are better places to eat and drink nearby. Also, the rooms *can* be noisy, try to get a room as high as possible and ask if it has AC noise at night. 

But genuinely, this is the best place I've stayed in New York, love it.

title: Noisy, narrow, non-caring, no-go
text: If you like noise, this is your place!  The loud club music pumping from the speakers in the tiny front desk area sets the bar.  Add in the slam, slam, slam of the heavy metal doors from the rooms.  Layer on top all night construction right next door.  Finally, top it all off with the constant blare of car horns, because this hotel is right next to a major freeway entrance, where cars constantly block the intersections on red lights, leading to explosive horn honking, non-stop during commute times.  The restaurant is surprisingly expensive, and supremely forgettable.  I ordered a side of potatoes for $7, and got six potatoes cubes!  That's more than $1 per 1/2" cube!  The front desk did nothing about any of the noise issues, even refusing to turn down the music they had cranked.  Did I mention the halls are so narrow that you'll freak if you're at all bothered by small spaces?  Be prepared to back up if someone's coming the other way with luggage.  There are so many great hotels in NY, why bother with this lousy property?

title: The Best Service and a comfortable place to stay
text:
The Four Points Sheraton Soho is my home away from home.  I travel a ridiculous amount of nights a year for my job (over 250 nights in hotels in the last 2 years) and stay at a lot of hotels - both fancy and not so fancy.  The Four Points Soho is one of the hotels I stay at the most often, and when I walk in they know me by name. 

The hotel is a perfect location for lower Manhattan with easy access to the subway, some great restaurants, and a short walk over to Soho for some of the best shopping in the city. 

The rooms are comfortable.  It's not the Ritz with flash, but you get all you need and the beds are great.   In the past the wifi has been a problem, but they just upgraded the wifi and it now works like a charm....oh, and it's free too.  

The reason to stay here though is the staff.  They are great!  They are super friendly and always willing to help you out with anything they can.  Seriously. the staff here are probably the most personable and nicest of anywhere I've stayed in the world.  They go the extra mile, and they always greet you with a smile.    

I'm tough on service.  I've stayed at 5 star hotels and have only had a 2-3 star experience.  This hotel gets a 5 star experience rating from me.

title: First rate each time
text: This coming Friday will be my fourth time staying at Four Points Soho this past year. Each time, no matter how busy, the staff is unfailingly courteous and helpful. The room is always immaculate, coffee is great (important) and it almost feels like a bed and breakfast, because of the welcoming (yet professional) ambiance. I used to live in the city so I really appreciate having a hotel of this caliber to go to when I need to come to the city. I cannot recommend the hotel highly enough!

title: Para ir de negocios y no dormir más de 2 noches
text: Habitaciones cómodas, no pretensiosas, buen tamaño, excelente ubicación, cumple con la finalidad al ir de negocios menos de dos noches, camas cómodas, baño limpio, muy bien ubicado, es el típico hotel de negocios, la wifi funciona perfecto, no me percaté de nada malo....

title: Very good location
text:
The girls and I had a great time in NYC.  The location of the hotel is perfect for what we wanted to do.  Cab fares were <$10 everywhere.  The subways are only a few blocks away.  Bars, restaurants, etc. are within walking distance.  

The room is small, but clean.  The gym is small too, but it had a treadmill, an elliptical, and bike.  There's a restaurant downstairs, and the hotel provide free newspaper, free wifi, and free coffee.  

The cab fare is about $50+tip to/from JFK, which is about an hour away.  There's a food court thing around the corner.

title: Great Location
text: We love this hotel, primarily for its location. It is very well located for exploring Greenwich Village, SOHO, Tribeca, and more. It is a bit of a distance to mid-town, but not impossible. Our room was comfortable, but we did have some issues. The lighting in the bathroom is awful. It is difficult at best to shave or put on make-up in the bathroom. The main room is not a lot better. There is a nice "desk" in one corner which is usable for computing, coffee brewing and an ice bucket. It is not really suitable for putting on make-up since there is a goose neck lamp. The lighting over the bed is OK, but not really bright. This is also not a very well insulated room against noise. The only way I could sleep comfortably was to use ear plugs.

title: Met our needs
text: Liked the SOHO  location and near subway stops. Clean, comfortable and nice staff who seemed genuine. Room smallish but great bed and bedding. Was quiet on 17th floor facing  back, around corner from elevator. Did not eat there- lots of places to get breakfast nearby.

title: Básico y caro
text:
Hotel tremendamente básico, sin apenas servicios.
La habitación era de tamaño suficiente (según los stándares de NY), pero el baño minúsculo, y el armario parecía una caja de cerillas. Limpieza correcta.
Lobby pequeño, bar casi agobiante, restaurante claustrofóbico. Solicitamos el desayuno como parte del regalo platinum de bienvenida pero era tan escaso y pobre (una triste rebanada de pan tostado, zumo de naranja en polvos, confituras baratas y el espresso que encima habías de pagar aparte) que decidimos prescindir de él y acudir a las excelentes bakeries de los alrededores.
Lo mejor: el personal (simpático y amable, es cierto), las vistas (si te toca una planta alta) y la ubicación (si te interesan los barrios circundantes).
Lo peor: el precio carísimo de las habitaciones, un descomunal abuso atendiendo los servicios prestados.

title: Great location, reasonably priced, friendly staff. Good value for NYC
text:
My second visit to NYC and I was 
keen to avoid overpriced midtown hotels this time. This hotel certainly fitted this Criteria. I have 5 starred this based on the price. Was good value for what else you could get in this city. Room was good and very clean.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  The immediate location was not prettiest in New York but you are on doorstep of Greenwich and SoHo which is great. I particularly appreciated the complimentary beer and food one early evening. Was totally unexpected and I was looking for the catch.  There wasn't one!

title: Excellent
text: Clean, cool, nice, cheap, great position, nice n funny staff, free fast internet, ipod station for music, gym. Big big bed confortable. It got everything. My favourite hotel. Soooo good, almost unbelivable. I love it.

title: Week of madness
text:
Loverly staff very helpful. Great location. Nice and clean. Room very small. Bit on the basic side. Restaurant naff, eat anywhere else.
Love all the nearby cafes and lots of walking. Met some nice local natives.
Coffee at reception would be a good idea.?

title: Lovely
text:
The Sheraton Four Points Soho is a relaxing, boutique like, hotel located in the western part of Manhattan's Soho District.  My wife and I have stayed here a number of times.  The staff is pleasant, the rooms are inviting and the location is quiet.

It is within a couple of blocks of New York's Greenwich Village where there are hundreds of great restaurants.  The staff is very responsive.  The rooms are clean and the hotel is a good value!

title: A great little hotel near Soho
text: We have stayed here on several occasions over the last few years. The hotel is located on a quiet street in an office building area west of soho and south of the west village. It is especially quiet over the weekend which often allows for street parking (free) within walking distance,over the weekend The rooms are fairly small but the place is immaculate with great bedding and free wi-fi. The staff could not be any nicer and it is a reasonably priced choice for NY. SPG members are treated very well.

title: Good for more experienced NYC visitors.
text: I have been to NYC many, many times and I enjoyed the location of this hotel for its proximity to Greenwich and the Houston Street subway station. For those looking to go to NYC and to all the traditional tourist activities I wouldn't recommend this location. The front desk was very curteous and helpful! Room was very clean and bathroom was very nice.

title: Great Location, Great Front Desk
text: Only a few blocks south of the West Village, this hotel is modern, well located and has a great front desk staff on all shifts. Room was small - NYC standard - but modern and well appointed. Everything worked and lots of outlets for electronic gear. Lots of nearby food choices. Would stay again.

title: Great little hotel.
text: This was my first time staying in Soho -- I was limited on choices and being a Starwood Platinum member I decided to stay in the SPG family.  A great little hotel for the price -- the bed was great, the shower amazing.  The restaurant is also pretty good -- but there are many choices in walking distance so I wouldn't limit yourself to the hotel food.  The staff was also great -- my one complaint is they don't put the free coffee out until 7 and the in room stuff is not worth the water you need to make it.  When I wondered down to the lobby looking for coffee the guy working the desk, Elliott gave me a dollar to run across the street and buy a cup from a street vendor who works early.  It was great customer service....thanks Elliott!

title: Great location, friendly service
text: We really enjoyed our stay at this Four Points by Sheraton. The location was fantastic - a few blocks from the heart of Soho, and a few blocks from the West Village, too. Our room was quite spacious - I believe it was a Superior King, so not the smallest room, but not the largest either. I found it to be large by ANY hotel standards, not just NYC. The staff was extremely friendly. Our room was impeccably clean. We arrived to find the sink clogged (so we thought) - turns out the stopper was just down, BUT when the building engineer unstopped it, the pipes started leaking! He returned promptly to fix the situation. While it wasn't the best way to spend our first hour in the room, he was quite professional and fixed the problem more quickly than any other hotel I've stayed at before. No, this isn't the Trump Soho around the corner, but you're not PAYING for the Trump Soho. If you're looking for that kind of luxury, pony up the dollars and stay there. Otherwise, check out the Fourt Points. It's a great spot for a reasonable price. I'd much prefer to stay here for the location than one of the SPG "luxury" hotels in another area of the city.

title: Great base to explore NYC
text: You should be spending very little time in your hotel room in NYC, although located in what seems to be a random street this small hotel is the perfect base to explore. The beds are super comfy, the shower is great and the staff friendly and accomodating. The walls are thin but we were so exhausted by the end of each day it wasn't an issue. You are a very short distance from 2 subway stations Houston(1 min) and Spring Street(3-4min) which can bring you to Times Square, Central Park, 911 Memorial, Century 21, The South seaport pier Brooklyn and Macys to name but a few. Its about a fifteen minute walk to China Town/Little Italy and walk a couple of mins up  Prince Street to an amazing selection of shops from Prada to Michsel Kors then  on to Broadway for Victorias Secret, Adidas and Hollister to name but a few. Buy a $30 7 day unlimited metro card each and enjoy NYC. My daughter took a real shine to Marissa who greeted us everytime we arrived and departed.

title: Molto comodo e in posizione strategica
text: Il Four Point by Sheraton e' una catena non pretenziosa, ma di buon livello e con rapporto qualita' prezzo buona. Io ci sono stato nel 2011 e il rapporto tra euro e dollaro era davvero molto favorevole, in ogni caso credo che anche con rapporto di valuta meno favorevole sia un'ottima strutture da consigliare. La posizione dell'hotel e' molto centrale e ci si puo' trovare in Time Square in un attimo ma anche a Central Park e nei principali musei della citta', inoltre la zona e piena di piccoli ristoranti e locali molto carini molti dei quali raggiungibili a piedi. Le camere sono un po' piccole ma confortevoli e nota negativa, il servizio wi-fi, almeno all'epoca, era a pagamento. La colazione non e' proprio un gran che, e visto che e' a pagamento consiglio di farla fuori in uno dei molti locali che offrono varieta' di breakfast uno piu' gustoso dell'altro, tappa obbligata per questo "Pastisse"..... Buona permanenza al Four Points di New York Soho

title: Chance of noisy neighbors: Very high!!!!
text:
