Let me start by saying that my wife and I love this neighborhood. We are ok with the fact that this hotel is not in the prettiest section of the village, but it is very close walking distance to many great bars, restaurants, and west village attractions.

However, what I am not ok with is the noisy neighbors we had when we stayed in October. There was some sort of bachelor party in the room next to us that would stop making loud noises all night. The paper-thin walls and very tight hallways amplified the problem. Even on a quiet night, because the hallway is so small and doors so close, you can constantly hear your neighbors come and go (even if they try and be quiet).

What compounded our particular problem was the fact that we were staying on the Starwood preferred floor (i am a gold member) and despite complaining to management several times, the noise roared on unabated. To management's credit, they did tell them to keep it down, but they did not stop. 

I booked the room with points and management offered me a partial refund. I called Starwood and got a complete refund of my points for that stay. 

The moral is be warned: the chance of you hearing loud annoying noises is high.

title: Practical but with NO CHARM.
text: This Four Points hotel suited us perfectly since we were hoping in staying in the SOHO area at a lower cost. The location was perfect but in an area that completely lacks in charm, but you are a few blocks away from the heart of SOHO. The staff is kind and gracious, very attentive to guest´s needs. The hotel itself has no character and lacks creature comforts. Our room was small and not very well thought out, our air-conditioner was a horror story in itself. It basically had two options of use, on and off. So either you freeze or you face the heat. And in all it was an OK experience, I can only recommend the location.

title: A decent hotel with great service = great price/value.
text:
We stayed here for over a week and although this is not an overly-fancy hotel, there is absolutely nothing wrong with it.  I’ve paid twice the amount for worse rooms in NYC.  The rooms are decent-sized (for NYC) and clean and the service is really great.  Seriously, the folks working there are professional and friendly and really do care about your stay – from the front desk folks to the cleaning ladies to the bartenders, etc.  They often have happy hour snacks and the small (seats 8 or so) connected bar makes you feel at home (that is, if you have a bar at home).  The gym is really small with 2 bikes, 1 treadmill and some barbells.  There’s not much room in it but if you need a workout and are at all creative, it will suffice.

Downsides are that there are only 2 elevators and it’s slow going in the morning.  Also, it’s in SOHO but the immediate surroundings are more business/commercial than residential so it’s dead on the weekends.  That said, there’s plenty of action within walking distance.

title: Friendly and Gracious Staff
text: This Soho Hotel is a good value for the location.  Rooms are compact but clean.  What stands out is the staff that greet you when you arrive, particularly Elizabeth and Nicholas, and they greet you every time you come and go.  Their warmth and helpfulness make this a great stay, and there are lots of fun small shops everywhere, as well as excellent restaurants.

title: A sensible choice
text:
No complaints really. Friendly staff, quick & easy check in and check out, decent sized rooms with free bottled water (not sure if it was coz I was a SPG), good location near the 1 train and walking distance to West Village, Greenwich Village and main shopping areas of Soho and restaurants nearby. 

Walls can be a little thin and you can occassionally hear people in the hallway but not enough to disrupt sleep. And I couldn't hear road traffic from my room which is a plus.

title: What a gem right in SoHo!
text: We booked this hotel as a girls weekend with my niece and sister-in-law.  We used Starwood Points planning on getting a regular room with 2 double beds.  There were no rooms like that available at check-in so they bumped us to a suite.  The room was big for Manhattan, there were 2 couches and large TV in the main room (pull out bed) and a king size bed in the bedroom.  The hotel is sleak, clean and much exceeded my expectations of a Four Points.  The lobby has a nice little fire place with couches, there is also a small bar for drinks and an italian restaurant on the property.  We walked to delicious food and great shopping in swanky SoHo.  Definitely will stay here again!

title: Love the location
text:
I stayed here a year ago, and have to say, it was definitely one of my favorite locations to be in when in the City.  That said, I love SoHo, so if you want to be away from the 'center of it all' this is the place to be.  The cons:  the elevator for sure (but that is a common problem in the more 'boutique size' hotels in the City..just leave a few minutes extra time) and it wasn't the most soundproof, although I've stayed in much worse in that department.  Pros:  friendly staff, again...LOCATION!!...you can walk to Chelsea Market, Morimoto, Spice Market, not to mention, there are a lot of quick food options right around the corner.  Also, there's that fabulous Sheraton bed, and my personal favorite, which could be a downside if you have small kids with you, but the windows open!!  Might seem like a small thing to those who don't visit Manhattan often, but for those of you who know what I'm talking about you get it, right?!

All in all, great value, and I will definitely check prices here first before looking anywhere else.

title: Really a great place in the new Manhattan
text:
Room:  We stayed in a deluxe king on the 18th floor, corner room.

Great room, spacious for a boutique hotel.  Very comfortable.  The free standing wardrobe is a bit small for a long stay, but a weekend or so, no problem.

What makes this hotel a good place to stay is that it has a full service dining room, unlike the Marriott around the corner.  Breakfast are good and, for NYC, real cheap!  Service is very nice.

Location is perfect for the new Manhattan.  So much is now south of 14th street, and this hotel is perfectly located: near subways, a walk to SOHO, the West Village and Lower Manhattan.

There are downsides.  The doors to the rooms look like metal, but I think they are made of paper.  You can hear everything that goes on in the hall.  Slamming doors and late night going on woke me.  The rooms are not very sound proof from the outside world. Even on the 18th floor the sounds of traffic were a bit disturbing.  However, I could not hear a thing from any adjoining rooms.

The hotel staff cannot be friendlier and more courteous.
 
All said and done, this will be our place to stay when in NYC.

title: Great Base!
text:
Have just returned from a four night stay at this hotel with a friend.  The location was absolutely great for us - just a couple of minutes walk from Houston Street Subway (1) which got us to Times Square in less than 20 minutes.  Walking distance to Greenwich Village.  

The staff were efficient and courteous and our room on the fourth floor was absolutely fine for our needs. I had been concerned about the issue of noise, particularly having read the comments made earlier about the building work going on right next door, but while we were there, the site was deserted.  We had asked to be moved higher but during our stay one of the lifts was out of action.  Being on the fourth floor meant we could take the stairs which was fine for us.  The managment recognised how irritating having a lift out of action was for guests and laid on free lunch for everyone on the Friday, by way of an apology.  Nice touch.

The heating worked well and the beds were very comfortable.  There wasn't enough drawer space for the two of us - travelling in early Spring meant we both had quite a few jumpers, but it was just a minor thing.  

Room came with a tea/coffee maker and an ironing board and iron.  Free coffee also available in reception in the morning.  We didn't eat in the hotel but had breakfast out - there's a diner right on the corner of Charlton and Varick, a few steps from the front door and also an IHOP on Varick!  

The bathroom was clean and well lit and the bath although small, was a welcome bonus as I was expecting just a shower. The shower itself had good water pressure but the best thing about the bathroom for me was the fantastic little hair dryer!  I need to style my hair rather than just dry it and it was great... Minor point to many, but a big bonus to a few!

I 'paid' for our room with Starwood Points but my girlfriend paid for her daughter's room.  She felt that it represented very good value for money.

All in all, I would recommend this hotel - we have already agreed that when the time comes for our next trip, we will be staying here.

title: Little space for luggage
text: Very good location, right next to the galleries and restaurants of Soho, but in a very quiet area. The welcome is warm and efficient but the laundry service sent our clothes to another apartment. The main problem is the lack of space for 2 medium sized bags.

title: A great little find (value) in SoHo
text:
The Good
Location, location, location- if you want to be downtown
The infrastructure- modern
The prices (if you book right...it can be compelling value)
The amenities in the bathroom- way better than other Starwood properties I've seen (in the midrange)
Funky Bathroom decor
Comfortable bed and large TV

The Not so Good
Elevators get a bit congested and crowded and long to wait for 
Lobby is small which compounds the 'rush hour crush' you can feel 
Insulation between the adjoining doors of certain rooms- ie two doors in the hall to two different rooms- when one slams, you feel it in your room- and yeah soundproofing is not perfect...light sleeper like me whipped out the earplugs.
SMALL ROOMS....glad my GF wasnt there with her suitcase as I think we'd have suffered

Overall, I really enjoyed my stay because the bed was comfortable, the amenities were pleasantly surprising, the location was perfect for my needs and at this price, there is no way I could have found better value.

Would recommend and stay again.

title: Boa localização
text: Hotel próximo da estação Houston de metrô, com grande facilidade de transporte. A equipe é ótima, atenciosa, eficiente. Os quartos são muito pequenos - como quase todos em NY -, o banheiro também é muito pequeno. Ótimo custo x benefício. Hotel muito limpo, camas ótimas. Máquina de café e chá nos quartos.

title: Between average and very good
text: A pity that TripAdvisor doesn't allow for an evaluation of simply "good". The best thing about this hotel (besides being right next to our office in NY) is the staff.  Very, very friendly and helpful.  The rooms clean and functional but average.  Closets are too small, and everything that is screwed into the bathroom walls (towel racks, shelf under the vanity, etc) is either wobbly or hanging at an angle.  I've stayed at this hotel often, and every bathroom is like this - the contractor seems to have screwed the fixtures into the drywall directly.  Otherwise, the value for money is good, but this may be due to corporate rate we have.  If you are impatient, do not take a room that is high up.  The (two) elevators are quite slow, so take the stairs.  Also, there is a major construction site next to the hotel right now.  No major noise this time, but this could change.

title: JAZZファンには最高のロケーション
text: NYのホテルはブランドに関係なく高い。ここはシェラトンの低価格版のハズだが実際は本家より高い事もしばしば。何と言っても場所がいい。セーフティボックスがない等欠点もあるがまた泊まるでしょう。

title: The perfect hotel
text: A very nice hotel. This is the third time in less than a year that we stay there. The staff is fantastic. They are friendly, always willing to help you and give excellent advices. Rooms are small but nicely decorated and most important very clean. We travel a lot and this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in.

title: Quick stay downtown!
text: I booked the room online 5 hours prior to check-in. Considering the location of the hotel, it was the best value I ever paid for a room in Manhattan. The room is small, very typical of NYC no-frill hotel configuration, clean bathroom/shower with strong water pressure and super attentive front desk staff. I was very happy overall and will take advantage of it again given the low-rate if I need a place to stay downtown for the night/weekend. You can easily walk to SoHo, Tribeca, Chinatown and the West Villgae to shop, dine and just simply explore the different neighborhoods.

title: Perfect for a business stay, great location
text: Really good for a business stay, the hotel offers anything you need, great bed and mattress. Size of the room is very correct, clean and everything you expect. Only small downside is that's a bit busy you can hear the traffic all the time but I think like in lot of area in NYC (and I am also very sensitive to noise when I sleep. but I would say bring your earplug just in case.) And the airco/heater system is a bit old and is also noisy. Location wise although it's awesome a 5mn walk to spring street and the beginning of Soho with all the great shop and fancy bar and restaurant. Moreover, I was on the 14th and had a great view!

title: No complaints: excellent value in NYC
text:
Having spent three nights at this hotel in December, I can definitely recommend it for those who are looking for a good value in SoHo. We did not expect large rooms and were therefore not disappointed, but they were tasteful and clean; the bathroom had a larger shower which was a plus. Free bottled water was in the room. 
The staff was very friendly and helpful and even had a US/Europe plug adaptor for sale, which helped us tremendously. The hotel has a restaurant attatched and a small bar area, and two computers with internet access. 
Breakfast was not a problem, as there were two places within 100 yards of the hotel. The nearest subway stop was 150 yards away and walking to the Village, for instance, was certainly no problem. 
Recommendable for those looking for comfortable accomodations at a reasonable price.

title: Very good, for what it is, a no-frills hotel
text: Spouse and I just had Sunday night stay here.  It is very good for a no-frills hotel: small room, only a shower (no tub).  However, the room was clean, the water hot, the drains good, the staff friendly.  Room on 19th floor had very large wall-mounted television, but not a great channel selection.  There as an in-room safe (inconveniently located on the floor of the closet), one terry cloth bathrobe, and very good lighting over the bed.  The room had a great view looking downtown: we could see and hear traffic approaching the tunnel.  No problem for us.  This is New York, after all, and there is always traffic.  For our one, Sunday night stay, the price was reasonable for the Soho location.  There are several restos withing walking distance.

title: Excellent Cost X Benefit Ratio
text:
The main reason for me to stay in this hotel was a good cost-benefit ratio. I needed only a few hours of sleep to follow in my connecting flight, but the hotel surprised me positively by the friendly staff and great location.
The room was within the standards of NYC, but well decorated and comfortable. The internet was free.
The location of the hotel allows you to be within a few minutes walk from the best shops and restaurants of Soho, all with a great cost.
I recommend!

title: I Will Stay Again
text: I am a frequent business traveller to NYC and this will now be one of my top choices. The room was a good size (have stayed in much smaller spaces in NYC) and the King bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and clean with black marble tile, decent amenities and nice bathrobe. The bottled water is free!!! (yes, free). The desk is a good size and there was a large safe in the wardrobe (I did not use it though).The staff is very friendly and seem to genuinely care about your experience there. WWD is provided at the front desk. Only minus for me, internet was too slow to get much work done. Will return though.

title: Excellent value in category
text:
Good location next to subway stop, good size rooms, clean and comfortable. 

Got a very pleasant room with great view on Midtown, thanks!

Staff at reception are friendly and responsive to any problem that may arise. One of the better Four Points around.

Some minus : quality of room service food is just ok, avoid unless very hungry ;-).  I found the internet to be quite slow, you have to log in ever so often, a bit of a pain.

title: Typical business hotel
text: Great staff, and a location with a 5 minutes walk to Soho. Fine for a business trip in the area, not a hotel I would holiday in. Big comfy beds, powerful showers and prompt room/maid service each day.

title: Gut und ruhig gelegen
text: Mein Aufenthalt im Januar war okay. Die Heizung jedoch lässt zu wünschen übrig. Vermutlich ältere Klimageräte. Fenster sehr zugig, so dass es bei 0 Grad oder darunter nicht mehr angenehm warm wurde. Davon abgesehen relativ günstig, etwas ab vom Schuss, je nachdem worauf man Wert legt. Personal sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend.

title: Clean and nice, but nothing special
text: Stayed at hotel for a weekend in the City.  The hotel is clean and relatively quiet but nothing special.  The neighborhood is fairly desolate at night but safe.  Only a short block to Prince Street and Soho.  All the employees were very nice.  Check in was a little slow.  Room was average size for NYC, but clean.  Good bed, climate control, bathroom.

title: Great hotel. I love staying here.
text:
I just finished up a 4 night stay here. I have nothing but positive things to say. I have been staying here the past 4 years for work and must say, this hotel just keeps getting better. The company I work for is just a few blocks from here, so that is another huge plus. Their front office manager Patricia was awesome to deal with and helped make my stay perfect. The whole team here go out of there way to make sure you have a good stay. 

The rooms are nice and clean. Modern amenities, good food in restaurant/room service, and great location. One of the best values in city.

title: Comfortable room, loud location, front desk staff great
text: I stayed here for a business trip. Check-in and check-out were both at odd hours; the front desk staff was available without any wait, supplied me with my random sundries request without hesitation (shoe shine kit) and held my bags for hours after checkout while I finished meetings. The bed was very comfortable and dark with the curtains drawn. Only two complaints, and only one of which is within the hotel's control: The neighborhood was very loud overnight (and I'm a former New Yorker, so it wasn't just random passing firetrucks) and the service over breakfast was inexcusably slow.

title: Amazing View
text: I had a really good time staying at this hotel. The gentlemen at the front desk were super friendly and personable, and they gave us a room with a really good city view. The room itself was small (as you would expect from a hotel in downtown Manhattan), but it was very nice and well arranged so that it was still very comfortable. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was great. The patio area downstairs is a great place to have coffee if you'd prefer a street view to a skyline view. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.

title: Beat starwood property in manhattan.
text:
I recently stayed at a few different starwood hotels in the city, not only was it the best. It was the best by far and i got way more bang for my buck at four points.
Fyi, patricia caruso, the gm at the property is one of the most considerate, easy to work with, compassionate and understanding professionals in the hospitality industry i have ever encountered.
Cant wait to get back to four points!

title: Excellent desk staff
text:
I've stayed here a few times now for work and I've always had great service from the front desk staff.  The gentleman who is the evening supervisor is super friendly and helpful.  The rooms are small, but adequate. Free wifi & bottled water are nice touches. My room views have always been of the construction site next door.  The beds are very comfy and the bath/shower is nice, except the sink faucet fixtures really bug me- the control is weird and it will very easily spray you & the room with high pressure scalding water.  The bath vanity is tiny and there is virtually no storage space.  

The San Marino restaurant serves excellent Italian food and decent room service breakfast.  Sadly I had awful service dining in for dinner my most recent trip.  I was forgotten in an empty dining room for nearly an hour.  Hire some servers, dang it!  Room service is the way to go unless they get their act together in the dining room.  Bar staff have always been very nice, although the size of the bar area makes me feel like I'm sitting in a tiny closet.

title: Friendly and Helpful Staff
text: I wanted to stay somewhere other than Times Square and to me Soho was the place I wanted to be. We planned a girls shopping trip and staying at the Four Points was perfect for our kind of trip. Kind of off the beaten path, not so busy and touristy like Times Square. Staff was fun and helpful. And a little Dunkin Donut shop across the street to get a cup of coffee and donut in the morning.

title: The most wonderful hotel staff I have ever encountered!
text: I just spent four days at the Sheraton Four Points Soho Hotel (NYC). I have traveled extensively in the States and in Europe and I have never encountered such a wonderful staff. Everyone, without exception, went out of their way to make my stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. The room ( a single) was completely comfortable, clean, and quiet (3rd floor). The restaurant food was great and the restaurant staff also wonderful. By coincidence I celebrated my birthday there one night with a friend and the waiters brough a slice of cheesecake (gratis!) with a candle on it. Wonderful, wonderful place, great, safe neighborhood near a very good movie theater and lots of restaurants and cafes. I had many friends visit during my stay and every one of them was impressed by the appearance of the hotel, my room, and by the hospitality they encountered. I totally recommend this hotel.

title: A Great Surprise
text:
Stayed here for two nights on business.  Have only stayed at Four Points once before, on an unplanned 'airport stranding' so I didn't know what to expect.  The price was great and location perfect for meetings I had planned in Manhattan.

Arrived to excellent service from desk staff and manager.  Throughout stay, staff was extremely helpful, polite and willing to accommodate.  The service style and responsiveness was typical of what is found in very high end properties, and which unfortunately is rarely found these days.  This includes housekeeping, as my room was extremely clean.  Big kudos to staff and management here for running things so well.

Bedding was incredibly comfortable, shades sufficiently dark, bathroom well appointed (but the shower is quite small).  The desk chair in my good size King room was quite worn and needed replacing.  Other than that no complaints about maintenance or condition.  

Location is good for subway, West Village, Soho and all the restaurants found in those areas.  If you get this at a reasonable price it is a true bargain for NYC, and a pleasant stay as well.

title: Great service and location
text: Great staff-friendly, professional & service-oreinted.  Wonderfully convenient and non-touristy with a nice view.  Big city feel with cozy atmosphere (not overwhelming and impersonal as many NYC hotels can be).  Bed was comfy, bathroom clean/modern/great water pressure, decent size for a NYC room, convenient bar & restaurant on-site but would recommend adventuring out (great choices very close by-ask the hotel staff for suggestions-the 2 they gave us were very good).  Have used the hotel twice and will surely return again-consistently positive experience!

title: Ottima l'accoglienza
text: Le stanze per new york sono spaziose e con tutti i comfort. Il personale sempre gentile e presente. Vieni accolto sempre con una ottima bevanda calda (caffè o cidro di mele caldo) e con un sorriso. Ottima la posizione  dell'Hotel vicino alla metro. Di negativo da segnalare i lavori nei palazzi vicini e soprattutto  la vista dalla camera (meglio tenere le tende chiuse). La strada dell'albergo è anonima e di sera deserta.

title: Great location, standard hotel
text: The location is great, no question but there is nothing completely special about this hotel from a purely structure, look, feel point of view.  And that's fine, it offers what you need.  The rooms are standard New York size (compact), the hotel bar is of the same variety (compact) however the staff more than make up for any shortcomings.  They are friendly, welcoming and very helpful. Would I stay again?  Maybe, it's a good back up if other options are limited.

title: Great West Village location
text: Great non-touristy location, lots of delis, shops and bars nearby and close to the subway. Loved staying in the West Village. Hotel clean and well maintained. Free wi-fi very useful, staff friendly and helpful. Room was warm, comfortable and had everything we needed. Didn't use hotel bar or restaurant as so many great places to eat and drink nearby. Free coffee each morning in the lobby was a nice touch, as was the complimentary bottled water in the room. Would stay here again.

title: Nothing remarkable, good SoHo location
text: Staff was amazing.  Asked for a high room with a view and got it (empire state building view from the bed!).  Room was NY small as was bath, but bed was comfortable and shower was great.  Skip breakfast and head to Chelsea market or one of the other fab places nearby.  Parking garage they recommended was 5 blocks away...

title: Average stay.
text:
Our room was 10x10. Our bed was the whole room. There is a place to hang your clothes but room was terribly small. I know it's New York and you don't get a lot for your money but I would not suggest this place if you are traveling with children, which we don't. For the amount of money you pay for a 10x10 room your  better off finding a better deal. We never hung out in the room because we felt super claustrophobic. Bathroom was descent size. 
You hear EVERYTHING your neighbors are doing, yup that too, and when the doors shut it wakes you up. Annoying how close you are to them. 
Elevators were probably the most annoying as they have two but it takes about 10 minutes for it to hit your floor. 
Overall, we had a decent stay. Oh btw, breakfast downstairs is NOT worth it. For 15 bucks you get a greasy breakfast that has enough salt in it to create a small Dead Sea. 
We'll try another place next time.

title: Bra hotell med bra läge!
text:
Första natten hade vi ett rum som var blåsigt (!!) och kallt. Klagade och fick direkt ett nytt rum, uppgraderade till ett delluxrum på 18e våningen. Ett varmt och trevligt samt betydligt större än deras vanliga rum. Fick dessutom frukost som kompensation!

Ligger perfekt i utkanterna av Soho. På 10 minuter är man mitt inne i Sohos shoppingkvarter, Ytterligare ca 10 minuters promenad så är man i Little Italy och Chinatown!

Bra service av all personal och det finns inget att klaga på, mer än att det är byggt med riktigt dåliga fönster på alla våningarna upp till 15e! Sen är det perfekt.

Hittar man deras rum för runt 125 - 130 $ så är det ett mycket prisvärt hotell! Rekommenderas!

title: Great location,  very helpful staff and good value.
text:
Stayed from December 14 to December 20. 
All staff very cheerful, welcoming and helpful - especially for first time visitors to New York. Pleasant room. Perfectly clean. Not large, but not paying a large price. Good value for N Y City. No noise issues on 5th floor. Great location for food lovers - a few minutes from MacDougall Street and Prince and Spring. Close to sub way(do use it, it's quick, safe + cheap).
PS - lobby size is small but quite adequate!

title: Friendly & Convenient Downtown Hotel
text:
We stayed in this hotel just before Thanks giving for our wedding.  The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Elizabeth and Emily.  As soon as we mentioned we were getting married they found us a very nice room with a view of mid town Manhattan and free drinks at the bar.

Our flight home was delayed by 8 hours and the hotel staff made sure we got through to the airline for an earlier flight and arranged taxis at very short notice.  Honestly don't think we would have made it otherwise so thank you so much.

As others have mentioned the location is excellent for shopping, restaurants and bars in Soho and the village.  One shopping tip would be to bare in mind that the shops have big brother equivalents up town which do have a wider range in stock.

One minor gripe from the hotel would be that the lifts do tend to get quite congested around major check in/out times.

Other than that this hotel suited us perfectly and we'd highly recommend it.

title: The PERFECT Hotel
text: Great location, within walking distance to Little Italy, China Town and SOHO. Particularly close to the Subway as well, making it very easy to get anywhere in New York. The service was exceptional. I reserved a twin bed room, and they gave us two double bed rooms instead with no extra charge. The front desk staffs were friendly and more than helpful to help us with the direction. However, like many hotels in the USA, they will charge you for the bottled water.

title: non un hotel di lusso
text:
Camere piuttosto piccole, hall piccolissima, bar minuscolo ( 6 sedie al banco e basta ).
Servizio attento , cucina ai piani senza infamia e senza lode.
Letto comodo ma con un solo comodino e senza luci per la notte , armadio minuscolo .
Riscaldamento / condizionamento rumoroso.
Adatto per soggiorni brevissimi ma non economico.
Posizione buona, a due passi da tutto ciò che cont a Soho,  anche se attualmemente nel mezzo di grossi lavori di costruzione.

title: Thanksgiving 2012
text:
I found an excellent deal on this hotel through Expedia. I had communicated with Patricia C prior to arriving about setting up transportation to & from the airport & where to have Thanksgiving dinner. I felt I had a friend even before my arrival & was looking forward to meeting everyone. We had a warm,friendly welcome & were given a room on the top floor with an amazing city view. EVERYONE of the staff was friendly & went out of their way to provide prompt, excellent service. We were always greeted by staff whether coming or going & they had excellent advice on local spots. I do agree the bathroom lay out was small & logistically difficult & the door was not well sealed, we could see the hall light around the door. Nothing is perfect, but our stay was pretty close to it! I do not usually return to the same hotel twice, but will stay at this one everytime I visit the city.

Subway access is one block away & easy for connections. SoHo shopping & dining are a pleasant, short walk. For the location, it is relatively quiet since it is off Varick & down a side street. There were always cabs available out front.

title: Good location, terrible internet, noisy HVAC
text:
Deceptively named (and not the only one to be), this hotel is not *in* SoHo but in Hudson Square (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hudson_Square), which is *adjacent* to SoHo (which ends 5 blocks away at West Broadway St) and to the West Village. Since both of these are a short 5 minute walk, the location is incredibly attractive.

The hotel is still relatively new (circa 2008) so everything still works and looks good, with a few minor scratches here and there; it has HD TVs (with HD service) and free Wi-Fi throughout. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, and the rooms and are clean. Beds are really comfortable, a brand standard. Rooms are New York tiny, and those at the lower floors (probably assigned to those who seek "deals") do get traffic noise. The hotel has both an onsite restaurant and room service, but given that the restaurant is unrated and the huge proximity of amazing eateries within a short walking distance we've never tried it; same with the bar, which is tiny. It has no lobby space to speak of.

The one HUGE mistake the designers made is to skip on central HVAC: not only this is an environmental disaster, but the cheap window-mounted units are LOUD. And I mean REAL LOUD. The room also lacks blackout curtains so instrumental for jet-lag recovery: just a flimsy plastic shade with ample light leakage from the sides.

Finally, the Wi-Fi quality was absolutely abysmal (graded F- on speedtest.net), to the point where I cannot return here if I have serious business (Skype calls with the team, etc.) to do.  Given that from what I read it costs an hotel 8 cents per room per night to provide internet, they seem to be incredibly shortsighted.  I would expect them to address this and hope that managements adds a response here about it.

title: Nice Location and Good Service
text: Recently stayed with family and friends at Four Points - Soho Nov. 20 - 24 2012. I had planned this trip for a mini Family Reunion centered around the Thanksgiving Holiday/Parade. We reserved rooms well in advance (6months) of our trip and wanted to stay in Soho to get a different aspect of the city since we have been many times before and stayed mostly in midtown. What a NIce surprise this hotel is. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by staff and though our rooms weren't ready yet we  were offered storage for luggage until they were. The staff also asked if we knew where to park our car and I said I had researched a place about 8 blocks away. They asked at what price and offered a garage around the corner (3 blocks) that matched the price I had. When we returned later that day and were given room keys we made our way to the storage room. We collected our own luggage (which I thought odd) and carried it to our room (again I thought odd - we were never offered a bellman to take the bags for us), this was my only minor complaint because later in our trip I saw bellman assisting others with luggage - maybe none were available when we needed them? When we got to our room it was CLEAN and Fresh with a Modern look to the room - not the typical outdated, painted over and over again look many Uptown hotels have. There was a small couch in the corner (which ended up being a luggage rack for us) and a desk area to work from in the opposite corner. Only 1 small dresser with 3 small drawers and an armoire that had a safe and an iron and board if needed inside. The room was small but we expect this when coming to NYC. Each time we left or entered the hotel we were greeted by staff and they always seemed in good spirits. The Subway is only 1 block in one direction and 4 blocks in the other direction - so very close to the hotel. There are a few nice places to eat nearby or to stop for a glass of wine and appitizers. Overall I enjoyed our stay here and would stay again - maybe next year.

title: Nice Stay
text: The staff of this hotel was very nice and attentive.  We arrived early and were able to get into our room well before the check in time which was also very nice.  I would say the size of the rooms is average for NYC.  I agree with some other reviewers that the sink in the bathroom is too small.  My only real complaint was that the walls seem to be a little thin (we could hear our next door neighbors tv) and there was minimal sound proofing around the doors which meant you could hear others coming and going.  The location is very convenient to downtown and the subway.

title: Hôtel bien situé pour visiter new york
text:
Nous avons séjourné 5 nuits. 
L'hôtel est très bien situé, station de métro à 300m. Le quartier soho, Greenwich et tribeca sont très proches à pied.
Sinon l hôtel en lui même est un 3 étoiles assez classique, rien de particulier à dire. Attention, il y a des travaux sur le trottoirs d'en face et les fenêtres laissent pas le vent. 
À l'accueil, le personnel est assez sympa mais ne fait pas d'effort pour ceux qui ne maîtrisent pas l'anglais. On a pu laisser nos bagages toute la journée le dernier jour donc plutôt sympa.

title: Great service and beautiful room
text: We planned our first trip to New York two months before our arrival date of Friday, October 26 with a planned departure on Monday, the 29th. Who knew Hurricane Sandy would be in town too? We loved our 20th floor room with a huge window and great view. Although the room was New York small, the furnishings were lovely: granite and marble spotlessly clean and elegant bedding. As Sandy set her sights on our area as well as others nearby, all that glass and the possibility of no elevator seemed ominous. This is where the outstanding staff took over. First, they had learned our names at check-in and greeted us warmly anytime we passed the front desk. They offered us another room if we wanted to be on a lower floor. Any request we made was promptly accommodated, and we felt if we wanted to stay and ride out the storm, they would be very conscientious about our comfort and safety. We did choose to rent a car and drive out before Sandy hit, but if we return to New York, we would definitely stay at the Four Points in Soho again.

title: Ottima posizione.
text: Come ho detto, ottima la posizione! Vicinissimo ai quartieri più belli, quindi soho, village e meatpacking ma...il prezzo è molto alto considerata la struttura. Le camere sono piccole e discrete, nulla di eccezionale, allo stesso prezzo avremmo trovato di meglio. Ottima la gentilezza del personale, giovane e molto molto cordiale! Wifi gratuito e caffè in camera sempre disponibile.

title: Cab drivers were not familiar with Hotel
text: Nice NYC hotel with reasonable amenities. Staff was welcoming and courteous.  Room comfortable although the small sink with strong water pressure led to much laughter in our room.  Wi-Fi worked well.  Great breakfast.  Sole concern with the hotel is that the cab drivers did not recognize the hotel name and location.  Through 4 different cab drivers, we found it necessary to repeat the name and address, and give them side streets to enable the drivers to find the hotel.

title: Tight fit
text: This hotel was easily worth the money for the convenience of being downtown right next to everything in Manhattan.  But it was very small and I felt that the in-room amenities were sparse compared to other places I've stayed at in New York.  I wasn't able to try the breakfast, although I found the workout room to also be quite cramped and dingy.  Sort of like working out in a locker room with no windows.  I don't think I'll come here again, but don't take my word for it.  Take a look at it for yourself and then decide.

title: Good place to stay without the frills.
text: We really enjoyed our stay here. It is a low frills type of hotel, no concierge or porters angling for a good tip and this made a nice change from the other places we had stayed. We had a king room on the 20th floor with a city view of the Empire State building and the Chrysler building in the distance which was exciting for us! The room was a reasonable size,  nicely furnished, comfortable bed,small but nice bathroom, good coffee maker and had a safe which I feel is a necessity when travelling. The free Wi-fi was a bit intermittent. There was very little noise from adjoining rooms. The staff at the desk, behind the bar and in the restaurant were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant is nothing special. There is a small bar which was a nice place to have a pre-dinner drink and to meet a few fellow travellers. The bar menu was good value. There is also an outdoor area but it was a bit too cool to sit outside. Soho is a great place to stay in NYC and the hotel was not far from a subway. The rates were not cheap on weekday nights but we did get a few extras thrown in by being members of the Starwood Preferred Guest Program.

title: Superb Service & Location
text:
Always been quite a far of Sheraton, I have stayed in this hotel chain through various cities around the world. The room is rather spacious for NY standards. The staff always greet you by your last name which is a great touch to the servicing quality. The aircon in the room may be a little distracting if you are light sleeper. 
It was my first time in NY and the staff was very helpful when I had a difficult to flag down a cab to pick up my other half from JFK as it was at the peak hour (4pm to 8pm). The staff guided me the route from subway to Air Train that will take me straight to the desired terminal with a cheap cost of $7.25. Very thankful for that. The wifi is excellent in the room. The location is excellent if you want a slightly less crowded place like Times Square. There are some restaurants nearby and the Italian restaurant at the lobby was pretty good. There are chic hotels around but give this a go if you like.

title: Posizione perfetta, ma MOLTO caro
text: Questo albergo è in una posizione perfetta: nel cuore di SoHo, vicino al Greenwich Village, a due passi dalla metropolitana. Le stanze sono pulite e curate, con un letto molto comodo. Il personale è estremamente gentile. Nota molto dolente: il prezzo (circa 300 euro senza colazione). In questi mesi sono in corso lavori di costruzione di nuovi edifici proprio di fronte all'albergo. E' quindi da evitare nel caso in cui si sia sensibili ai rumori esterni (ahimé gli infissi non sono proprio all'ultimo grido, ma questo è un "trend" generale in tutta NYC...).

title: Away from the crowds, for a price
text: I'm a big Sheraton fan.  Actually Starwood all round - they're terrific.  And the Soho Four Points isn't bad at all.  If you like Soho vs Time Square then this is a good location, friendly staff, clean and nothing that you can fault.  The only issue sometimes is the price.  I've stayed at the Trump for a lower room rate - fix that and it becomes a bargain business travel location.

title: Nice hotel with bad wi-fi
text:
The hotel looked relatively new.  The rooms weren't too bad size-wise for NY standards that is.  I had a room with two double beds and didn't find it too cramped at all.  There is free wi-fi in the hotel but it really doesn't work well at all.  If you need wi-fi for work I would suggest you stay somewhere else.  The wi-fi works great in the lobby but that's all.  

There isn't much in the streets directly around the hotel but a short stroll up and you'll end up at Greenwich village where there are tons of food and bar options.  The subway station is just a few minutes away.  If you like to walk it's quite easy to use this hotel as a base for exploring the city.    

If you're looking to go for a run, the promenade along the Hudson River which is only a few minutes away is a great place to go.  It's a nice alternative to running in Central Park.

title: Truly terrible
text:
This hotel is terrible value for money. Although the rooms are of a high quality, the rest of the hotel is a disaster. The staff are rude and incompetent – everything ranging from it taking over 3 hours to get a robe delivered to the room (and 3 phone calls!), messages were left at the front desk and never delivered, and staff refused to help with luggage from the fifth floor when the lifts were broken. The restaurant might be one of the worst I’ve ever experienced with inedible food and wine and yet more rude staff. 
So terrible in fact, we checked out half way through the week and into the Iroquois in midtown which was cheaper and so much better.

title: Great Place to stay
text: Staff is always friendly, the rooms are extremely clean and secure.  Rooms are small but most of them in NY are, good location for the purposes of my trip.  The bar is small but welcoming, did not eat in the restarurant as there are too many other choices nearby.  Would stay there again!

title: Strike Team
text: Recently we were deployed to help out the City after the Hurricane, unfortunately we had no place to stay, we were sleeping on floors and cots.  After numerous attempts to other Hotels in the area and their prices kept creeping up and up we needed a place to stay at the government rate because that rate is what we get reimbursed for.  The manager and staff were excellent in meeting our requirements and assisted us tremendously especially in difficult times.  Whenever i get the chance to come back hopefully as vacation I will be staying here.  Thanks again for your assistance...

title: Better than expected
text: Stayed for two nights in late October.  Used my SPG points to pay for the room so wasn't expecting much but i was pleasantly surprised.  All of the desk staff I dealt with, regardless of shift, were very helpful  and friendly.  The cleaning staff were also very friendly and accommodating.  The room was quite small, even by NYC standards, but was well appointed with fresh decor; not at all worn or dingy.  Plenty of hot water and water pressure in the shower, both of which can be an issue in some NYC hotels. Room was on the 18th floor and had a south facing view of lower Manhattan.  Would certainly consider staying there again , though it would depend on what rate i can get given small size of the room.

title: Perfect for short stay
text:
I loved staying here during Thnksgiving break....
It's tiny, yet lean, comfortable room and bathroom. Location is excellent,  super clean, and friendly! it's not cheap, but hey, its Manhattan! We loved that we could come in a 4 am after parting in the city with kabobs and they even gave us napkins! Highly recoomend it.

title: Rate went up drastically when left early due to Hurricane Sandy
text: We made reservations for this hotel for 4 nights from 26-30 Oct 2012.  But due to Hurricane Sandy we left on Sunday the 28th of October, 2 days earlier than planned.  Southwest Airlines charged us more too but that's another story.  Our initial rate for the 4 days was $265.50 plus tax. When I went on-line to change planned dates, the rate for the two days went up to $382.50 plus tax.  So I was penalized $234.00 for the two days that we stayed there for knocking off the last two days of the stay so we could get out of town before the storm hit.  i complained at the front desk about the price change when I checked in and when I checked out but both people said that they could do nothing about the price.  So a letter to the company is in the works,  The room was very small. Bathroom amenities (except for a small bar of soap) are in pump bottles that you and every other guest before you has used and are attached to the shower wall.  The only good thing about the stay was that we left a day before the hurricane hit and didn't have to walk up 12 flights of stairs to get to our room since all of lower Manhattan lost power. Our son lives 1 block away from the hotel and his power is still out.,

title: Perfect for a little getaway
text:
I've stayed in dozens of NY hotels, and this is one of the most modern, convenient, and clean for the price I paid.

The rooms are small, as others are saying, but they are very clean and the hotel is wonderfully updated. We stayed on a higher floor, so no problems with noise at all.

We had a car and in the evenings, there was no shortage of parking in the area. Also, the location is fantastic as just a few short blocks away you'll find lots of restaurants and cafes.

Definitely a place we will revisit in the future.

title: Clean and ok for a base
text: Stayed here on a business trip and although the rooms are quite small, they are very clean and the bathroom has a good shower room.  It's very noisy outside but that's to be expected in New York.  Soho is a great area to use as a base if you want to stay somewhere other than Times Square.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Didn't try the restaurant, there is a small bar and I  do mean small and a small patio outside with tables.  Easy to get taxi's and lots of places to eat within a short distance.

title: Compact but can walk to villages
text:
We could hardly walk around our room after we packed the third suitcase full of shopping. Tiny but clean bathroom. 
The hotel is perfect for walking to Soho, Greenwich village and NoLiTa. We just loved Bleeker St, Spring and Prince Streets...cafes, pastry shops, indie clothing boutiques etc, and Balthazar!!!
Also near Fire Engine Museum.Fun!
Staff were so incredibly helpful. Front desk knew great restaurants, cafes. Couldn't have been more energetic, enthusiastic, or eager- they honestly seemed to be enjoying their work! Great to see.

title: You couldn't pay me to stay here again
text: Windows allow every sound outside to be heard in your room - traffic, rock band studio next door (playing wearwolfs of london) and construction. Air conditioner SUPER loud. View was horrible and location of tv was to the side of an armoire which you had to navigate around to change the channel when sitting on the side chair. Bathroom was nice, staff were very friendly and the elevator decor was good. Location is NEAR soho not really in - you have to walk a few blocks and there is not much right around hotel. Until you call the entrance to the lincoln tunnel a destination. Was near subway lines.

title: Clean Hotel in a Good Area
text: If you're looking to stay in a decent hotel in SoHo, this is the place. As typical NY standards go, the room wasn't very big. I stayed here with 2 of my girlfriends (so 3 of us in the room) and it was a bit cramped. However, it's not like you stay in your room for very long. The front staff desk is very friendly and the rooms are clean. The hotel is located within walking distance of the subways (Houston I believe is the closest one) which is wonderful and an easy walk to SoHo, NoLita, and everything else in downtown Manhattan. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking for something in the SoHo area.

title: Great Little Spot
text:
Recently started using SPG more (over IHG Ptiority Rewards) and have been very pleasantly surprised.  

Just spent three nights in NYC (frequent traveler to NYC/former NYer) at three different Four Points SPG hotels.  All were great. 

First and foremost they treated me like royalty and recognized my Gold membership level (you couldn't tell by the treatment there's a higher level). 

At the IHG properties I've stayed at--unless I'm at an Intetcontinental the other hotels in the group act like I'm doing them a favor for having their highest level; Ambadsador Platinum.  The little freebies are never there, you can't get late checkout (only Intercontinental) and the service is basically cold.  

At this Four Points Hotel (all actually) the hospitality and service were top notch.  
I'd liken this hotel to an Indigo (brand wise.).  The room I had was large by NYC standards. It was even bigger than the step up W hotels in the same chain.  

The bathroom was especially well appointed and modem.   

Location is perfect.  

You really couldn't ask for more for the price point.

title: Very Pleasant Stay
text:
I normally stay in midtown when visiting NYC on business but this time stayed in Soho as we were attending a family wedding. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and the location of the hotel close to transit and great restuarants. There is free stable internet - big plus and coffee & tea available in the lobby in the morning. 

I would certainly stay there again.

title: Convenient location, friendly service
text:
The reviews are true, the front desk staff are very friendly and seem genuinely happy to help you which they did the few times we approached them.

The location is excellent between 2 subway lines and a short stroll into Soho.  We've stayed in NYC a few times and mostly around Times square and we definitely preferred this.  Soho feels like a neighbourhood over the hustle of times square and with easy access to the subway, you can get everywhere quickly.

Rooms were comfortable and typical New York size small but they were clean and the beds nice.  Elevators could be slow at times but I think it would be more of a bother if you're at the top floors.  We stayed on the eighth and there always seemed to be one on the way down.  Air conditioning unit was loud and could annoy you.

Free wifi was fast!!

I will definitely return.

title: Praise of the employees
text: The personnel were extremely cordial, helpful and accommodating. Excellent customer service. My room was more than adequate. Emily at the front desk was just wonderful. The Thursday night happy hour was an added pleasure.

title: really nice hotel
text:
Stayed for the weekend September 27th till October 1st. really liked the location of this hotel, hadnt visited Soho before, it really is a smart fun place in NYC.
From check in to check out we really could not fault this hotel, reception staff are ever so friendly and courtious, especially Nicholas, what an asset to this hotel he is. 
there are plenty of nice places to eat in the vicinity.
On the evening we arrived there was a note in the elevator inviting everyone to a welcome glass of wine in the lobby that evening. that was a lovely touch. We will be back!!!!!

title: Handy location
text: I can't comment on value for money, as my brother paid for the room, but I understand that it was pricey but typical of New York.  No surprise with small hotel room, nice bathroom and very handy to everything.  Some nice restaurants nearby.  Staff at reception always friendly and helpful.  We could hear air conditioning fans operating - looked out window and we were just above them.  Some construction about to start next door, so if I was staying there again would ask if I could have a room on the other side of the building.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: Hotel is greatly located, right in the middle between Houston and Spring metro stations. Very close to a lot of good restaurants, but in a quiet street. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the staff was very responsive to our every call. The TV was not working in our room and they even replaced it on the spot!! The rooms are also quite spatious for being in Manhattan.

title: Decent value, nice, quiet location
text: We stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton in SoHo in mid September.  Although the bathroom was very small, the hotel was clean and the staff was very nice and helpful.  We loved the location. Quiet, close to the subway and SoHo neighborhood is so quaint.  We would definitely stay there again.  Only complaint was it was very expensive (every place was during the week we were there). We used Starwood Points and were glad we could.  We didn't feel it was worth $400 a night.

title: Buona struttura in ottima posizione
text: Camera di piccole dimensioni, arredi minimal di buon gusto, armadio poco capiente, letti molto comodi. Non c'è firgobar ma disponibile macchina del ghiaccio al piano, contenitore apposito in stanza e quotidiana fornitura in camera di 2 bottiglie da mezzo litro d'acqua gratuite. Anche il bagno è piccolo ma funzionale, asciugacapelli e prodotti d'igiene disponibili. Non abbiamo avuto problemi con il condizionatore, che funzionava regolarmente e non era particolarmente rumoroso. Il servizio di pulizia e cambio biancheria è stato perfetto, personale di reception competente e disponibile, hall piccola ma confortevole, servizio efficiente di deposito dei bagagli per il giorno di check out. Non abbiamo fatto colazione nella struttura contigua all'hotel perchè piuttosto cara, ma nei pressi diverse buone soluzioni possibili (noi preferivamo, anche se distante qualche centinaio di metri, il Getting Hungry (centrifughe immediate di frutta e verdura, pietanze calde e fredde, dolci e salate, servizio rapido e cortese). La posizione è ideale per le visite, i locali, lo shopping, la metro è a pochi passi. Il rapporto qualità/prezzo è soddisfacente.

title: Location Location Location!
text: I've stayed at this hotel three times, I think that says it all.  The location right on the edge of the SoHo couldn't be better. Just a block away from all the great places (day or night) makes this hotel the perfect spot for a weekend getaway, although I've even stayed here for a week for a business trip. The rooms are small, but not tiny, really OK for NYC. The price varies a lot, for $200, (hard to find these days), it's a bargain.  NYC has many boutique hotels and that's just not my thing!  I like contemporary style with comfort and that's what this place offers. They even have a little restaurant with inside/outside seating if you just don't feel like going out. Staff is super friendly.

title: Very friendly front desk
text: We didn't need any amenities for our trip this weekend, so can't speak to that.  As with many hotels' free wifi, their network is slow. Nothing new there, bring your own hotspot or be patient. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and neat. The shower stall (converted from original bath tub) is pretty narrow and be careful not to slip on the slippery when wet tile floor! We didn't but it looked scary. The front desk staff  was the most cheerful we've met in a long time. Especially Nicholas late at night. Thanks for that. The room was quiet, but nothing fancy, and not much larger than the king bed. No view to speak of, but location was what we wanted- we didn't visit to stay in the hotel room all weekend, afterall.

title: Perfect for weekend stay
text: We stayed here for a long weekend in September 2012 and it was perfect. Clean, comfortable, great location and the hotel staff could not be friendlier. It's just a few blocks west of SoHo, an easy walk to the Village or Meatpacking district and an easy taxi ride to TriBeCa.

title: Over priced
text:
Even for NYC standards, and that's saying something.  What did I get for $500 / night, weeknight? A room slightly larger than the bed, a coffee pot that sprayed coffee everywhere but in the cup, and a tv remote that wouldn't function.  That said, it was clean, the bathroom black marble and shieck (though shower only, sigh), and a great location with a really friendly staff.  But, call me old fashioned, I couldn't help but think I could stay in a suite at the Phonecian for almost the same rate.  It's just over priced.  Maybe the solution is to cough up a bit more and stay higher end? I don't know.  I feel like it was the worlds most expensive La Quinta.  Hard feeling to shake. And, I'm not thrifty.  If I was, I probably would have ad a hissy fit.

The restaurant for breakfast is a typical NYC nook.  I found it charming, if the choking poster on the wall from 1920 did turn me a bit off.  For lunch, I sat outside, and my raviolli was really good.  

The staff is on happy pills which is always great to see, and took a bit off the feeling of being bent over.  But just a little.  Starwood needs to take a look at the pricing structure for these basic inner city hotels.  What makes them attractive is the value.  The value here was lacking.  I'd rather have spent a bit more for luxury, ar less for basic.  As it is, I felt, rightly or wrongly, I spent on luxury and received basic.

title: Friendliest staff ever!!!
text:
We wanted to stay here for 7 nights but upon arrival (8pm) we were told that our reservation has been cancelled. This happened because Booking.com sent us a wrong email (long story...). 

So we didn't have a room for the next 7 nights. But the really helpful staffmember, Nick(Nicholas), tried his best and found us a hotel in the neighborhood to spend the night. Fortunately we could spend the remaining 6 nights at Four Points. The next day Nick arranged for us to check-in early which was great. The staff on duty immediately knew what happened the day before and checked us in very smoothly. Again staff is very friendly and helpful. 

The room was small but clean. Bathroom was nice but also a bit small. Not a room to hang around in. Just drop off your stuff and head back to the city. The room and lobby also have free Wifi which worked fast enough most of the time. 

The location of the hotel is great. There are uptown and downtown subwaystations only 1-2 blocks away. It's near the SoHo neighborhood but in a quiet street. 

All in all its a great hotel, with super friendly staff, to stay in if you want to explore New York. I'll recommend it to anyone!!

title: Will suffice
text:
Starwood Gold Member. Spent 5 nights on the front end of a business trip to celebrate our anniversary. Used points for our stay. (5th night free promotion) Easy access by car service from Newark Airport. Reached out to the hotel manager via LinkedIn prior to arrival but did not hear back until I pointed it out to reception after check in. 

Arrived at the hotel at 2:50 p.m..Was told that our room was not ready but it would be only 15 or 20 minutes. Waited in the lobby in the small lounge and watched three parties behind us get their keys and head upstairs. After 45 minutes had passed, I saw the front desk clerk in street clothes and leaving for the day. I approached the new clerk and was told our room was ready. Wonder how long we would have waited had I not inquired again.....Requested king bed in quieter spot regardless of view.

Room assigned was 1106. No doubt these are a bit smaller than your typical Manhattan rooms but it did have the necessary amenities for a comfortable stay. Spent 30 minutes trying to log into Wifi until I finally called down for help. They sent up some technical help who said the signal on that side of the building was weak and sometimes you had to stand by the door??? So I am standing in the doorway of our room with my laptop in hand and still could not get a strong enough signal to connect. I used my Ipad via 3G the rest of my stay.This room was also handicapped accessible but the differences were subtle enough for us to let it go. That is, until we used the shower just after checking in. Glass enclosure was barely wide enough for me to stand in and the design allowed for water to leak constantly onto the bathroom floor. After two showers, the bath mat and another towel were completely soaked and the floor still had standing water. The tile floor was like walking in ice.  I told my wife not to use a hair dryer while standing in there and I went downstairs to request another room. When I voiced my frustration to reception about my check in snafu and safety hazard in that bathroom, I was peppered with excuses. He (Nick I think?) ultimately assigned us a new room and sent us help to move to room 1002. Bellman was friendly, helpful and apologetic. This room, while comparable in size, was layed out differently and it offered more usable space. There are few rooms on each floor so slamming doors and housekeeping in the hallway will likely be disturbances regardless of your location. Noise seems to travel inside the halls.

Came back that night to a bottle of wine and fruit plate for our anniversary. Nick also sent us some drink tickets for the lounge. The gestures were appreciated but we prefer a seamless stay over freebies any day of the week. Our only other issue was dry cleaning not being returned as promised. When I inquired the next day, I was told our DND sign was on. Hmmmm - we have been gone for the last 8 hours and our room was cleaned. Would have preferred they just take responsibility over the excuses.

Rooms were clean, climate control worked very well, beds were comfortable and standard tub/curtains showers were spacious with plenty of hot water and pressure.  Hotel location was fantastic. Subway close and a short walk to dozens of bars and restaurants. Don't understand prior reviews who claim nothing is nearby. 

Had a few drinks at the lounge on site but cannot speak to the food. Throughout our stay, Nick had been helpful in recommending Dylan Prime for dinner, offering an umbrella during a storm and directions as needed. The 1st 24-36 hours were the most rocky but things settled from there and we ultimately enjoyed our stay and agree that we much prefer this part of town over midtown going forward. We would recommend this hotel and suggest the appropriate expectations upon arrival to make for a more pleasant stay.

title: tolle Lage
text:
In wenigen Minuten erreicht man Soho und Greenwich Village zu Fuss. Die Houston Street Station der Linie 1 Ubahn ist 2 Minuten entfernt.
Die Zimmer sind für NYC Verhältnisse angemessen gross. Von den Cityview Zimmern in den oberen Stockwerken hat man einen tollen Ausblick auf die Hochhäuserder Financial District.

title: 'Yes ma'am, you'll be safe round here... and I was!
text: Arrived at the hotel, book in was quick and effortless, Emilie was the very friendly and most helpful girl, she gave me a room with a fantastic view of the ground zero monument buildings and other amazing skyscrapers. Lovely room, very clean, modern and comfortable. I haven't stayed downtown before, and I have to say, it was a nice change, lovely tree lined streets with town houses and local deli's, which were open 24 hours. I fell asleep as soon as I got in, woke up at 2am, realised I hadn't booked transport to the airport, the concierge was a huge help in arranging a lovely big mercedes to take me. I was hungry, he pointed me in the direction of the deli at the top of the road, I asked if it was safe for me to walk, hence the title of this review. I usually stay midtown, but this area is so peaceful but also typically like the New York you see on the telly. I will definitely stay here again, and would recommend it to anybody.

title: Relaxing Stay
text: I stayed for one night while in NY on business. The hotel is in a great location. Quite, close to great areas. The hotel facilities are basic but it has everything you need. What makes the difference is the staff. This was one of the cheapest hotels I looked at in NY at short notice. The front desk staff where really welcoming and helpful, Emely in particular. over the whole stay everyone was really helpful. Would definately stay again.

title: Serves the purpose
text:
Looking for somewhere for a night between a late flight in from the UK and a drive out from the Classic Car Club on Hudson, this fitted the bill because it was reasonably priced and well located.

Don't get your hopes up for quality beyond the functional though: this was typical mid-market New York: noisy a/c, basic furniture, tired carpet and paint, tiny slow elevators. At least it has a gym which is reasonably equipped and lightly used.

title: Decent value on Canal Street
text: Great location for this SPG property, the concierge lounge on the 21st floor a big plus (typically not a given for Sheraton) and the views, just spectacular.  Easy access to SoHo, China Town, Little Italy and TriBeCa.  The carpets can use a little upkeep, but other than that it's pretty clean.  Staff very helpful and accommodating.  Not a bad deal overall.

title: Good moderately-priced SoHo hotel with very friendly staff
text: Great location- walking distance to a lot of great SoHo restaurants and shopping.  The hotel is nicely decorated and perfectly comfortable furnishings for the price.  The staff were great and so helpful and kind to us during the trip.  My only complaint is the elevators are SO slow--there is two of them but they take forever to come to your hotel floor at times.  Our toilet was running sporadically after being flushed, and the air conditioner in our room was freezing at times and very difficult to regulate.  But bottom line: in Manhattan, for the price, I'm not sure that you can beat it.

title: Location, location, location...
text:
This hotel is EXTREMELY well situated. A 3 minute walk brings you on Prince street, in the heart of SoHo, where restaurants, pubs and boutiques awaits... Not far from downtown, near theVillage, you can walk everywhere or, take the nearby subway.
Although rooms on the lower floor have no view and are fairly small, (the norm in many Manhattan Hotels) they are well furnished and extremely clean.  The washroom with separate shower was lovely. When you have the chance to get a room on a higher floor, the view gets much more interesting. The staff is very, very nice. You are always greeted with a smile. 

One small comment... A/C unit ave very noisy in some rooms !!!

Overall, a very good at this hotel. I recommend it.

P.

title: stressful time
text: A big disappointment-we stayed here for our nieces's wedding and it made the time much more stressful from problems with our reservations, given the gift bag for the wrong wedding, waiting 2 1/2 hours for our second room, no air conditioning in the halls; bad phone system,  unable to call us a cab, etc.   Really not worth it wished we had stayed at the Marriott which was just as well located.

title: A find!
text: Fantastic experience. We stayed at this hotel for pleasure and it suited all of our needs. Staff was amazing, location was amazing, very comfortable rooms and the restaurant associated with the hotel was excellent. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

title: Three days stay in SoHo
text:
We stayed at this hotel three days. It is in very good location and very close to Houston and Spring St subway stations. It is away from Time Square but we were able to go take subway or walk ( yes long walk but we liked it).
Positve:
1. Staff are very friendly, nice and helpful.
2. We arrived early and staff did provide us a room quickly 
2. Onsite restaurants .There are many other in the neighbourhood.
3. Newly done wash room in the room.
4. Bed is comfortable.
5. Hotel has two computers for you to check in and print boarding pass.
6. Very safe neighbourhood. We walked back from  the Time Qquare two days around mid night.
Negative:
1. Rooms are small - I guess that is to be expected in New York.
2. Lobby is very small.
3. Air conditioner is very noisy and rooms are not sound proof. You can hear next room and people talking out-side. 
4.  The hotel car is very expensive (quoted $30.00 to Penn station NY and we were able to get a taxi for 7.00) and we were able to get a taxi for fraction of the cost.  I am not sure why hotel does not offer other travel options.

title: Good location
text: Location is very good because it's in Soho and very close to the subway. Otherwise it's just an average hotel with small rooms and with small problems like an air-condition not working properly. I would stay here again though as the prices are suitable. However do not plan to spend you time in the hotel or go for a bigger room.

title: Back and still good
text:
It's my second stay in this hotel and i'm glad it's still a good choice in manhattan.
The rooms are not big, but you remember it's Manhattan. But the location is great, near two subway stations and all the major attractions in the Soho and Village.
The staff is very friendly and always ready o help.
Good choice again.

title: Solid hotel, always a great visit here
text: I travel to NYC once a week for work and can choose where I stay from the nearby Trump Soho, Soho Grand, Gansevoort, Mercer, etc., but always choose to come back to the Four Points every time! I've traveled around the world for business and pleasure and have stayed in all kinds of lovely hotels and resorts but always choose to stay at the Four Points hotel. The location in Soho is very convenient for traveling around Manhattan, the rooms are neat and clean, the food and drinks from the attached Italian restaurant and bar are fabulous (especially when you consider all of the wonderful bars and restaurants around you in NYC) but best of all, this hotel's staff (Alex, Justine, Eric, et all) are SO attentive and So friendly and they always go above and beyond to make my stay as comfortable as possible. I highly recommend this hidden gem in NYC and will definitely be staying there again really soon!

title: Good hotel, nice stay
text: We stayed at the hotel last summer. Even if location is not at Manhattan's most visited places, we had a great time. We stayed 7nights and the staff was awesome even if they didnt speak spanish. Subway is within walking distance. Rooms are really small but, what can you expect in Manhattan? Even though rooms are clean, nicely decorated and beds are comfortable. Highly recommended.

title: always like this hotel
text: I always have a good experience here...great location....service was impressive and good quality rooms..the hotel staff was great!! Will be staying her again and I recommend this hotel especially if you are having fun in the city and arent't spending much time in the room anyway..

title: Nice hotel great location
text: A little off the beaten path, but central location.  Lovely bathroom. Very nice front desk staff.  WiFi service is not great, it's nice that they try in day and age of nickle and diming hotel customers to death. Esp. In New York City.  For the hotwire price I would stay here again.

title: Great value, quiet(!), close to subway
text:
We stayed here six nights when we visited family for Christmas. I am from NY and just wanted a quiet place close to public transport to sleep at. I wasn't there to sightsee.... 

Rooms and public areas are small, but that's the way it is in NY. But this encourages you to go out! The hotel is on a side street and it was very quiet! Staff was very nice and super helpful. Free bottle of water every day, and hot apple cider mornings. A one minute walk to the subway. 

Next time we visit NY we'll be staying there!

title: Speravo meglio
text: La collocazione e' ottima: in una zona tranquilla tra Soho ed il Village, ottima per trovare un buon ristorante da raggiungere a piedi la sera e per visitare la citta' e fare shopping di giorno. Il personale e' gentile. Le camere sono piccole e contengono l'indispensabile. Buona la pulizia. Aria condizionata rumorosissima e difficile da regolare ( un problema d'estate!). La nostra camera poi aveva la finestra che dava sull'edificio retrostante e sul motore generale del condizionamento,...non proprio il massimo!

title: Great Value for NYC.
text: A very good, small hotel far away from the insanity of Times Square...yet close enough via subway, if that's what floats your boat. Love Soho and the Village...so this is a great spot for us. Rooms are small (standard NYC) as are public spaces in the hotel. Recommended...

title: Staying at the four points over thanksgiving. Can anyone recommend a good restaurant?
text:
Hi all - 

My wife and I are exicted about our first trip to the four point in Soho this November.  We're checking in on Tuesday the 20th and are looking for some good restaurants close by and most importanly for Thanksgiving Dinner. Any favorites? I know things book up fast during this time of the year. 

Scott Carter

title: Great location in excellent hotel
text:
Stayed 15 nights at this hotel in July 2012. Stayed in room 2004 on the 20th floor which overlooks parts of the Hudson river. Stayed in our hotel room at 4th of July and had a great view of the fireworks. Recommend it!

The Houston subway station is a short block away, so are small eateries for breakfast. The hotel has a atm and ice machine in the basement in addition to a small gym.

The location is superb! Walking distance to all the shops and great restaurants. for bar hopping, head to east village which is just a cabe ride away, appox 7 $.

title: no vale el precio
text:
Me pareció un hotel caro para lo que ofrece y para su ubicación. Esta cerca a Soho y el W Village sí, pero no en una zona tan linda. Las habitaciones son normales, bien chicas.
La atención del personal es promedio, tuvimos problemas con el check inn.
En general no estuvo mal, pero no volvería, por el mismo precio o un poquito más hay otras mejores opciones.

title: Great Location, Affordable
text: The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The location in GREAT!  The rooms are VERY small (standard for NYC), but have everything you would need.  My room was on the 17th floor and had a great view which made up for the tight space.  I had a very comfortable king bed with nice linens. For the price, this hotel was perfect.

title: Great value, if a bit small
text: We spent a week at the hotel, and it surprisingly turned out to be a little gem.  First off, the location is fantastic.  Soho and the Village are structured far more as lovely neighborhoods than further uptown, and the hotel is an easy walk to shopping and galleries.  The 7th ave subway is a block away, so theatres, Times Square, and the West Side are handy.  But the real revelation was how completely pleasant the stay in the hotel was.  From the moment we checked in, every staff member on every shift couldn't have been more helpful, enthused, and committed.  Congratulations to what must be a terrific management team for creating a truly welcoming environment in this behemoth city.  The restaurant is cozy and reasonably priced, as is the bar with its outdoor area.  The gym downstairs is unambitious but has the basics.  If there's a negative, it's that the otherwise comfortable rooms are on the small side, and even two people are going to find themselves having to negotiate walkways between bed, desk, and closet.  The truth is, though, that visiting New York isn't about hanging out in your room, so if you can put up with this minor inconvenience, the place is otherwise a complete pleasure.  Word to the wise on room location:  Charlton St. is under a lot of construction as of Summer 2012, and you'll want to request a room to the rear and east side of the hotel.  That said, you will very much enjoy this very well priced and welcoming little piece of Manhattan.

title: Average
text: Stayed here last year. From memory, when I was searching in the Internet, there weren't a lot of hotels in Soho, or the ones I wanted weren't available. The location isn't great and the streets closer to the hotel aren't as well lit. It's a 10-15min walk to Soho. Rooms were average for NYC I think. Our room was behind the elevator and was a little bit noisy. Due to the location, we probably would choose somewhere else either closer to the main parts of Soho.

title: Great value
text: I've stayed here several times and am always happy with my visits.  The rooms are average size by NYC standards (which means smaller) but it's clean and has a very friendly staff.  Room service is provided by an Italian restaurant located off the lobby and I have to say, is pretty darn good.  The location is great as it's tucked off the main street so isn't noisy and there's a Dunkin' Donuts right around the corner where you can grab your morning coffee.  It's only a few blocks from Soho's great shopping area and is pretty easy to hail a cab nearby if not right in front.  All in all, a good place to stay.

title: Excellent location, nice staff!
text:
We spent three nights at the Soho Four Points in July. The location of the hotel is superb: just a couple of steps away from all the shops and restaurants of SoHo, on a quiet street (with Manhattan standards) without too much noise from the street. The closest subway stations is also just a couple of blocks away.

The rooms were tidy and quite spacious as you would expect from a hotel of this (price) level. Free wifi was included and worked without a hitch, the room also had a nice flat-screen tv (although it was a pain to use due to the "advanced features" which slowed the whole thing down) as well as a coffee machine and complimentary bottled water. AC worked perfectly as well, which was a lifesaver considering the 40C temperature outside.
