But what really stood out was the positive and attentive attitude of the front desk staff, which made us feel welcome from check in to check out. Keep up the good work, Four Points SoHo is definitely a place I would consider booking on our future NYC trips as well!

title: Great stay
text: No complaints here! Hotel is clean, modern and the bed is super comfy. Wifi worked perfectly and the hotel is situated in a great location. Close to shopping and restaurants. Staff was super friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody.

title: Great Staff !
text:
Stayed here in June for 2 nights .
From the moment we checked in the staff at the front desk were amazing . We were given a room on the second floor and when we woke up in the morning our bathroom door wouldn't open . We'd placed all our toiletries in there the night before and were unable to retrieve them . After calling reception they sent up a service man who eventually got the door open . The front desk then organized for us to be ugraded to the 18th floor with amazing views of the Empire state building and as we were heading out to explore NYC made sure all our belongings and luggage were waiting for us in our new room when we returned .
The room itself was excellent . Very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable . Strong WiFi in the room too.
The location is ok . Subway lines on the corner and some pretty cool restaurants close by too .

title: Dependable
text: I stay here about every 5 weeks and it has yet to let me down.  Free wireless, free water in the room, nice HD flat screens.  The rooms are small (this is New York people!) but have everything I need and are clean.  Nicely up to date as well.  The staff are tremendous, absolutely the best I have encountered.  Fantastic location on the edge of SoHo.  1 Block from a train heading Uptown or Downtown.

title: Great hotel without all the crowds.
text: This hotel was fantastic. Close to many great destinations without having to deal with crowds at your hotel too. Jessica Zye was especially helpful suggesting restaurants and attractions. The entire staff was wonderful. The rooms are a tad small but it's NY. The deluxe room was nice and fairly roomy versus the standard room. I highly recommend this hotel and will be back.

title: Lousy Location but decent rooms
text: This hotel has tiny rooms and the carpets don't look as clean as they should, the lobby is also small but what bothers me most is the location of the place.  You walk outside and you feel like you can't possibly be in NYC.  The place outside the doors is super smelly and dirty.  Not a great place for you to ask guests to meet you or to feel that you can wander and locate great eateries close by either.  The rates are also costly so for a better location and cheaper sleeps maybe try somewhere else.

title: Great location, nice hotel but staff could be more helpful
text: I'll start by saying I would recommend this hotel to friends because it's in a great location, the hotel is nothing over the top but nice, and the staff is friendly. I was in New York for the weekend to find my future home (I was preparing to relocate at the time) but sadly, I lost a pair of pricey boots along with some other belongings while staying at this Sheraton. I called several times after my stay and was directed to house keeping each time. It took house keeping a while to get back to me, and they apologized, but in the end were not very helpful.

title: Impressed ... Everything We Wanted
text:
Having been  to NYC for leisure twice before and stayed in absolute flea-pit hotels, I booked
this because it was within the price range we wanted. I warned my wife that Manhattan hotel rooms were small and poky and not to expect too much ... Boy! Was I surprised. I found a very decent hotel in a great area and the price was about as good as it gets for my wallet. The 2 double bed room was spacious enough with a full tub as well as a shower. The location is great: the Houston Street subway is, literally, around the corner and a short walk down Charlton  / Princes streets revealed an interesting neighbourhood and a good selection of restaurants. I've knocked off a point for 2 reasons: 1) they did charge my booking way in advance of my stay and 2) we found the plumbing a bit noisy. That said, the management *did* correct both issues very promptly but I can't give a 4.5 rating (or I would). Out family of 4 (2 parents with kids ages 20, 16) liked it very much and would happily return.

title: Great value
text:
I got an amazing deal at this property, so felt I had to take advantage and book it. Plus, we always tend to stay close to Times Square. This time we stayed nearby Soho (hotel is close to where the action is, but not in the middle) and truly enjoyed the experience.

Hotel is small, comfortable and rooms are quiet. If it were closer to the restaurants and shops I would have certainly rated it as very good.

title: Great Value
text: Not your fancy brand name hotel, but has everything you need for a comfortable and productive stay in NYC. Free wifi, new/modern-looking lobby, decently sized rooms optimized for the business traveler (desk + lots of outlets). Staff is friendly and attentive. Location is excellent. I truly enjoyed my stay.

title: OK for inexpensive downtown Manhattan stay.
text:
Pluses:

Location is just great.  Downtown near Soho - lots to see, lots to do.  Easy access to the subway.

We very much enjoyed the room service.  Breakfast was great, pizza was great.  Not too expensive.  Very quick and prompt service - always a hello on the way in or out.  Maid service was very good.  

Good quality television. We brought a movie player and hooked it up with no problem to a spare HDMI port.

Minuses:

Air conditioning quit on us at midnight one night.  They did fix it right away, but while in the lobby we heard of another unit failing the same way so it might be time for them to look into a mass replacement. The A/C in the rooms is very loud, bring earplugs or you'll likely not sleep much.

Shower was difficult to use.  Turn the knob one way you get lukewarm water, the other way scalding hot.  No cold showers on a hot day!

There are only two computers available in the lobby, so best bring your own if you plan to do any work.  They are fairly well secured, so you'll not get access to install anything, though my Citrix connection did work.  

TV channel selection a little weak.  

Overall:

A good enough stay for a less expensive choice in Manhattan.  Without earplugs, you will suffer though.

title: My new hotel in New York City and yours as well
text:
It has been a long time since 1965, when on every trip to New York I have stayed at the New York Hilton on Avenue of the Americas. Last year when staying there, I was reminded that the hotel opened in the mid 1960s . A few months ago, I tried to get into the hotel and found that rates were nearly 500 per night, thanks to the Hilton Club concept which seems to have cut the available rooms to ordinary folk to about half of the total, resulting in twice the price.
I took a chance and decided to stay in Soho, where a pal of mine owns a great jewelry store, and found the above sheraton. When I checked in, the desk staff acted as if I was a long time lost person who had come home for good. In a flash I was in my room, all new and nice, with internet that worked like a charm ( I seem to remember a german phrase - mit raazender geschwindekuit- or something like that- with great speed) and a very very nice room for a very very good price. Best of all, elevators that got you to your room on floor 14 with even more speed than ever in a hotel in new york. No waiting.
Once I checked in, I found the staff eager to help me get around the city, and where to walk to. All kinds of flower shops, my pals store, and every imaginable kind of cool stores are available. plus, something you will never see in mid town, nice little bakeries, pizza places, and restaurants of every type. 
The rooms. like many at any four points sheraton, are modern design, and not the traditional heavy woods,and massive chairs, but very very comfortable and well appointed. There was even a power strip for those of us who think we are to be in touch with 2 phones, two laptops, and of course an ipod. So for the first time in years, my own power strip was deployed to remain in the suitcase. 
In walking around, I was able to visit my pals store in soho, visit art galleries, and frankly enjoy myself despite having heavy duty finance meetings ever day over 4 days. My worst fear- not being able to get a cab, or being forced to use the subway a lot- were never realised. Despite it being a small hotel at least by gotham city standards, there was always a cab waiting out front. Also the cab fare to LaGuardia was about 10 bucks less than the trip to midtown. 
Now it turns out that soho is considered a new emerging area for tech companies, lofts, and young people. If you want to enjoy the City of New York, consider staying here. Its my new  home.

title: Clean, good concierge, decent location
text: Stayed here on a weekend trip to catch a play and do some shopping.  Overall the experience was good.  The room was clean and well appointed, the staff was very helpful and the area was within walking distance to the Broadway shopping.  The rooms weren't huge, but for NYC they were average and a much better price than some of the other options we considered.  I would return.

title: Great Food and Excellent Service
text: I travel for work at stay at the Sheraton Four Points in SoHo regularly.  When I'm there and don't want to venture far for dinner, I'll eat at the hotel restaurant - San Marino.  The Italian food is wonderful - I've tried most of the appetizers and salads, several of the pastas, and a couple of the main courses too!  While it's not the same as Italian food in Italy, I highly recommend the restaurant.  But, to top off the good food is the amazing service.  You’ll find that all of the waiters and the owner are extremely friendly, attentive, and helpful.  Tonight they even moved a table to a different area outside for me so that I could reach a plug for my laptop!  Stop by and try it when you're in SoHo.

title: Not Really Business Class
text: In town for a conference at NYU, this was one of the two choices for hotel at the conference rate. Sheraton markets the Four Points brand as a business class hotel, an but this property fell short on several points. On the good side, the staff was friendly and helpful, it was a walkable distance to the conference, subway line 1 access one block away, and a very fun neighborhood with bars and restaurants just a few blocks away (MacDougal and Sullivan Streets). On the other hand, the room finishings were just average for this grade of hotel, there was no realistic work space (although the wifi worked well), and the complimentary breakfast for conference attendees was just pastries, juice, and coffee. I feel this kind of breakfast really falls short for what people want when they are about to sit in a conference for 4 hours until lunchtime. At other conferences I've been to, the hotel offered a full, complimentary breakfast. Too, the bathroom has the world's splashiest skin, so if you are environmentally-conscious and wish to reuse towels, forget it because everything was saturated. I needed all new towels every day. Overall, it was not a bad stay. It was quiet and the bed was good, but it does not achieve the aspirations that Sheraton has for its Four Points brand.

title: Not for s
text:
Stayed here at the end of last year, i am regularly in NYC and normally stay at the w etc, due to high demand for rooms i booked this hotel through my spg account. I  booked a prepay rate without realising and being unable to cancel - not a good start. They did offer to move the dates, but being spg platinum i actually expected them to allow me to cancel as it was the same day as booking.

This was undoubtedly my worst hotel stay with any spg hotel.. i admit i normally stay at the w's but even the old sheraton in belview seattle is better than this.. but when i booked at $400 per night i expected  a lot more than i got, for me it was fail fail fail...

the only redeeming feature was the reception staff were nice and enthusiastic...

the photography for the hotel was misleading....in my opinion....its next to a derelict lot, the picture of the hotel start a few floors up the building

reception very tiny
the bar - awful
restaurant food very bad- i failed to eat my breakfast
 - deluxe was more standard by other hotels, bathroom was small..
the air conditioner in my 'deluxe' room was like a freight train
and even after being moved it was the same

rooms were slightly dated
yes it had a coffee machine if this makes a good room for you...

for me i would not recommend this hotel - may be at $125 - $150 per night
i stayed in hotels for over 80 nights last year and this was a low low point

hey but thats just my view!

title: Good hotel but not outstanding
text: I had a pleasant four night stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan SoHo Village; the bed was comfortable, the view was good, the staff were friendly, but there just wasn't anything special about it that would make it any better than a nice Premier Inn. It wasn't like it was cheap either. Don't get me wrong - if you're looking for somewhere to rest your head for a few nights and want it to be in a great West Village location then go for it. Other than how tiny the room and pretty noisy air-con was there's really nothing to complain about, but I just wouldn't rave about it.

title: Great location
text: Just returned from a 5 night stay here.  Hotel is in a great position in fashionable Soho, within walking distance of restaurants, bars and shops.  3 minutes from subway and bus stops.  Fairly small rooms but adequate. The bed was huge and very comfy.  Coffee maker and safe in room. Small but clean and recently renovated bathroom.  Hotel staff very pleasant and will help you out with any directions etc.  Expensive bar ($11 for a Sambuca!) The only downside was the view from the room,  a brick wall.  Huge flat screen TV.  Will definitely stay again.

title: Excellent!
text: We stayed for 8 nights during May 2012 and the location was excellent, quiet and close to everything.  The staff are excellent, very helpful and accomodating.  The rooms compared with more expensive options are actually a good size by New York standards.  Very clean and tidy.  The restaurant and room service is excellent.  Would definately stay here again.

title: Will definately return!
text:
Good location, close to subway and shops. Very clean! We've had problems with bedbugs in other hotels,  and the first thing I do when I walk into a hotel room is to check beds, walls etc! Rest assured, there are NONE here! Very comforable bed, and a nice big shower.   Free internet is a BIG plus.  We don't live in the USA, and need to keep in contact with family, check on bookings and flights etc. In some hotels you have to buy a 24 hour internet package, which gets very expensive if you only need it for a couple of minutes each day.!!  
The staff is very friendly and helpful, you can walk past them 10 times a day, and they will always greet you!

title: Great staff, small rooms
text:
Overall, we liked our stay at the hotel, but I'd look for a hotel offering me a better room size and location, before I'd settle for this again. I'd even be willing to pay a little more for those factors next time. 
The beds were very comfortable to sleep on. But the space around the beds was really limited. The rooms are small. Our room with 2 double beds felt quite cramped for our family of 4. They was hardly any place for the luggage. Not much counter space in the bathroom. 
Subway connectivity to other parts of Manhattan is good, with two subway stations nearby. And although the hotel is just a couple blocks south of Greenwich Village and a couple of blocks west of Soho, the hotel itself is located on a fairly drab street. Maybe it's okay if one's there for work, but coming back to the hotel just pricked the holiday bubble a little. 
What I found really amazing about the hotel was the staff, incredibly friendly, helpful, with a great "of course, we can do it" attitude. The front desk staff were really chatty and welcoming. The housekeeping did an excellent job. Their response time to requests was quick... On the first evening in the room, my little one fell, bumped his nose, leading to a nose-bleed. I called the front-desk and they sent up ice within 2 minutes. Later, they also gave me a list of clinics nearby, in case medical help was needed. Luckily it wasn't. 
On arrival, we discovered that Travelocity had booked us into a King Room instead of the 2 Doubles mentioned on my booking voucher. The staff at the front desk immediately assigned us a room with 2 doubles. This correction happened in such a smooth, tension-free manner that I could barely remember that an error with regard to booking had occurred. 
There was one service glitch regarding the rental car we requested through them to go to the airport. It didn't arrive. Apparently it was stuck in traffic leading to the Holland tunnel, which is just a couple of blocks down the road. But the person at the front desk, helped us find alternative. He convinced the driver of some other rental car that had come to the hotel to take us to the airport. It was a pricier ride than it should have been. But we did manage to make it to the airport on time. 
It would have also been nice to have real glasses and mugs for water and coffee instead of disposable ones in the room. 
Although they couldn't do anything to change the givens of this hotel - location and room size, the staff did everything in their power meet the guests' needs and make the stay a pleasant one. A big thank you for that :)

title: Excellent!
text:
Really great hotel!
Staff are very helpful and the location is great!
Steps away from the subway you can get anywhere from here.
Free bottles of water every day is a nice touch.
Wifi is a bit weak but it works.
Free computer access is nice too.

For a good parking option, a few blocks away is Pier 40 where parking is about $30 a day.

title: Good location
text:
Even though this hotel is a little out of the way from soho, the walk is short. It is also very close to two subway stations so its easy to get around town.

The hotel room is ok, but it looks a little old and maybe in need of a renovation soon.

The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful.

title: Decent hotel with some good and bad points
text:
We recently stayed at the Four Points in Soho for 8 nights and the stay was just OK... A few things to consider when choosing this hotel:

- the location is definitely not in Soho (it is about a 15 minute walk to the centre of Soho)
- the hotel is convenient for the 1 line which goes about anywhere
- the rooms are tiny but clean (though the shower was pretty good)
- staff wre friendly, helpful and welcoming
- there is a lot of obstruction going on around the hotel which would start at very early hours of the morning (it started at 2am one morning!)... try to request a room away from the noise because it drove me insane!!

Overall a decent stay, nothing flash but does the job.

title: Perfect location close to Greenwich, but expensive
text:
We were advised to look for a hotel in or around Greenwich because of the nice and lively area. This was difficult because all the hotels are either expensive or lowly rated on tripadvisor. We chose this hotel for the good comments, but still think it is expensive. 

Pro's: 
- close to subway (red and blue line)
- Nice neighbourhood and a lot of good eateries to choose from
- small rooms, but convenient
- free wifi
- free waterbottles
- service and cleaning

Cons: 
- expensive for what you get (good hotel, but 5star prices)
- small room.

title: Eine gute Alternative in SoHo
text: Ich liebe SoHo, das Village, Tribeca... Dann ist dieses Hotel wunderbar, da alles fußläufig erreichbar ist. Wer weiter weg möchte, hat zwei Subwaylinien vor der Tür. Mit der Metrocard kommt man überall hin, somit bietet sich das Hotel auch wirklich für Touren in alle Ecken Manhattans an - und auch darüber hinaus. So ist man öffentlich in einer Stunde z. B. am Flughafen in Newark für 12,50$. Sehr schön am Hotel fand ich, dass es nur 8 Zimmer pro Stockwerk gibt, was es auf den Gängen ruhig macht. Das Hotel ist modern, neuwertig eingerichtet, das Bad hat eine sehr schöne Dusche, das Bett eine wirklich hervorragende Matratze. Wer sehr lärmempfindlich ist, wird vermissen, dass man an Schallschutzfenstern gespart hat. So hört man eben doch den typischen New Yorker Straßenverkehr - aber das gehört ja auch eigentlich dazu... Der Service ist sehr aufmerksam, man fühlt sich rundherum wohl und gut aufgehoben, es geht schon fast familiär zu, wenn man ein paar Tage länger bleibt. Alles in allem kann ich das Hotel nur weiter empfehlen und werde es bei einem nächsten New York-Aufenthalt wieder wählen.

title: Excellent Hotel for Location and Price!
text:
Four Points by Sheraton Soho New York, NY,

Excellent location for shopping on Spring St., food and bars and music on MacDougal, and many other neighborhoods to explore. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. Hotel to Newark International Airport via subway and Airtrain was only 50 minutes! at a cost of $15 per person.

title: Perfect Location
text:
If you're not looking for amazing views out your window, Four Points Sheraton in Soho is in a great location.  It's located on the West Side right near the 1 train that takes you uptown, if you please, or downtown, if that's where you're headed.  It's also walking distance to the West Side Highway for great water views and if you go in the opposite direction, you'll head into fashionable Soho and Broadway -- a shopper's delight.  

The hotel is very clean, beds were very comfortable and for me it was a plus since my office is right down the block.

I will mention that when I got there the toilet was not flushing.  On my way out I asked the front desk to have them take a look at it and by the time I got back, it was taken care of.

title: Great Location
text:
The hotel is well located in the Soho/Greenwich Village area of New York.  Great location to stay with many bars and restaurants to choose from and a conspicuous absence of chain establishments, barely a Starbucks in sight believe it or not.

Room was compact but clean, modern and comfortable, and included king sized beds and large flat screen TVs.  Heating/Cooling system was excellent.  The hotel itself was quiet, however there is a degree of traffic noise from outside.  This is a common problem with hotels in Manhattan due to main roads and volume of traffic, no fault of the hotel.

The hotel does not feature an extensive lounge and bar area, but given the location it is not something you would be likely to make use of.

title: Wonderful Staff
text: The service was great and the location was awesome. The room was small but extremely clean with comfortable beds. The staff was so kind and knowledgeable. When my girlfriend and I return to NY we will stay at the Four Points again. Thank you to the wonderful staff at Four Points.

title: Great Stay in NYC
text:
I stayed at this hotel two weeks ago and I was delighted with the experience.  The hotel is a couple of blocks from the hectic SOHO streets, close to the subway, great shopping, and amazing restaurants.  I had requested a room with 2 double beds but when I checked in, our room had some problems so they gave us two rooms (for the price of one) to make sure we were comfortable.  I did not even have to ask!!!  The rooms are good size for NY standards!  Not a lot of noise, which can be a problem in NY -- The entire place had a "newly done" feel to it! 
The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: A gem in NYC!
text:
This hotel and its staff are wonderful. So accommodating and helpful. Probably some of the kindest and most professional I've ever encountered. What a lovely surprise. 

The hotel has a great location in Soho on a quiet street. The rooms are comfy and perfect for weekend travlers. 

We will be back!

title: Great hotel
text: My dad and I stayed at this hotel on vacation. We knew we didn't  want to stay in the middle of all the hubbub in the city but wanted to be in a convenient location. This was perfect. Very close and convenient subway access. The staff were extremely accommodating and friendly. One of the best staff of any hotel I've stayed at. Everything was very clean. Very comfortable bed. Overall great hotel! Will definitely stay here again.

title: My home in NYC.
text:
I have been traveling at least twice a year to Manhattan for the past 4 years and this has become my hotel there. I love the location, the quiteness, the price/quality and their super friendly staff (seriously, friendly and extremely helpful). 
If you like to be close to the west village/soho area this is probably the best option unless you want to go for super expensive hotels like the W in Union Square. 

Great for business or pleasure. Free bottles of water every day, coffee, newspaper and wifi!!

title: Welcoming visit
text:
After a long flight and nightmare transfer from the airport the front desk welcome was energetic, friendly and extremely welcome. Thankyou for a good first impression!
A business and social trip combined I had a very nice room with skyline views. The staff always said hello on the front desk.
I was there for 8 days in March 2012 and the location was perfect for evening strolls into and around SoHo. Felt safe as a female walking on my own both to work and to restaurants at night. A couple of blocks away was the hustle bustle of SoHo evening crowd.
Subway convenient. One block away to the A line and a 10 minute walk took you to Spring St subway which is a 45 minute ride to the airport airtrain. Worked that one out for the journey home.
Room clean and nice decor. Bathroom well equipped. Used the laundry service which was same day and good.

title: Best Room Service Food!
text: The restaurant that feeds the room service menu for this hotel is fantastic! An Italian eatery that has fabulous choices and terrific food at reasonable prices. A surprise and delight!

title: A pleasantly surprising value. Welcoming. Convenient.
text: Ultra easy and convenient for those driving into Manhattan via the Holland Tunnel. Welcoming young staff who obviously are working hard. Tiny little bar right off the main entrance with a lovely, Yugoslavian bartender who makes a mean mojito (only in NYC!) Rooms are plenty big for the cost and room service is available. This will be my go-to SPG property for quick NYC business trips. Low hassle, high value.

title: This is the place to stay in SoHo, NYC
text: We were looking for a hotel to base ourselves, close to the SoHo district within NYC, but also close to the Subway (we wanted the red line as it seemed to offer the best of access to lower and upper Manhattan). The Four Points couldn't have been better. The staff were helpful and friendly, the rooms were perfect and the price was excellent value for money.But above all the location was ideal for us and our teenage daughters who wanted to shop in SoHo.

title: Great Basic Hotel and Great Location
text: My mom and I visited for "girls" weekend for 3 nights. We had a room with 2 double beds. Very comfy beds and a nice bathroom. The room is small, but we don't come to NYC to stay in the room. Nice flat screen TV, in-room safe, and free Wi-Fi. The AC unit is quite loud, but no big deal. This is a great, safe location with the Houston St. Line 1 subway about a block away.Overall, we had a nice stay and would stay again.

title: Impeccable customer service
text: Had a great stay at this hotel. On a solo business trip, the staff could not have been any more welcoming, helpful and friendly. I arrived early and they got my room available for me as soon as possible, staff remember your name and greet you with a genuine smile and desire to provide top class service without being intrusive.

title: Great location and super friendly staff
text: We stayed here for 4 nights last week and found it to be a perfect location for exploring the city. The staff were very friendly and happy to help out with any request. Accommodation in NYC is crazy expensive but seemed reasonable against others. Rooms were smallish but well appointed and although they didn't have a view they were quiet and set back slightly from the main road. The bed was super comfy.

title: Holidays with two teens
text:
Had a terrific stay over the holidays.  First chance to write it up.  GREAT location.  WONDERFUL staff at the front desk and office who were friendly and helpful always going to the next level to help.  TERRIFIC view from our room.  Small but enough room for the three of us without feeling as though we were on top of each other.  VERY nice bathrooms.  Easy subway access.  Just had a wonderful time and would DEFINITELY stay here again.  Can not wait to return.  Best aspect of the hotel, it was small enough to feel intimate . . . 

Jon
Los Angeles, CA

title: Okay Stay
text: Affordable room in a good location. The rooms are clean with no major complaints.

title: everything you need in NYC.
text:
I'm not sure if Nicolas who checked us in could actually be any nicer or more helpful. He was a delight to encounter and a real asset to the reception team. Upon check out the team were also very cheery which I feel is a good reflection on the management. you would imagine that this is the standard through the chain - but believe me - it isn't.
As SPG platinum members we were given an upgrade to a higher floor room and given a small goodie bag with a copy of Time Out, a bottle of water and some cookies. a very nice start to our stay. The rooms are not overly big but they are very comfortable, clean and with a very comfortable bad and coffee facilities. There are the standard toiletries plus mouth wash, cotton wool, shower cap and dental floss which is leaps and bounds better than some of the other Four Points hotels we have recently stayed at.  
There were only 8 rooms on the floor (I think) so it was very quiet and we slept very well. 
There is a bar and an Italian restaurant on the ground floor with a small sitting outside area, we didn't try these as we already had plans.
The hotel is very convenient for shopping, restaurants/bars and for the metro. 
I'd definitely recommend this hotel and we will probably be back. You guys did a great job. Thank you !!

title: Great location and front office staff
text: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel because of the location. Really close to the Subway and all the great shops and restaurants around Soho. The front office staff here are so friendly and helpful. Emely the front office supervisor cannot do enough for you. The rooms are small, but I'm guessing this is standard for NYC, however will definitely be back again based on location and service.

title: Home away from home...
text:
I've stayed at many SPG properties in Manhattan. This is the only one that made me feel like home, literally, two weeks every month. Friendly and courteous staff, always.

San Marino, the restaurant, is not to be missed. The grilled Calamari on the menu is really a perfection! If you're adventurous, you can create your own calamari dish or any other dish.

title: The staff is awesome
text:
The staff here is great--they helped with everything from the room to providing razors. The gym is basic and clean and the beds are great.
Its in a safe and fun neighborhood and is great if you want to be in NYC but not RIGHT in the bustle.

Brian and Nicholas at reception are so nice!

title: Hidden Gem in NYC!
text:
I've stayed at most of the Starwood properties in Manhattan and this was my first time at this hotel.  At a glance, it seemed a little out of the way, and I wasn't sure I'd be happy with the location.  But I was pleasantly surprised.  It's on a quiet street, right on the edge of everything SoHo has to offer.  It also seemed a bit "upgraded" in decor vs. the other Four Points Sheraton properties in Manhattan (Chelsea, Times Square).

PROS:
 - Very attentive desk staff.  They were efficient, friendly and actually quite funny when I checked in.
 - On a quieter side street where you don't hear constant honking horns and sirens, but still just a half block from Varick St. (name changes from 7th Ave a couple of blocks up at Houston St)
 - Rooms are nicely appointed - comfortable bed and pillows.  Work area in the corner maximizes desk space.  Bathrooms are mostly black granite with a stand up shower only.  I felt this was a nicer bathroom than other FPS properties.
 - Nice view of mid-town from rooms that face that way, although a little blocked by a nearby hotel tower.
 - Very short walk to the Red "1" subway line - about a half block away at Houston St.  This will quickly take you to to the West Village, Chelsea and Times Square to the North, and the World Trade Center to the South.
 - Very short walk to the heart of SoHo (shorter than I had thought), which is packed with awesome restaurants and shopping.  It's all pricey, but it's classic New York.  Even if you just walk around and look.

CONS:
 - Not the easiest/quickest to get to from the airport. I paid about $45 to ride from La Guardia.  
 - By no means a big, fancy hotel.  The lobby is tiny and the small restaurant/bar wouldn't be my pick with so many other choices nearby.  But it's quick and easy to get in and out of, which I prefer.
 - Not centrally located within the city.  If you're hitting all of the classic New York sights, you'll need to allow time for walking or switching of subway lines.   

I'll gladly book this hotel again for future stays.  Among Starwood hotels, you can get some of the better rates for this property.  I usually book AAA rates on spg.com.

title: Perfect for business travelers
text:
I have stayed at this hotel four times in the last two years.  It is perfect for business travelers. The rooms are well equipped from the free Wi-Fi access to the power strip to handle all of my mobile and laptop needs.  

The good: service is awesome; the bar in the lobby is small, but very well stocked.  Being in SOHO, there are a lot of good restaurants nearby (including the one in the hotel).  I especially like Indian food and there are a few good places within a few blocks. 

The bad: gym is small and wait for elevators can last a few minutes at the end of the work day as everyone returns

title: Will definitely stay here again!
text:
This hotel is in a great, safe location.....almost in the heart of Soho and the Village.  I have stayed in many hotels and this is one of the cleanest I have ever seen! From the lobby to the hotel room, everything was immaculate.  Very friendly staff and quick check in/out. 
My daughter and I were in NYC for a couple of college visits and a little getaway.  This hotel served the purpose perfectly. When I go back to NYC, I will absolutely stay here again. Great restaurants in the area, as well.

title: Very good hotel, Amazing staff.
text:
I've been in many hotels in NYC, Four points Is one of my faforite now. My room was clean and very Nice. the hotel was close to everything, Shopes and restaurants.
Great and friendly staff! Very helpful!
Michal Baum

title: Comfortable and value stay
text: Was travelling with college frnds for a reunion and we got a good rate even on a weekend. It was a good, fully functional hotel with a perfect location. Being an elite member, we got a room on higher floor, but as such there was no upgrade; all the rooms are same and small (well this is New York after all!). Front office people were friendly and addressed us by name after 2 days of staying with them, which felt nice. Food in the restaurant was bad though, and internet was pathetic (well it was free!). Overall I would rate it as a pleasant stay

title: Great value and very friendly staff!
text:
This hotell has a minor lobba and not that many rooms, but from the second you step into the small lobby you feel welcome. The rooms are clean, have nice comfortable beds and have all the stuff you need. An extra bonus for the small coffee bags, huge flatscreen and wifi. 

Walking distance to almost every destination from central park and below, but if you would prefer the subway, it's just around the corner.

title: The Nicest Staff
text:
Fro the moment we walked into the lobby till the moment we checked out the entire staff could not do enough for us.  No matter what we wanted or asked for, they were incredibly sweet, kind, helpful & delightful.

Great location in SoHo.  Right around the corner from Jacques Torres chocolate shop.  The Vandamn diner 5 minute walk away.  I had an incredible Monte Cristo sandwich made on french toast with maple syrup on the side to dip. 

Everything was so close, Little Italy, Greenwich Village, Chelsea. Great local, great people, close to subway, extremely reasonable rates.

title: This hotel has stepped up their game!
text: This hotel is awesome! The service is great and the staff is friendly and knowledgable. The new restaurant, San Marino, which opened last May, is top notch. The location is a few blocks away from amazing shops and restaurants. I stayed here in June of 2006 and vowed I would never return because of poor service and a horrible restaurant, however, this establishment has improved in such a fabulous way that I will certainly be back. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excelente hotel
text:
Conozco bastante el nivel de servicio de Starwood, pero esta fue una de las mejores experiencias que tuve. El agua de cortesia todos los días, el coffee service y el NY Times todas las mañanas en el Lobby es un agregado interesante. La ubicacion es buenisima, una zona de moda y que es conveniente a todos los atractivos de NYC: El staff, desde el Conserje hasta el Front Desk fue exepcional y sobre todo calido y genuino , algo dificil de encontrar en NYC.
Las habitaciones super comodos y muy bien equipadas, parece un hotel nuevo ya que el mantenimiento es optimo.
Recomiendo con total seguridad este hotel para quedarse es esa ciudad tan fascinante

title: Great value, great service
text:
We stayed at this Four Points location and had an amazing experience. The location is amazing for walking into Tribecca, West Village or Soho within 15 minutes. 

The price was very reasonable for the accomodations - $139 for clean space, sunlight, gym.

What really impressed us was the service. All of the staff was super friendly and helpful. They really went out of their way to make our stay great.

And free wi-fi in the room!

Highly recommended.

title: Great hotel, great value, again and again
text:
This is probably the 5th time I have stayed at this property. The qualities that I like about it (other than its location) high value, great staff, casual service, clean rooms, free wifi!

The staff really make a difference and they care about what they do. I like this property because it is really no nonsense. I stay at a lot of big hotels and they are impersonal. Yes, this Four Points is a chain hotel, but the small lobby with no crowds and eager staff make you never want to stay at a big hotel again. It is nice to be greeted immediately, welcomed back to the hotel and never a queue at reception. It's great.

Did I mention free wifi? To me, this is a great thing. Rooms are super clean and all you need. Work out room is on the small side, but that's OK.

Only complaints.... wifi was a bit weak in my room (1407) and there are not a lot of great TV channels. The TV's are huge HD TV's, but not a lot to watch, like Food Network. I would have loved some international news programmes.

Great stay, great place and I'll definitely be back for the next business trip, A

title: Location is everything!
text:
My husband and I stayed for one night while visiting our nephew who lived right around the corner.  The hotel is in walking distance of shops, restaurants bars, you name it.  
The room is standard size for NYC, in other words not a lot of space but we didn't have tons of luggage to stash.  We had the king with city views on the 16th floor, if your room is in the front of the hotel there really isn't much to look at but if your in the back you'll have terrific view of downtown.
The staff is very friendly and helpful.
Since NYC is the city that never sleeps be prepared for honking horns and people yelling on weekend nights. The din finally ended around 4:30 am.
There is a restaurant bar within the building, however, I would recommend walking a few blocks and see the neighborhood for other options.
We would return as the location is ideal.

title: Welcoming staff and a decent room
text:
Chose to stay at this hotel primarily based on area, price and SPG membership. I was really pleased to find the property was only one block away from the Houston St metro station and very easy to find. Staff were very welcoming on arrival, even though the single staff member on the front desk was multi-tasking - working very hard to meet each guest's requirements and smiling throughout. I was given a welcome bag of goodies including a bottle of water, a pack of cookies and a Time Out guide, a nice touch.
The room was small - I had read other reviews where this had been mentioned but from the property images I was not expecting it to be quite so small - however as I was staying on my own this was not an issue and I settled in quite quickly. 
My room backed onto the elevator shaft (I think 2 rooms per floor back onto the elevators) and there was quite a lot of noise from the elevators that seemed to travel through the bathroom ventlation shaft. There was also quite a bit of noise from other rooms which also seemed to travel this same way. The noise did not affect my sleep fortunately but was a bit intrusive when trying to relax in the room at other times.
The room was clean and well appointed with a desk area, work chair, armchair, wardrobe and flat panel HD TV. The bed was very comfortable with clean crisp linens. The bathroom similarly was well decorated and stylish with everything you could need provided. I loved that the towels were a good size, soft and fluffy and smelt really nice and fresh.
Didn't get a chance to try the Italian restaurant - this was off the small lobby area and to be honest looked more like a bar than a restaurant although I can imagine that in the summer when the terrace is open there would be more space and activity.
Overall I was happy with my choice of hotel - you dont get much for your money in New York, but this property offered a quality room in a great location for a reasonable price (considering New York options!!!) I would certainly consider staying here again if visiting the area.

title: Weekend overnight stay
text: The hotel was fine, but it was incredibly noisy. There was a party going on until late and the sound traveled up to the eighth floor via the courtyard. Based on the noise I would not recommend the hotel although the accomodations were good and the staff was very courteous.

title: Great first stay!
text:
This was our first stay at the Four Points by Sheraton.  We were very pleased with the quality
of the room, the service, the location, and the staff were some of the friendliest we've dealt
with in several years of visiting NYC.  Would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: Outstanding Staff, make this hotel even better!
text:
Really enjoyed our over night here at Four Points. The location is great, their restaurant  & bar convenient & good. Pretty typical of most NY hotels in that the room, lobby is compact, but each space was spotless. Because we are members in the Starwood program (sign up for free) we were offered a free drink at the bar, free water in the room. And of course there was free coffee/tea available. 

But the staff here sets the hotel apart from other comparable hotels. Not only were they all professional & friendly, they went out of their way to make sure our stay was a great one. Even thought they were very busy at the front desk with others checking in, they were very helpful in giving my husband directions to a parking lot via our cell phone ~ even having to look up on a may where he had ended up. 

Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great place at a very reasonable price
text:
We only stayed here one night, but we found the room to be clean and comfortable. 

The staff was excellent beginning to end.

Not much to say other than this Four Points did exactly what we were looking for.

title: Birthday Party at the San Marino Restaurant at Four Points Hotel
text: Four Points by Sheraton is a real find. It is on a residential street very near wonderful shopping and great restaurants in Soho. The hotel is small and the people and staff are very friendly and take great care of the guests. The ground floor San Marino Restaurant is fabulous. I had my birthday party there. They offered me the whole restaurant for a buffet dinner for about 25 people.It was the perfect setting. Guests gathered in the main room which had ample seating and wonderful space for moving around to talk to the guests. The food was served in a side room at one end of the room; coats were at the other end. It was a fabulous set-up. Restaurant owner "Sammy" did a brilliant job organizing the dinner. The food was spectacular. Everyone felt very happy and relaxed, the sign of great party. This hotel and restaurant are a great find; it is a wonderful combination. Great people and great service. The location just one block north of the Houston Street subway is ideal. 5 stars!

title: great location, nicest staff, cozy rooms - book it!
text: Let's start off by saying that you don't go to NYC to spend time in a hotel room, so the limited square footage is expected but still efficient and clean. wicked comfy beds. But the staff makes the place - delightful Jessica and her side-kick on the front desk greeted us with genuine hospitality and charm - and when we needed some minor assistance later each one of the staff were really there to help. Ah - old fashioned service at its best. The location is so convenient to anything in the Village, Soho or nearby. A great alternative to the mid-town hustle.

title: Wonderful staff, great price
text: The location near Soho and  other village areas was great. It was a fantastic price compared to others we had researched. The staff was beyond friendly and accomodating. Rooms were not large but very adequate and the linens, bed, bath were are clean, fresh and nice. We were allowed a VERY early check in since there was room availability...no hassle and no charge. I would recommend this for anyone looking for a pleasant Soho area experience at an affordable price.

title: Small And Sufficient
text:
This little hotel is perfectly situated for anyone wanting to hit the shops in Soho and explore the surrounding villages of downtown New York. We easily walked to West Village, East Village, Noho, Nolita and the Meatpacking District from here. We felt absolutely safe walking through the streets at night. Subway station is located within 100 metres of the hotel as well.  

The rooms were smaller than expected here. We had a queen bed with a sufficient room for our bags. The room has a large TV, small dresser and small wardrobe with in-room safe. The safe was suitable to store our valuables and laptop. They also provide an umbrella in the room. The bathroom was quite small. It was only fit for 1 adult in there at a time. Not much room to store your own amenities. The amenities provided seem more like what you would find in a motel than a hotel. However, the bathroom did look new, modern and very clean. The heating unit was quite noisy, as it would make loud noises as it switched on and off, as well as when it was heating up the room. Our room had a nice view of the wall next door. The free wifi throughout the hotel made it convenient for us, as we had free wifi in the room.
  
The hotel had a small breakfast room, tiny bar, small lobby and reception area, which got really crowded in the mornings. There is also an internet station with 2 PCs for those that don't have their own with them. The staff were very helpful and professional, always on the ball with everything and greeted with a smile. All in all, this hotel does the basics well and would recommend to those who want something in the Soho area without paying a fortune for it.

title: Great hotel, great location, one small problem.
text: Stayed at Four Points on 1/14 and I really enjoyed the hotel. When I first arrived I noticed the lobby area was very small but I also wasn't expecting a grand lobby. The customer service was top notch. Brian at the front desk was really nice and very informative. I was on the third floor and the room was small but not cramped, the bathroom was modern and very clean. The only issue I had with the room is that view was of an ally and the draft coming in the room was terrible. I didn't complain to the staff because I honestly like a cold room when I sleep. Ordered room service for breakfast and it was fantastic. I could come back to Four Points in a heartbeat.

title: Another great experience at Four Points Sheraton
text:
Stayed: January 9-13, 2012
This is the 3rd time we’ve stayed at the Four Points Sheraton in SoHo and we are always impressed. When we arrived, we asked for an upgrade and were given one…a room on a higher floor overlooking the new World Trade Center building. We arrived early and our room was ready. The staff at the front desk is always friendly and welcoming…every single one of them. The woman who checked us in even remembered us from our last visit a year ago, which also speaks to the longevity of the staff. She also bought us a glass of wine from the hotel lobby bar. One evening as we returned to the building, the staff was having a “Thank You” reception for the guests offering wine and introducing the Housekeeping Manager and General Manager, Denise Luna. Ms. Luna took the time to chat with us and ask how our stay was and what she could do to make it better. 

Our room was always clean when we returned in the afternoon and never had to wait for housekeeping. When we asked for additional towels, someone delivered them within minutes of our request. Same with the gym…when we called about room temp and sound, an engineer arrived within a minute. 

The room itself is average-sized by NY standards. Our room had a desk and chair as well as an additional reading chair. The room also had plenty of outlets. 
The location of the hotel is great as it is located on a quiet street in SoHo, but is easily within walking distance of many great restaurants, bars, and shopping. There are two subway lines within two blocks from the hotel. 

We highly recommend this hotel and will be booking our next stay soon.

title: A Great Experience All Around
text:
I stayed at this hotel for work in the first of January and was very pleased with my stay. I work in New Jersey so my co-worker and I took the subway from Penn Station and got off the Houston stop. The hotel was about 1 ½ blocks from the subway stop. 

The check in process was great-the hotel staff was so super friendly and accommodating. I had a room on the 7th floor (I had read online that the rooms with the best view were the 10th and above but it didn’t really matter to me.) The room was very nice and had an extremely comfortable bed. The rooms are small, but so are all hotel rooms in New York City. The bathroom was very nice and there were complimentary toiletries and a blow dryer underneath the sink. The shower is all glass and completely see-through which I didn’t have a problem with but could see might be embarrassing for some. A few minutes after settling into my room, an employee came and delivered a welcome basket complete with water and a granola bar. I thought that was a nice touch. 

There is a gym and ice machine on the bottom floor. The gym was small but would have been sufficient for a quick workout. There was also a VERY small bar on the first floor (literally had 6 seats in it) but it looked like everyone in there was enjoying themselves. There was a coffee maker and tea bags in the room, as well as a complimentary bottle of water. 

On the day of check out, my meeting ran a little longer than expected so I called the front desk and asked them if I could push my check out back to 2 pm which they accommodated no problem. Again, excellent customer service and they didn’t charge a fee. 

I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is considering it. I would most definitely stay here again.

title: Beautiful room/suite and the best service!
text: We stayed here for three days. The location was excellent, we could walk to Sohos small streets and to the metro. Not far away from anything! Soho was also the nicest place on Manhattan, I think. The service was the best I have ever experienced on a hotel! Always a smile, a welcome, wishing us the best and no problem to get some help when we needed. The suite on the top of the hotel was really really beautiful with great view and big space for us as a couple! The roomservice was also clean and good! We would come back next time we are in New York! Wish Alex (the boy in the reception) a good new year and also to the others of the staff!!

title: A New York Oasis
text:
The only complaint I have from staying at the Four Points is that it makes staying at my beloved Westin REALLY hard!

The hotel itself is in great condition and has been well taken care of... I guess you could compare it to a W hotel, only tamed down a bit.  Rooms were smaller, but not so New York small you couldn't enjoy yourself.  We came with two kids under 3 and we had plenty of room to spread out and do our thing.

The highlight of our trip however, was the customer service of the staff.  I used to travel about 80% of the year for business and have stayed at many different hotels.  I used to remember hearing people talk about customer service making the difference in their stay, but I didn't really understand what they meant.... well, now I do!  The staff at this hotel may have been the most friendly and helpful staff I have ever experienced at a hotel.  The front desk crew were always attentive and excited to help.  The cleaners and maintenance crew were even exceptionally helpful and friendly.  I should mention also that we were a VERY high maintenance crew with 2 little kids, yet every request was met with a smile and was completed in minutes without having to ask twice.

For a stay in the big city, this was definitely an oasis that we enjoyed coming back to at night.  I would highly recommend staying here.

title: Great!
text:
I stayed here last year in July and really enjoyed the Sheraton.  While away from the main area of Soho, it is only a 5min walk to Broadway along Prince St, which in itself is fantastic.
The hotel is VERY close to the subway. Its just across the road (30 second walk).  The location of the hotel is really close to everything by subway and cab.  Its a really good location.
The hotel is very quiet and clean.  We were lucky enough to get a great deal through spg.com giving us very good price for a city view room!
The staff were friendly and very helpful.  I really couldn't fault this hotel at all.  If I can get the same deal again I will definitely stay here!

title: great service!
text: I stayed just one night while traveling for business. Front desk staff were very nice, even upgraded me to a king suite.  Room wasn't huge, but it was big enough. I loved the desk space - great for working - lots of plugins!  My room was close to the elevator...but I didn't hear anything at night.  Quiet location, friendly staff.  Coworkers told me to cab it to Penn Station instead of changing hotels, I should have listened!

title: Perfect for what we wanted
text:
We wanted a base for our trip, knowing we would be out for most of the time but would need a good bed when we got in! We also wanted to be out of the theatre district and close to bars and restaurants. The Four Points met all of these criteria and the room was a decent size, clean and comfortable. 
Unfortunately there was a problem with the room so we had to stay in a different hotel (literally 1 minute walk away) on the first night, the staff were highly apologetic and gave us breakfast vouchers for our stay - unfortunately our breakfast (not excessive!) came to more than the voucher value! This didnt bother us too much and once we were back in the original hotel we had no more problems - oh, except one of the lifts was out of order so there was a long wait on the first couple of days! 
Despite all that I had a very positive experiennce at the hotel and in the city, the hotel staff always said hello and goodbye and generally welcomed us. 
The hotel is in a great location for bars and restaurants, and also close to the subway stations to head up or downtown.

title: A very comfortable business trip
text: I had the opportunity to stay at the Four Points for a business trip and can't say enough about the excellent service by all of the hotel staff making my stay both productive and enjoyable. From their personally greeting you by name to the prompt response to my requests for a different desk chair or to fix a light that went out, they were very attentive to my needs. The room was reasonably sized for a New York hotel and the corner desk was spacious enough to do my work on. The bathroom had a nice shower and excellent water pressure. The hotel is steps away from the 1 line making it easy to get around by subway. I didn't eat in the restaurant but the menu looked appealing. I would recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure and look forward to staying there again

title: We were not disappointed!
text:
We booked this hotel for three reasons; 
1) We had stayed in a rather luxurious Four Points in Punta Gorda, Florida a couple of years ago 
2) Price - reasonable
3) Location 5 min walk from west village - this was 2nd stay in NYC and didn't want to be in Times Sq

We were not disappointed. We were warmly welcomed by the reception staff and checked in swiftly to our 2nd floor room facing the front street. It was a standard double room with more space than we had anticipated and it was also fairly quiet (you could hear some light corridor noise and late night tv from the neighbours but nothing that disturbed our sleep at all). The room was modern in decor, very clean, had a large flat screen tv and was also perfectly made up every day. The free water and wifi were also a definite bonus. The reception area is very small and not for lounging in, but we were too busy anyways. The neighborhood is great... a few blocks from bars and restaurants (recommend the Ear Bar and Cafe Noir) and the subway with the 1 line right around the corner for the touristy zones. We would go back.

title: Pretty Good
text: This hotel was a great deal this past week (paid $139 plus tax for a Thursday night) and I have no real complaints  - it was pleasant and adequate and a good location, but there was nothing to make it special, either, hence no extra stars).  (I would have given this hotel another half star, but you have to choose 3 or 4). Small, nicely furnished (they said "boutique style", but I wouldn't go that far), super comfy bed and pillows, free wifi, and a VERY friendly and helpful front desk staff. Do bring earplugs - there are only eight rooms on each floor, and you can hear every door close, and if you're near the elevator, as we were (room 2108) you'll hear the gears of the elevator all night long too. Walking distance to Soho, great restaurants nearby, and easy access to the subway.

title: Perfetto
text:
Venendo a Ny almeno 4 volte l'anno ho nominato questo come il mio hotel di riferimento. Premettendo che in town ci sono hotel spettacolari, questo si distingue per alcuni aspetti per me cruciali:
-qualità/prezzo con circa 130$ 
- location in pieno soho a 50 m da spring street
- camere grandi (una rarità)
- personale al top

title: Second stay - neighborhood has improved
text:
This was our second stay at this Four Points, and we were again very satisfied.  The reception staff seems to be hired for their big smiles, and they never failed to greet us as we came in and out.  

One of the problems I described in my previous review - that the hotel was far away from anything to eat - is no longer so acute.  A Pret A Manger sandwich shop and a Starbucks have opened down the street - don't go towards 7th Avenue/Varick, go in the opposite direction - and the hotel now has a pretty good Italian restaurant built in.

If you're a chocolate fan, don't miss the Jacques Torres chocolate shop around the corner from this hotel. World class!

title: Excellent in every way especially reception staff!!!!!!!!
text:
My daughter was 18 in Dec and booked this hotel for us both and my best friend who flew in from Florida.
A fantastic, spotlessly clean hotel.
We had two queen sized beds in one room so that we could all stay together.
we arrived late and after unpacking, asked the boys on reception if they could recommend a restaurant. Alex told us the choice and type of food avail nearby.Then printed off a menu and directions to help us.
Hotel was ideally situated for walking distance to restaurants and the subway was on next block.
we did not eat at hotel but had breakfast 2 mins away at diner called Van Dams  and evening meal at AOA, in Tribeca, 10 mins walk  where we tasted some of the best food we'd ever had at a very good price.
At the hotel we requested extra cartoons of milk which were delivered in less than 5 mins followed up by a call from reception. A maitenance man appeared with in 2 mins when we experienced problems with remote.
The reception staff on duty from 15 to 19 Dec ( i can only remember Alex by name, sorry ) were exceptional, greeting us with huge smiles and happy to chat and offer help if needed.
On our last evening, they offered to book a taxi and stored our luggage with named security tags as we had 11.30 pm flights home.
A stretch limousine was awaiting us, which the taxi co.provided due to a shortage of yellow taxis that night which completed a fantastic stay at this hotel.
We will be returning asap and recommending this hotel to all our friends. A BIG THANKYOU FROM US ALL.xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

title: Good Manhattan Value and Convenient for walks and subways
text: Modern, comfortable size and reasonable pricing for  NYC accomodations with efficient staff

title: great value for location and quality
text:
this is the best place I've stayed in New york so far (4 visits). the location is great for a relaxed stay, walking distance to soho and greenwich village/meatpacking, however the immediate area has very little to offer. that really doesn't matter though, as it's a nice walk to great spots for dinner, drinks, shopping, etc. 
trump soho is just down the road, and there a some nice spots on Carmine Street a few blocks away.
this is by far the best hotel I've stayed in this price bracket, and being away from times square was a real bonus. would definitely recommend and would stay again. room was average size. forget if i booked a twin or double double, but would say it was only suitable for two people or family with small children as the beds were I guess about 4ft wide, so between single and double size.

title: Modern rooms, great price on Hotwire
text:
Stayed her for one night for an airport run to pick someone up. Snagged a room with 2 full size beds on Hotwire for 99 bucks. Can't beat that.
The room was clean & modern, albeit small- but it's NYC we're talking about.
Check-in & check-out was a breeze with very friendly staff.
Parking was a challenge (again we're in NYC folks) but I ended up at a Central Parking System garage about 6 blocks up. Tiny lobby with a smallish bar, didnt end up eating in the hotel. I was on the 14th floor. Crank up your heat if you're there during fall.winter. I usually keep my rooms cold but this room was quite chilly without the heat on. Also surprised that the window opened all the way, seeing as I was so high up.
Big 42 inch TV (almost too bnig for the room) with a tiny corner desk w/surge suppressor. iPod dock/alarm clock. Clean modern bathroom. Free bottled water. Over all very good for an overnighter. For dinner I'd recommend Mark Joseph Steakhouse. In the financial district, kinda pricey but a great meal. Or you can get Domino's delivered and they'rr bring it up to your room =)

title: Small, comfortable, well-located to avoid the mid-town madness but convenient to the subway, Greenwich Village, SoHo and Chelsea
text:
While this was admittedly a freebie courtesy of frequent flier miles, it was a pleasant surprise to discover this pleasant small hotel just a block south of the Houston station on the #1 line.

We were greeted by a very pleasant and courteous staff at check-in and, though an hour early, shown promptly to our room.  The room was small but nicely appointed with a fairly sleek, modern aesthetic that was warm and comfortable.  The bed was comfortable and nicely outfitted with fluffy comforters and equally comfortable pillows.  The bathroom was modern and nicely outfitted.  One quibble - the faucet in the sink was overly touchy and you can't avoid spraying the countertop no matter how slowly the water is running.  It was a quiet and restful night's sleep, though it should be noted that some of the second floor rooms are above the restaurant, which was hosting a fairly noisy celebration of some kind that brought several calls of complaint to the manager while we dined at the bar.  I would highly recommend this Sheraton for anyone wanting to sleep comfortably in a more quiet but interesting Manhattan location.

title: Boutique type of hotel in great Village location.
text: This hotel is a great location for walking around Soho, Greenwich Village and Little Italy.  The hotel is modern and up-to-date.  The room was small but tastefully decorated, comfortable and very clean.  The hotel staff was very accommodating, friendly and helpful.

title: Good customer service, modern rooms
text: The rooms were clean and modern and if you are on a high floor, have beautiful views of the city.  The downstairs desk managers were friendly and nice.  The rooms are a bit small, but standard for any hotel room in NYC.

title: Right in the middle of it all
text:
Although there is no view, this Four Points hotel is located in a great area near the river, the subway and the Soho/ village shops and entertainment district. 
The rooms and everything else is smaller than at the big brother Sheratons but then, so are the prices. The hotel is clean, the staff tries to be helpful and you can get everything you need within a 10 minute walk.
All 'n all, a good place to stay if you can get a good $ deal.

title: Great hotel - good location and convenient
text: I stayed here for two nights last week whilst visiting my US office.. The hotel does exactly what you need. A comfortable room, big HDTV, complimentary bottled water and fast wifi. The room was clean, and the room service was fast. It was my 4th stay there and I couldn't fault them!

title: Clean, pleasant, did what I needed...
text:
I got a very good rate here for one night via Priceline and got everything I wanted, and more.

(To be clear, though, what I wanted did not include a restaurant (I'm in NYC, for gods' sakes), a bar (I don't really drink), a health club or pool (too busy being in the city))

To start with, the desk staff was absolutely friendly and had me checked in in ~2 minutes, including handing me the free wifi password and emphasizing the free water in the room, or at the desk as I wanted, and everything else they had to offer.

It was a fine clean room, far more space around the bed than I'd been expecting from earlier reviews here. The bathroom was large and well appointed (though the shower stall was a bit tight. 6" wider would've been nice).

The bed was reasonable comfy, the pillows were mostly feather (win!), the TV was large - though the lodgenet installation was odd. There were outlets everywhere, and the blinds kept 98% of the light out. (That I need 100% dark in the morning is my problem, not theirs, though it'd be great if they worked on edge-of-window blocking.)

Sure, there's street noise - see above comment for what city you're in - but it was reasonable and (since I'm out of practice of dealing with NYC night noise) a pair of earplugs did me fine.

I have NO complaints about this place, at least not for the price I paid. :)

title: Good city hotel  - good location
text:
We went for a city break with three girls and chose this hotel. The hotel is clean, the rooms are a liitle small but normal for NYC. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is great, a 10 -15 minute walk from the boutiques in SOHO. Also the subway is a threeminute walk and it takes you straight to times square. The areas is safe for girls to stay and we never felt anxious when going back to the hotel in the evenings.  The restaurant in the hotel is awful, definetly go to local dinners.

Would recommend Brooklyn Dinner on 57th street between 5 and 7 avenue, for an origianl america breakfast, the portions are huge and the food is delicious.

Nearer to the hotel there is VanDam's dinner which has good breakfast and lunch.

title: Great Service & Location
text: My wife and I took our daughter to NYC for a long weekend so she could experience the city during her senior year of high school.  Although the lobby is small the overall service that we received to include the booking of the property, check in experience, cleanliness of the room, housekeeping during our stay, and check out was flawless.  The staff at the front desk helped us out with taxi service, subway directions, and countless dining options.  Although the property is about 40 blocks south of the Times Square and Rockefeller Center area it's only a 10 minute $8 taxi ride.  The WTC is only a 20 minute walk south and we got to experience history in making.  Battery Park is also just a 5 minute walk from the WTC area.  I would highly recommend this property if you're looking to do it all in NYC.

title: Bed and Chocolate
text:
The room is tiny but the space is used efficiently and it still has style--nice modern decor, well-kept, clean, everything you need. Staff was genuinely friendly and helpful. My only complaint was that I felt like I was sleeping on plywood--probably the worst bed I've ever encountered. 

Jacques Torres Chocolatier is right around around the corner. That more than made up for not sleeping well!

title: Nice hotel
text:
I spend a weekend on this hotel which was a very nice hotel. Small rooms but clean. We were 2 persons in a double room. Comfortable beds. The receptionstaff was very helpful. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel so I can not say anything about the restaurant.
Nice neighbourhoud. 
I would recommend this hotel.

title: Perfectly Adequate
text: Everything about this hotel is perfectly adequate, which means that it is nothing special or memorable, but everything you would generally expect from a mid-range hotel.  The rooms were small, but modern and clean.  The bed was comfortable.  There were enough ammenities, but nothing special.  The location is good.  You are in close proximity to lots of great shopping and restaurants, but you are not on top of the big tourist draws.  I travel to NYC frequently and would stay here again for a quick trip, but probably not for a special occassion.  The front desk staff was incredibly friendly particularly for NYC.

title: Great location!
text:
It was nice to stay at this quite hotel from Thursday 6st Sept to Friday 9 Sep (last 3 nights in NY), after 5 nights accommodation of crazy Times Square. As Starwood member, we try to stay in Starwood hotels.

We checked-in at 5pm. We booked a traditional room and requested in our original booking top floor with views.  We got room 2003! The view from this room was fantastic, windows everywhere, overlooking the Hudson River and the city (photo). We had a very welcoming room and very quiet, right on the corner in Level 20. They offer free bottle of water and coffee/tea facilities for your convenience. At night, they deliver to you room some snacks (popcorn) if you wish to relax in your room watching a movie. The bed is super comfortable. The only drawback is the internet (free of charge) which is really slow.

As we wanted to explore the Soho suburb and restaurants and cafes, we didn’t dine in at the Hotel. They have “happy hours from 4m to 7pm and lunch specials.

The nearest subway station is only two blocks from the hotel. The WTC is only two stations away and 10 min ride to Times Square. There is a Starbucks located just a block from the hotel (right on the corner)

Also a big thank you to all the front desk staff that were very friendly helpful. We would like to thank especially Alexander Ruiz (Front Office Supervisor) for making our stay an unforgettable one. Keep up the good service Alex!

title: Nice hotel, great location
text:
The only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 "stars" is because it's not a luxury hotel; it's a mid-grade one.  However, it does mid-grade better than a lot of other "mid-grade" options.  First of all, we stayed here using points so for us it was a win-win.  I imagine they charge a lot for this property considering it's in Manhattan and I might not be as thrilled with my experience if I was actually paying, but that said, I was very pleased.  The staff was very friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  Staff makes all the difference in a hotel, and I give this staff top marks.  We stored our bags twice with the hotel and they even seemed surprised but pleased when we offered them a few dollars for doing so - unlike most other hotels which consider it almost a fee.  The room was clean, adequately sized, and the bed was very comfortable.  I even liked the pillows (which is unusual)!  The bathroom was nicely updated and again, a decent size.  Both the bedroom and bathroom are not huge, don't get me wrong -- this is Manhattan after all -- but decently sized.  We had one issue with the bathroom - the shelf above the sink was broken at some point and thus leaned downwards.  Our stuff was perched a little precariously but didn't fall - no biggie.

My biggest complaint about this hotel would be the noise.  The hallway noise (people coming in and out of their rooms, or waiting for the elevator) sounded as if it was happening RIGHT next to you.  Also, the room wasn't well insulated from street noise.  And finally, when the AC kicked on, it did so loudly.  However, this wasn't a huge deal -- pop in some ear plugs (a necessity when traveling) and it's fine (although you may be awoken throughout the night by some noise or another).  We were also on the front of the hotel, which could have led to the load street noise.

The location was ideal - so close to SoHo and the Village.  I was very excited about the location. Yes, it's pretty far west, but a quick 5-7 minute walk puts you into the thick of things.

I really appreciate the free bottle of water.  More hotels should do this.  For what probably costs them $0.25, it's worth the goodwill (and the well-hydrated clients are happy clients).

title: Good location, clean & great staff.
text: Four Points was the perfect location for a 3 day visit to the Soho neighbood of NYC. The hotel is within easy walking distance of great shops, galleries and restaurants. Rooms are a little small, but clean and adequate. My only suggestion is to add a mirror over the desk. One mirror in the bathroom is not adequate.

title: 5 Star Service! Highly Recommended!
text: Stayed here last weekend for a girls get away. We had to put a lot of trust in what others have said about location, not staying in the city before. We had an wonderful time. This location is great. The hotel was exceptionally clean, the room was small, but we are in NYC, of course it is small. Housekeeping was wonderful. Goofing off, my friend and I would write messages to each other on the shower door. You could tell the next day, it was thourougly cleaned every time. The best part of this hotel is the front desk staff! Nicholas, Alex and Emily were AMAZING. I travel a lot and this is by far, the best customer service I have ever experienced! From the second we walked in with our bags, Nicholas greeted us with a smile and took care of us. Every time we came in, we were welcomed. When we left each time, we were offered directions to where we were going. I called to ask where the ice was, they said, "we will just send some up". One night they just called up to our room to see if we needed anything. The last night we were there, we asked for suggestions for a restaurant, Nicholas actually called and made the reservation for us. Then, champage was brought to our table, "courtesy of our hotel"! I can't say enough about how wonderful these New Yorkers were! Like I said before, best service EVER! Thanks guys!

title: Great, quick overnight stay
text:
As a Starwood Member, I try and stay at a Starwood branded hotels when possible. I had a very early stand up paddle start the next morning at nearby Pier 40 and decided that the location of this hotel was perfect as I could walk to the Hudson river and the Pier the next morning-which I did. Four Points is more of a budget/economical business traveler type hotel that although is predominately no frills, it is very clean, comfortable and perfect for "just a place to stay". Four Points is kinda the equavalent of Marriot's Courtyard by Marriot brand. 

As mentioned, the location is great if you want to be near both the West Side, Soho, Tribeca and the Holland Tunnel. I also needed a quick and easy drive from Pier 40 to the South Street Seaport-which it is as well. ROOMS: small but nice and thoughtfully appointed. Very comfy bed with a nice flat screen tv. Bathroom was clean although when I left at 5am didn't get a chance to shower.

Staff: supa friendly and very nice! It's very easy to get alot of atitude in NYC, but the guys behind the desk were great. They even gave me extra water for my hyrdration pack the next day. My wife was with me who has very high expectations of hotel rooms-even she was pleased. I will definately stay their again next year as well. All in all very satisfied. Oh ya, because this hotel is sorta off the beaten path, it's easy to just pull over out front, unload, etc....

title: Standard, Nothing Exciting
text:
My stay was very short, only one night. The good: EXCELLENT staff, very friendly, very concerned with my needs. The location was ok. The hotel was immaculate. The room tiny but very, very clean (typical size of many standard rooms in NYC hotels). The bed awesomely comfortable. 
The bad: nothing exciting about the place, dismal views, bar started shutting down by 11:30. AC unit in the room was noisy...click on/click off. The place is perfect for the busy traveler or business traveler that needs a clean, comfortable bed after a busy day and not much more.

title: Nice for the price point but slooooow internet
text:
Only a few blocks away from the heart of Soho  the hotel can put you in that area and should be able to save you a few dollars. Its clean , my room was quiet  from the traffic noise but the air system was quite noisy. ( it might have just been a maintenance issue)
