Front desk staff especially Patricia were very nice and efficient .Bathroom and room in general though smallish was clean and updated . I would stay again if the price was right.

title: A reliable, friendly and well located hotel
text:
This is the fourth time I have stayed at this Four Points Sheraton. It’s one of the rare times I’ve stayed in this chain within the Starwood portfolio and I find it to be high value, friendly, informal and just right.

The hotel is situated in Soho and easy walking distance to shopping off of Broadway and the quaint stores of the Soho area. The staff are very friendly and do a great job. They are efficient and know their hotel well.

Lobby is rather small and so is the restaurant area but it does the trick. Rooms are also quite small but this is normal for New York. The rooms are well equipped, well decorated and have windows that open. The room was very clean, especially the washroom and had all the necessities for a one day overnight.

Free WIFI was definitely appreciated and add a lot of value to the experience. The ipod docking station was also appreciated.

I’d definitely stay here again when staying in the Soho area. Keep up the good work.

title: Me, my wife and Irene
text: What better weekend to pick to head to NYC than the weekend Irene made her visit...  The hotel staff were amazing in giving us top notch service despite the chaos the city was under.  With the exception of elevator service and room service for the critical 24 hour period the storm hit, all other services were unaffected.  We were really impressed with the hotel.  I hadn't considered Four points hotels before, but will definitely do so from now on.  Very clean rooms and this hotel is in the perfect location, bordering SOHO and Greenwich.

title: Good Hotel
text: Good Hotel. Typical smaller NYC rooms but clean and well accommodated.  A few small maintenance issues between the 2 rooms I had but they were fixed immediately after notifying the front desk. Bar and restaurant in the hotel which was convenient. Outdoor seating was nice. Front desk staff was very good-helpful and friendly. Also, it was an easy walk to Greenwich Village restaurant and shops and a few nightclubs. I felt very safe in the area. Taxis were easy to get. I would stay here again. About a $5 taxi ride to midtown

title: da prendere in considerazione
text: Hotel di medie dimensioni sito nella parte bassa di Manhattan. Le camere sono piccole se comparate a quelle di altre località degli States, ma in linea con gli standard di New York. Lo stesso ragionamento puo' farsi per il costo delle camere, in linea con la media cittadina. E' pulito e molto comodo per visitare la città. La colazione non è compresa, ma c'è ampia scelta di ristoranti (uno è contiguo all'hotel) e bar nelle immediate vicinanze, nei quali è' possibile magiare bene e a prezzi onesti. I collegamenti versi gli aeroporti sono garantiti da un servizio convenzionato con l'hotel, che è comunque molto più caro da quanto offerto da taxi gialli, che peraltro passano in continuazione.

title: Convenient location and very friendly staff
text:
Stayed at this property for 3 nights and being a SPG Gold, we were instantly upgraded to a high floor with a view and automatic late check out at 4 pm without having to ask.
The property looks fairly new located just a little west of soho, steps away from Houston or Canal on the 1 train. The area is not bustling during the weekend , away from the madness in the middle of soho. The standard room is equiped with most amenities , a modern bathroom with shower stall. The staff is very friendly in all aspect and helpful. My only comment on this property is there is some level of noise echoing from the bathroom vents coming from housekeeping and also noise from nearby guest rooms. If only they can the doors more soundproof that would be perfect. It could be only that room but I can't say for other rooms. Being an easier sleeper that doesn't bother me..and I will definitely stay there again..

title: Practical Hotel with Outstanding Customer Service
text:
I had a mix-up with payments (NOT the fault of the hotel), and the reception staff went out of their way to accomodate me and help as best they can. This was far beyond the call of duty, and I am so impressed. The friendliness and wonderful service continued for my whole stay. Amazing!

The room was clean, good size and practical (not luxurious, but very nice). The shower was lovely.

Breakfast was huge, speedy and yummy (but pretty standard). Perfect for pre-work.

title: Great attitude
text: Their systems were still awry from the storm the prior weekend, but they managed around not being able to find my reservation.  While I was checking in, one of the desk folks was going to great lengths to communicate with a Swiss couple who apparently had an issue with their next hotel (I thin), passing an  ipad back and forth using a translation program to communicate.  Room was solid for the property tier.

title: WENT FOR A WEDDING
text: This place was clean but I did have mysterious bites while in NY that I finally tracked down to Central Park. I quite literally tore the bed apart to make sure I hadn't been a bedbug vicitm & everything was spotless. Even though we had a discounted rate for the wedding I was shocked by the cost of the room but I think that is just because I am unaccustomed to NY prices (even though I live in LA it is a bargain by comparison). Room was teeny tiny with a very small bathroom but all furnishings were comfortable and they had excellent air conditioning.

title: I was very impressed from the moment I checked in with the amazing staff!
text: I travel every year to New York by myself and found this place on expedia. It was in a great location in SoHo within walking distance of the subway and many great restaurants. I'm a 30 year old female and I felt very safe at this hotel, especially at night. The staff was remarkable. Super friendly! (That is shocking in New York, haha!). I stayed for 5 days and every employee, down to the cleaning staff said hello at every opportunity. The rooms have Starbucks coffee and Tea with a bottle of water everyday. Nice to have when I'm cruising around the city. Clean bathrooms too.

title: Excellent Choice...
text: It took me awhile to settle on booking at the this hotel, mainly because it was my first time to NYC and I was unfamiliar with the areas and transit. However, this hotel is in a great location, nearby to several subway lines and bus routes. I found it very easy to navigate the MTA from this hotel. The staff was very friendly, and always saying "Hello" or "Welcome back!" anytime I entered the building. Mainy people say the rooms are small but I found it  quite adequate for my needs. I was on the 2nd floor with a street view and didn't notice any street noise. It had been raining off and on while I was on my way to check into the hotel and I asked the staff if they new a place nearby in which I could purchase an umbrella, low and behold they have umbrellas in stock for customers use, free of charge...unless you lose it. Sammy the bartender is wonderful, he makes you feel like you're at the corner bar conversing with a friend and not at a hotel bar with a stranger! Overall, great hotel (very clean), great staff, and great location. I definitely will be staying here again the next time I visit the Big Apple.

title: New Favorite Hotel in NYC!
text:
This is a great hotel.  At first, the location seems strange in an industrial area.  Once you get out and walk, however, you'll see what a great spot you're in...just a block or 2 away from great Soho restaurants and shops. We walked everywhere in the area from Soho to NYU to Tribeca to Chinatown.  Subway is only a few short blocks away.

Front desk and restaurant staff are excellent...very helpful and easy for us to ask questions.   Food was very good in the onsite restaurant, and they have a cute area right out front to sit outside while you eat.

Rooms are small but very nice. Loved the desk in the corner for me to work.  Unlike some reviewers, I appreciated the constant fan noise I could have at night to drown out the city.  Slept very well in the plush, comfortable beds.  Although small, the bathrooms were beautiful and functional.  There were only 10 or so rooms on each floor; the elevators were quick.

Next time we visit NYC, we will hope to stay here. Loved it!

title: Would Stay Here Over Trump
text: I continue to enjoy the fine service at this hotel. You will feel like part of the family if you come regularly, which I do. The management, Mr. Brooks and Mr. Kirincic are of the best in the business. I've stayed everywhere in town from the Four Seasons/Le Parker Meridien/Essex House/Helmsely to the Benjamin, et.al. My needs require a downtown hotel and this is sensational. Even if you have business uptown, the subway is right there and it is easy to get a cab M-F. McDougal Street takes you directly through the village and is only a couple of short blocks from the hotel. This is a fine boutique style hotel with a luxury, but not pretentious feel.

title: Great Location and Excellent Staff!
text: I have stayed many times at the Sheraton Four Points Soho in NYC, including 4 or 5 times already this year.   It is a relatively new hotel and provides excellent value for price (well, at least by New York price standards).    The staff is very friendly and professional, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the location is tremendous – you are just a few blocks from the most interesting areas of Soho and the West Village, so it is a great spot to call home  during a NY visit.   I often drive from the hotel to NJ for work and the hotel is literally 4 blocks from the entrance to the Holland Tunnel so you don’t really have to fight traffic to get there.   The hotel is right off Varick Street (7th Avenue) but Charlton Street (where the hotel is) is very quiet.  There are coffee shops and good deli’s on both Varick and Hudson (one block to the west).  Also – you can walk to the Hudson River in less than 10 minutes, and the Riverfront park is wonderful for walking or biking.   The only downside is that the rooms, like all new-ish ‘boutique’ hotels, are not large – however, you are not likely to be spending a lot of time in them so it may matter less than in some other places.  Overall, I highly recommend this hotel!

title: great location, friendly staff, clean rooms and good beds
text:
we stayed at the four points in soho for four nights in August. We stayed as a family with two children in a double.
The front desk staff were very friendly and warm and made us feel very welcome indeed. The hotel lobby is very small, but efficient. we stayed on the 7th floor and the room was both clean, up to date and very quiet. Also, a big plus on the comfortable beds. rooms are not very big but easily accomodate the four of us and our luggage. especially for longer stays it pays to unpack, here was sufficient room to put clothes for four days. 
The great thing about the Four points in soho is that is is easy to get to both by car and public transport. The subway station is literally just around the  corner. also there are starbucks, dunkin donuts and many other places nearby which are handy for breakfast or a quick coffee. the Village is only a short walk away as is the University campus with many nice restaurants. The rooms carried umbrellas for use by patrons, which came in handy as there were some rainy days. 
overall, we would certainly return and recommend this hotel to families traveling to new york.

title: clean, friendly, good location
text:
Not right at Times Square which we avoid but close to Broadway Ave, Canal Street, the Hudson river and in Walking distance of Greenwich village.

A good location for returning visitors but for first time visitors you might want to be closer to Central Park and the madness of Times square.

Not the best choice if you are going on a Museum tour since it is farther south than might be convenient.

Hotel was very nicely appointed, great beds and very clean.

title: A great stay at the Four Points Soho
text: We spent 4 nights here and really enjoyed our stay. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, were able to answer all of our questions, and satisfy all of our needs.  The location is great (on the west side of Soho) - just a short walk from central Soho, MePa (meat packing district), and West Village. Close to many great restaurants and fantastic shopping. All around a very pleasant stay and I would definitely return.

title: Like sleeping next to a jet engine
text:
While the rooms were relatively clean, the air conditioning unit and fan in the bathroom are extremely loud. I'm not a light sleeper at all and used to city noise, but it felt like I was sleeping next to a jet engine warming up. Even tried turning off the unit, but it was way too hot. 

Additionally, I left my keys in the room on checkout, only to find out that housekeeping was unable to find them, but it seemed more like they were unwilling to look for them.

Internet speeds were sub-dial up - business travelers beware.

title: My new hotel of choice in NYC
text: I recently stayed at the Four Points SOHO for a fun girls trip to NY. I love the Soho/Village area and wanted to be close to the restaurants, shopping etc. I was honestly a bit on the fence because I've always stayed at a W or Westin never a Four Points. Wow, I was totally impressed. We were greeted at the hotel by Emily and she was very helpful and friendly in accomodating us and getting us familiar with the area. Everyone is VERY friendly and helpful at the hotel, even the room attendants, everyone always says hello and has a smile, you can see they love their job. The hotel was suprisingly close to everything...I saw reviews saying bad location, but I have to completely disagree. New York is a walking city and its about a 5-10 min walk to the heart of SOHO or the Village. There are numerous great restaurants within that walk---(great bakery Francois Payard, you gotta try Molly's Cupcakes (Cupcake Wars winner from Food network) on Bleeker it's new and the best cupcakes we had anywhere in the city (strawberry shortcake cupcake) and believe me we tried a lot!!!, Joe's Pizza at 6 and Bleeker is great for a true NY slice it's the locals choice for Pizza, for a nice dinner try Palma on Cornelia everything is wonderful!). It was nice to be close to several subway lines so that it made getting to any part of the city very easy (ask for the map of the city when you check in, it's all you'll need).  The room was nicely appointed, much larger than expected considering you are in Manhattan (much bigger than what I've stayed at in the W in NY). The bathroom is small, similar to that of the W. Walking at night was completely safe, not sketchy at all for two girls walking back after midnight most nights. Next time I'm in NY I would have no doubts in booking a room at this hotel again over the W or Westin...it's a true value and nice boutique style hotel.

title: Country manners in the heart of SoHo
text: What a pleasure to stay at this hotel!  From the moment we pulled up (traveling by car from Virginia with 5 girls...yikes) to the time we departed, the staff could not have been more attentive or friendly.  First greeted by Michael, the hilarious bell-hop who parked the car and helped with bags, then the front desk staff who worked with us to find two adjoining rooms and to map out our itinerary for the day.  I travel a lot for business, and have come to trust the Sheraton brand for cleanliness and comfort.  This hotel was no exception.  The rooms were neat and clean, and fairly well-organized.  Decent views into SoHo, which was a bit worse for the wear IMO.  We were right down the street from TriBeCa, which is one of my favorite areas to stroll in.  It's also an easy walk to ChinaTown and Little Italy....maybe 10 minutes tops.

title: Not bad hotel - good location
text: Rooms were small but then again we didn't spend much time in them. Our (king size) bed was very comfy - we loved it. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast very basic and average. Great location near fab restaurants, shops & subway station. One problem was that our tv signal kept cutting in & out as did my mobile coverage otherwise we were happy with our stay.

title: Loved it - great location
text: Very reasonably priced for the area.  Convenient to subway.  Friendly staff.  Decent restaurant.  Normal NYC sized rooms but well appointed.  Only complaint would be slow sped of Internet but that seems to be everywhere now.

title: Best Manhattan Stay
text: We used to live in NYC and head back for a weekend every once in a while.  This is the best place we have stayed (usually book hotels on hotwire, this one included).  New, clean, large rooms (by NY standards), close to public transport, great neighborhood.  Could not recommend enough!!  Even have gratis Starbucks coffee and bottled water in room.  Staff super friendly and helpful.  Very, very comfy bed.

title: Very average hotel, very small rooms
text: it is new hotel, front desk people are very very nice, rooms are small (even upgraded once are small). Location is great especially for shopping and dining.

title: What a treat!
text: I stay at the Four Points often for business.   This last trip I arrived in the middle of the night due to delayed flights and a nasty cab ride into town.   The manager on duty took especially great care of me - upgraded my room on arrival and made sure that my stay was pleasant.    He even offered to help me by booking a car service for my ride back to the airport, to make my trip home much nicer.    On top of being a clean, quite and safe hotel, I really appreciate a hotel that makes me feel welcomed, cared for and tended to during my stay.    The Four Points delivers - every time.

title: Gutes Businesshotel
text: Das Four Points SoHo liegt nahe der U-Bahn Stationen Houston und Spring St und ist somit von überall in der Stadt gut erreichbar. South of Houston (SoHo) bietet sich vor allem für Shopping Ausflüge zu Fuss an, aber auch ein Spaziergang entlang des Hudson oder im neuen High Line Park sind sehr zu empfehlen. Das Hotelpersonal war stets freundlich und zuvorkommend, für ein Zimmerupgrade hat es jedoch trotz Gold Status im SPG Programm nicht gereicht. Nicht einmal ein Zimmer auf einem hohen Stockwerk lag drin, was allerdings nicht weiter schlimm war, da man so zumindest nicht auf den Lift warten muss (der 2. Stock ist gut via Treppenhaus erreichbar). Die Zimmer sind klein aber sauber und zweckmässig ausgestattet. Insgesamt ein gutes Hotel zu vergleichsweise vernünftigem Preis.

title: Friendly staff, clean rooms, safe place
text:
Really friendly bunch of staff there.  The person who checked me in had a smile that brightened up my evening after a long flight.  I am picky that they do not reveal my room number out loud and they didn't.  

The room was typical in size for something in NYC.  It was very clean and efficient.  Cute little business center where there are 2 computers and a printer and printing is free.  The only bad thing was the loud A/C unit in the room.  It would wake me up from time to time when it kicked on.  Having said that, I would stay here again in a heartbeat if business takes me to the SoHo area.

title: Service with a smile and SoHo, too!
text: Can't believe I haven't reviewed this hotel before... Have probably stayed 10- 12 times in the past 2-3 years.  The location is fabulous: close to tunnel, parking garage & subway close by and of course, great shopping & restaurants, too.  The rooms may be small, but they are clean, modern and well-appointed. Showers are excellent!  The staff at the hotel-especially the reservation desk-is top-notch!   Even when heading to New York for business and others are staying at the specified conference hotel, we choose to stay @ The Sheraton SoHo.  There’s a nice patio for drinks/dining.  Great experience every time.

title: Most excellent hotel & staff!
text: We travel a lot for our business and have stayed at much more expensive hotels, but never have been treated better than the people at 4 Points Soho. Just a couple blocks from all the shops and restaurants in Soho, and a short walk to subway stops for anywhere else you'd like to go in NY. The room was clean and new, the bed ultra comfy and plush. A very nice large screen HD TV for when we were relaxing in the room. We felt so pampered! A shout out for the staff--Patricia and Jessica at the front desk were SO sweet and helpful, and Rich the maintenance man was amazingly fast to come and fix the chain on the blinds that we broke twice in a row.  I think we were doing something wrong trying to raise the Roman shade, but he showed up in MINUTES to fix it for us! We couldn't believe it! We highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely be back!

title: Very comfy and well located
text: Stayed here two nights and while the rooms are the smallest I have ever experienced in NY, they were very comfortable, clean and well maintained.  The room has a nice flat screen TV, in fact, a lot of TV for a room that size.  The staff was excellent including a very cheerful and energetic welcome from Nicholas when we arrived.  The pillows were so nice my son (13) wanted to buy one to take home.  The hotel is located in SoHo within a block of the MTA and we found that very useful.  We didn't use any of the amenities of the hotel or the bar/restaurant.  There is a little outside area to sit in to enojor food/drink.  We did use a deli and the donut place almost next door to grab a quick bite in the morning before we ventured off.  This hotel is adjacent to Little Italy and only a few train stops from the World Trade Center.  Normally, I like to stay up near the theater district but this was a nice hotel.  If your focus is in the southern end of Manhattan and like to walk, this is a nice choice.

title: What a Hidden Jewel
text:
This Hotel doesn't look like much on the outside after staying at the W hotel BUT the staff was so friendly!!! When we arrived our room wasn't ready so they brought us a drink at the bar.

The room had a great bed & a great view of the Empire State Building!!! The bed was filled with fluffy pillows and plush quilt. The room was spacious with large TV. I loved the turndown service...they would place a bag of White Cheddar Cheese Popcorn on your bed-yummy!!!!

We walked everywhere: Caliente Cab Company, Grey's hot dogs, Village Lantern Bar (comedy show), Washington Square Park & all across Bleecker Street. Great Bars, Shops & Hidden Neighborhoods!!! 

I would stay here again for sure!!!!!!!

title: Friendly Staff, Great Location
text:
On this trip to NYC I wanted to stay in in SoHo rather than the tourist area of Times Square.  

The hotel was four star quality.  Large beds, excellent service.  Bleeker St (with various bards and nightlife) was a five minute walk away.  Shopping on Broadway was approximately 10 minutes away.  

I received an excellent room rate on the internet and was not dissappointed.  

If your after a nice beer after a day of exploring, The Brooklyneer (a nearby bar made from reclaimed Coney Island boardwalk) at 220 West Houston is an excellent alternative to the lobby bar.

title: Loved Four Points SoHo
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights and we loved it. 

Pros: We had a Executive Room on the top floor and the room was spacious, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom was chic. I didn't find it small at all, it is NYC what do you expect.

The staff gave us free water and umbrellas which came in handy

Its near a subway station and you can easily walk to SoHo or Greenwich Village

The Staff is super friendly

Cons:

The bar is so small its almost non - existent

The hotel has 2 elevators which take forever during busy hours. We had a corner room so we didn't hear the elevator at night 

The gym is tiny and parking in a garage will cost you

title: Clean hotel, great location
text: Hotel was very updated in a great location near SoHo and Little Italy.  Front desk staff was very accommodating, gave me extra complimentary water bottles every day which was great given the extreme heat (105 degrees outside), and let me check out at 4:30 PM on my departure day so I could enjoy the neighborhood leisurely before my flight.  I'm SPG Platinum, booked the room on points and got a very nice room on the 21st floor with a view of the buildings of lower Manhattan.

title: Summer Vaycay
text: The rooms were a little small, but very nice. The location was amazing...in SOHO right by a metro station with plenty of eateries and shops near by. Free Water was a plus, and the higher floors have decent views. The front desk was really nice as well. I would totally stay here again.

title: AMAZING HOTEL!
text:
We lucked out by getting this place with priceline. The room was so chic and clean (Bed bug free and without any reports!). The bed was sooo comfy. I wished we stayed here longer. Staff was super nice and friendly. 

Area was great, walking distance to soho and subway to everything. Next time, I'm in New York I'll stay here again. 

ps. try Jacques Torres nearby for their amazing hot chocolate.

title: Not for business travelers
text:
Cons: Stayed three nights and could not get the internet to work fast enough to function. Front desk constantly reset the router but nothing changed. This was very annoying and made things much harder. Business center computers were just as slow. Took me 30 minutes to write this review with the hotels internet. Also had issues with the television working and getting channels. Simple luxuries but very annoying issues to deal with repeatedly.  

Pros: Fairly clean room, nice hotel staff

title: The best 3.5 star I have stayed at
text:
This place was beautifully decorated, had super comfortable beds, friendly and helpful staff, reasonably priced, and it was close to a subway. The rooms were a little small but that is to be expected in NYC! 
This place surpassed my expectations and I would definitely stay here again.

title: carino e comodo
text: Hotel in zona soho, perfetto per chi desidera una sistemazione in questa zona della città. l'hotel è pulito, le camere spaziose, inoltre l'hotel offre collegamento ad internet gratuito sia nella lobby che in camera. La colazione non è compresa nel prezzo ma cmq se deciderete di farla è davvero abbondante, all'americana insomma! Il personale è molto disponibile anche per prenotazioni di ristornati e servizi navetta verso l'aereoporto. Anche la fermata della metro non dista molto ( 2-3 isolati ) dall'hotel. Il rapporto qualità prezzo ( se fatta la prenotazione per tempo ) è ottimo!

title: The best getaway hotel!
text:
From start to finish this was a great place to stay.  From the friendly staff( everyone stopped to say hello) to the accommodating manager (Alan).   The hotel is located perfectly for anyone who wants to be up close and personal with SOHO or the village.  It is easy walking distance to shopping, Canal street and everything that is great about this area of the city.  We walked to Washington square park Sunday morning with Times and coffee.  You even get a discount to park in a garage a block away.  
The rooms ( we hand a king size on the 20th) had a view of the river and you never felt like anyone could see into your room.  Unlike other hotels in Manhattan.  The bathroom was clean and appeared new.  The bedding was clean and very comfortable( you could even buy a set).  The room had a 32" LCD tv that was easily seen on the bed or a chair.  There was a workout room down in the basement that was air conditioned.  We didn't take advantage of the restaurant nor the outside seating, however it looking inviting to sit and have a drink there.  
The manager, Alan, was warm and inviting.  He seemed competent and if (I don't believe there would be) an issue it would be handled professionally and to our satisfaction. 
Although our stay was short lived I plan on returning several times a year.  
Thanks for a great time Sheraton!!!

title: Friendliest staff I have ever experienced!!!
text:
This place could change NYC reputation! Absolutely the most genuinely friendly and most helpful staff I have ever experienced. I spend about 75 nights a year in hotels, for business and pleasure. We dealt with 5 different front desk personell throughout our stay and met a maintenance employee in the elevator. Every single one of these employees had a smile, was friendly and helpful in everyway possible. 

Also very clean!

title: Boutique hotel experience with the quality you expect from a chain
text:
Having lived in Manhattan for 8 years and relocated to MA over two years ago, my fiance and I decided to take a trip to NYC during our week long vacation this July. We scoured the internet looking for a good deal (which would allow us to stay for more than one night) with a good location and of decent quality.

The Four Points by Sheraton in SoHo exceeded our expectations on all counts. 

The staff was friendly and accommodating, the room was clean, well appointed and luxurious, and the location was fabulous. We could walk to SoHo, the West Village, Greenwich Village and TriBeCa with ease, and there were several subway stations very close by if we wanted to venture further than comfortable walking distance. 

On top of all this, we were able to get a great rate which bumped this hotel up from "very good" to "excellent" in our opinion. We were so pleasantly surprised and comfortable with the room that we got that we found ourselves wanting to stay longer than the two nights that we booked. 

One caveat to this glowing recommendation: if this is your first time in Manhattan, it might not be the best place to stay. I think that if my fiance and I had never visited before and wanted to partake in all of the tourist activities, the location would have been too isolated from Times Square/other tourist destinations, and because the hotel is smaller, I might have expected a lobby and amenities on a grander scale.

That said, as a veteran NY-er, this was the perfect hotel for our visit. If you are from NY or returning for a visit, the SoHo location is unbeatable. We look forward to visiting again!

title: Friendly, clean, but we got hungry.
text:
We enjoyed the Four Points Soho, which had very friendly reception staff and housecleaners so thorough that I left an extra-large tip.  In our room (603) everything was new, clean and worked.

The slighly odd location of this hotel is probably what made it affordable to us.  It is in a low-crime but mostly industrial neighborhood, and in the "city that never sleeps" this area does, particularly on weekends.  Since the rooms did not have in-room refrigerators, every snack of yogurt, fruit, or beer required a 10 to 15 minute round-trip walk to a more populated zone.  As a previous poster mentioned, the hotel bar has been closed, and room service is available only for breakfast.  There are vending machines available, but they contain mostly junk food. On weekdays, a couple of dusty, neglected delis nearby also sell sodas and dry sandwiches.  We got pretty hungry.

Other than that, we liked this hotel.  It is particularly well situated for travelers landing at Newark Airport, since it's located just a few blocks from the Holland Tunnel.  The wireless access is excellent, although the fitness center consists of precisely three machines.

title: Modern, nice cosy little hotel
text:
The location was very convenient, with two subway lines a block away. There are many restaurants nearby, just a short walk to SoHo village, and neighboring areas. 

I chose this hotel because I wanted a place that was fairly newly built, with nice new clean and modern fixtures and furnishings. Also, was looking for a location that was safe, not too noisy, yet still have easy access to NYC's sights and attractions. I think it was a good choice to stay here; it was everything I hoped for. 

The front desk staff were exceptional in service delivery, probably the most friendliest and courteous I have met. We had a room on the 15th floor, with city views looking south, to the downtown districts.  It was nice being high up, as this tends to distance you from the street noise, which is barely audible when the windows are shut.

Although the bathroom was very small, it did not worry us too much. At least it was elegant and modern. The beds were very comfortable, and plenty of nice soft pillows are supplied. Flat screen 42" LCD TV was great.

Stayed here for 4 x nights. Booked on SPG's website and got the "Better Tomorrows - 40% off second night" deal.
I was very happy with this hotel, and would stay here again if I could get it at a really good rate.

title: Not as good the second time
text: I stayed here and reviewed it about a year ago. It was good then. This time it started badly. I arrived at 4pm and was told I could not check in until 5:30 or 6pm, which I find outrageous. The reason was because their frequent sleeper platinum members can stay until 4pm. I understand that, but at this rate I will never become a platinum Starwood member because I will end up avoiding their hotels if this is what it means. After stating extremely clearly that this was a real problem for me (I had to change and get to an early show) they found me a room. The safe was broken and unusable and the room smelled of moldy hotel carpeting (you know what I mean). Otherwise was ok.  Too bad, really, because last year it seemed like a place I would go back to. Now I won't.

title: Nice hotel, decent location, good value
text: Booked this hotel because it was the right price and not far from NYU where are son was staying for the summer.  Location is a little out of the way and on the quiet side, but access by car was easy, as was Sunday street parking.  Clean, comfortable, no frills, good value.  Would stay here again.

title: Slightly disappointing
text: I was in town for work over the weekend at NYU School of Law and I had booked a group block of rooms at the Four Points.  Our rate was $239 including breakfast.  When I checked in, I was informed that their restaurant was only open for breakfast.  They were undergoing new management and the restaurant  and bar were not open past breakfast.  Luckily, the hotel is in an area with many dining options and it is NY after all but it is nice to grab a drink in the hotel bar while trying to figure out your evening.  The rooms were actually a decent size and fairly nice.  They had just upgraded the TV's to 42 inch TV's but didn't realize that they weren't compatible with their programming system.  Therefore, all the channels did not work and the TV had to be unplugged multiple times to get it to work.  It appeared to short out when the air would click on and off.  I also would wake up in the middle of the night to see that the TV had turned on with a blank screen.  This was annoying.  Other than that, the hotel was clean and the location was pretty good.

title: Gross
text: The people who work at the Four Points are really nice, but the property is really gross. I am not a picky person and this place was just really way overpriced for the room not being very clean and the small size of the room.

title: Whether or not Four Points wants to see me again, I'm coming back.
text:
I'll admit it. I was a difficult customer.

Last minute business travel happens, and my business logistics went  haywire. 

I had to change my arrival date.
I had to change my departure date.
I had a stain on a shirt that needed taking care of.
etc. etc. I won't go into it but lets just say, for this trip I had issues.

Four Points Sheraton took care of me. And they were nice about it, as if my high maintenance needs were their pleasure to accomodate.

The agent on the phone was super nice. Her first name, sadly I can't remember, but her last name was Estrella which I remember because she was indeed a star. 
The front desk folks took care of all my requests 
Housekeeping was superior.
Guys, ladies in uniform in the elevator, in the hall, etc. asked me if I was satisfied with my stay.
Dude at door always welcomed me back.

Check all the boxes for details taken care of. I was hungry and you gave me a great restaurant recommendation. I was thirsty and you gave me bottled water. 

Whether or not Four Points wants to see me again, I'm coming back. 

AND FREE WIFI!!!!!!!

title: Nice Hotel, Good Location, Worth The Price
text:
We stayed over Memorial Day weekend and found the hotel to be near plenty of what we wanted to see- Soho, Battery & downtown, Chinatown & Little Italy, and the village.  It's also near several subway lines.  The rooms were small but fit two beds, a desk and armoire, and had a sufficient view.  The beds were comfortable and bathrooms were nice enough.  I was told that breakfast (or even coffee) at the small restaurant is a lesson in patience- two different groups of ours walked out.  Luckily, you step outside and enter one of the greatest culinary destinations in the world.

It seems like the new concept in Manhattan is for every hotel chain in this category (ex: 4 points, courtyard, HI express...) to build a new, narrow, tall, tiny lobby, two elevator, hotel.  It works but is kind of cookie cutter.

It's worth shopping around for the best rate/location in NYC.  I see this hotel go for $130+.

title: Solid hotel
text: Clean, nice finishes, decent location, good service. Worth a money, a good choice if you're staying in manhattan.

title: What a bad idea!
text:
We stayed there for one night only at the and of our trip, but it was enough. We got some trouble in finding the hotel as taxi drivers didn't know it. When we arrived, tired for the flight and looking foreward to get the room and have a rest, we had to wait long for the check in as at the front desk there was just one person. Finally we got the room, but we had to wait again for the elevator. Our room was quite small, with no decoration and no personality. The main problem about it was the noise. When other guests entered in their rooms it seemed like they where entering in our room. Noises becoming from street are a big problem as well. Drunk people making noise in the street during late night disturbed us as the windows has no insonorization. Same for the bathroom: you can clearly listen to all the noises becoming from other guests toilet. Moreover during the night the a/c stopped suddenly and we experienced a terrible hot inside the room. We tried also to turn on the a/c again but  the machine was so noisy that we gave up. 
Housekeeping wake us up in the early morning while we where finally sleeping. There's no minibar, just one small bottle of complementary water which is very few for two people in a hot room in the middle of the night. Wifi is complementary but is also very slow. May be we weren't unlucky, but for the price we paid we were very badly surprise.

title: Good hotel, good location. Def. worth the price
text:
We chose the Four Points to stretch our shopping budget after having considered other and more expensive options in Soho and Meatpacking.
Couldn't be more pleased. Thank you to the other reviewers who recommended it.
The reception was very helpful and all dealings with them was smooth and efficient.
Had breakfast in the restaurant the first morning. Service was friendly, but slow, and we went out for breakfast the rest of our stay. 
The room we had was on the 9th floor, and it was nice and very clean. The shower had some temperature issues, but I was told they were in the process of replacing those. The bed was comfy and the air con worked well. Soundproofing between rooms  seemed good. 
I would stay here again because it is very good value for money. In fact I hope to do so soon.

title: small but great
text:
pros:
great check  in staff , they were awesome
loved decor of room
awesome bed sooooooo comfy
awesome big shower even though room small
free internet
free water in room
very clean 

cons:
on a yucky street not "right in soho" have to walk a couple of blocks

room is the smallest in new york,  if you have a family and lots of luggage will not fit, nowhere to put luggage, and only very small armoir no cupboard, but still very comfortable room 

Even with cons(very little) I would stay here again. Love soho and it was only a 3 block walk into the heart of Soho.

Regarding past comments if you go to New York and expect a quiet room GO SOMEWHERE ELSE YOU ARE IN THE WRONG CITY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You will never find a quiet room in New York where you do not here the city outside your room.

You want a nice view in New York city from your  then you have to pay for it, becuase nice views are very limited here.

title: Very average hotel.  First and last visit.
text: We stayed over the holiday weekend.  Rooms are tiny.  Some of which are too close to the vent system.  The location and service is good.  Overall, the interior is a little cramped and dingy.  I stayed here because I am a Starwoods member.  There are better options in the same price-range and neighborhood.

title: Wonderful position and excellent stay in NY
text: This hotel is perfectly placed for a NY visit.  We are drawn back to NY over and over again and we like staying in and around the Village rather than in the crowds and sameness of the central city. Emely Estrella manages a team of enthusiastic, kind, engaging and professional front of house staff who simply could not have been more helpful.  We had ordered about 11 different items from Amazon.com that arrived at their different times (most before we even got there) and they were expertly received, cared for and handed to us with the broadest of smiles.  The room was wonderful.  Large and comfortable bed, spotlessly clean room with all the facilities you would want as a tourist. free internet was reliable and reasonably fast.  The location on Charlton street is perfect.  Short walk to the Village, literally 1 block from 2 different Metro stations if you want to go to the city or on other trips. Extremely good value - but mostly a genuinely friendly and happy place - we'll definitely be back.

title: discreto
text:
L'albergo non è molto comodo dal centro, struttura molto semplice addetti alla reception molto cordiali. Le camere non sono molto grandi in compenso ci sono due letti molto confortevoli. Bagno decisamente molto piccolo e senza il bidet come sempre negli USA. 
Non si sono in tv canali satelliteri italiani. Colazione alla carte senza buffet. Il bar, durante il mio soggiorno, non era in funzione, davvero scomodo! per colazione o un birra ci sono però vicinissimi uno Starbuks ed un simpatico bar. In camera offrono comunque due bottigliette di acqua e caffè free. Connessione internet wireles gratis. Molto difficile trovare dalle 17 alle 19 taxi dal centro di Manhattan a Soho.

title: Solid budget hotel
text: Yes, rooms are small but I had smaller rooms at the Sheraton in Tribeca.  Location is good.  Dining and bar options nearby and close to two subway lines.  Professional staff who actually seem to give a damn about guests.  That was refreshing.  Hard to call any hotel in NY a value but I'd stay there again.

title: Hôtel CONFORTABLE et bien SITUE
text:
Nous avons passé une semaine en avril 2011 au Four POINTS.
Nous avons été bien accueilli. Nous avons demandé à changer de chambre pour être côté cour (plus calme, on est à NYC) et cela n’a posé aucun problème (Réception courtoise et efficace)
Les chambres sont petites (on est à NYC) et sont très propres. La salle de bain comporte une très grande douche.
Les chambres sont équipées d’une bouilloire, d’une cafetière avec café et bouteilles d’eau à disposition et d’un climatiseur dont nous n’avons pas fait usage.
A la réception, il y a 2 ordinateurs comprenant Internet et outils bureautiques reliés une imprimante.
Nous recommandons de réserver le plus tôt possible pour bénéficier du meilleur tarif. Le notre comprenait ce qui est rare à NYC un petit-déjeuner américain complet.
Si je devais retourner à NYC, je réserverais cet hôtel
A proximité, nous avons découvert un supermarché BIO « whole foods », sensationnel car restauration à emporter sous forme de buffet.

title: Well below average
text:
Yes the rooms are small- I didn't mind that, nor did I mind that the room faced an airshaft - what really did me in was the loud exhaust fan that roared up the air shaft most nights, the impossible to control thermostat and the slick walk in shower floor.  Ok we got a deal on expedia but I've stayed in better hotels in NYC that were also "deals." 

The staff was terrific - however, I don't recommend getting them to arrange a ride to the airport - we were charged nearly double what we paid from the airport - never, ever again!

title: Great location
text: Loved this hotel!!! The loacton is great! It's close to the 1 train, which will take you to all parts of the city! Hotel was clean and staff was very friendly!! I'm an SPG member and will definatly be back!

title: standard business hotel
text: clean, convenient, good value.  rather no frills, but who goes to NY to spend time in a hotel room?  very close to soho shops and restaurants.
